LfqnEEyrI1z68SDepmhzlQ.text: Came here to grub with my girlfriend, everything is average quality. Dont order anything seered from here its just propane on fish ruins the taste completely. The slices of superwhite were extremely thin, and had none of the butteryness. The only thing I semi enjoyed was the sashime included with Ayce..Just take the jalapenos of and replace with Daikon. That spice too overwhelming with glob of Siracha.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SASHIMI INCLUDED IN AYCE!!!
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kabuki masks

68Md-KKz9QeIeAsA6WVnAA.text: A great AYCE sushi spot for the price. Expect to wait a while with a group of 3 or more people.. Usually its only me and my wife and we get seated almost right away almost every time (if you don't mind the bar seats and sitting next to other people). During dinner on the weekdays, and anytime during the weekends and holidays, expect to wait at least 30 minutes, and parking can be challenging. Other than that, food is awesome, service is great !

9DZAwn55YQY4dSRH_Rj3VA.text: This is so far my FAV AYCE sushi bar.  Good location on Spring Mountain, always busy and friendly.  I've been here before 3 PM to catch the $19.95 AYCE price and at 1AM for $24.95 price, still a good deal and busy.  Parking is limited but there is plenty of parking in the lot next door and walking is safe.   The restaurant is not too big, but they are on top of cleaning tables as soon as one is done to get the next group seated, or you can take an available seat at the bar.  The staff is hustling in there, I have always had good service.  There is a karaoke bar next door that you can have a drink while waiting for your table, just let them know and they will go get you when your table is ready.  They have a good variety of rolls on the menu, my fav so far Tiger Roll, Bonzai roll Rainbow roll, sexy roll and Vegas roll.  They also have good size nigiri pieces. I've read that the kimchi fried rice is yum and it looks yum, but Im always too busy with the rolls to try it.' I do like the bacon scallop skewer and baked green mussels.  We always start with the Ahi Poki, yum!!  Last call to order is 2AM.    Oh yeah, they have Pepsi products, yeah.  Love this place.

myTzig7AE0Or0CSfTKNfxg.text: Kaya is the only place i go to for all you can eat sushi, the only thing that sucks about it is during the hot summer their AC is not working and they don't bother to fix it for the past couple of years!

AeyhdR9tmlNp-hNAzG3iHw.text: Everything about the food was good. Huge variety and once we started ordering it just kept coming. Our group tried at least 20 different rolls. The only one we didn't care for featured bbq eel. We also had some nigeri the jalepeno poppers and a seaweed salad. All of those were ok. The spicy here was indeed pretty spicy which I love but it might be something to consider if you are sensitive. My gripe with this place was the hostess. When I called she said they didn't take reservations until 10 and that we wouldn't need one because it wasn't busy. Lo and behold it was busy when we got there and had to wait a half hour to sit at table that was empty when we got there. The mixed drinks were good tasting but lacked a kick. I'd be inclined to give this place 3.5 stars and another chance if I was inthe area.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasty and spicy

QX7HFO9ueXgTTBGoBzHBuQ.text: Best all you can eat sushi place on earth !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I'm still sitting at my table eating , I can't even walk out the door without sharing with yelp how wonderful this place is. Perfect for a date or even to go with your kids and family !!!!!!

EEl0A009q0dmH-HfQhejHw.text: I honestly don't know why people are nuts about this place. Every time I go the sushi tastes WARM. Like the fish just doesn't look cold as if it's been sitting on the counter for 20 minutes probably because you see your wen you buzz them to the table three times. The cuts are really weird especially the salmon. The portions are tiny, meaning you have to keep calling your server over. If you End up eating here best thing is to order a lot at once because you won't see your server again until long after you finished whatever round you were eating.   Not to mention the parking in this building sucks the most poorly designed parking space (it's a giant square that's impossible to back out of). This restaurant is always on a long wait especially on weekend nights and when you sit down the awful music is playing so loudly you can't hear anything. Seriously last time I went "Let it Go" was shrieking over the speakers. I just don't want to hear that during dinner with friends.   There's much better All You can Eat options that are open late and for the same price point.

4E_4WcDgQgI9ckJ-0ceqGA.text: The absolute best sushi in Vegas! Shout out to the Amigo Roll!   The service could not be any quicker. I hate waiting to get the check when I am finished eating and you will never have to worry about that here. Competitive prices, fresh sushi, and quick service. The best!

kh8wG1sl9uDpt1ha7eYJ4Q.text: This is my boyfriends favorite place. I like it but I don't think it's the best in town. This place is always packed. I like uni with quail egg on top its my favorite.

SJBbGaY4BovKu2rJpbVC-Q.text: My friends and I ate this establishment before and it was good so we decided to go there for lunch today. There was a 30 minute wait time so we decided to get service right away at the bar. The service was absolutely terrible and slow, all three of us were charged for all you can eat sushi when we did not want all you can eat. The fish was not fresh and it was warm, we had to repeat our orders for dessert because it never came as well as ask for refills on our drinks. When leaving the establishment we walked out of the back because that is where I was parked. There was a cook smoking, trash and grease all over the floor to the point I had to remove my shoes before I got into my car. The bathroom was filthy and smelled like sewage. There was also grease all over the men's bathroom floor. I am unhappy and honestly will never go back to this place for sushi. Everything  about  my experience  was terrible and I would NOT recommend it to anyone I know.

jdaZrh4iJICaPhTKpGNhQA.text: FOOD POISONING!! Ate here last night. Fish seemed fine...until two hours later when I got home and started to feel dizzy and nauseous! Vomited the rest of the night. My friend and I both got sick!! Bad fish! If you want to get sick be my guest!

rtHBqH3u1BDur2lWdwF8pw.text: My kids and I were turned on to this place by friends of ours who are locals.  The sushi is superb and variety is endless. I also like that it is a good price for all you can eat sushi especially at lunchtime (the price goes up for dinner).  The only reason Sushi Kaya gets four stars instead of five is because there is always a wait, but not much room to wait in, and because when they are busy it is hard to get the attention of a server to get more dishes while eating all-you-can-eat.

5_EqYZ6Td8Tl6RfBgxAY7A.text: If you do come try making reservations 30 min prior or there maybe a bit of a wait (30mins) on the weekends. I recommend any/every deep fried roll. My fav were the 'Who is your dad' and 'crusty philly roll'. I also enjoyed the Alaska roll. Can't go wrong any of those 3. Make sure you know how much you can consume. There is a few if you don't finish all the food on your plate. Food comes out pretty fast. Definitely worth the 27 bucks. Every thing I tried added up to $50+.

oj6MiHNEO2RiCWDMLrduGQ.text: They have around 100 different options with he unlimited option. This is the only way I would eat there. The food is great and fast. I would give it 5 stars, but it is always a wait to get in. No matter when you go,you will have to wait to be seated. BUT, it is worth the trip.

ZuPkPENOfSlMIQLcMMh_4g.text: Sushi was nothing special and the service was TERRIBLE. Our waitress was missing half of the time to one point we waited around for over a half hour before she came back to our table. Food came out fast once you could finally track down the waitress. Half of our order was incorrect. Do not recommend.  ******REVISED REVIEW******  Came back with family and sat in a reserved room and service was much better, but maybe that was because we had a special room. Bumped up my review to 3 stars after my last experience.

j0oxrdpNahNu2dUMWgRIrg.text: Best sushi in town!!! All you can eat lunch is $22 and there are over 40 different sushi rolls. Top 3: money brain, red dragon and sex bomb... Definitely try the shrimp and beef skewer are tender and great flavor. Cherry amaretto ice cream is a must try!!

ulacAT9Ci3UvfuAoKkq5sg.text: Above average for Chinatown sushi.there is a wait for all you can eat but it's worth it.

_mDopezu-Wfd_VPGRqB75w.text: This second visit was so much more pleasant than my first visit! First of all I'd like to say that what changed the most was the customer service. I came in for dinner the first time and this time I came in during their slow hours which was between 3pm and 5pm.  ATMOSPHERE: Good, relaxing and I was extremely grateful for the A/C which wasn't on blast making me cold like most restaurants nor was it too hot. Hey, that's important! Just saying =) the interior has the typical classic Japanese sushi setting and very subtle wood and black colors with interesting pieces of Kabuki masks and Japanese paintings.  FOOD: good good good! I enjoyed all of the nigiri that I ordered which was what my entire AYCE sushi experience consisted of. I don't really like getting complicated rolls and I prefer to taste each ingredient in its beautiful simplicity. White tuna nigiri is my favorite and although it hasn't been the best I've ever had, it was still pretty good. Other nigiri I recommend is Cajun albacore, salmon, amaebi (sweet shrimp), surf clam, eel and yellowtail. Stay away from the tuna and tako wasabi, respectively they were dry and too slimy.  SERVICE: great service, I wish I remembered our Asian male server's name. He was way better than the rude Spanish guy that we had during dinner my first visit. Also the girl with the Skrillex haircut was pretty cool/nice. Definitely much better service. Keep it up and I'll be back =)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red bean/green tea ice cream, mini cheesecake. My bf didn&#39;t enjoy all the extra &#34;fluff&#34; and toppings on his cheesecake though
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White tuna nigiri, salmon nigiri, sashimi poke, garlic and beef tongue skewers. (AYCE sushi lunch!)

_yMkHyS_7tNpftua6Pr6vw.text: Fresh and served fast! Did the all you can eat Sushi and got to try over 6 different kinds. (Was my first time here and they recommend you to try half orders so you can try multiple kinds and find a favorite). Lots to choose from and served VERY fast too.

xbqxoRsrRWR7bJk8usPzgQ.text: Sushi Kaya is awesome! Their rice is light and the fish is cut perfectly. If you are looking to eat just sushi this is an awesome place to go. The rolls are pretty good, I prefer to go to other places if I want to eat just rolls. I would recommend the Cinderella Roll! This place gets really busy so make a reservation for sure!

x3ILNHEptqNzWxcvJ0VyOg.text: This is just ok. The freshness and quality of fish is not the greatest. The yellowtail looked dry and questionable. I am more of a nigiri fan than anything so this review is based on that.   I came here with some Kaya regulars that had not been here for a bit. According to them some of the items that were on AYCE menu are no longer and or have shrunk in size.   The service is in dire need of improvement! So slow! Inexcusably slow and waiters or waitresses don't pay attention or do it on purpose! I see why there is a 90 minute usually there is 60 min limit they run you out of patience by forgetting about another order.   One of my fave things to order is Ikura... The  lack of salmon roe is very noticeable. They cover enough for you not to see its all rice.   One thing I did enjoy a lot was baked muscle but that was the only highlight.

6YXPCHH4CPHpBVMLYt-9kg.text: Service was good. It's cute inside. I love to be able to order half rolls for variety on AYCE. Will be coming back again.

giCNPeuTtL2kBVbsTkVvRg.text: Experience here was just an "okay" experience.. Price is reasonable enough for an all you can eat sushi  Not enough parking (specially during busy days/hours)  Just a piece of advice, DON'T GO there on weekends or any busy days cause the service during their busy times are SO SLOW! For one skewer alone that we ordered, took us 35mins of waiting, SERIOUSLY! But staff are very friendly & accomodating still, no complains on that... I'll be back maybe, I'll just choose a different day when they're not that busy...

wOyZHvJJp2HTJFdYDse2tQ.text: CONDENSED IN A SOUP CAN: If you are mucho hungry, you are definitely getting more than your money's worth. If you are fussy about the quality of your sashimi, I'd go with Sushi Koma, Goyemon or Blue Fin. THE MEAT: Their lunch and dinner prices are $2-5 bucks less than most AYCE joints and their menu is more extensive - including skewered items, noodle dishes such as Japchae and bottomless ice cream. We enjoyed the bacon and scallop skewers, the dynamite and ahi poke with seaweed. The nigiri not so much - the salmon was not as fresh, the ono was slightly seared and served with rice doused with vinegar (same with the Cajun albacore... it was a little weird to me, very sour). For the rolls we had the Sex Bomb, the Dragon Roll and Amigo Roll. All were pretty good except for the fact that the sushi rice on the rolls was all warm. I'm not sure if I'm just accustomed to cool temperatures, but what I'm reading is that sushi rice should always be cooled down and served at room temperature, or as the same temperature as the fish it is served with (cool if raw and warmer if cooked). All in all, we still enjoyed our meal but next time I'm craving good AYCE nigiri I'd rather pass out at Sushi Koma. I'M STILL DIGESTING... That awful warm sushi rice. And the fact that the tables around us were getting their orders a lot faster than we were. Curse you cursed table with slow food turnaround time! (I dunno what happened, service was pretty good). WANT TO SEE SOME FOOD PORN? :-) Amiga and Dragon Roll yelp.com/biz_photos/sush... Tobiko and Cajun Albacore Nigiri yelp.com/biz_photos/sush... Ahi Poke with Seaweed yelp.com/biz_photos/sush...

iJ1xqulMiVtBl_3flzctWg.text: I was not pleased with the sushi here.  I ordered 4 different rolls.  The shrimp tempora because that is always a safe choice.  While eating it the seaweed was chewy a few bites and that quickly turned me off. Then I ordered the lasagna roll because I thought that was a clever idea, it was so bad I had to stop after trying it and then scrapping off the cheese on top that looked like clumps of butter and trying again.  Then they brought me out 2 other rolls that I forget the names and they were ok nothing special.  The last two days after eating my stomach has been upset.  I will not go back. Staff was nice and that's about all that was enjoyable.

f643t1p1cfn2w1XcPytYLQ.text: When in Vegas don't miss this sushi joint because it's a locals favorite for a reason! The decor is simple with a modern Asian influence,  along with a high energy vibe and music playing in the background that makes this place hip. It's Located in the heart of China town, it's worth getting off the strip to enjoy the all you can eat and made to order sushi. Be aware the dinner prices are $27 per person, but well worth it. The sushi was a little better then middle to high grade and the service is excellent. We were helped by 3 different servers in which they all seemed energetic and attentive,  Also they will charge you extra for any leftovers you don't consume, so eat what you order.. That's understandable right? Lucky it's delicious so we didn't have the problem of leftovers. Because of its good Location, convenience, great staff, good sushi, a good vibe, easy parking and fair pricing I gotta give this joint a 5 star! Bam!

COOoYeA78dxlUXZe-AwSUQ.text: We came into town for a girls weekend and asked for a sushi rec when we checked in. We were told this is the best sushi in town so we checked it out. All you can eat for $26 (dinner) is an incredible price for the quality! The rolls are amazing and the wait staff are super quick and responsive. Will definitely return to this place on future Vegas trips!

skvjl7nT1j6cztIYsy-ruQ.text: used to love this place until one day i was enjoying lunch over there with my family, and we saw a roach crawl on the table. i believe this is a very recent issue that is occurring but i'm just trying to keep everyone aware of this horrible situation.

GyLxf3PK7J-Aq_9zRHf1hg.text: Love Sushi. Cannot stand Sushi places. This place is out for one thing, and one thing only. Your MONEY! If they were able to charge you for the toilet paper you would use in their restroom they would. The Sushi, yes, its ok. I guess. We were a party of 6, 4 adults, 2 children. According to their policy parties of six or more get charged a gratuity fee.That includes children. Mind you, all they are gonna eat is probably some soup and peas. So that means, if its you and your partner, and take your 4 kids, yup! you guessed it. 18% gratuity added. POS place. Honestly this is why I have going to eat at Asian places. Mofos want to charge you for the straw your sipping your drink with! Customer service is something they could get a lesson in!

XMYF_KLmJZ5fU_bmBwC6iw.text: I have eaten here several times and love it!  If you go during dinner time, you'll generally have to wait 30+ minutes, but it is definitely worth it.    My favorite rolls are Salmon Fashion, Alaska and Monkey Brains - no, they're not "real" monkey brains ;)

EH9DbvmT0zU8fBdJzqcPPA.text: I've been here once last week for the first time and loved it! They have a great selection on their menu and service was fast!! pVo5Bh8uRakA_hHGcfxRhA.text: What do you expect from $25 all you can eat sushi. Below average service. Hard to get a hold of the overworked servers. Sushi rolls are loaded with rice and imitation crab. Go for the nigiri which has a lot less rice and stuff you don't want. And both me and my dad have diarrhea the night and morning after.  Not sure if it is cause and effect.   Oh and what's up with all the college age kids eating here?

Sometimes the rice with the nigiri is too sour, sweet, or wet, or all three.

2K2gnXkYptV3MWiJwdR9gw.text: One of the best sushi places in town love the chefs, servers, and the atmosphere is nice! Quick on serving your food! I recommend to get AYCE you can't go wrong with it! Ultimate Albacore, California Dream, and Crusty Philly Roll are a must! Oh and don't forget the awesome Pot Stickers!!!

DlPAs5ppnAXoKP1MHYm7fw.text: This is the place to eat if you love good sushi. AYCE menu is fabulous. Been here 10+ times. Quick service, creative yummy rolls. Always had great experiences and I'm a sushi fanatic. There's also a bubble tea place a couple doors down, so go there for dessert.   I've come with groups of 10-15 a few times and they are very accommodating. My favorite rolls are the Who is my Dad roll and the Sex on the Beach roll. Sometimes you have to wait 20-30 minutes to get seated, but it's well worth the wait.  Absolutely delicious.

pT3O47tddSFXmpcNQJE3AA.text: I had a terrible experience on the evening of 4-8-17 around 8 pm. My party and myself were waiting for our checks to get picked up after eating. About 15 minutes went by, which we thought was odd so we walked to the hostess to hand them our checks. After standing for five minutes we discover their card reader is down. This explains why they never picked up our checks at the table. The hostess tells us "We're working on it." in a very unpleasant tone. Another 10 minutes go by and my party and I are becoming impatient. I then tell the hostess in an assertive fashion that I need a resolution to this problem, and I want to talk to the manager. At that point we had been standing for the aforementioned time period plus the time waiting at the table. The hostess snaps at me,"You don't have to be rude." I then tell her,"And you don't have to be a b****." Afterwards a young, Mexican, female busser decides to jump in to defend her friend and begins arguing and lecturing me (she had a bad attitude the whole night prior to this scowling at all the patrons in the restaurant and moping about). I tell her to walk away and mind her own business but she continues on. Finally the busser ceases her baboon like antics and walks away as the manager arrives. He barely speaks English and virtually ignores my explanation for why his employees should not argue with paying customers and finally hands me a piece of receipt paper with my card number scratched into it. They did not offer me any compensation, they did not apologize, they did nothing! What kind of establishment runs this way. The customer is always right you morons. Also, they told me they would call before they ran my card but did not and ran it anyways. Great job. I'm never bringing my business back here again and I hope you teach your employees with piss poor attitude to shut up and not argue with customers. This is singlehandedly the worst experience I have EVER had any wear, at any business, in my life. #theworst #dontshowupatmyhospital

u71jarXn0EHBE2hk6McbVQ.text: I've been going to Kaya since they opened their door. I have to admit, the quality of food has gone down over the years, but not a total disappointment. This is only on certain items. However, I have never had any problems with their service. The staff's attentiveness and quick service remain positive.   This place has an extensive sushi roll selection compared to other sushi joints. The big plus for me is that they offer half rolls for almost all their sushi rolls. I like this option to give you an opportunity to try many of their items without getting too full on one sushi roll. They have a decent selection of skewers and nigiri. The fish to rice ratio is a hit or miss for me.   Kaya only takes reservations for large parties. Be prepared to wait during peak hours. Don't forget to ask for their sushi stamp card where your 10th stamp gets you a FREE dinner, but you're unable to use it on the same day it was stamped.

4SYDelTijJjGcaF1esxkAA.text: This place is the best in town!!! There are times when it's busy but that's expected on a Friday night. The longest I've waited is 30mins. I was tempted to get mochi with my takeout order but I didn't because the server said they close at 3AM && I was just in the area having fun somewhere there was no food. So 2:30 I get back to the restaurant and the doors were locked, I knocked and the cooks just laughed. 5 star simple service just turned into 1.

GoIPTXqSTUdgk75vXdEapA.text: Came here because it was the only AYCE Sushi place open in the area. Glad we came.  Yummy food. Great service!.. And you can't beat the price. I would definately come again and recommend Sushi Kaya to my friends.

dDdRL_W9-E1A5xo80P2XwA.text: Last night we came out to eat at what used to be our favorite place for sushi. The last few times the service and quality have been worse and worse. This time we placed our first order for AYCE. Our order was incomplete. We tried asking numerous servers about our order. We had to wait 40 mins before our the rest of our order was brought out. Also, they no longer offer refills on their soft drinks. I ordered a lemonade and it was watery. They only offered a refill once after our check was brought out. I spoke to the manager and he said he would discount our drinks. That was $5.00 Felt like a slap in the face. The worst part was no where was an apology offered. Nothing. I mentioned to him that after waiting for so long we were ready to walk out. He said charging us full price was fair. I don't mind paying my bill but I didn't feel like we got the service or food we paid for. Also, the sushi was a bit cold and lacked flavor. The super white tuna cake out dry and bland. I paid my check and left but I won't be going back. I'll take my business elsewhere and will be letting friends know this isn't a place I recommend.

lQyJ5krSprGeisuQ9UbpFA.text: AYCE SUSHI! Look no further this is my go to spot in Las Vegas when I need my sushi fix. I like the fact that they allow you to order half rolls of the specialty rolls because you are able to try more of a variety. The nigiri is always tender and fresh. They also have a variety of different dishes and skewers for people who don't like sushi.   Lunch - $21.95 Dinner - $26.95

oK4MEhn3RR-GynLDG8mKkw.text: This is typically my go-to place for AYCE sushi. Their price is cheaper than others & they offer pretty much the same items. Their baked rolls are my fav!   They can get busy & sometimes may have to wait. But, it's definitely worth it.   Their dessert options are just okay tho, but I'm pretty stuffed by the time I'm ready for dessert. Sometimes, ice cream is all I need. I go here for food & not dessert anyway.  I definitely enjoy coming here & will continue to do so!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their baked rolls are my fav! Alaska Roll &amp; Japanese Lasagna

Z6UomnVfPhh_byAJ_MHXgA.text: Amazingly quick service, fun atmosphere, sushi chefs yelling out thank you's to the leaving guests, very fresh, quality cuts of fish, and the rice was the perfect sushi rice: slightly warm, soft, with the perfect combination of vinegar and sugar.  Highly recommendable!

chbLlJ_3_DJW5xuTnBqMJg.text: Worst service I ever received at a acye don't get seated  with people who don't order the acye  special they think your sharing

jSLC6PmEUomtqBvfkuYwrA.text: Late night food.  All you can eat sushi for $26 bucks.  The quality is is great, the taste is yummy, the only thing  don't like is that you only get a 1 time, repeat 1 time order for the sashimi and I love love love sashimi!!   On this visit, to celebrate my birthday, my girlfriend Anna and I came here for a late dinner.  We were both starving so I was very happy when I saw that there was no wait.  Usually on the weekends, you can wait up to 1 hour plus!   The place itself isn't too big and sometimes it does take a while to get your food but with good company and sake, you'll be just fine.    Happy Eating!

D2121dq7zsVYG0cWmjpiZg.text: Sushi Kaya is somewhere I've been going, since I was young. I haven't been there probably in about 5 years or so, but it's still as great as it was before. Sushi & apps were all great. I was surprised the rolls with mango tasted as good as they did. I love the fact that they do 1/2 size & full size rolls. Service was friendly.   It was a busy night, so the wait was about 20 minutes & they were definitely sticking to their rules. I saw them abiding to the 90 minute time frame to be able to turn tables around due to the business demand. Also, the table next to me was complaining because they were charged for 4 rolls ala carte price due to not finishing them but the rules are clearly stated on the menu for all customers to see.   One of my rolls was incorrect. They made the roll with cream cheese & it wasn't supposed to have any. Also, there was a bit of a wait for refills & whatnot but I understand they were busy. Overall I had a great experience & I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skewers: Bacon/Scallop &amp; Beef
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeño poppers...super yummy &amp; flavorful!
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tS919v9_FruX3IHuG0eCGw.text: Favorite sushi spot. Goyomon and sushi mon. Staff is pretty friendly. Service is good too. And the food is just delicious.

_4-XCxpGAh95r-CaQNSxgQ.text: Great selection of Sushi, the all you can eat is incredible!  Quick friendly service!

orv7Yq-7xsBFjzBjjwtgbA.text: What's up with Korean people opening sushi restaurants?   Kaya..open til' 3am 7 days a week. Perfect for those late night sushi cravings. In my case, after work.   I like how they make nigiri sushi here. bite size, fresh and perfect ratio of rice & fish. I also enjoy the skewers they offer as well as the different appetizers that comes with Ayce.   The chefs are fast on putting food out but the servers are slow and very awkward.  Yes, my water is empty. Yes, I'm done with my food. Can I please order more? I did order AYCE...didn't i?   Service is hit or miss but just do what I do and shut your mouth and enjoy your after midnight sushi.

5caJQlUNy60Ezcb2BJajuQ.text: Holy cow has this place gone down hill.    Dingy cracked chipped plates, dirty cups dried with a dirty towel, food debris on the edges of the floor,  dirt caked on the edges of tables, tape holding the seat pads together,  ripped seat pads.  . .   It has been abandoned into disrepair I don't even want to know what the kitchen looks like .  The food was decent but I was eating with a little apprehension wondering if I was going to get sick.   ( I did not)    $20 bucks plus tax all you can eat at lunch is not bad.  Service a little slow but polite.    Management needs to clean this place up!    Eat at your own risk, I do not recommend it until the place shows some respect for the culinary arts.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Its hard to appreciate the food when the plates they serve it in are soiled

IFyeD7DFhozXe4Zcu6rg5g.text: Probably one of the best locations in Vegas .  Been there so many time and I just love it. Sometimes it's too packed and you have to wait for so long . But if you are looking for great sushi . This is the place

G_gzc99XqWHtjyVC1t524A.text: Belle was our server today and she was absolutely horrible. She was such a bitch to us. Everyone else in the place was super nice and friendly, and the food was good, therefore, I'm giving it three stars instead of one.  Another reason for the low rating is because every time I have been here, everything is so slow. Everything.  I like this place because it is open very late and that is convenient for me. Very mixed feelings, so three stars from me

5A_5Z9xK1Dfvsy3Nz083ig.text: I've been coming to Sushi Kaya for a little over 2 years now and it seems like every time we come here the service gets a little worse. It's really sad because this used to be my absolute favorite spot but between the service and the cockroach that was crawling by my head I will be looking for another AYCE Sushi place. The food quality has gone down a little over the years as well. It's not terrible by any means but it's just not as good as the first few times coming here. Management really needs to step it up before they start loosing more and more regulars.

SfIAH0otY4fhUCEAadV4Aw.text: Sushi Kaya is my favorite place to go for sushi. The quality of their food is very high for the price. Sushi Kaya offers all you can eat at lunch for $20 and dinner for $25. They also give you a stamp card that gives you a free all you can eat every 10 stamps.  Their sushi rolls are the best thing about Kaya. They have a large variety for everyone's taste palette.  I highly recommend the Sex Bomb Roll, Cinderella Roll, and the Volcano Roll.   The nigiri is tasty too but not the best I've had in Vegas.    What I also love about Kaya is they offer everything for all you eat including pot stickers, skewers (the bacon wrapped scallops are great), soup, edamame, and more!  The atmosphere is great! Very nice decor and the seating allows for privacy. The service is very fast and friendly too- however, on a busy day, it's a little difficult to get they're attention.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half order of the bonsai roll
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinderella Roll
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sex bomb roll

YfAY_1DY5yPoiZt53LBIBA.text: DENG! I did not realize I have not yet written a review of this place! It is definitely one of my favorite sushi spots because: 1) It is open late (until 3am), 2) the baked green mussels, and 3) I LOVE AYCE SUSHI! (AYCE Dinner is $24.99!... HELLA GOOD!)  As of lately, whenever I get that sushi craving, I always end up here. I don't know if it's in my comfort zone, or if the UNIVERSE gave me some form of GRAVITATIONAL PULL to Sushi Kaya, but I'm all in!  Since I first started coming, there has been an increase in customers. There is always a waiting list for seating, and they even opened up a smaller room for customers! To avoid the line, I suggest sitting at the bar. We got in there in 5 minutes! =)  Some of my favorite things that they offer are: (I mean I love the entire menu, but I do have my favorites. Don't we all?) -Green Baked Mussels: My all time favorite! They, hands down, have the all-time best baked mussels in my book! -Japanese Lasagna roll: Okay. Guilty. I just love baked sushi rolls! & Japanese Lasagna never fails me anywhere! -Japanese Pizza: This is also baked, hehe! This isn't a roll, more like a Japanese pizza on a tortilla. Delicious! -Salmon Skin Salad: You must try this! The salmon skin is fried and crunchy, in salad, and drizzled in this zesty dressing. -Sexy Roll: Loved this! It had a little crunch to it, plus I love rolls drizzled in sauces. Lol. -Super White Tuna Nigiri: Gotta have it at all times!  Okay, I can seriously go on and on and talk about every single thing on the menu, but these are some of MY FAVES!  As for the service, It was good. Our server was Super Nice! I'm sad I didn't get her name though, because I believe she has been my server twice already.  If you haven't already, have a go at some GOOD SUSHI, try something new, and ENJOY!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gotta have the super white!

1UeHIz-EQhAwaYdcUEtLJg.text: Good Variety of rolls. Well worth getting the all  you  can eat if your ready for a sushi throw down!  Great service.  Many sushi chefs behind the bar that keep the rolls coming quick.   They also have a private room for special occasions.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Customer
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert.
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Rock Roll

cZjkm_e6JzxgHVTQkVvJKg.text: I always come here to AYCE. I think its worth it since I hardcore eat sushi. There is a large variety and there is bound to be something you like. I recommend the Amigo Roll, the Ryan Roll, and the Ichiban Roll. The Spicy Yum sauce is great too!!! True, the waiters are hard to get a hold of sometimes and you have to search them out, which is why I order everyTHANG at the start. The mochi is fire  Not to mention it's open late and there's KPOP on all the time. Have had great experiences all the times I've gone there with friends.

5eUz6k4DW6l_b2fYzB6VxA.text: I love Sushi Kaya! They have always been a favorite of mine. There are not to many places I feel safe ordering eel. This is a place I know I'll be happy with whatever I order.    Their customer service tonight was a little more off than usual. Could have had something to do with how busy they were. They are always pretty busy so I don't know why tonight one of our servers was a mess. We were waiting for him to go over the sake menu with us and when he came up, he asked us if we were ready to order drinks and we said "no, could you please" and he grabbed the sake menu, placed it in front o us and then walked away. Another server saw and heard how offended we were and sat down and helped us with our drink order.   The other server was back and hovered over the server taking our drink order. Once the server that took our drink order walked away, our original server looked ready to run away again, but since I've been here before I was ready to order for the my party of three. We started with:  edamame calamari tempura pot stickers seaweed salad shirmp/scallop  black dragon vegas roll rainbow roll shrimp lover roll cinderella roll arizona roll whos your daddy   I ordered all the food at once and it all came out at once. All of our order was out in about 15 minutes. There wasn't one thing that our table wasn't happy with. Everything was fresh. Nice, flavorful pieces of eel on black dragon roll. They were out of the white Tuna so we ordered squid, octopus, tuna, and red snapper nigiri which was a taste that just tastes clean and fresh.    At one point the absent minded server took our drinks to refill and never returned with our drinks. We asked another server for drinks and we still never got them.   We had green tea ice cream and mochi to finish. It was delicious as usual.   This was a great visit because we got our food so fast. The customer service could use some work.   3 ACE 2 Sodas 1 Hot Sake $105 with 15% tip  Now that I think about it they are more of a 3.75 because of their poor customer service for such a high price. Reasonable if server had paid more attention instead of getting paid by my table.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Viagra roll
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red snapper

So8iAp4b80XzCF7Ze6cDqg.text: A hidden gem!  Lunch AYCE is $20 (no drink included). Sushi is fresh and the rolls and other side dishes are awesome! Dessert is also included.

IY3nH7ODPplSFSQszMHbyg.text: My favorite sushi place in Vegas ! $60 plus tip roughly and two people can chow down with all you can eat and a couple of sodas. They are pretty strict about leaving leftovers (they will charge you - and who can blame them) so make sure you order what you realistically think you will eat !

z8x6LFM3acGmpWDtaSKFuQ.text: This is one of the my first and many favorite AYCE sushi spots, it's got a wide selection of salmon rolls, which I love, and it has a really good flavorful selection, good sashimi, appetizers are pretty good, although I do with they had stuffed tuna jalapeno poppers and some cucumber roll selections, the new additions to the menu are really scrumptious, and at a really great price for what you get. I eat here often, the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because on occasion the staff has made me wait incredibly long periods for my orders, and usually there is a long hour + wait outside, however it goes to show how delicious this restaurant is, and usually worth it if you can stand the wait. On the bright side they offer stamp cards.

O77cWqWN_vOgSM1XqFO4TQ.text: I've been here so many times, and I came today with 5 members of my family, everything was good until the moment that we found a BIG HAIR in our chicken teriyaki, I called my server in a really quiet manner and show him the hair. I didn't received an apologize, not even an answer. As we were 6, the 18% tip was included. Is that fair?

GUSu9KLaiHiRgDN7q8irTA.text: This is my favorite sushi spot in vegas. no question about it. hands down best sushi and amazing service

xZZFNjyZ3zmvvC4VJFsWug.text: Ruben and I came for dinner with two of our friends based on their recommendation. I have to admit that I was weary, as I usually am with sushi restaurants. I also already have my sushi spots and until something goes wrong, I have no plans on straying.   The nigiri and hand rolls were good and I liked the Tiger Roll (Shrimp tempura, cucumber with spicy tuna, avocado, and eel sauce) and Dancing Eel Roll (Shrimp tempura, cucumber with spicy tuna, unagi, and eel sauce). I also enjoyed the Ahi Poke (white onions and seaweed salad) and shrimp and vegetable tempuras. Otherwise, nothing special or memorable.   I'm a little surprised how much everyone likes this place. It wasn't terrible, but I was not impressed in any way. I think the lines between AYCE sushi restaurants start to blur a little because offerings are the same or very similar, so after trying a few restaurants, something needs to stand out. Perhaps if I had tried Kaya first, I may have liked them better.

ToWbDiCrfxmpjTMLnYwRlg.text: I have been there so many times and I was impressed. service was the best.. Leo and everybody else keep checking on us continuously. Food was sooo good. They never really take long time to cook food. They also do half roll. and this what makes us able to order variously to try every different ones. We'll definitely keep coming back here.. :)

1004HmFGFJoYRelphqDLLw.text: I came here last month and was at awe with the selection you had with AYCE (all you can eat). Desserts also included! The amount you spend is well worth the money if you're hungry!! The place is also very busy. They always have a wait list!

Lw78yxaEKwj073nlCMrfzQ.text: Spicy tuna role is good, staff friendly and nice, but their noisy neighbor Korean karaoke is too much to endure.   On the other hand, for people who sing in the Karaoke, they can get decent sushi conveniently, so, good for them,  :D

dXDL3Dzk3s6QnbryXvHySA.text: The All You Can Eat is so worth it... Lunch (11:30-4pm) For $19.99. Dinner (4pm-2am) for $22.95) .... All I gotta say is I usually come here once every trip I get out to Vegas :) good music and fresh food!

O8uFuhUQ8XAjLMkR2C70jA.text: I've been here a couple times and the food is great but the Services is GOD Aweful!!! No lie! I start to wonder if they cater to certain crowds and ignore others! Because the waitresses always forget the orders you place... Ive gotten my sushi items without a drink or ginger wasabi plate!... WTF... I laugh!...They bring out about 75 % of the order you place... Ignore you if you seem to be consuming alot and not show up to place another order!! This on a slow day too!! Then they tell you last round on food!!... I've learned that it's best to sit at the bar so they can't ignore you!... To those reading this: It's great for a late night AYCE sushi but don't expect service from the staff! I've seen the chefs act rude to other guest and waitresses don't know what they're doing sometimes!

wBncRyu6DX4d63msJzxqRw.text: Been here a couple of times at night with friends, and I have to say there are better places for sushi.  The price is decent for an AYCE sushi for $19.99, but the quality of fish is horrible. For people who are into nigiri sushi, this is not the place to be, the fish is cut super thin and accompanied by a lot of rice.  The rolls are decent, and the other non-sushi items are pretty good.  The one thing that I really didn't like about this place was the service.  The servers would get our first order and then once you received your order it was hard to order again.  There were times where we order nigiri and we would wait ten minutes, ask about it and then they would finally start making it.  If you want a place for cheap AYCE sushi at night this is one place, but I would rather pay a lil bit more for better service and quality.

0kS-qvjPTxYGISxSRubUZg.text: All you can eat sushi for $22.95 which is very resonable price. I liked their appetizers better than sushi. One of the best appetizers I have experienced in all you can eat sushi restaurants.  Sushi, the fish part was so thin and sushi rice was hot. (which is not supoosed to be hot) Servers were too busy to take care of customers.

GRMAopGY-wRxSb5l0-Pdsg.text: in town for a bachelorette we were in the mood for all you can eat sushi...i never realized there were so many options!  we were staying just off the strip (rio) and this place was less than a mile from our hotel.   i made a reservation for dinner about 1/2 an hour prior to our arrival and they were so awesome!  willing to accept the res and even to push back 15 minutes when all 6 of us girls (surprise surprise) couldn't get there in time! we got right in, sat down and immediately started talking about how great it smelled.  the ayce was $25 and it was INCREDIBLE!  SOOO many choices!  there wasn't one thing we tried that we didn't enjoy!  i personally am a HUGE fan of the grilled shrimp skewer app...but you can get sushi, rolls, salads, soups, skewers, bowls, etc....all a part of the ayce special.  soooo worth it! at the end of the meal we all agreed that aside from batista's...this is our new hole in the wall go-to when in town!

z5GPMdpvxRmrswPbBTjbug.text: We asked for a certain dish four times, but the server never brought it to us. They overcharged our card, but the blame came to us instead. The staff at the restaurant never attempted to offer an apology for their mistake. In fact, the 'manager' or 'owner' of the restaurant used vulgar language and turned away from us. It's a shame to consider this place for dinner, or even for a glass of beer. Their fish is not fresh and the entire restaurant is so dirty. The only reason why people go to this place is because the location is in Chinatown and because it is open until past 3am. If you are craving sushi, or any kind of japanese dish, wait until the next day and eat elsewhere. I am a local and this is by far the worst place ever with the worst customer service. I have never experienced a place like this before, i created a yelp account just for this. They should be so ashamed of who and where they work for.

SoQySy7GU6FN3-zH7ACRPQ.text: not bad, $23 for sushi, appetizers, and desserts.  not much to say, but they gotta have the best white fatty tuna in vegas!  good day.

ESkSPdYDFZq3CiImEX5Buw.text: I love their all you can eat or so I thought, My friends and I ordered the all you can eat last night , But apparently there are certain items that u can only order once, such as their  Ahi poke salad which it's considered an appetizer. I was taken back when The server told me I could not order it again. The service was alright they greet you once you walk in but once you sit down it was a different story .They walked away three times while my friends were still continuing to place an order with the server. When asked what kind of beers they carried the server was not knowledgeable and brought us a menu to look at instead. Other then that great sushi :)

uNxEuCcH9e3C8T5-NAk4Rg.text: 3.5 stars for meee.  Lunch $19.95 Dinner$21.95/$22.95 i forgot.  I was a little skeptical going here, we've always wanted to try their AYCE but we weren't sure if it was going to live up to our expectations hah. here goes my long review.  I had dinner here last night with the bf around 7 and it was packed. I really liked the atmosphere, tables were full and there was a party in the karaoke room so it was a little loud, and not so good singing haha kind of added to the fun atmosphere.  Overall i liked the dining experience Korean/Japanese, nice deco, fun atmosphere(they were playing K-pop the whole time) loved it! , friendly waitresses/chefs, fast service, cheap AYCE (2 hours!!), and good but not great food.   I was starving when we got there so i ordered alot of side-orders for the first round, we got: Skewers:] i was a big fan of these really tasty! you could only order one of each per person so we tried all of them except for the gizzards, the only one that i didnt like were the beef tongue but i've never tried it before so my opinion probably doesn't count for that.  Pan fried Udon: Really good, it had a korean feel to it, i think they had a kimchee mix in there but it wasnt too overwhelming, the only problem with this is when we left my udon plate was still there. Their size for this order is huge for AYCE, it was like a regular order and i think this got me kinda full fast.  Shrimp tempura: we got two orders of this and it was hot when it came out yummy and i was a fan of their tempura sauce kinda sweet-issh. AHI poke: Def get this if you like Ahi poke, very flavorful and fresh tuna. Baked Mussles: has a teriyaki sauce. ordered this couple of times.f I think we ordered more but these Appetizers really made my $22 worth it already without the sushi. Other appetizers are Kimchee fried rice, shrimp fried rice, bulgogi, fresh oysters, beef bowl, korean noodles, etc.   For the sushi.. I was a little disappointed, if this review was based on their wide selection of Appetizers i would have given them 5 stars. but for the sushi and nigiri for me they kind of fell short. We ordered salmon, tuna, yellow tail, cajun albacore, ama ebi, scallop.   - it was okay, some the salmon was kind of fresh but the others kind of tasted weird to me and the cajun albacore was drowned with like this vinegar taste.  For the rolls we ordered the OMG roll and the Spider roll, maybe we should of tried other ones but after forcing ourselves to finish the OMG roll.. oh my gah i guess we now know why its called that. The OMG roll was california roll with chunks of tuna on top of it with bigger chunks of tomatoes covered in their version of the dynamite sauce.. dont get it!! the way they arranged the roll wasnt how we expected it and we were unaware that they had tomatoes in it...yuck.. The spider roll was pretty good, i dont think this roll could ever be bad.  for dessert you could only get one ice cream:[ bummer! choices are vanilla, strawberry, and green tea.   All in all this place has good AYCE side dishes, really great selection, okay sushi, and great service. Just a side note if you're going to eat there dont wear a white blouse with shorts! that was what i was wearing and if i walked around the place people would have asked me for orderss.. i would go back here again to try their regular menu though.

azoKqDNUWjsmWZGo_MQjvA.text: Today me and my family went forr lunch in Kaya. The food was great and the service was excellent! !! Our server Han was exceptional!  He was very attentive, very knowledgable, very proffessional and very kind! He was on top of everything at all times. Our drinks were promptly refilled and the empty plates cleared from the table all the time. All I want to say is what and excellent service!!! I am lookong forward for our next visit!!!

m1KJtaE1rl319ucYDB5oEg.text: One of my favorite all you can eat sushi restaurant! They have the best spider roll there! The grilled shrimp skewer was also delicious. The hot items were great as well. Sushi was pretty fresh for being in the desert. Service was excellent always on top on our orders and quick service. Closes late as well.

Vr7Mkv6HNUSzoqSI_DM2Vg.text: First time reviewing, don't know if it is possible to give less than 1 star. However, it was definitely not my first time there today, their food has been consistently tasting worse every time I've went. The food is never cooked as well as it was the previous time, and the service gets worse and worse. I can understand neglect when they're not busy, but the rate that we received refills does not match up to how busy their servers were.   Also, an interesting situation which could have been easily resolved came up when I ate there today: my friend (who eats there a lot) brought multiple stamp cards, which more than qualified for a free meal. As a business man myself, I understand the value of being cheap for the sake of saving money for the business; however, something worth many more times the value of a $19.95 write off as a meal is keeping good customer relationships. By refusing to honor the fact that she did deserve a free meal, they lost 3 frequent customers who frequently brings other new customers to this establishment. Yes, their cards say no combining allowed; yes, my friend did forget her card several times; but also yes, they made a promise to honor a combination of stamp cards the last time she was there. Sometimes business people do have to take a step back and evaluate the whole situation instead of being a little bit stingy. Sometimes business people need to not make such a big deal out of a small transaction.   My friend ended up leaving without paying so I payed for her meal, and they took my money without batting an eye. I wish that one day we can live in a society where business owners can focus on people first and money second. Such a small transaction could have easily gone either way but they decided they needed $19.95 so desperately that they were willing to refuse long time customers.   Done deal. I paid unnecessarily so now I'm venting on Yelp. Thanks for taking the time to read this, anyone who does.

IvdxMY5FfsbnY1w4FAOohQ.text: I went here after a long day of work and I was super hungry. I was greeted by a girl and she was all smiles and that was good. I quickly got my drink and started ordering. The all you can eat price was $22.95. So I thought it was reasonable. I ordered mostly appetizers since that look more interesting then the sushi selection. I have to admit most of their food is spicy or really spicy. Which was a turn off since after one bite mouth was numb and I couldn't taste anything else after that.   After my first round of food was gobbled up I was still very hungry and I needed more food right away. The server asked me if she could do anything for me and I replied yes I would like to order more food. She smiled and went off to another table. So I was sitting there for 30 minutes I know coz I was timing this. And after the same girl came and asked me if I wanted some thing else?  At this point I was beyond angry and I started telling her off. Then she had the nerve to tell me that " well I'm here now so what would you like?". Right then and there I asked for the check!  Then she asked me if I was already full?  And I thought to my self , r u kidding me!!  The service at this restaurant is a embarrassment especially in this economy. All she had to do was apologize and be sincere about it and instead she had to give me lip. Well I spoke to the manager and she said she was sorry about I didn't get the feeling that she sincere about. I got the feeling that this happens all the time and this was a routine situation for then. The manager ask if i wanted the money back?  And because I felt like nobody was sincere I said " yes please". As if giving my money will make me forget about it. Or even keep me from speaking about it. Well they got another thing coming. This kind of situation should never happen and the servers there needs to be trained properly.

cMCVyrAYJPc7LjI21vyCRQ.text: Can't speak for others, but I would give this establishment a 'No Star' rating if I could. We are rather undemanding customers and we like to enjoy our dinners at a restaurant at our own pace and we do not expect servers to run around for us frivolously and our tips are at least 20% if not more.  We do not like to pick on any restaurant if it is simply OK. But this one is unbearable and I simply cannot hold back my opinion as someone who works butt off for our customers to make our living. The music was loud, and it was some sort of Korean pop music with rather fast beat. Sushi is a very Zen food which is supposed to be enjoyed in a rather serene environment, isn't it? The service is absolutely horrible: it was not the busiest time of the night as there were several empty tables; many servers were running around but nobody came to hand us a menu nor asked us for drink orders. I wanted to leave, but my diabetic husband started showing signs of low blood sugar and going to another sushi restaurant was just beyond him at that moment. So, with a number of failed attempts to get a server, finally one of them decided to stop by and took our drink order, right after he left, another server decided to hop by and asked us again for our drink order. We sat at the Sushi Bar, and there was a Sushi chef standing right in front of us, but instead of starting to take our orders, he completely ignored us. We waved at him several times, he finally reluctantly came over and said' you have to give your orders to your server and we make it for you." WTF??????You've got this bureaucracy going when most, if not all, other sushi chefs take care of the customers sitting in front of them directly along with servers assisting with their drinks. The drinks finally came, and the server was ready to walk away without asking us what we'd want for our food. That was strange, so I asked him if he should be the one who would take our sushi orders, he told us that the sushi chef would take our order directly since we were sitting at the sushi bar. Ooooookkkkkk. Seems like either the sushi chef who had spoken to us or this server had no clue if were not lying to us. Then the chef and the server conversed between themselves in front of us, in Korean, the server then took our orders and walked away. We told him that we were doing AYCE. We were expecting the orders should come gradually, but man o man, the servers dropped all our orders in front of us at the same time---at the sushi bar!! It was very embarrassing that we had all these plates spread out to the spaces next to us, thank Lord, no one was sitting next to us at the sushi bar. The yakitori was tiny but OK, the sushi rice was too soft and sticky as if they had put too much water in the rice when they were cooking it, which is no more than just being edible. We ordered two orders of Uni sushi, one for each, the uni was OK. And here came to insult--the chef told us that we were allowed to only have one order per person---wasn't it on the freaking menu? And we never wanted to order another round because 1) uni is a delicacy, not a staple 2) it is an expensive ingredient, for AYCE, as fellow business owners, we certainly understand the matter of numbers and don't want the restaurant to lose money!! The chef had to go out of his way to give us this freaking 'warning'?  We did order the second round of other sushis and rolls---a server wrote down all our orders on a piece of paper and ran to the back. The orders never came! We flagged down another server to follow up on our orders and the answer was they did not have our orders!!! Then why the heck that guy did not have the guts to come over and tell us that he'd lost the paper and ask us again what we ordered!  So much for our appetite, which was completely ruined. I hate to assume that this was their tactics to deter AYCE customers from ordering the food as they'd want, but all they had done so far left serious suspicion in our mind. We being nice customers does not mean that we are idiots. We wanted to talk to the manager. Guess what? The server walked away but the manager never came. Fine, enough is enough. We asked for our bill and that was the only thing that showed up right away. We paid the bill in full but left ZERO tips--yes, ZERO--never ever done this in my life, but this restaurant certainly earned it and it has a lot to catch up if they want to stay in business in the midst of tough competitions and bad economy.

xuaufqupWfoJrpd47HujnQ.text: good food, consistant customer service and great atmosphere. by far one of the best uni's i've had in a very long time and the all you can eat is worth the price.

GL4tuKteWqlBCGXEfpg2FQ.text: i haven't been here for over a year now because the last time i was here with my boyfriend we ordered the all you can eat sushi and had the worst service/experience i've ever had at a restaurant.  we had come a handful of times before and had always enjoyed the food and service, and would have never expected anything less. well, this last time we went we ordered the all you can eat and practically had to get up and go to order our food straight from the cook. our server ignored us the entire time. we were probably there for 2 hours watching other people come and go with full bellies. we weren't even quite sure who our server was because 3 different people came to our table. when we first ordered, 3 of 5 items came back to us so we waited for the rest and they never came. then everyone kept walking past our table ignoring us so we practically had to wave our arms in the air for someone to acknowledge us to inquire what happened to the rest of our food, and if we could get more water. it seemed like all the other tables were getting their food quickly and leaving. at that point we had ordered the all you can eat and i wasn't just going to leave without being full or getting my moneys worth of food otherwise we most definitely would have just walked out.  i'm not sure if it was because we ordered the all you can eat and it's just how they do it because they don't want you eat but they made us feel like we did something awful and did everything but ask us to leave. needless to say i'm scared to ever go back to this place.

796H7ga-37nQM9gkag3T1Q.text: When you choose to sit at the sushi bar, that usually means you wanna eat and go. Even while sitting right in front of the sushi guys, they forgot too many orders to count and were extremely slow. Waitresses, rude and not helpful at all. Service was unbearable. Prices are cheap and that is about it.

HgoiWKHQU-dKJEg6YnXwjQ.text: They got me, I'm a fan. Sent out a mass text to my fellow sushi lovers... I was craving an all you can which they suggested as being yummy for the money. I'm picky about my sushi, especially the all you can eat. I was here with the boy friend. He isn't really a big fan of anything seafood (other than shrimp, which has to be cooked). He got a beef teri bowl and after much debate, I decided with the all you can eat. Not too shabby, as it was $22.95 for dinner all you can eat. I got soo much food, it was amazing how much I ate. LOL i actually counted each individual order and added up the prices and I ate almost $60 dollars worth... if I would have chosen ala carte. Service was good, they weren't all up in your face rushing or watching you as you eat. That was nice. I had read a few reviews and some people were complaining about service, I didn't have a prob. Happy belly that night= food coma.

T7-6OayU-desGq5lywFaTQ.text: Local Eats Sushi Bar. Food is very good but what makes this great is the prices which are extremely reasonable in for Las Vegas.

qqbE_Ab-5xx86wuJjlaSIQ.text: Service can be slow, and thee is often a wait (30+ minutes), but I love how big their appetizer selection is!  Be sure to try the Amigo Roll!

xptwXtx_evCRjJP4ZsNe9g.text: Best sushi in vegas, the only downside is that it's always packed, but overall is delicious! my first choice for all you can eat sushi spot!

QgQy_ZrxUeUoUcF0o--34w.text: Awesome find!!! Not sure why people only giving 3-4 stars?? Service was amazing, have all you can eat for lunch for $21, which is well worth it! Best thing is you can order 1.2 orders on the rolls so you can try a lot!! Fish was fresh and everything was yummy!  We are sushi snobs from LA, and this was a great find!!

aIUasrRND64JSQxUIeT7aA.text: My favorite sushi place to go to. Their sushi really does not compare to others sushi restaurants. No one can beat Kaya so far, I just wish it was more cleaner

CHNwcC_EyinQanwMU0i72A.text: This breaks my heart because I use to love this place.  Just so amazing but the last two visits have been so terrible I don't think I can go back.  The visit before I was standing in the men's room waiting for a toilet to open up (they only have two) and watched as a cook strolled out of the stall and walked right out the door.  He didn't wash his hands!!!  I almost lost my lunch right there.  As I was leaving I told the manager what I saw and he said well don't worry they wash their hands on the line.  Okay then.  My last visit the food took awhile and the baked Alaska didn't look right.  As I was leaving I noticed their health grades were a B and a C.  That was worrisome.  Of course I got sick the next day.  I'm not saying it is related but.....  Not where I'm going anymore.

rMzO9W1Vls7q4BdXAmNvcQ.text: By far my fav sushi spot in Vegas! Try the sex bomb roll it's the best but the parking situation is horrible. They need a bigger lot.

0ZoJK8IQ1xgwbfpPMT_-Ug.text: Our fav sushi place used to be yama sushi. I think they are replaced to sushi kaya now. Great selection, yakitori selection. Kimchi fried rice? Fried Udon?? Come on, this place is bomb.  We came in late one evening decided that we would like some sushi dinner at midnight. Guess what? Its still open and its an absolutely one of the best sushi joint in las vegas. Love their rolls and dynamite. Surely you must try this place. Surely.

Uo1mt_CSOUgb7nr3dlIF0g.text: I've been here more than a couple of times. Location is really small and really busy they should take under consideration that 40 mins wait will possibly cause for customers to leave. Very successful restaurant I just wished they expand. As for the service I'll give them a 6 due to the fact that it is a ACYE restaurant and customers should always be attended every 10 mins or so. The carbonated drinks are always flats that's a big issue for me. They tend to leave the co2 drinks in a pitcher which eventually goes flat and they still unfortunately serve it. The servers are usually very nice. I've only had one bad experience with one server she was very rude and seemed bothered every time I'd ring the button there wouldn't be a reason for me to push the button if she'd constantly check on my table.  The food is absolutely amazing I lovee their crunch, xxl, california, Lisa Lisa rolls and many more. The shrimp tempora is always fresh and crispy. Bacon and asparagus & shrimps are very tasteful as well. Miso soup also delightful perfect temperature every time! The food is delicious never had a problem with the cooks.  I just really hope they open new locations and hire more staff so customers are well taken are off. I do recommend their food but if you have no patience I wouldn't suggest it.

ncgfMN_QvSHg9EUOsnk1UQ.text: Was here for valentines I loved everything I ordered thanks babe!! Don't have to spend a lot to get good quality sushi AYCE

UpHByYylfiGBWOPnF07jXQ.text: great space and friendly staff! we loved the brooklyn bridge roll, we ordered it 3 times! we came during the dinner slot for all you can eat and it was way worth it. also loved all the crunchy rolls like the french kiss. definitely going to be coming back!

KI7gCSINB9GwqMlRtPF0Aw.text: I came here yesterday evening. It was packed and lady told me that waiting time would be around 45 min but they called me after 20 min. Very fast service even with many people inside, good food, I really enjoyed that place, definitely coming back

1Rh93j5uyeSlfPX62i12ug.text: Service was fast and everything tasted great. The dynamite was a small portion that was delicious and not so filling. All you can eat for lunch is only $20. None of the rolls really caught my eye but the appetizers were all awesome. Will definitely go back

jCNzenDUEZNGV915tZGGFA.text: I must say the worst sushi experience yet  not only was the hostess rude the toilet seats in the restroom were both broken the children prices are apparently applied if the staff working  that day feel your children look like children my 10 yr old is very tall for his age so the staff charged me adult prices for him and when I addressed the issue they didn't disclose the children age till after I told them how old my son was after the fact didn't make an attempt to fix the charges then we were charged 18% percent gratuity for our party to find out later that night that it is no longer legal for merchants to charge 18% anymore if you do visit this place watch out for the gratuity ! I will not recommend any of my friends to ever visit this place

4v1ILfI0kUJ4TmK4KtRUEA.text: The food was was ok BUT the service was horrible. My cup was empty for at least 15 minutes and the server wasn't enthusiastic at all.

05qBwo1SN7Ik-3PCAM-NxA.text: It's hard to get this type of rating from me... Service on point... Food on point... I taste the quality... Plz test this place out for yourself... Kaya Sushi got a new fan out of me...

b1kxttKFwzEwoKtOju3AVw.text: Today we came in sat down we're ordering and a roach walked across our table in broad daylight.  Fucking disgusted. It's ridiculous that all our waiter had to say was sorry guys.

_yendFtmCY7VdLj2PsKw0w.text: Love this place! Extremely attentive service and the all you can eat joy of the world. The food comes almost instantly and is fresh. Highly recommended if you are in Vegas, for a reasonably priced meal with fresh fish and outstanding service.

yKTIaAUw0EJTZyuL_UJzCQ.text: Very friendly staff and always asked us if we needed anything else. The price is good for AYCE sushi dinner. The only thing I had a problem with is that the restaurant is very small and the sushi was not great.... it was mediocre. We tried about 8 different rolls and about 10 different nigiris, all just tasted okay. I was a little disappointed because we had a friend in town and would like to have taken him to an amazing sushi house but that didn't happen. As much as the staff was very friendly, I would try other places first before I make a trip to Sushi Kaya again.

Ww7rk0hIZn2LSNr2M7LMJw.text: This place has hands down, THE BEST sushi I have ever had!  Some girlfriends and I were in Vegas for a friend's 25th birthday weekend and her party planner recommended that if we wanted sushi, to come here.  She said they had all-you-can-eat sushi and as soon as we heard that, we were sold!  I got miso soup, a cucumber salad, calamari, and 2 12-piece sushi rolls all for $20! The soup, salad, and appetizers are also included in the $20 all you can eat price which was so awesome!  Everyone must go here at least once! There were 8 of us girls and service was super fast, even though we ordered a lot!

N0ocmppEsUUCxeI7aEYdnw.text: THE best all you can eat sushi restaurant. We come here everytime we go to vegas. Sex bomb roll was amazing and the service is suuuper fast. Don't forget to try their mochis :) love this place so much I definitely recommend trying this place out

fGPv-IaUpASWKkU9GrH8Jg.text: YELPERS LOVE AYCE SUSHI!!  $22 for lunch, and $26 for dinner/late night! Great value considering the depth of the menu (30+ specialty rolls, grilled skewers, fried rice, etc.). Even if you're with somebody who doesn't enjoy sushi, there's enough on the AYCE menu to make a great meal out of. I love how they offer the "half roll" option for AYCE...more places should offer it too! You can try out more of their options that way.  It's a $10 uber ride from the Strip. Worth coming out if you're craving sushi and don't want to pay premium pricing on the Strip.   Final Piece of Dirty Donovan Life Advice? Save room for dessert! The green tea mochi is ON POINT!!!

oDfz1u_xgn8V2gd3I6pm0g.text: Sushi Kaya is definitely my go-to spot when it comes to AYCE sushi. Their staff is usually very friendly and attentive, and the price is just right for what they offer.  Every time I go here, I always start with an agedashi tofu to get things going. I've tried agedashi at other places and the one here is my favorite.  I love their baked rolls with my favorite being the California dream roll. It's a little on the heavy side so I usually do half order for it. I also like the lasagna.  I definitely recommend this place as you get your money's worth m. The wait times could be a little long sometimes, but it's not too terrible.

mP6hPXvdPih0FPyz3tvuwQ.text: This is my family's go spot for sushi.  We a loop ways do the all you can eat.  I usually only order half rolls this way I can try more items without getting full too fast or to avoid wasting anything because there is a fee for over ordering.   One of my favorite rolls is the Jose roll.  It has soucy tuna on the inside and tuna on top with ponzu sauce and a jalepeno and some chile sprinkled on top if you can't handle anything too spicy this isn't the roll for you.  My kids love the Jackpot roll it has crab and tempura shrimp on the inside and on top temoura crumbs and a sweet sauce.  My husband get's the salmon skin roll and spider roll with out fail. We also like the garlic skewers, beef skewers, there are just so many options on their menu too many to list.  Miso soup, udon noodle soup. Plus you can get a scoop of icream and a piece of mochi for dessert.  They are always so friendly and all the servers work together as a team so your water cup is never empty someone is always checking to see if you need anything else.  Something we found out today if it's your birthday they will sing to you and bring you out a special dessert with a candle in it. My husband was a little embarrassed but she kept it low key.

k5uZgF1Sup8IjnRTj-x9uQ.text: Amazing they don't have a 5 star average on yelp. I'm seriously shocked. All you can eat has tons of value and includes all menu items. Service was good and food was mouthwatering good. What gives people; what else could you ask for? I am very happy with them and will return.

IH8YZqmc5fK5FTiDLfpTEw.text: This is just one of those places you always go back and keep giving try's because the sushi is good but sometimes a roll or two can be a little questionable, but they have definitely gotten better.In the beginning of last year I had came and got seriously sick right after a roll and went straight to the bathroom in the restaurant to throw up I know super gross and to be honest I wouldn't have ever came back after that but my family really likes it here and I was willing to give the place a second try because it's been over a year since that happened and I'm a forgiving person, so we all decided to get together for a family dinner here, the rolls did take quite some time to come out, but other then that service was good and the food was good and it's always nice when you discover a new roll you like and the evergreen roll took the trophy on this trip.

su8ZYSXFsTi8Db7T4Rs_pg.text: AYCE Sushi! What can  I say? I've been wanting to try this place ever since my parents told me about it. We walked in on a Wednesday night and it wasn't too pack. To our luck, it's their 10th anniversary so AYCE is around $23? bucks per person. SCORE!   We sat down and we got our drink orders and our waiter stopped by to take our order. Oh man is there a lot to choose from! Certain dishes like the uni is only one order per person. We had a total of 5 and 1/5 of us liked uni so lucky for that person, he got 10 pieces of it! All their fishes were pretty good. It wasn't amazing but what can I say, it's $23 bucks! We ordered a ton of food ranging from nigiri, to rolls, to tempura. We opted out for the noodles cause I wanted to save my stomach for the fish! Nomz!!! We were so full in the end but I still managed to sneak some dessert into my tummy. The mochi was meh....I got the mango mochi and it didn't really taste like mango. The cheesecake was alright, nothing too amazing.   All in all, it's $23 bucks, what can you say? I would definitely stop by again if I were to stay in town for a longer period of time.

iwWBYXHS7xAQirpvJA9fvg.text: This place has become a family tradition. For the last 4 years, my wife, her parents, and I come here for Thanksgiving. The sushi is fresh, the flavors are great, and the service is usually prompt.   Now today, we did have a slight issue with the avocado. It wasn't even close to being ripe and had no business being served in sushi. However, because we've been coming here for years (not just for Thanksgiving) and this was our first problem, we felt they still deserved 5 stars.

v8bCTZEn4R3Ve4g_2zmd7Q.text: What a treat! Our server was so sweet and personable! He really knew th food and got all of our demand oj ng and picky orders just right. This place is really fun for groups and because you can choose all you can eat you get a great chance to try many items! We were a party of 5 at 6:45 on a Saturday and only had a 15 minute wait!

ihKLik4bKVeKvRc0ssNL2w.text: This is a favorite.  How is this place only getting 3.5 stars?  The wait was incredible prior to us coming in and so glad we came in after the rush.  It's just about 1 am....filling up all over again.  Quality of sushi was yum.  Buttery goodness.  Only thing we probably didn't care for was the Mochi ice cream.  Not even going to knock a star for that... the most important part was that the core of the meal served and delivered.

b0Gpk584a9KI9LTxxXfwjg.text: The service is horrible!!!!  I will never come back.  You're not getting your moneys worth because the service is so slow and you can only get 2 orders in an hour.  Our server is the worst   It took them 30 mins to bring our order. Took them 15 mins to ask for our orders.  This is the Most HORRIBLE Place. Took them 45 minutes to bring my Dynamite Roll.  Don't come here if you only have an hour for lunch.  If you do order about 6 sushi at the time they take your order because you won't see them for another 40 mins.  We constantly had to ask for our order.  It was the worst experience for an all you can eat sushi.  NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!  This pace really sucks!!!!

hROZwm6r5dou4gFbz-V4cA.text: I love this sushi place rolls are amazing  I like everything on the menu  I go every Saturday to eat sushi at this place  Customer services is great they're very quick bringing the food. Five stars for sure!

_AKMnVdb2upr7a40NurOJQ.text: Loving this place! The service was SO fast and the food is great. I was able to find some vegan options for fair pricing. Try the Korean Japchae! I will absolutely be coming back here again.

lVMp-MFu537KLA5qfRfp0g.text: With so many restaurants for AYCE sushi in the area, this place was recommended by a friend of ours as a go-to place. Sure enough, when we got there, it was a 20-30 minute which meant that this place is definitely popular among locals. It was a Wednesday night, during peak hours and we were able to find parking behind the building.  AYCE per person is $26.95 for dinner. Pretty much everything on the menu is part of the AYCE. There are a few items that you can only order once per person, everything else is unlimited! Sushi was exceptional, everything we ordered was very tasty. What I liked is that they don't include a lot of rice in the sushi rolls, which means you are able to eat more sushi!! Their menu is fairly large, especially their rolls, so choose wisely when picking your sushi unless you know you are going to eat it all.   In addition to sushi, they have appetizers, fried rice, fried noodles that are also part of the AYCE menu. Dessert is also included with your meal: ice cream or mochi ice cream, so make sure to save room at the end!  All of the servers were very attentive to our needs and our food always came out in a reasonable time. I can see why this place is highly recommended by others as well. I will definitely try to come back to eat here the next time I am in town.
