q-Qc7B5-B5PYl4kKDl11gw.text: First time here and it didn't disappoint. I will be back! I was afraid due to some reviews but I decided to try it anyway with a group of friends that had decided on this place. Sushi was good! Service was great! And the garlic edamame is so freaking delicious!

oiWH_N07Ns7VWbGMumepTA.text: Great restaurant!   Good place to have some affordable sushi, all you can eat and very fresh! Will be coming back soon!

MB7cRaA-eBqzMqDGfZSHxw.text: Only good thing about this place is that it's one of the only sushi spots open till later. Foods not bad either. My main problem is being treated rudely and given bad customer service. I was being treated rudely during one of my visits and decided to go back a year later, giving them another chance. I was disappointed as you can tell from my 1 star review. The staff needs to be trained in customer service and the rude ones need to be let go if you want happy customers.

IvXHEcGJecY6A-5nxLMf5Q.text: We all had the AYCE sushi dinner option ($26.95). They have several choices that are pretty good. Tuna, salmon, crab, shrimp, eel, etc. Sometimes they combine different fruits and veggies with the seafood to make different varieties of rolls (avocado, mango, cucumber, daikon, etc). They even have a few riceless options for the carb-conscious customer. The fish is medium quality but that's understandable with an AYCE menu. I would not recommend the beef shish kabob. It's mostly fat.   I'm giving three stars for the 5 times different servers/busser/hostess came to the table to ask if we were ready to pay the check. I understand trying to get a good table turnover to make money but it was after 10 pm on a Monday with empty tables around us. I don't think there was a waiting list and we hadn't gone over the 90 minute max dining time. Even our friends with us, who are in the service industry, were a little taken back.

gJ9xAXPP4X6c1tNGVrr1dg.text: My last visit there wasn't a good experience  Starting from the quality of the food all the way to the service.  We did all you can eat honestly you can do it anywhere in Vegas for same prices as 25$-30$ per person and we didn't order lots of food anyway!!! We had left few pieces of sushi like maybe 5% food on table the server didn't wanna give me the check she told me : finish the food like I'm 5 years old !!! I told her I want the check now don't waist my time please and she give me a hard time during my dinner time. She tells me I have to charge you for leftovers (doesn't makes sense) I told her charge me whatever you need and let me go.   She charge me additional 3$ total in the end !! So why to make all this drama for 3$ !?!?  As an owner for a place like that I'll be ashamed to called my self a business this is embarrassing! I'll never go there again unfortunately.

edvWSwFi5wGAWBBOkm_Qjw.text: Pretty decent for AYCE. My favorite part of my meal was the udon noodle soup and green tea ice cream...so good!

BC_mISTiVmy52HfPf77g5A.text: I've given this place MULTIPLE chances and each time was the same. Terrible service, rude management, and this restaurant has been on DIRTY DINING. I'm not surprised at all.   First time: I wasn't eating all you can but I asked the guy if I would be able to switch. He rudely said "No and if I catch you eating off their plates I will remove you myself." Our table laughed but he then said he was serious and "don't try it."   Second time: We specifically ordered HALF rolls and they brought us full rolls. When we told the guy we asked for half rolls he said "well you have to eat all of it because if you don't I'm charging you extra." WHAT!? talking about controlling issues.   The LAST time: The SAME GUY from the first visit saw my grandmother walk in and immediately embarrassed her! She gets around in a wheel chair and it would get stuck on chairs. He told her she had to leave because she's disturbing guests!! They weren't even disturbed especially since they were helping her. That was the last straw.   They have an occupancy sign which they don't follow. They've been on dirty dining in which they all of a sudden "don't speak English". They're rude, condescending and extremely temper mental.  NEVER going back and continuing to steer people away the best I can.

7DITMiL0bhL4_XdELuHLxg.text: Dropped by just to buy dessert. I didnt try their sushi but the "mint cheesecake" was literally a tiny I mean TINY alice of miny cheesecake and it wasnt good at all. I'll update my review once I try their sushi :)

bAwOJen0PLGF6GTozsc-kw.text: Quality sushi but I always hear about the place next door closed down by the health department.  Hope the roaches stay on the other side of the wall. Have never gotten sick here and food is always made to order.  Freshest sushi in China Town and always a line out the door with wait times sometimes 2 hours and people actually wait because it's that good.  This is my go to place when visitors come to town.

ZMPfj3HUainIVGrJr5K0FA.text: This place used to be great but its service had decreased drastically. We were a group of about 8 and the person who reserved the table and arrived before everyone was never asked if he wanted a drink. Was just brought water and he pretty much had to grab someone after 3 people had been to the table and asked everyone else what they wanted to drink to place a drink order. I then asked about a pitcher of sangria instead of ordering by the glass and the waiter pretty much looked at and explained to everyone except me the only person asking about the sangria that they have pitchers but ordering by the glass wads better...so at the end we all have our checks, I counted out in front of the people at the table with me the cash I was using and then putting the rest on my card and some how the amount in cash they took was different and charged my card more. I confirmed with the four people closest with me that I counted out a certain amount and everyone agreed. I caught a waiter and said hey I think my bill is off I have this amount. He instantly gets rude and said no you have this amount. I didn't even give him my bill I gave it to a female waitress. But everyone around me also said to him that it was the amount I said. He's still arguing telling me it wasn't. At this point I can see it's not getting anywhere so I say ok whatever and he proceeds to tell me he can pull the camera because I didn't give that amount and walks away. We all felt that was rude and asked to speak to a manager. The same waiter comes back and says he's a manager. I asked to speak to someone else and he says he's the only one so I proceed to tell him that his comment was rude and unnecessary after the fact I had said ok and stopped going back and forth with him and he proceeds to tell me I have a different amount and says that he's sorry I feel that way. He was very rude and none of us believe he was the only manager on duty. We come there all the time and have never had such terrible service and for sure will never be back again.

G-za7B0R6NOtFaONo7kRmQ.text: For a Monday night I honestly thought the wait might be a little shorter. The last time I tried coming here, the wait was over an hour long and I just didn't have the patience to wait that long because I was HANGRY. This time we were quoted a wait of about 30-45 minutes which I was okay with. Ended up waiting a total of 1 hr 10mins.   We did AYCE and the food came pretty quickly. I was pleasantly surprised. The sushi was delicious.   Then the service changed and we had to wait about 15 mins for our server to come back around just to give us our check. Our table was obviously cleared and we were just sitting around waiting so I think it was pretty clear we were ready to leave.  Overall, sushi was great but if we arrived at 7pm and didn't leave until almost 10, I don't think I'll be coming here too often.

oQiQYbrAWAzm-15Wc3ICOA.text: Don't be put off that it is in a strip mall. We went on a Thursday night around 7:30. Our wait was maybe 2 minutes. Once we were seated our waiter came over to offer drinks. He was pretty witty, although not awesome as a waiter. He seemed a little forgetful, and when I was not ordering fast enough, he seemed impatient.   We did the AYCE sushi. I could tell you all the names of the rolls I had, but I can't remember them all. The sushi seemed fresh and the sauces were very flavorful. Most items came pretty quick.  Cooked items like the "who is your dad" took a little longer. We for sure got our money's worth.   The sushi was great, and I recommend it. A couple things kept it from 5 stars. 1) The waiter. As I mentioned, he was witty, but not an awesome waiter.  2) on several of the items, the presentation seemed a little sloppy. Sushi is an adventure and I would have liked a little more flair.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some of the rolls.

6cgf0vH-Qu4r4kC9yQ7lIQ.text: Maybe one of the better AYCE sushi in Vegas. Maybe that's why there's always a queue throughout dinner to late night!   We waited about 30 minutes for a table. Finally seated we decided to hurry and order. I got all nigiri and my friend got all rolls.  All the nigiri were all decent sized and not overwhelmed with rice! The sushi was not fishy at all and we're all good.   EXCEPT....  Of course there's no uni!! The rice was more than warm. Rice is never suppose to warm in sushi. So that felt kinda gross in my mouth. Also they servers so slow! They take forever to bring out your food after you have ordered. Maybe it's a technique to get people full so they don't order anymore.   Pass on Sushi Kaya.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice sized sushi

7rrGTuT01ucf9mXTpP8S3w.text: Sushi Kaya Never Disappoints.  I've tried other places for an AYCE Sushi and Sushi Kaya has to be the best so far (in my opinion).   The three amazing things that separate them from the rest.  1. Food of course! The sushi, sashimi (which is unfortunately only available for dinner), and side dishes are lovely. The sushi options from nigiri, rolls, and ect. never end! If your feeling daring and want to try something different like the Mango Roll which is sweet and refreshing. Or if you want something a little more familiar like a tempura roll, or maybe you'll want something that's artery clogging goodness like a deep fried roll? (I recommend getting half orders so you can try different rolls without getting too full!) The sashimi is fresh and the presentation is beautiful, and the side dishes range from spicy udon noodles to baked muscles. Desserts are also a really nice way to end the meal. (Ice cream mochi, cheese cake, or ice cream)  2. Music. It's a personal preference but I don't like it when a restaurant is silent. When the restaurant is silent, if feels weird talking because it sounds so loud. The music here ranges from K-Pop to todays hottest hits, a little bit of everything if you may.  3. Staff. The people here are really great. I feel that whenever someone's eating in an AYCE place and maybe someone runs out of water. It generally would be REALLY hard to flag someone down because they're so busy with other tables. But here they are really amazing by being really nice and attentive. They generally get all orders in, and nothing gets forgotten (if that happens it's really rare).  Sushi Kaya is a little pricy, but with great food, catchy music, and an awesome staff. I believe it's worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful!
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!

q6Eb1zs2jXDJu3givUUwGg.text: Hands down the fastest All You Can Eat sushi with the biggest portions! Lunch is $21 and dinner is $26. They have a full bar and a HUGE AYCE menu to choose from.      They are really well staffed, we came on a Monday around 2pm and they were packed with a waiting list but we were seated in a few minutes and had our orders taken within a couple more.      They have other Asian cuisine on the all you can eat menu, like curry and skewers and Deep fried sweet Potatoes! Their cheese cake is awesome and their specialty roles that aren't included in the AYCE are unbelievably delicious and around $10-13.       They are open till 3a and do time you from when you start eating. You get 90 minutes for AYCE.     They have a punch card system where you buy 10 meals and get one free which includes the AYCE menu.       They place nice upbeat music too!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stumpy

OAP4C9DCY7Evhu0kGn2GGA.text: Super fresh and delicious sushi, fast and friendly service. Weekends can have a bit of a wait, but well worth it. Try the Salmon Fashion and Jose rolls!

sdfD73OedRQcYwhEjd7Izg.text: After having been here many times, I feel like the quality went down a little. The last visit just confirmed it for me. I'm a sucker for salmon nigiri and I love the buttery smoothness of it. Although the salmon nigiri here is rationed appropriately (there could be a bit more fish), there was an off taste to it, as if it had been sitting out too long. I didn't get sick from it, but I know my fresh salmon.  The one thing I do enjoy from here is their baked rolls. Make sure you try one of them. Other than that, you could get a better experience at another AYCE that offers more appetizers and fresher fish.

js9q7jO9jSKR4ELXRep1sw.text: A group of us had dinner here last night, my girlfriend & I were the only ones that ate sushi (everyone else ate chicken & rice). Not even 2 hours later, my girlfriend & I were both extremely sick in the worst way. Lots of vomit. Safe to say we will never be back, it was the worst experience we've had at a sushi restaurant. The fish was either bad or mustn't have been prepared right. Aside from getting sick, the service wasn't great either. Our server wasn't easy to get ahold of to place our sushi orders through out the duration of our dinner. We kept having to ask other servers or bussers to find our server. All in all not a great experience.  **After a formal complaint was made with the health dept after our visit here, Sushi Kaya was on Dirty Dining 2 weeks later & received 35 demerits!

HJUIGk_cVUM0mI_oqQVPSg.text: I have been in Vegas less than a week and have had Lunch and Dinner here. The Service is Great the price is unbelievable for everything you get. The dinner rush is pretty overwhelming chance of a wait but well worth every minute. It was highly recommended the baked mussels is a "Must". I'm from an island and mussels is served many ways but the flavor is unforgettable! The choices you have for sushi is also something to be taken by. They have a wide selections for rolls and other dishes. From Kim chee fried rice to mochi for dessert literally all you can eat from start to finish.

8qdn8sfL0tLo43erTZzSWA.text: Been here few times, o always get there all all I u can eat: gotta. Say? Service is going glad. Service mediocr I order a ship temporarily amd they come wrong and again I said pls get right and they do wrong Agaon. I said it's ok. I left   Their sushi is really good but they messed up twice   It was busy though   Always busy  I leans them ( Stars bc they're ok

flwsanhRHJSbygNZ2HG-Sg.text: Always busy but great sushi. All you can eat for $25. Service is not really fast but always friendly.

wPGklkgCdMJFQqh8hD83Bw.text: Haven't been back in a while but my first impression was in shock of how small the restaurant is but the service and food was DELICIOUS ! I'd recommend anybody to come here.

Hstg4pVF5q5u6FNoXhYfZQ.text: This is hands down, the best sushi joint in Las Vegas.  It is located right in the heart of China town and offers all you can eat sushi for about $25.  The price is great and so is the sushi.  They have tons of rolls to choose from and you never run out of options.  The Brooklyn roll is my favorite and if you like eel then it is a must try.  Even when it is busy the waitstaff is attentive and always keeps the food coming.  They offer a frequent buyer card too, so if you go to Kaya 8 times, then you get a free meal.    (If you plan on going Friday or Saturday night be prepared to wait since it gets super busy)

-TKZbrP0YCssyWnj1ZdrRA.text: Frequent this place usually once a week with my fiancee, it is usually a good experience but last night was bad. We sat at the sushi bar, which we have fine before and it took them a few minutes just to take our drink order. Our first order of sushi was taken, it was over the next 25 to 30 minutes to get all of our pieces. No-one came to check on us, refill drinks or take our next order till I flagged him down after 15 minutes. Again Ayer waiting for our dishes to come I sat passing on my phone because no-one came to check on us again. Again I had to flag down the waiter who seemed shocked that we were done. So when the check came, I normally tip 20% but only did 10% for this bad service.

CIQHaIYJRon1zFGRwjCzNw.text: I am loyal to my sushi spot... I recently ended up here because they are open until 3am on a Friday night. So had to check it out. Price wise it is standard to AUCE places. One thing this place has is service. Not your typical get in, pay and we are kicking you out ASAP type sushi place. There was a small wait but worth it. 5 stars on service alone. The quality of the food itself was top notch even at 1am !! Def give this place a shot next time you are craving late night sushi.

EGKb8W-_AxTM1uYDaPrmGw.text: Our last visit was terrible. I thought we had found our favorite sushi place, but instead were let down by a chef with dirty habbits such as stuffing his face while also preparing food. No gloves and no hand washing inbetween eating and prepping as a bonus! Then grabbing a dirty rag and using it to wipe up his hands because we all know just how unhygenic gloves can be. Upon mention to the manager the only reprimend told to the chef was change that dirty towel. Upon seeing these actions my wife became sick to her stomach and could not continue eating so we asked for our check. Now seeing as we had only begun to eat one would think that by no means we should have paid for both meals, perhaps a 50% off for this inconvience but instead we were met with a 20% off due to poor management. Now not to say we ate there alot, but in 2 weeks we spent $700 so yeah... This is not the place to make your regular spot... Infact avoid it all together because raw sushi can make you sick if not properly handled.

9m0pmPDLvekHQPzxLnLdjg.text: Visiting LV from LA, gf since HS and fellow Yelper took me to this quaint little establishment off the strip. It's not much from the outside, situated in a strip mall, as you walk in it's as if you walk into a little Japan. Inside is contemporary design, with cozy booths and tables.   Friend and I had the AYCE sushi, of course. Service was spot on, the food just kept coming and coming for a good part of 2 1/2 hours. And was all so wonderful on the palette. I think we ate just about everything on the menu. I have been to several other AYCE sushi establishments and have accepted that "it is what it is"...limited menu items, limited time to eat, and green tea ice cream for dessert. UGH!!!! There was none of that at Sushi Kaya. The AYCE includes a plethora of menu choices; appetizers, soups, noodles, sashimi, of course a wide range of sushi, AND desserts. When I say desserts, I don't mean just green tea ice cream, I mean you've got options. That was really surprising to me and I was very happy to be able to order several different desserts. Thinking back, we weren't rushed out like so many restaurants typically do for the purposes of turnover. Sitting relaxing catching up over AYCE sushi, now that's a day well spent.  When traveling I prefer to go where the locals go, and this is definitely a local place and I will definitely return the next time I'm in LV.

2_oA0wJIAmTwPjgsU2CiNg.text: Food was good! Just that our waiter took long in checking up on us. They told me we couldn't get any bigger table. Could be I came little late since our friends got there before us but I am coning for second try.

N5TYE5TuGP2K-yKtybmHjQ.text: Sushi Kaya is probably one of my most favorite sushi bar/restaurant in Vegas. Tonight when I visited the food was delicious and everything was great until I saw a roach crawling up the wall by my table. I saw a previous review about seeing a roach but I was thinking that it was just maybe a little roach that came in on accident, until it happened to me as well.

ZM00jxxOPtBMcQXEu_A6rw.text: I really want to like this place based on its ambiance and nice menu options, as well as their 23 dollar AYCE option, but they fell short for me.  Kaya is a nice sushi bar to meet up after drinking or for a late night bite.  I love the decor in this place and the music is contemporary, so that's  nice.  What's missing from here is better service and food, in my opinion.  After reviewing their menu I found that their prices are reasonable, so we ordered tempura appetizer and 2 orders of their fried chicken.  While we waited we had some water, chatted for a few minutes, and then our tempura arrives.  Five dollars for 3 small shrimp?  REALLY???  I pay that much and I get at least 5 pieces or more everywhere else.  I guess it's because they are posh, or they think three is enough for two people.  I should've ordered one more, so that may have been my fault.  Twenty minutes later a plate comes out with lots of chicken, pickled radish mixed with carrots, and this shredded cabbage heap with ketchup and mayo latticed on top.  (see pic)  Interesting, but definitely NOT korean fried chicken.  I mean, technically it is because of where we bought it, but in terms of how it was prepared and how it came out, definitely not.  The chicken was fried TO DEATH--leather is easier to chew.  The crust is very crispy, but it won't save the leather within.  I love picked radish, but there's was definitely frozen and thawed somehow before serving it to me, because there was a ton of ice left in my dish mixed in with the radish.  Freaky.  I've never seen a restaurant use frozen daikon, or maybe there the first to get caught.  Either way it made it somewhat a challenge to eat because the radish was soggy to chew, which is honestly gross.  The salad was basically--when you mix the ketchup and mayo--thousand island dressing on salad, but I don't dig ice in my cabbage, either.  We tried their sushi, which was decent, such as their cali roll, but their tuna looked freakishly pink, so I assume they purchased the dyed fish.  you know, the ones dyed on purpose to not lose color when degrading?  it's an honest business, but it kills the flavor of the fish.  Overall I think if you want AYCE sushi, stick to that when coming here, but in terms of anything else on the menu, I'd be weary.  With my fried chicken experience on top of the sushi and small appetizer, I left sad.  I hate leaving full but sad.    I'll try this place again in six months, but for now, I refuse to walk through those doors again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining area

N91mjgJayufW89vypCYlRQ.text: If you guys are looking for a cheap place to eat sushi this is your place. Lunch starts you off at $19.95 for a all you can eat. The lowest I have ever seen for a all you can eat sushi buffet. Their sushi quality meets me expectations. Enough to where I wouldn't mind going back again. Again, if you guys are looking for a cheap and decent place to eat an all you can eat sushi buffet I would highly recommend Sushi Kaya. Don't forget to tip your waiter and your chefs!

5tf_WhWsUG2wWIVhLbocnw.text: Great place me and my girlfriends all time favorite!!!! I didn't even like sushi until I can here

hTvSccsx9MLWCoC3gHyLZg.text: Ate here the last day of our Vegas trip and I wish I found this place sooner.  At first, I thought it was a order and pay kind of place which would be kind of expensive but i was surprised it was an all your can eat Sushi place.  We went here for lunch and it was a 19.95 for all you can eat lunch!  Winners!  I ordered everything off the one item only menu ( this is stuff that is too expensive to serve all you can eat)  They were all good.  Tempura was good and you could have ate your fill of that if you wanted too.  The miso soup was good, Cucumber salad was soso, Sushi fish was very fresh.   Their rolls were excellent and I wish my stomach was bigger because I definitely wanted to try a few more rolls but my stomach gave up.  Mochi ice cream was a nice topper for dessert.  I would definitely come back again here next time I am in vegas.

UZfdzlZ4eiQQicbM5o0KnQ.text: Just wanted to drop a note to Sushi Kaya! I have enjoyed each time that I have visited.. The food is great for "all you can eat" and the Management and Servers are very nice as well! It must be my blonde hair lol jk jk ;)  Keep up the good work and my stamp card is almost full!!!

lYpyPGgMEMNr4kroAWRWZQ.text: The BEST place off strip. $25 all you can eat - amazing rolls. Be sure to try "half orders" so that you can try more sushi.

8eq1ILn5KUo7FwG6lHIr5A.text: First of all, there is nowhere to park. We spent about 20 minutes trying to find a spot because the next lot over do not allow parking if we're eating here. It's already inconvenient and we haven't even started yet.  We came here in March 2015 for my best friend's birthday dinner. He made a reservation for us and we got there in a timely manner. (even with the ridiculous parking situation) It seemed like a busy night and it was quite crowded in their waiting area...if you could call the tiny hallway that. Front staff didn't seem to have any clue as to what we were there for. Eventually, we got seated in a private room right next to their "host stand". Our table was set up inside but very awkwardly. No menus on the table. The room looked like a storage room, there were tables and chairs stacked up on one wall and it felt like we got shoved in the storage closet! They left the door open to the room so people waiting kept coming in and sitting down because they thought that it was a wait room. I don't think any AC was working because we were dying in the room. Server had attitude with us. They needed our drink orders but WE HAD NO MENUS. He seemed really impatient with us and it was frustrating. We couldn't get settled in because of how they set up the table in this "private dining room". To be honest, it was just ghetto. We didn't get certain food we ordered, they kept bringing us food from other tables. Service was just atrocious. Food was eh. Nothing special about it at all. I've had better sushi, better service, better environment. Especially for what they charge. Definitely never coming back.

OFmja44EgCajwlCm3yGfMw.text: So far best AYCE sushi I have tried.  The rolls are about $13 each so after 2 you might as well have done AYCE.  I do wish they had a baked lobster roll however there skewers are fantastic.  Shrimp, Beef are so good.  Open late however small restaurant so sometimes you might have a little wait and parking in the shopping center can be a bit scarce.  But Close enough to the strip to give it a whirl as a tourist.

LMWZtP4EEkHhlgeA8SK2Jw.text: Absurdly delicious... their all you can eat is awesome and they just bring it all out to you as much as your heart desires. We are definitely regulars now!!

aL_j7jhINI0pY-UrwhRkdQ.text: Great AYCE. Always a great experience. Super friendly service, sushi made super fast and beautiful, and the food is always so delicious. The entire staff always greets us when we come in, and the sushi chefs thank us every time we leave. We've tried many other sushi places in town and this one is by far the best. When we want to start thinking about trying something different, we can never think of anything better.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The call buttons

I-FxA5WuBHjfY09mfaRpsA.text: We've made it back to Sushi Kaya a couple times after my first review and unfortunately, the place has slowly gone downill, but their prices sure haven't.  Our most recent visit was this past Sunday.  Granted, it was Christmas night, the place was busy, but they had a few empty tables. We did the AYCE option and started ordering off the bat.  Each time our server took an order, she would miss a couple things, then would later make an excuse of:  1) "We ran out, because it's been so busy tonight!" -Whatever, we were there at 9pm, you're open for another 5-hours lady, what you gonna do then?!? 2) "The kitchen is really busy." -Is that really my problem? 3) Or simply, just ignoring the request by smiling instead. -Sorry lady, it's too late to play that no Engrish front on me.  In total, she failed on SIX plates due to one of the above reasons.  Sorry, that's not going to cut it, so I took it out of her tip.  Arigato Sushi Kaya...or should I really say, "Annyonghi Kaseyo" (sp?), it was great while it lasted but, it's off to find a better AYCE sushi spot in the LV.

Q3BYDSLuiB07X01cJIoIVA.text: Definately good for the price. When it gets busy the staff is not as respondent but the way it goes I guess. Man they certainly have a extensive menu for the AYCE side though. And the fact it's open till 3 and I'm a night owl definitely helps. Worth going back to.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. OMG roll
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi Kaya Roll on there AYCE menu

ugkTAHeljlMRZLqRMPYFGw.text: Been here a few times and each time more satisfying than the next. The AYCES is definitely worth every penny spent. Whilest not holding a huge desert menu, they have a few favorites such as mochi and choice selected house ice creams. Would recommend to local sushi enthusiasts. Although caution about the usual 45 min wait or so. With that being said, another restaurant to add to my locals "favorite" choices on nights on the town.

yh4hTINUqj6BQHagSfsSow.text: As I sit and reflect on my experience at Kaya i'm conflicted between giving this place between 4 or 5 stars. I'll give it the benefit of the doubt and give it the extra star based on faithful service from our waitress.  We arrived around 8ish and left around 10:30ish. Each of us had the 22.95 all  you can eat special. I havent eaten anything serious all day and was really looking forward to this place. This probably wasnt a great idea. At first everything looked and tasted great but half way through everything seemed to taste the same.   Sushi Kaya is nice but lacks a lot of variety. On the specials menu there are 8 different types of California Rolls, the original, one with spicy tuna on it, one with spicy tuna and deep fried eel, one that's baked and topped with cream cheese, in the end it's the same old Cali Roll...  The miso soup was VERY bland but this is a sushi bar! Focus on the sushi man!  The best in my opinion is the 'ultimate albacore roll'. Albacore rolled with a slice of cucumber, topped with albacore and drizzled with spicy garlic pon...something sauce. Has a nice heat to it and is loaded with albacore.  Number 2 spot goes to the Spider Roll which is one of my favorite rolls, is often ordered first, and how i rate sushi spots. I know i shouldnt because the point of sushi is fresh raw fish but hey look at my picture i yell at pancakes..Anyway the spider roll was quite refreshing, drizzled with eel sauce and the soft shelled crab was quite nice, not too greasy and had a nice crisp in the center slices.  Number 3 went to one of the variations of the Cali Roll. Forgot what it was called but it was topped with spicy tuna and deep fried eel covered in eel sauce. The spicy tuna and the eel sauce had a nice balance to the overly bland and very basic not to mention cheap to mass produce Cali Roll.  There's a small corner of the menu dedicated to grilled skewers. There are limited to maybe two per person and are quite nice. Some are overcooked while others are a bit undercooked. For example the Beef tongues were overly bland and overcooked where as the bacon wrapped scallops were undercooked and wasnt to my own personal liking. The chicken gizzard skewers were great, would be a whole lot better if seasoned with a little salt, pepper, and sesame seed oil.  I would recommend this places to others but give better advice on things such as which rolls to avoid (the lasagna roll...dont touch with 10ft pole) and to order more 'premium' items to maximize the all you can eat bang to buck ratio (ahi poki appetizer, oyster shooters)

ROJ2jFXFAST3VB3LWqAnog.text: I like this place, I recieved excellent service like it was a 5 star restaurant. I was very please with everything.

rl-rqnqLFiuHRosbH12j9Q.text: Everytime I come to Vegas this is a place I go to. Great service and quality of food. Its AYCE sushi and yakitori, can't really complain.

H1UbMIG0a1Kjl_xGlbnffQ.text: wow! i was soooo surprised. this place is great for the price.  you have to get the all you can eat for 22.95 for the price, the quality is decent. i give it an A- on a AAA scale  it is a regular sushi bar menu, some things are limited to 1 order per person such as uni, oyster & sweet shrimp (which are all delish!!!!  the rolls are good, they are not "all you can eat stingy" if you know what i mean. they do not over load you with rice & skimp you on the fish.  i recommend the kaya roll  the appetizers are good, and so are the skewers.   i love this place!! highly recommended to anyone coming to vegas & they dont want to spend a whole lot on the strip!  i will def. come here more than i love sushi on the eastside, just for the great price & my full tummy :)

Tjfz4klXYQPbUJh_qRjWAg.text: Good but not great AYCE.    I really enjoyed the appetizers that came with the AYCE and the nigiri was flavorful and fresh.  But the rolls were smothered in sauces and the flavors didn't complement each other.  We had the scallop and bacon, beef and shrimp skewers - definitely yummy!  Sucks that you can only do one per customer  Seafood Udon - good amount of seafood and flavor in this dish but it is a big portion and definitely fills you up with non-sushi...  The fried calamari was not too greasy and just the right amount of chew.  Poke Salad - Very nice size portion and good chunks of tuna  Salmon, yellowtail, mackarel, halibut, white tuna, and squid were all fresh tasting and flavorful.  Good service but there was only one other occupied table while we were there.  So if you are going for AYCE with non-sushi eaters or if you stick to nigiri, this is a great place to come visit.  If you are looking for flavorful, creative and tasty rolls, I would go to one of the other many better AYCE places in town.

Vwa5Sgv5Ujd2MmaSZGS1dw.text: OK, I like food and can be a bit picky about where I spend my money, especially for sushi.  When a friend introduced me to this place a few weeks ago, i was like, "all  you can eat sushi, really? That doesn't sound very appealing."  BUT, I was blown away by the food!  The best calamari tempura I've ever eaten! Very fresh, light, not greasy.  And the agadashi was like fluffy white clouds in my mouth.  The nigiri, especially the white tuna, was awesome:  very fresh, perfect temperature.  And ALL the rolls I had were great.  I highly recommend this place.  It will be my new sushi spot from now on.

RwFKwDzHZSSz_fbNgfesnQ.text: Great fresh food! Go with friends to share in all the choices offered on their all you can eat menu. I enjoyed the Kim chi fried rice, Vegas Roll, Arizona Roll, Brooklyn Bridge, and others I lost track of, it was all yummy :)

t5Dc-LSLgWWG1Z9hQE0ajQ.text: The sushi here is some of best I've EVER had. The prices are really good for all you can eat and it's a really chill place to eat sushi. The palace is truly amazing, that's why there is always a waiting list to get in here. But I do have to say the waiting list is never too long. The longest it's been when I've come is on Friday or Saturday night. But I never mind waiting 30+ for some of the best sushi ever.

JMexnuk-DRKY_hLdzs8giA.text: I like the small plates more than anything in their AYCE.  Good robata/skewers (I like gizzards and bacon wrapped scallops the best but order them all), ahi poke is good, I love fried soft shell crab and can eat a bunch of those critters! Bulgogi was flavorful.   Kaya and spicy albacore rolls are favorites here, but I'm not really a roll person so "favorite" doesn't equate to fucking fantastic but just good. I wish they did half rolls as some rolls we ordered were just okay and didnt really want to eat a whole of something wrong.   Nigiri is hit and miss for me, few times were okay and some days top notch freshness- still a decent spread and not skimpy on the fish or rice heavy. It seems though the fresher times were a while back when it first started the AYCE and has since been lesser quality.   We've gone during quiet times like near when they open at 5pm and sometimes even the service is hit and miss then. We just have to wave her down sometimes as she'll be off doing something but not major neglect- just gotta be assertive sometimes to let them know you need something.   Docked the one star for the hit and miss service and one star for the no half rolls and also each time we've gone, more and more items have become "one order per person"...almost all the robatas except the potato and ginko and garlics are 1o.p.p. The nigiri quality wasn't as good the last visit.   It was a place I'd say was good, but now it stands as A-OK so I'm looking for a better place to AYCE.

teZuYoZ9RDNcq1bUr2OFqA.text: Off the beaten tracks, right down from my regular Korean restaurant, this is a great value. Lots of choice in the made to order all you can eat category that include Sushi but also a plethora of other nice Japanese meals.

g2vCeqx0CaWqr4GQX_HhqA.text: Nom Nom! Me and my GF went there twice in a week at her prompting. prices are competitive and the all-you-can-eat has a better than average selection. You do have to pay per piece left over so Nommy Noms kiddies. Service is a lil below average but certainly not terrible. Great for Locals looking for a change of venue. Transfriendly- A- just cause

jGLOu9IopLBQpkB4X9nkYA.text: Went at 1:30pm for an All You Can Eat lunch for $19.99 and it was amazing!  You can order almost everything off the menu and their sushi selection is huge.  They offer unique rolls that I have never seen at other restaurants and they were all very tasty and fresh.  Our server was very attentive and kept checking to see what else we wanted to order and the food came out pretty quickly.  The Agedashi tofu was probably the best I've had anywhere, however the vegetable tempura was just fair.  Too many yams and potatoes and just one small piece of broccoli, but that's ok since it's all you can eat!  Kim chi fried rice was ok, but the calamari tempura was delicious.  There were 4 of us so we got lots of rolls and they were all awesome!  Had mochi ice cream and the cheesecake (can only order one of each) but that's ok since I was stuffed!  Will definitely be going back there the next time we are in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our first 2 rolls and nigiris were delicious!

L10-HCxvZbyy5M1krrIT1g.text: It was worth the 45 minute wait on a Friday night. There were plenty of spots in the area to check out while waiting so the time passed quickly. Parking is awful. The calamari was the most tender I have ever had, bland, but relish. Potstickers were good. The filling (beef, mint, and noodles I think) was very flavorful but they would have been better steamed instead of fried. My husband had the Nemo roll and asked for smelt roe on top and I had the Red Dragon roll. Both were very good. Service was great, although after our appetizers we had to flag someone down to order our main courses but they weren't bothered by it and our waitress came by afterword. No harm, no foul. Would love to go again. The two tables beside us both had the AYCE options and they seemed pretty content as well. Not our style though.

UXFxh9CsigR76c9I00rdug.text: Overall, a great spot. Mostly AYCE but you have the option to order ala carte & can even order 1/2 rolls, which is great for trying new things on a budget. The fish is always eceptionally fresh, & Ive never been disappointed after a visit there, though they are a bit creeative with some of the special rolls....(The Tornado Roll, raw fish & cheddar cheeses? I tried but, IMO, not a great idea.)

IP5bEJKhk8Ek6fDXfp8RAQ.text: After going twice, I have decided this place is just not worth returning to. Find somewhere else, seriously, or just go to Cafe Noodle, door over!  Although it is the cheapest in town for AYCE sushi, I am just not impressed with the selection. Many rave about the appetizers, & I have found that although the kimchi fried rice is good, I don't want to eat fried rice when I am eating sushi... it just doesn't make sense to me. Many of the rolls are made with nothing but fillers (i.e. avocado, cream cheese, crab mix) & no real substance.. aaaaand on top of that, the fish is no where near fresh. Their hamachi was YELLOW. Disgusting!  Oh, I also asked for my unagi to be crispy, expecting that it would be baked, but instead, they seared it with the torch! Yuck, again.  Their service is not the worst, but not the best. The lone male server, who I believe to be the manager, is the only one who was actually tending to us. Once he went on break, my bf & I were stuck waving someone fown.every time we needed something! I believe the only reason I didn't rate 1 star, is because I happen to like their hot tea, which comes in a steeping pot, and their ice cream, cherry amaretto & mocha almond. Both flavors that are unique to this restaurant, unless another restaurant is serving these, and just I haven't been to it yet.  -sigh-   I am actually regretting the fact that I even spent my hard-earned cash here! Shame on me. Ha!

Z2HHm0JdSqF2gyQGSDmQ0g.text: The place is a great deal if you can stomach a lot and are not too picky about the quality. While my party was satisfied by the quantity, I found the rice for my nigiri and maki too warm (so the fish were limp and not fresh tasting) and seaweed salad too oily, too much cream cheese in the maki with them, etc. It bothered me that I had to finish a dish that I didn't find appealing just because otherwise I would have been charged extra for unfinished pieces. I wish I could just sent them back to the kitchen!

c1Ko_pZ0Wx1x8quxZteyNg.text: New favorite ayce sushI in vegas. Good service.  Good quality fish. And nice portion of rice in their sushis

wAXaIIacbAkc-OHHDOI7GQ.text: This place was recommended bye the homie at work. The plaza is very busy so you find that parking is an issue. I had to park in the next plaza over.  My wife and daughter and I checked in around 715 pm (Sunday) and was told it would be at least 45 min wait. Not a problem,  we just walked down to the Asian mall and looked around. So yeah if you have Time to spare to do a little people watching its not a big deal.  Anyways came back about 45 min later within  minutes of our return they called us to be seated. $25 for AYCE.  We ordered tempura calamari, green mussels, and some other appetizers. Nothing to write  home about,  but not bad. The jalapeno  popper with crab and cream cheese was fire for sure. Loved it! Anyways I believe we ordered about 6 or 7 rolls.  Not bad at all,  just wasn't life changing either.  The service was amazing, food was fast and seem like there were plenty of staff to take orders.  Will I come back? I would. Still haven't found "the place" but this place definitely won't disappoint.

OyOznzkAwZJIoiU5pnoC1w.text: You never know what to expect at AYCE sushi joints. But I would have to say that is right up there with Oyshi. Maybe my review is based off a late night run for sushi after dancing the night away, I just remember that it was actually impressed me that I need to review it!  Trying to find this place? It's right underneath Mother's Korean Garden and next to Anime Ramen. Like most places, it's open until 3 a.m. so good place to go to when near the Strip. We walked in around 1 a.m. and it was quite a hustle & bustle, however, we were quickly seated. The lighting was dark but the music was bumping so it made it fun and kept me from falling asleep.  The AYCE is around $25 per person so the typical price. Everything tasted fresh and quite palatable. My only complaint was that you couldn't get a half order, only on select rolls but the waitress didn't tell me which ones! Kimchi fried rice was awesome, very similar to the one at Ichiza.   Overall it was a great experience and I wouldn't mind trying it at a more decent hour.

GE4PdIQPNxYXz-8mOQVf6w.text: $20/ for ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI! I really wasn't expecting quality or quantity because anytime I've went to an all you can eat sushi place, it sucked. This place offers a variety of sushi on their ayce menu which include baked rolls, fried rolls, sashimi, and all that other ish including appetizers such as soft shell crab, mussels, and calamari. O.o I found it hard to believe at first and decided that I should order slowly because the portions might be huge and I didn't want to get charged for not eating everything. BUT GUESS WHAT? Portions were ON POINT & the sushi wasn't full of RICE. BTW, those skewers everyone's raving about are pretty BOMB. I think the best bacon I've ever tasted were the ones wrapped around their asparagus. BLAH! They also offer dessert on their ayce menu, get the mini cheesecake! It's absolutely delightful. :) I'm making this my to go spot every time I'm in town!

9LmwmV1SQlggluTyx2Bd3g.text: This is definitely the best priced AYCE sushi joint in town for sure.  I agree with some of the reviews about the quality however and the one review about most of their specialty rolls being variations on a California Roll.     The big plus with this place is the non Sushi items included in the AYCE menu.  It's basically like going upstairs to Ichiza (another great restaurant in the complex) but you only are paying one flat fee.    Service wise this place has to have some of the best service I've ever seen at an AYCE joint.  That alone justifies a visit here.  Plus it's AYCE sushi is availible until 2am.  Also the ambiance of the restaurant is very cool.  Physically the lay out of this place is 10 times better than any AYCE sushi joint I have been to. So if it's late night and you have a craving for raw fish....KAYA IS THE PLACE!

TaRYMqO7ftLptLW3nB-pdA.text: This place was amazing!! I wish a place like this existed where I am from.  We did the unlimited sushi dinner and ordered maybe 12 rolls and a couple tapas.  Every roll we had was unique and delicious.  The service was very quick and friendly as well.  The wait was long, but well worth it and the trip from the strip.

CHGacmQ4DjlMWbJnUpXKdA.text: Great place but the staff can be slow at times but over all great food, price, and music.

pdU0l--WclLTs6pk7XVhxA.text: Service was a little slow due to unexpected rush around noon, but food was great and waiter was super nice.

m8KoOS3BPvO8aNzJkGbKAQ.text: Awesome. So good always a wait at night. Try the XXX2 if you like spicy sushi

QMhBek7YMQScl4QbTgwLVw.text: Hands down, the best all you can eat sushi in town. They have a ton of appetizers, Skewers, nigiri, and awesome sushi rolls. They're open super late and even offer lunch AYCE. Definitely my favorite spot.

jpJg1fGJz02bK_qJXz8fKw.text: Visited this restaurant late yesterday night. I appreciate the fact that this place is open til 3am.  Not quite sure how much I enjoyed the K-POP music playing in the background. I thought this was a Japanese restaurant? ;)  $24.99 for all you can eat sushi puts a bit of a dent in your pocket, so if you're gonna eat here, make sure you're either a) a big eater, or b) know to order the more expensive sushi to make your money back.  Decor is cute. Wooden planks, dim lighting, and comfortable.  I appreciate the huge assortment of sushi you can order on the All You Can Eat menu, from sashimi to rolls to your dependable appetizers like potstickers and sunomono.  Let me say this:  SERVICE WAS FAST. Not even 5 minutes after ordering and there was a roll waiting at our table already. The waitress was great. She constantly kept checking in, taking away empty plates, asking if we needed anything else and consistently filled our water. I appreciate that.  I ordered/tried the following:   Miso soup - Good, nothing fantastic or horrible about it. I don't think you can go wrong with miso soup really.  Zizzy roll - YUM YUM YUM. I really enjoyed this roll.  Spider crab roll - Very good also. I love me some soft shell crab. Not over cooked. Crunchy, soft, and savory.  Sex bomb roll - +5 for the naming convention. I just kept thinking of Tom Jones. Also very tasty.  Green tea mochi ice cream - I think they just gave me the Mikawaya brand mochi ice cream, which is totally fine because it's still tasty.  The rolls are huge. For a petite  girl I definitely overate (because I was determined to eat my money's worth).  All in all, great service, taste, dependable sushi, and open late nights so it makes a great hang-out spot.  I would definitely recommend visiting this place, provided you don't mind spending that kind of money.

74hZPXTjogDRMBwHsL90xg.text: My friends really wanted to go here , a couple of weeks ago so I said fine I'm usually very particular about the sushi places I choose to go to but I decided to give it a try , once we got there the service was slow the sushi didn't taste good and the place was dirty.

fzU326cHLn0fQJ4_8nDMUw.text: I love this place! It's open 24 hours so if you ever want late night sushi, its the place to go!! Me & my friend come here for the all you can eat sushi :) I've never tried anything but sushi here so Im not sure how their other food is, but if its anything like their sushi, you'll love it! Great price for all you can eat with appetizers, great selection of raw & cooked sushi & dessert! The sushi is fresh...I haven't really had a problem with this place yet. Food usually comes out rather quick... Last time I ended up waiting longer than usual, but maybe it was just busy for them... So other than that one time its great!

J2i5lowu2YwZkXlTPMKUYg.text: Super fast service. Good food. Extensive all you can eat menu! Just get the AYCE... It's a better lunch value than a la carte. Only bummer was being charged like $2- $3 for hot tea. Really!?!

6k6y6z_dqnimfxbqSVmAdw.text: The best sushi in town!  Service is quick and friendly!  Well worth the ALL YOU CAN EAT price!

DINrYpGUpFRB7vvj9gOr2Q.text: food poisoning, all three of us. ate different things. not cool man.  maybe we had bad luck that night. even so, i just cant go back there.

fwh1f497vagvOdBdgeYfBw.text: I use to go there and send friends over ....not anymore the food has the same taste the service is one of the worst ..good buy kaya koreana

YFpEQops92l_f0CSwR906g.text: Go early and very hungry.  90 min limit will be hard to reach as the orders come up quick and the rolls are fresh and filling.  I recommend getting half rolls so you can taste more of the menu.  Only thing to watch out for is having leftovers will cost you, so make sure you are hungry enough before you order that next roll.  You can spend $200 for inferior sushi on the strip or take a short cab ride to Chinatown and Mange in sushi paradise for under $30/person!!!!

nxCqh11w3VawvRq11xvseA.text: I go here all the time it's by far the best sushi in Las Vegas. The service is great and fast for the amount of people there. The fish is very fresh and the menu has a good variation of combinations.

dONG2QWEWyoEdJH4moTbwQ.text: I'm required to give at least 1 star, but this place deserves none. I signed up for Yelp just to rant about this place because I hope to save people from wasting their time and money here. Service was terrible! Food was decent, but the service was horrendous. It was a major turn off. She kept asking to take the plates. She even asked not once, but 3x when she saw a couple of pieces of sushi left on a plate if we could put it on the other plates so she could take it. Where have manners gone? I don't understand the rush because it was 9pm and there were 2 empty tables and no one waiting. All our plates were brought to us with no chopsticks, no napkins...nothing. We were a party of 8 with a mandatory 18% gratuity which I feel this $30 tip was stolen from us. I can't believe my sister recommended this place! She was with us though and said she will never go back. I'll stick to my usual sushi joint.

H2Ji5464nHYP0B36zy6DRQ.text: Yummmm !!! is all I can remember but I will be back to try it again. I live across town but it is well worth a return trip or two. So I will have to update this review with much positive comments.

awGmY0gtNj0Q6W4oik6JyQ.text: Hanging with a cousin and with a friend from San Diego for some Birthday Sushi. We came here after I recommended it to my cousin a few weeks back after a dinner at Cafe Noodle. Wait times for a Monday I thought was unusual but the place was full and we waited about 30 minutes. The place seemed bigger last time but I was wrong. We first started with the 1 order per person (1o.p.p) stuff first Uni, sweet shrimp, oysters, beef fire (?), then a assorted mix of fishes. Service was generally quick and cheerful and the wait times between courses was short. On to the robatayaki skewers tried most of them and all were hot crispy and cooked just right. Bacon sometimes just makes it better :) Everything was fresh and tasty with no real complaints except, It seems they put a lot of ponzu sauce on everything soaking the rice. For $24.99 a person is not too bad about the same as most places. Full and stuffed another AYCE completed!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. skewers
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sushi

jdP42vkvBVTpkcs2qwhLog.text: THE worst sushi place in vegas.  Their nigiri is horrible.  Not only do they cut their fish super thin, but the quality is not good at all.  I do understand you cannot judge these places (AYCE) vs ala carte places but this is still one of THE worst sushi places ive ever come across.  i will say that the only thing that i did like was the robata things they offered which most sushi places don't.  Nevertheless, i won't go back for any reason.

MgUCIKf55DSZUs0fzcOgyw.text: Susihi was ok. Seemed not as fresh as other sushi places I have been to. Special/baked/deep fried rolls were below average in taste and quality. Service was good for the first fifteen/twenty minutes, but for some reason the waitresses and waiters completely stopped coming to our table. We would stare down the staff and I'd even motion them over and no response. If you want great service for half the time and below average sushi, this is the place for you.

9luNRqdx0p4riFyCcH6egw.text: I have had a variety of customer service in this establishment, ranging from piss poor to amazing. There are a lot of choices for the AYCE sushi including dessert and appetizers. Just be warned that many of the choices are different variations of the California Roll.   This particular visit that I recently experienced started off well. There was a short wait for a Friday night and the hostesses were friendly. We had to wait for everything else! We had to wait for a drink order and to order rolls. When we were finally ready for dessert the waiter was no where to be found. We waited for 30 minutes for our waiter to even say anything to our table. Finally the table next to us sent over another server because they noticed we needed one. We decided to skip dessert because we were tired of waiting.   The most frustrating part was seeing the tables around us getting way better customer service than we did. We felt forgotten and ignored.

xsOEpmaVlnUiGPLx7EUKQg.text: The sushi is AMAZING! Sushi never falls apart, everything is just delicious! I always get hecka salmon nigiri and i love crispy rice, sex bomb roll, jackpot roll and their bacon scallop skewers. U can order half rolls here! U get cheesecake for dessert with Mochi and ice creams too! Stamp cards have me coming back! My favorite spot for sushi hands down!

lJ6NhBIbX9KJM_l8gwRoVA.text: We have been customers of this restaurant many times. We love their sushi. We recommend them strongly to everyone. we especially love the lasagna roll, and the baked muscles. I love how they greet us every time we walk in and the staff is always very caring and sweet.

Z8afTRT5TXWPygg8xYoLqQ.text: i will never eat here again, my friends and i would come all the time for years, but as time went on their prices went up and the employees are rude! When they are busy they rush you out and instead of asking the table who ordered what they just toss it on the table and keep walking . They are so rude

fKfHFXWA415vTy7mDXky5Q.text: Beware the woman's toilet on the left. It doesn't currently work. And it didn't work when I was here 4 months ago.

NEvXk1hscd1sAkRwlyBH9A.text: The All You Can Eat menu is awesome!!  The servers are very attentive and the food is GOOD!!! Sometimes we've had to wait a long time, sometimes we just go right in, either way, its worth it!!!!

I_OBA5-4Xz05c9jB8A7Rlg.text: The best AYCE sushi in Vegas. The quality of The fish is superb and the staff is friendly and orders come out fast. I ordered nigiri: unagi-octopus-yellowtail-salmon-whitefish. And the rolls sex bomb-dragon-Viagra. Everything was amazing.

AmW6mxbJMJccOUDf0i_CTg.text: Sushi was horrible. This was not the first time we had come here. The sushi use to be good. Super white tuna was warm and tasted like melted plastic. We even tried cooked items on the menu as we ordered all you could eat. Nothing tasted good, don't know what happened. We will never return! Hope we don't get sick! The only thing good was the water.

Kbe0yqfvNvVZkhpL-TzvDA.text: $24.95 AYCE sushi.  Sushi Kaya isn't that big.  Always ask to sit at the bar, you'll get quicker service that way.  I had a hard time trying to figure out what was what on the menu.  I'm so used to seeing the nigiri sushi in Romaji English.  I forgot this is Las Vegas.  I sat on the bar and listened to a couple of Mexican ladies complaining that the "spicy" sushi wasn't hot.  "You call Jalapeno hot?"  Oh, this is not going to be good.  They're pretty generous with the two-hour time limit.  I had a double order of nigiri maguro, hamachi, saba, unagi and sake - tuna, yellowtail, mackerel, eel and salmon.  The cuts were horrible, the fish undersized and the quality average.  The maguro was a light pink rather than a rich red, which would identify it as either previously frozen or possibly tombo - a low quality tuna.  On a positive note, the rice was served warm and portioned suitably for drinking/snacking.  Sushi Kaya has a large selection of specialty maki (handroll) with eye-catching names like Crazy Orgasm, Who is my dad? and Sex bomb,  I ordered the Lasagna Roll which consisted of a baked California Roll with Philly cream cheese and unagi sauce.  This was the best thing I had.  I also ordered the Viagra Roll - deep fried tempura style maki with maguro, sake, hamachi, avocado and masago (fish roe).  Not bad,  but not great either.  To round off my dinner I ordered the Sho Chiku Bai Nigori for $12.  Not a bad deal.  When I asked for my check I had 3 of 6 pieces of the Viagra Roll and 2 of 8 pieces of the Lasagna Roll on my plate.  The waitress informed me that if I didn't eat everything, the restaurant might charge me for the leftovers.  My response "Go ahead if that's what you guys think is right."  I ate about $80 worth of sushi and sake in less than an hour.  Pretty good deal, but not the best sushi I've ever had.

Kv648JUo1G7Yxxr74nMzUQ.text: The food is amazing. One of the better sushi spots in Vegas for sure. Service isn't bad but isn't great either. The environment feels warm and welcoming.

MPJAbFSBVHmqIYCccLpEAw.text: Sooo yummy! Went here with my family for the lunch all you can eat special. The service was quick and friendly. We ate a lot of sushi, french kiss roll was my favorite  only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because it's impossible to have super fresh fish in Vegas.

qClQjmp3O2ur0V1ZsPMjRw.text: My visit was very disappointing. The wait wasn't long for a table. All of us got AYCE so we planned on sharing everything we ordered. Everything I ordered the first round our server wrote down on paper. The edamame took over 20 minutes to come out. That was already disappointing. All the rolls came out a little after that. The 2 orders of Dynamite, grilled shrimp skewers & cucumber salad which is usually pre made was never sent out. I had to ask about the dynamite 3 times. I ordered a second round of sushi. Maybe 5 rolls. One of them was a baked roll & the server said it would take longer cause it's baked. Funny cause that's the roll that came out first! All the rolls came out & I still didn't get my Dynamite. When it did come out I started laughing cause the serving was the size of my palm! It wasn't even worth waiting for. The restaurant is nice inside. Small thought, but nice. The service was just terrible. My boyfriend has been here before & said the service was way better last two times I came here. Maybe it was just out server. She was the only one not in uniform. Just wearing a white shirt.   The buffet is priced at $24.95 per person not including drinks.  There is nothing special at all about their sushi rolls. If you look at the specialty menu they all say "in:California roll" or "in:shrimp tempura" with just different stuff on the outside.   I will not be coming back here!

iamhPaOtPdn-JLvJQxiVTg.text: This is my go to AYCE sushi place since it's around the corner from my place...  I originally started coming here because they had fresh oysters and ahi poke... but they have since revised their menu... they still have poke... it's just sashimi poke... so its mixed fish...   the last time i was here they were packed and it took forever to be served... order... get served... and order again... so we were a bit leery about coming in again... but it was late and I had a sushi craving that needed to be fulfilled...  the parking lot was full... so we were a bit annoyed.... i hate the parking situation here... it's such a small lot... but THANK GOODNESS it wasn't busy... we were greeted right away... seated and our server was on the ball... after he brought our drinks he took our first order... they were out of SOFTSHELL CRAB... sad face =( ... but didn't surprise me... that used to happen when they had oysters...   anyways... SEX BOMB ROLL, SPICY TUNA ROLL, and SASHIMI POKE made our first round picks.... the poke is limited to one order per  person... i LOVE LOVE LOVE their Sex Bomb Roll... I think that's the reason we always come back... Next round we did half orders... so you get 4 pieces opposed to 8.. its nice so you are able to try new rolls... so we did half orders of the SEXY ROLL, SEX ON THE BEACH, and THE ONE NIGHT STAND... they were good... but not as good as a SEX BOMB... so I made another half order.... YUM! my tummy seemed full... but i needed to end off my dining experience with GREEN TEA MOCHI ICE CREAM (which is also limited to one per person)...   Sushi craving = Satisfied

g3OBhsEk5YaT-C2hPF70zw.text: This place is simply awesome ! The service could be better . Our waitress was very emotionless , but overall the atmosphere is great ! And I love their uni

ssXusDQczgGxKjSJI6xNmw.text: Service was good, food was fast. Quality low, lots of rice with everything. sauces too overbearing. They do have a decent spicy ponzu though.. I ordered everything of course no yum sauce or eel sauce only a mammaluke would eat that shite!  They did a couple unique rolls , and a couple unique appetizers.. The who is your daddy which i order no cream cheese, no yum sauce or eel sauce was a joke they took one normal piece of shrimp which they pounded out thin and split it into 4 pieces wtf? I know they are trying so save cost fill u up on imitation crab and tempura batter + rice but that was quite unnecessary. I would never go back but I don't regret going there. go to Blue Fin...

6itLnOKhRXpXpEyCTQOtMQ.text: Decent place. Not a lot of vegan options. Standard sushi. Standard place.  Standard service. Nothing to impress me more than normal.

u-Ii68dbMBlE7p-bkVASyQ.text: Stopped here at the recommendation of a friend. I noticed a couple other places in the immediate area with no waits or few customers. Not so here, a good sign. We did the all you can eat. I'm generally weary when they put a time limit on it; 90 minutes here. However my worries were quickly put to rest as the service was extremely well. Our server brought multiple rolls and continually checked with us for additional orders. The time limit was not an issue and we did a goof job of sampling many different thongs on the menu. It also helped that most everything came in 1/2 size as well. Some rolls were better than others, but none were bad. Sample away. One tip- parking in the immediate lot can be difficult. We parked in the lot next door and had no problems.

DPSEcCb3qvSV2Yxs0cpNaQ.text: The food and the service was excellent. The night club music blaring at ear bleeding levels was the only negative.

vua4K71nLYFOkOMwZMsnVg.text: So the catch to the "all you can eat sushi" is that you have 90 mins to eat ur food and if you don't finish it they charge you. Which is fine and all. However, they take up alll your time and minutes to order more sushi and bringing it back to you. They were first very attentive but after 30 mins they stopped caring.

cvWR8IqrJNZ1DpXhMcWdmg.text: First time coming here and it wasn't bad. They have a variety of all you can eat and also have a no limit on the mussels. The service was great and the food took no time to come out. The dishes were a little dirty and there was some nats flying around but I don't know if that's normal or not over here. It was good food and if I was ever in the area I might return but I wouldn't make the drive from my house lol.

1zalpVyq3A8B3tw8zKjaXw.text: My favorite sushi spot to eat at! They have really good rolls my favorite is the amigo roll, Brooklyn bridge, and sex on the beach. They are all seriously amazing. Their ice cream is also really good, not sure what brand but whatever it is it's fire! The only thing is that when it's busy the food takes forever to come out, but they are usually quick 10/10 would recommend!

993CCffDF47e2sXHmerdwQ.text: It's my fourth and last time here.  Super disappointed.  Uni is not fresh, tasted and looked like shit.  Waitress service is horrible.

KVaJVOQ5Q3WDCPOsdV9_2g.text: I wanted to try a new sushi place and saw this place on Yelp and decided "why not?" So here it is:  Food was mediocre and the staff were negligent. Although they were very friendly I found myself having to call them for everything.   TIP: Don't sit at the sushi bar or you'll have the waitress reach in front of you WITHOUT SAYING "EXCUSE ME."

CFhuEagOvFqH6phhmRg_ew.text: The service was super quick and the food was really good. All you can eat at lunch is only $21.95 and includes almost the entire menu, not just rolls. Appetizers, skewers, entrees, and deserts included.  They don't take their time like other all you can eat locations. Almost everything we ordered we received in 5-10 minutes. This was our second time and we will be back.

2YKVLOMavmLDyFdzsaQ4HA.text: Sushi was fresh and they had my favorite roll the Lisa Lisa! Came for lunch and the service was fast. A plus they offer a punch card too! Will be back for sure

BvJdSbkqsR0sT32NhOU_lQ.text: We searched all night for a place open on New Year's Eve after 7. I am happy i found this place, the inside is beautiful & modern with a rustic touch. The sushi came out lightening fast. My waitress...Well she just didn't want to be here and that was evident BUT you could tell that the other waiters could sense it and went behind and helped her out.  talk about family. She sling the ticket and card back on the table after disappearing for a long while. I thought maybe it was to adjust her attitude-- but it wasn't. Oh well the food was amazing and the atmosphere is very young and hip. I'll be back-- hopefully she won't be so darn grumpy.

yyfrciDNwTXdcb1t1YaOiA.text: This was the first AYCE sushi restaurant we ate at when we moved to Las Vegas. We stop in every now and then, usually when friends are in town who want to eat sushi at a place off the Strip. The Mango Style, Japanese Lasagna, and Philly hand rolls are our top picks. I am a huge fan of their tuna sashimi poke! Kaya is open until 3am, which is great for us night owls.  Don't forget to get a punch card!

vrdgNMf8JQv7wQKaJY-L6w.text: Absolutely loved this place!  I had one of my favorite dishes, Kemchi Fried Rice and it was delicious but my rave has to go to the Fried California Dreamin roll because it was fabulous.  There were so many selections it was hard to decide but if I were a local I would be a regular customer and go through the entire menu!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kemchi Fried Rice

Sd9OA4E3RrFaT4jIBz9OiQ.text: Absolutely the best 'All you can eat' Sushi I've ever had. They have a huge selection  ranging from basic rolls to more intricate rolls (even hand rolls)! Since there's so many choices that sound good, I try to get a different roll (mixed with my faves) every time I come back. Every person gets one selection of sashimi, and usually I go for the salmon but the jalapeno yellowtail is amazing and is my choice of sashimi here. Their dessert selection is also pretty satisfying, you get number of choices between mochi and differenty types of cakes. Even though you only get to choose one, by dessert time I'm already way too full to have anything more than one. The servers are pretty lenient, and people at my table have gotten anyway with getting more than one dessert a couple times.   I'm from Washington, and have have visited Las Vegas a handful of times since I have family here. Every single time I visit, I make it a mission to come here at least once during my visit. Definite recommend.

fv-9id3zBlfKMPiQs1JAHA.text: If I can put negative 5, I would. Rude service, terrible food! I asked the server if they freeze their salmon, and they don't when they're suppose to!  do not come to this establishment!

o_VZ-9JefH41LdiK9IiPQQ.text: Cons: 1) not Fresh sushi; 2) quality of service is so so; 3) smell in a restaurant not good.  Pros: 1) they welcoming you with a kind of song, never see that before.

QfcTeufOLPszzsDpMXBnJA.text: Listen, Who knows who these Vegas haters are. Clearly if you can see it from my original review, these people rock and they really run a good game at this restaurant. I know there's a lot of options but when you find something you like and I did long ago, this is a great place and I would always recommend my co-workers to come here and they do and I never hear any negative feedback.  They have so many Sushi chefs, when you make your order it comes out so fast and fresh. Thank you.

Vf_rBwrTez-gMMbIeyfMMA.text: Our first time here and honestly it's better than sasa sushi. They have one of the freshest sangria ever the fruits are fresh and the wine is delicious

kCji01mu5_UHysMxwyS8qQ.text: Small dining area, terrible parking. But the service is always 10/10. I've tried so many Ayce sushi places in Vegas and Kaya never disappoints. 5 stars, because I enjoy having my server actually come to my table when I don't ask them to. Their level of customer service is outstanding and I will always keep coming back to this place because of that.

UsEWVZCt-BvfVkEaw5WUyA.text: This is where my husband and I went for our first date and have been going back ever since! We have probably visited this place about 80+ times(no joke). Definitely our go to date night! The sex bomb roll is by far the best roll I have ever had. My husband will agree on that one and add that the Cinderella roll is also a favorite of his. You can't go wrong AYCE appetizers and rolls as well as other things on the menu plus they give you a stamp card.  The wait is usually 30-45 minutes even though we have waited for an hour and 15 minutes one time it is well worth it! If we are meeting friends or family there we will just go early and by the time everyone arrives we already have a table! And the green tea mochi is amazing!

AM8e_5U1sjlq5loSnM5d-w.text: I was here with my daughter a day after Thanksgiving, it's is a great place, everything was good. Definitely will recommend.

8ANjOj6Ft1xQafdUm2UtnQ.text: Worst customer service i have ever got in my life , I ordered sushi baked roll , I eat kosher fish  only , they brought me sushi with crab meat , when I asked to replaced it the manager asked me not to come to the restaurant any more !!!! Cuz they are tired of making a custom order for Jewish people . The staff don't know how to talk with customers ,  They insulted me and made me feel very bad . I will never get back to that restaurant . What a racist attitude ... Shame on you guys .

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NcK_w1063RguBpc1HjPsBw.text: AYCE, lunch price is $21.95 and dinner is $26.95.  Good service and pretty good food.  Smelt Roe sushi actually consist of "crispy" seaweed, that is a plus, because most sushi restaurants serves soggy seaweeds.  Lots of items on the menu for the all you can eat option. Opting for the all you can eat menu, we we're able to order Udon noodle soup without the noodles.  This is important, because most restaurant showing poor customer service will simply say no or says it just can't be done.  Kimi fried rice were very good compared to restaurants that specializes in serving rice such  as Hong Kong cafes.  Im taking away one star, because their green tea ice cream does not contain the green tea taste and their menu does not have pictures (You'll need to know your food based on experience).  I enjoy making observations of each establishments, hopefully this will help on your visit.

O99VPIGm-VaBQ1sja5tdpw.text: Very dissapointed with this place today. Customer service was just not together. There was a slight wait due to lunch rush however the hostes didnt even acknowledged any of the people waiting. We just figured to sign in our selves and wait. The hostes saw us and walked by us atleast 8 timea before making arrangements for seating. I told them i would like to sit at the bar so he placed us at the very corner of the bar where the server completely forgot about us and barely came by checked on us. I waited 10 mins for a server to come around, finally asked the sushi chwf if i can just order from him, he said no and that i can only order from the server. Waited for the server for another 7 mins then finally got to order some sushi.  This lunch i spent more time waiting then actually getting food.

xnkTb2B0YQqgH1icwzTvcw.text: Been going to spot since 2011! We love it! The all you can eat is $25. Food is amazing! So no complaint there. Expect to wait for a bit, unless you have reservations but they only take reservations for parties over 10 and you can get their private room that fits 20 but everyone might be bumping elbows with 20. So if you have a big party try not to have more than 17. Parking sucks, it's a small lot so you might have wait for a spot to open or park else where. Other than that, love this spot! As I said Food is amazing

fANiDGPbd7DEjDxiuOLG-w.text: We came here for my friends 21st bday, it was a lil packed for a Tuesday night. There was like a 20 minute wait. Service was decent, we got bobas while we were waiting and were told we couldn't have them normally but they didn't see them so they let us keep them. They let my friend eat all you can eat by herself while the rest of us got al la carte which I thought was cool, restraints don't normally do that.   It was a pretty busy night, servers seemed really busy. We got our food in about 10 - 15 minutes which was not bad for how busy it was. Chinatown restaurants are always quite busy just cause it's such a small area and the best Asian restaurants are usually here. This place was a lil pricy not too bad. We came here because a couple of my friends recommended it. But I think it's a lil over hyped to be honest.   There's another sushi restaurant in the area called jjanga Japanese restaurant and they have great sushi and it's at a great price. And it's a lil off spring mountain "china town" so it's not as crowded.

mcYSMw_V_jrNTDvJDlLp7A.text: Been here a few times now, and tried a lot of their menu items as I always do all I can eat. Food comes out fast and is super tasty. Great value and service. Will be back. YumYum.
