And you can try a little bit of everything full rolls or half rolls , appetizers, dessert, you name it!! Definitely a place i would highly recommend for sushi !! Also they are open late!!

YmUngiIww3XHztWKZXWv-Q.text: I've been there twice for the all you can eat sushi, and when you think of anything "all you can eat" one assumes the quality is going to be mediocre. Not at Sushi Kaya! I was really impressed at how good the quality of the food is. Very good selection on the menu and good customer service. Good vibes overall. Would highly recommend it!

--fSLi14TytnBRcEkWUJHQ.text: Love coming here all the time. Staff are nice and always ready to get your order. It's fast and very delicious and fresh. Sushi and sashimi are both fresh and tasty. Garlic edamame are the best! Always coming back here!!!

aIk167UveFgNgHPjIbIC4A.text: This was my favorite sushi spot but after tonight I will never go back. After being seated we found a hair on the straw of our drink. Then about halfway through meal service there was a cockroach on our bench. We told management about it and they didn't seem to do much. I'm disgusted with this place.

R98ZZ9YgRQZc6CvSAWn0fA.text: Unfortunate two star review for a place with decent sushi. So for the good - the price is reasonable and the atmosphere has a great vibe. The bad is the lack of customer service on two fronts. As soon as my friend and I walked in, the hostess was pretty cold. We asked to borrow the menu, and when we did end up finishing, she quite rudely came up and asked, "are you done?" with no sense of hospitality.   Then, as soon as we got seated, no joke, ten seconds later, our waitress came over and asked if we were ready. Eeer... no? She stalked off looking annoyed. When ordering, I asked her a question, which she gave quick and short answers to. Seriously feeling the love here.  But the cherry on top was when another waitress had dropped off a couple of miso soup for me and my friend, and hurried off. Since we're from out of town and making this our first visit, I thought it was customary to get miso soup (like so many Japanese restaurant) and thought nothing of it. My friend was about to take a sip, when our waitress swooped in and asked "did you guys order miso soup?", to which we looked at each other confused, shook our head, and had the soup snatched from under us. No apology for the confusion, no explanation at all, nothing. It made us feel like crap and really made the rest of our experience just utterly sour. To be honest, in this case, she should have just given us the friggin soup and be cordial. It was just soup.  Aaaand finally, I had ordered just $6 worth of food and was about to pay with card. Nowhere did it say that they charge extra for under $10. She came by and said "we charge a dollar extra for under $10". I seriously hate when companies have minimum charges, but what I hated more was how she explained it.  Yes, I wrote an essay. Can you tell now how much this experience impacted me in a negative way? Pleaaase get better customer service. (Your busboy and busgirls were so much better).

BfF_oN1jPK52IMnQ9sHuOg.text: One of the best AYCE sushi spots in town, the quality is great, love the atmosphere and I've never had better baked mussels anywhere else! Been coming here for years and it keeps getting better.

NHsOz27c4Tymo0NHaSGWeg.text: This place is not worth trying. Both food and cleanliness were awful. Our dynamite was cold in the center, fish quality was poor, and the rolls were drowned in sauce.   Our server didn't give us plates. When we asked another server walking by, she gave us a rude look before grabbing them for us.   One of the server was literally grabbing a quick bite at the sushi bar which is right in front of our table. Then he wiped his dirty hands on the back of the pants and walked away. I'm not sure if he even washed his hands afterwards. Later on, he was grabbing from the sushi bar with one hand and the other hand he was using his pinky finger to pick food out of his teeth.  Another server was carrying dirty stacked drinkware to the back. On the very top was the small black container that holds sugar packs. I saw him dropping off the sugar container on the self near the server station. He surely didn't wipe the container or check if the sugar packs got wet from the dirty drinkware.  My table saw many other disgusting things. I rather not get into too many details.  Never coming back.

lv8jubeytcadJpKDvjSIfA.text: Kaya is a-okaya. Good deal for AYCE. Your food comes out quickly and it is not too difficult to track down a waiter/waitress to order more. Plenty of sushi rolls to choose from. Unsurprisingly not many options for vegetarians. Be careful to not over-order, as there is a waiter there who has asked me to finish a few pieces of sushi or be charged for leftovers.. Also be sure to ask for stamps for your stamp card.   Not the first place I'd suggest for ayce, but not bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bb9HGV2KA3vAwZjPgz5uYw.text: Probably one of the only ayce sushi spots I have driven by so many times and tried to avoid at all costs. I only did so because the Chinatown area is so busy but I ended up eating here recently with a coworker.   We arrived at midnight and surprisingly was not as busy as I expected. Our server was very nice and patient as I proceeded to order as many plates of rolls as I could. I ordered from the baked rolls and the deep fried rolls for the most part since I have been hearing about others getting food poisoning... yikes.   I got the Crusty Philly Roll, the Monkey Brain Roll, The Who is your dad? Roll, the Volcano Roll, the Lasagna Roll, the Japanese Pizza, and the Ryan Roll.  Okay I didn't eat all these rolls by myself but I did inhale more than half of them. I would say all the rolls I have ordered were very good.  For dessert, I ordered the green tea cheesecake which was completely frozen We asked the server what was up with that and he just said it was sitting in the freezer. How disappointing but I wasn't even there for the dessert anyways.

_rH33DqVfeeiPikwlH9Nzw.text: Pros: Service, variety, value   Cons: Not really any, parking maybe?  Details: I have only been here once and it was a good experience. The sushi was really good but not the best in LV so I have to give it 4 (really a 4.5). Service is 5 star though. I was very impressed. Typically we experience order mistakes or missing items with AYCE, but did not have any of those issues here. Service was super prompt. I will be back and recommend. The parking lot was pretty full but that is about the only negative I can think of.

RMDqwMU1ab4JK8DtIm-Kdw.text: Sushi Kaya can be found in the heart of China town next to some other great food and karaoke options!  It has a very cute Japanese theme inside and it's always wildly busy  because they are very popular. I went during  lunch hour to eat the AYCE menu. I really loved everything I ordered and they served a lot of dishes with a decent mixture of my favorite ponzu sauce and eel sauce.  My favorite appetizers were the bacon and scallop skewers and the jalapeno poppers!   Their service is very quick. As soon as I placed an order it was on my table in two minutes or less. My cup never ran dry and they removed plates from tables as fast as they served it.  The really cool thing about this place is that they have an AYCE punch card and in your 10th visit your AYCE meal is free!!

9aVTHKSL7hU7_FJVjctpXA.text: Super busy for a Tuesday night. The restaurant itself is super cute. Everything came out fast and was delicious, only reason it didn't get 5 stars is because the serving staff seemed a bit unorganized as to who they were serving and we were asked if we were ok or needed anything else by multiple people very often. We were even delivered the wrong order once. Great food and good place to stop by!

amq5kRKYv4GPKsLjGW0-zg.text: EXECUTIVE SUMMARY: Pretty good ... for an after-hours drunken Chinatown chow-down ... and all of the experiences that come with such a joint.  This place has something very much in common with a lot of those Waffle Houses scattered around The Deep South. On weekends, at 2am, they are over-run with drunk clubbers gorging on massive amounts of quick & filling foodstuff!  At least that was True when I was called into service (from my home office desk) around that time by two fairly-intoxicated buddies who had landed there after indulging themselves in a nearby Spearmint Rhino experience. When I got there, sure enough, a scattering of bowls & plates evidenced they had already been belly-busting on a good bit of edamame, little tempura shrimp and deep-fried Cali rolls ... since this venue was running an AYCE deal at a base price of about $27.   And the entire place was just packed, packed I say, with younger folk, a lot of 'beautiful people' taking late-night advantage of that deal. Parking was horrendous; I waited my turn for a spot. Given this Chinatown venue was pretty close-in on Spring Mountain to Wynn & Venetian, one might first surmise these customers were recent graduates of the Universities of Tao, XS, Surrender or where ever. But, being ever-observant, I noted a lot of them were not dolled-up quite at that level, no serious BCBG cocktail dresses or such. But it was clear they had been livin' la vida loca somewhere ... that expected some level of "dress-to-impress." Point being, if you want to people-gawk, yeah, this place works for you at this time of night. But if you are looking for upscale, cozy, chat-her-up late-night digs, this certainly isn't your best wager. I mean ACYE isn't usually going to strike the best first impression, anywho.  I'm gonna make a call here and say the name "Kaya" was taken as an abbreviation for "Izakaya," that being Japanese for "sake shop," a place that typically offers patrons AYCE dining with their sake. At bit odd, I thought, since these servers hardly looked Japanese. And I didn't see much in the way of sake flowing, or any other kind of booze; I suppose these clubbers knew when to flip from grog to grub.  Having once logged a sushi experience that has left an indelible impression, I went with a Teriyaki Chicken entree at $13. Tasty -- I mean who's gonna say oh-so-sweet teriyaki ain't tasty -- but I do say the portion was lacking. And the little side of broccoli looked pretty shriveled & tortured as well. Thank goodness for that glob of white rice and the bottle of soy sauce! I guess appetizers and teriyaki entrees and such are just menu-fillers for the odd duck (such as I); this place is all about the AYCE option. I also sampled some of the offerings my pals were having, other than the sushi. It was all reasonably tasty.   Service was willy-nilly given the crowd, but it sufficed; table-touches (at every table) occurred rapid-fire and repeatedly. I had to fill out a requisition for a fork. (Yeah, I'm chopsticks-challenged. So just put me on the shortbus, OK?)  All in all, I don't have any serious complaints. I cashed-out, bottom-line, $24 - soda, one of those little chewy ice-cream deserts, tax & tip. Which, again, was a message that the only solid play here is the AYCE. Too bad I am a card-carrying member of Sushi-holics Anonymous.  CONCLUSION: OK, it wasn't anywhere near being on my bucket list, but I suppose I can now say I did this joint. If anyone ever asks. I doubt I will return unless under similar duress. I've got other late-night Chinatown venues in my GPS I'd much rather prefer to investigate -- Pho Kim Long, Hobak Korean BBQ, Q Bistro, perhaps a Joyful House redux.

p7xmEJCGZUm27l_xug7mJQ.text: I've been coming here for a long time and I have to say that every time makes me happy, I love the atmosphere. When I go to certain places the atmosphere has to be there or I won't enjoy my food especially when it comes to sushi. I'm extremely picky when it comes to sushi so I have to say that sushi kaya does it for me every time, the food is always awesome, and I think the chefs like it when I come in because I eat a lot, maybe I don't know but I do get great treatment. Servers are pretty cool and they never stop asking me if I need something, and they are always checking up on me to see if I'm eating lol which is awesome. Thank guys. By the way it's the 10th anniversary and they dropped the price so stop by some time guys.

7wfmPh6Fl7Cb_bVBRxcyIQ.text: Very yummy place potstickers were fresh and delicious! We didn't order all you can eat because we weren't trying to eat too much so alacarte is just fine! Chicken fried rice was perfect and udon soup. My BF got the kimchi fried rice and said it was he best he ever had- came with a fried egg on top! We got excited when the food came I didn't even get to take a picture! We finished everything!

K43j3yJNsChG4qGUItkbIA.text: I came here about 2 weeks ago for a co workers going away dinner. We came with a party of 11 people for all you can eat sushi at around 25$ per person (u do the math). With a party this large, we were invited to a secluded room right next to the entrance. Upon entering this room I was very star struck. I felt like I was walking into a beat down motel 6.  1) there was dust on everything except for the tables and chairs. You could see dust from the ceiling and on the walls that probably landed in our sushi rolls & wallpaper was falling off the wall.  2) there was a bloody Band-Aid on the floor.  3) there was burn holes on the ceiling due from an electrical outlet (I believe) and there was a water sprinkler burned up and rotted.  4) service was slow and the waiter did not know which rolls had been served because there was multiple "food runners" delivering our rolls.  5) the speakers did not work and were only for show.   After all this discomfort I asked to speak with a manger. I asked the manager to close the door leading into our room. I asked him "would you feel comfortable eating in a place like this". The manager looks around the room and says " yes, what's wrong with it". After pointing out the 5 things I listed above he did not know what to say. He hesitated and after about 15 seconds of awkward silence he asks "so what do you want me to do?" I replied "your the boss you tell me". He exits the rooms and comes back 4 minutes later giving me 2 options. Option 1- we can take 15% off the tab. Option 2- we can take off the gratuity (18%) with 4 free socke shots. Option 1 is not even 5$ per person. Option 2 screws the server by taking off the tip (even though the manager claimed all tips were pulled) & gratuity is 'illegal'. After must disatisfaction i asked to speak with the owner, i was denied multiple times because she wasnt there. Which was a lie, the reason i couldnt speak with the owner was because she doesnt speak english. I am a worker in the hospitality industry for multiple years and this is absurd. I was not expecting a free meal but more than what was offered for what my friends and I experienced.   I want to eat at a place that takes pride in their bussiness and loves their customers. This clearly isnt the place that takes pride in anything other than filth. In Vegas a review and word of mouth go a long way. I will never return to this place & I will gladly take my business elsewhere. I took pictures of the room and will upload them with my review (hopefully yelp keeps them up)!

CWhiXI5tF9w7y3yZeIWKmQ.text: Love the all you can eat Sushi for $26.95 Best sushi price you can find and really enjoy the nice place and the service is great.

Lo86K4umb5jia1GqtXy2hA.text: food is good. names for rolls are creative and fun. staff could be more engaging and friendly.

zZE5qebxLl4t99uZ-nz_4g.text: I've had a lot of AYCE sushi and this is way below par in terms of food quality and taste.  Also, beware that you WILL be forced to finish ALL food.  Not much leniency.  Maybe I would have finished the food and not "wasted" any if it was good...  There is so much selection in Vegas that for the price, you'd be better off eating elsewhere.  Pros: - Good variety.  Has sushi rolls, nigiri, rice dishes, appetizers, skewers. - A few friendly servers - Can get smaller portions of all items. - Made to order and food was served fast (although not sure if it was too fast...) - Good indoor vibe/decor.  Cons: - Quality of food was not good. - Some of the food was just not that great.  Overcooked or bad flavor. - Forced to finish ALL the food. Not very lenient. - Pricey for the poor quality and bad taste of the food.  Must Try: - Nothing  Good to Order: - Agedashi Tofu - Nigiris - Sexy Bomb - Miso Soup  Avoid: - beef tongue skewer - beef don - salmon skin roll

n6LNhefNxGG56oq_0__mGw.text: OH MY GOSH!! The sushi here is DE-LI-CIOUS! I'm definitely stopping by on every trip I make to Vegas.. I'm surprised I've never tried this place before. The sushi was fresh. I completely recommend the ahi poke.. mm mm delish! && the sex bomb roll was a BIG hit at our table.  Now I have two concerns for the place... one of which is that the place is a little small so there may be quite a wait. We waited for 20 mins in order to be seated, but once we were seated, the ordering process & getting our food was fairly quick.   My next concern is the text on the menu that reads: "we charge for leftovers"... Though I understand the reasoning behind this, it had put quite a damp on our meal. It was our first time there so we were ordering items to try... you know, trial and error. But after reading that note, we were forced to eat EVERYTHING we ordered... even if we HATED it.. For about half the time we were there, we were more concerned about how to get rid of the items we didn't like rather than focusing on enjoying the other delicious items we ordered. Nexttime, we all plan on bringing some sort of plastic bag or something... because I refuse to be charged an extra fee because I didn't like a certain item that sounded better on the menu than in person. -- I don't suggest the jalepanos poppers... eck.  Here's another downside of the leftover clause... RICE is counted as a leftover, but they don't offer just sashimi on the menu... bummer.   Ahh, the review ended up sounding more negative than positive now, but trust me.. the place is worth a try... just order in moderation.. instead of ordering a ton at once, split it up and make sure you'll finish it or.. sneak in a doggie bag!

LgZ9w_Z72gZMg-8qmU8ujQ.text: My family and I dined here last night. We were a party of 7. The wait was not bad, wait time was 20 minutes. My husband did most of the ordering since I'm kinda new to the sushi bar scene. I loved the jalapeno poppers and the tuna nigiri. There was NOTHING there that I DIDN'T like. I had almost a whole strawberry soju pitcher to myself. I was feeling amazing after that. Service was great. Our drinks stayed full and sushi kept on coming our way. We happened to get parking right in front. I have no complaints on this awesome place. The ice cream mochi was delicious. I would go back and recommend this place to anyone.

bKu1_MPxgpwTIMxyLWYnfQ.text: Its the only place I will eat sushi. I was never a fan of sushi until I came here. Love their deep fried sushi, my favorite is monkey brains (its not really monkey brains, that would be nasty). Cant beat $20 for all you can eat (before 4pm).

sh4U63Xb2vBWM-CzhWJufw.text: We went to Sushi Koya last Sunday following my daughter's UNLV graduation, after having been turned away from Yama Sushi when 3 of our party were late (boo Yama Sushi).  We arrived with 9 guests and were seated almost immediately in a small private room off the main dining room.  The service was prompt, professional and outstanding!  The variety and freshness of the sushi and rolls was very, very good.  I would have no hesitation about going back.  The only down side is the limited parking in front of the strip mall, you may have to park in back and hoof it from there.

1ZxXc5dyqKkBVAfHbWar2Q.text: My favorite Sushi Restaurant! Always order the all you can eat, its approximately 25.00...huge variety on the menu, and they have a variiety of foods other than sushi! plus they are open til 3 or 4 in the morning...! great place, highly recommend it...the staff is amazing also, friendly and fast!

vAJBVJMvCyXhSYx04s0X4g.text: You can read other reviews about chipped plates, bad service and other things in other reviews.  In my experience, it's True--the service and atmosphere could use some work.  Each time, I get a different server with each trip to the table, so there's always plenty of confusion between the 4 or 5 people running back and forth to the table.  Constant check issues, missing AND overcharged items; we tried to pay with cash at one point and the bill disappeared.  We found it hiding in one of the card wallets, but it took some finding.  Plain lack of attention.  I'm giving it a 2 because no mistake: the food items are tasty enough and the service entirely pleasant, but the last time I went--and it will be the last time--the presentation was so appalling I couldn't believe I was being served a sushi roll that looked that much a mess.  It was so sloppy-looking, absolutely no pride or skill in the food being served.  It tasted fine, not amazing, but it looked like it'd been dug up.  TL;DR: Pleasant but terribly disorganized service, decent but not stellar food presented poorly, be prepared for issues with the check.  Go upstairs to Ichiza instead and skip the irritation.

gjZ7Jco6E6-KlZ7niE2gTg.text: This place was alright and decent when you're in a pinch.  It offers AYCE and is open until 3am. We were looking for Korean Yakiniku at 1:30am and apparently Tofu Hut closes at 2am now. So we were wandering around and decided on Sushi Kaya.  Walking in, there were still quite a few people in the restaurant and it was a pretty mixed crowd. I'll risk sounding like a snob but I totally gauge the customers who are in the restaurant. And, this place wasn't looking promising. As if to confirm that, we were sat next to a table with a few guys and as our server came to check on us, they were getting up to change tables. As he gets up and passes our server he grabs her ass and she was not pleased about it. I felt bad for her. As for him? Word that comes to mind? Disgusting.    The menu is extensive but most of the rolls are only ok. The skewers are one order of each per person and aren't all that impressive either. Overall the service was good and the rolls are decent. Good place if you're just trying places out but there are other AYCE places I would go to first.

I9WkXU6amcsWyrUIJX-WlA.text: Jayden was awesome!!!! Was great throughout the whole time we were there , very patient and very caring for our table!

IMBd8EoQC8sy5CgkZjoTCA.text: Do NOT go here! If I could have given this place less than one star I would have. I ate here on Monday 2/29/16 with a Friend and we both had all you can eat. We both took advantage of that and I had about 6 or 8 eight piece rolls. The very next night we both turned up with food poisoning. The next day we find out two of her other friends got food poisoning from eating there the night before we did. So I called the health apartment to find recommendations on what to do and they tell me reports came in of the same thing a few days prior. I've never been this sick in my entire life. The manager said that I need to go to the hospital to prove a diagnosis of food poisoning. Only problem is I cannot miss work and I had work that next night and the next morning after that. The manager said that they would pay for our hospital bills, but after telling him that I am not able to make it to the hospital they had no other accommodations to offer not even a simple refund. There must've been some cross contamination or mishandling of temperatures with the meats, probably both. You've been warned!

dqjlsvPcOOwlLghvRZMDMQ.text: Sushi Kaya, I found them on yelp one night because we wanted try a different sushi joint. Oh boy we're we pleased to find out more than just sushi rolls were on the AYCE menu. That meant more things for our belly to try!   My favorites were the skewers, the volcano roll and the black dragon roll. I wish I would have written down the names of my other favorites because there are many! If you're looking for a great AYCE place that has many options and awesome service as well, then this is the place! We definitely left with food babies and named them satisfied. :)

XCISpgRUPwzX_A9u-tCQDw.text: It was a disaster and I absolutely don't like the way they treat guest.The only one waitress who worked yesterday wears white shirt  is very rude and she totally ignore us with attitude all the way to the end and don't want to come back after we sit down.We understand everyone may have a bad day and we tried to get over with it, but it was so sad hat my friend just asked a cup of water for 3 times, she pretended she never heard from us.Believe me,It was not busy at all ,we tried to speak loud and I almost tried to yell about the water and she still didn't come back to serve.Our dinner was totally ruined, I will not go back again just because of the bad service from that lady, the food is good actually and it's OK for the price you pay.But I didnt see any service from the beginning to the end, nobody greet, nobody asked anything you need or even a smile. Hope the owner can see this and will do sth to improve the customer service!!! Bad bad bad!!!!!!!!!!

tFUerVjvobfE1GmInViocQ.text: For $22.95 you can't get better for the money. The selection is great and diverse, they don't over serve you rice. The staff is very friendly. I have eaten there 100's of time. Best price value sushi I have found to date.

zQtT787m5k_9zBoCkBzePg.text: My husband and I went there for dinner last night with our 17 months old son. The place was full and we were told to wait in a room off to the side (karaoke room) so we went there and waited. Then we realized people that came in after us were getting seated before us. The waiter forgot (?) that we were there. My husband was hungry so he got out and stood where they could see him and FINALLY we got seated.  When we got seated, I asked for a high chair for my son and the waitress asked me how many high chairs I wanted. Hmmmmmmmm....did she think we (adults) wanted to be seated in high chairs as well? Clearly, we only had ONE baby with us. Later the same waitress came to take our orders. My husband got all you can eat sushi and I didn't. She said it's okay as long as we don't share food. My husband put orders for his all you can eat meal and I studied the menu for something my son can eat. I asked for japchae and white rice for the baby. She said the rice is $1. I said that's fine. Then I realized that japchae and the rice were both included in the all you can eat menu. The waitress knew I got that for my 17 months old son. I know my husband can't share his meal with me but couldnt' he have fed my son off his menu?? I didn't really want to eat there so I just got an order of Norwegian mackarel (this was good btw) and had that for dinner.   BTW, their all you can eat menu isn't really all you can eat. Probably about 30% of it is marked where you can only place one order of those items. I gave it a 3 stars because my husband liked trying various different items off the all you can eat menu. He didn't have any rolls but just sushi and yakitori (skewers) items. He, however, wasn't happy that they seated other people ahead of us and how quickly the waiter tried to drop off the check. (He brought us the check right after they brought his first orders from all you can eat menu.) He said he felt like they wanted us out.

o4RpFiA-Yab_bFrXcy4-_A.text: meh. i've experienced WAY better. rolls and sushi were whatever. The waitress was rude and so was the sushi chef. rude rude rude.

kYEMdA8erJVUpDOa_XEBeQ.text: Where to start...  So I've been coming to Sushi Kaya for about 3 years now. It wasn't always as busy as it is today, but the service/food was definitely better a couple years ago. Staff was always polite, and the food came out quickly. However, that's different now. I'm assuming they've undergone some recent changes this year, because this restaurant has done a complete 360.   Went in with a friend for AYCE, and the food didn't seem as cold as it should've been, but we didn't pay too much attention. Stuffed ourselves, even had 2 desserts lol!   Next day my two friends tell me they got food poisoning from there, which scares me since I just went with my friend as well. I wasn't sick yet, so I was being positive. The next morning I had a few terrible episodes in the bathroom and I knew immediately! I couldn't even keep water down, and stayed in the bathroom for half the day. PLEASE save your money! It is NOT the same restaurant it used to be. I am literally disgusted.  Contacted the Health Department and apparently Sushi Kaya has been getting a ton of complaints.

GqU5aQmogAgJQ3jeIvn1ww.text: This is a great sushi place.  It's unlimited but different than most.  Most sushi places have the basic apps and a list of rolls to chose from for all you can eat.  Sushi Kaya is unique cause they have a huge appetizer menu that even has grilled shrimp and mushrooms and steak and other fun stuff.  You literally can graze on so many appetizers before you even hit the sushi menu.  Then you start ordering sushi and it's so good.  The diversity of the number of rolls they have is fantastic.   This is a big place and is always packed. But in my opinion it's well worth the wait.  I've been several times and it's always great.  The service is fast and friendly and the quality of food is delicious.  It's a bit higher cost for the all you can eat but they're open late night and the extras you get are worth the price you pay if not more.   I'm excited to go back.

SK85uRztqQARt4d8y-dTDA.text: Absolutely the worst service imaginable. Servers did not smile and just did not look like that wanted to be there. I dined in with my family. I could not believe it . The entire dinner my son did not even get a refill. The sushi was decent.. I would recommend trying another Sushi spot. There are literally thousands in Las Vegas. _7P9Qywv7e5dvzbuSTBeeA.text: Favorite sushi joint so far!!!  Incredible menu for all you can eat, the price is right. Service seems to be kinda hit or miss, could be too I'd eaten too much and they want to slow me down! Variety isn't too bad, although after awhile (10-12 rolls) it starts to all seem like the same.  It's still my favorite sushi joint in vegas!

8VmyW-yU0A7pjDC-6VdEfQ.text: My friends and I were craving sushi, so my husband and I took their advice and went to one of their favorite spots. After maneuvering through the crowded parking lot and putting our names on the wait list, it became obvious that this all-you-can-eat spot is not just THEIR favorite but a fave among many. And for good reason...   I love AYCE sushi restaurants because you can try a lot of new items. Sushi Kaya has a huge menu, from regular nigiri sushi to special rolls, tempura, and even Korean dishes like bulgogi and kimchi fried rice. We each basically stuck with sushi and rolls, although we shared some garlic edamame and seaweed salad. (The menu says "no sharing," but that didn't seem to be a problem -- and why should it be?)  As usual, my husband and I ordered lots of eel and hamachi, with a variety of rolls. The black dragon roll (California roll with eel and avocado) was my favorite, but everything was good, and it was nice that you could order half rolls as well. I'd also never had mochi ice cream before, and on my friends' recommendation, I tried it for dessert. LOVED it! (My husband did not agree.) Reminded me of a small scoop of ice cream wrapped in Botan rice candy.  Service was quick and efficient, although one of my friends' orders was never delivered. But as it's AYCE, I say just order it again! (And if you come with a large party, you know someone will eat it!) Unfortunately, you don't want to eat garlic edamame while everyone else is eating mochi...  Sushi Kaya is right in the middle of Chinatown and, as I said, the (small) parking lot is a nightmare. But you can park right next door at Chinatown Plaza and walk over (which I suggest you do). And if the restaurant is too crowded, there are plenty of other choices nearby where you can dine. But I suggest that you wait and try Sushi Kaya. Good food, large menu, and -- although it's new to my palate -- MOCHI!

0vO4rU1Vo148t16ld0Oj8g.text: This is my favorite sushi place and I always recommend it. It also has a vegan/vegetarian sushi roll.

dtbZjHQqhNYbqOaS1DwFOQ.text: I don't know how this place has such great reviews, obviously the people who like it have no idea what good sushi is.   This place was not my choice, we were dragged there by a friend who swore it was the best sushi, (poor girl doesn't know good sushi)  The wait is long and we are seated in the waiting area which smells like pee. We finally get our table and order. The sashimi was warm and definitely not fresh. The best thing was the garlic edamame.   Needless to say we will not go back and that friend may not chose restaurants from now on.

mCUj3jysmE4UtY1wFClbTA.text: One of my favorite sushi spots in town. My bf and I went for lunch and it was about $19.95 for all you can eat sushi. You def cannot go wrong for that price. g0FRVnwNMiJTwTsqqaQ4kw.text: We have been to Kaya several times and they have always been good to us. I just went again a little over a week ago and unfortunately experienced one of the worst services I've had at any restaurant.  After we ordered, our waiter gradually disappeared the further we got into our meal. At first we had to wait on water and then it just became a wait for everything. My date was going to order dessert with his AYCE but gave up after a good 20 minutes of looking around for our waiter to appear. Someone at the table next to us ended up raising her hand to get the attention of another worker (maybe the manager?) who helped us all and prompted the waiter to give our check. When the waiter finally came back with our check, he was impolite and didn't say anything like "sorry to make you wait" or "have a nice night" and it made the whole thing that much worse.  We've never had a problem with the service at Kaya so this visit was highly disappointing. I would probably still go back because I enjoy the place and people overall, but definitely would not hope to get that same waiter again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. spicy seafood udon

4qBD4cabtqycCgEx0Haf2A.text: Love this place! We've been coming here for 3 years. Parties of 10 or more can reserve the private room. That's the best!

OAxUm-cl3MZ-NvOf6bWAjg.text: I've been to a lot of AYCE Sushi here in Las Vegas especially around Spring Mt. area. I was hoping they would realize the competition and raise their quality and service. I was very disappointed. I brought my family from east coast to have a sushi dinner and decided to go here. We had a big group and it was nice that they put us in a room. The service was super slow and they forgot a lot of our orders. The rice was mediocre and their "fresh" nigiris are warm. Most of the rolls we ordered tasted bland. I don't think I'm gonna come back to this place again.

8PHJrxC9YH5u11eY-f0jGg.text: Stopped in for a late dinner and discovered a hidden GEM! This place is the bees knees. Fresh sushi, great quality (for ACE), and friendly staff. Almost anyone that passed my table took an order from us. The ginger and wasabi could be fresher, which is key for me, but besides that everything was great here!

iWX2pfezg6K7r1qE0X_MAQ.text: I love sushi and love this place for their delicious and fresh sushi rolls  Make sure you try their Dragon roll

H9Ohmbk8dHM9KwtzMAT1jA.text: I don't expect much quality from all you can eat sushi places but this place topped my expectations.  I must have tried 20 different items (benefit of going with large party).  Food was delivered quickly and was excellent in quality.  Rolls, tofu, skewers, dessert, sashimi - all of it tasty!

ibfic5vx9muvBnnx8BpmpQ.text: Clean and friendly service,  fresh food and a lot variety to choose from. The price is affordable

4FwirM3yX1mtFGUwu2pqrg.text: As tourists to Vegas we enjoy finding new places and this was a huge treat! We had been going to the same sushi place for a while when we visited, but something made us decide variety is the spice of life! So we decided to look around again.  I called one sushi place near me and they offered Kaya to me for AYCE. I am so glad they did. At first we knew we were in a great neighborhood for food as we have eaten in the area and there are many great offerings near here. We arrived before they opened and were seated quickly. Everything was very tasty, but the one item that really made an impression on me was the mussels. At first I was concerned because they were covered in cheese. (cooking shows say "Seafood and cheese do not mix") Well, guess what? These were amazing! My husband never eats sushi mussels because they are usually drowning in mayonnaise but he too enjoyed these! Actually, we tried many items on their AYCE menu, and the skewers were also a nice surprise that many places do not offer.  At dinner you can even get sashimi! Great price, great food! The only reason they got one less star, the waiter seemed upset or was basically not at all friendly the entire visit. One female with glasses on was full of smiles and helped us also, but the man wasn't happy to be there or I don't know- just not professional demeanor to me. Smile- your restaurant might be the highlight of someone's trip to Vegas!

d3HYP6_3Jv_fEjbXtUaEqg.text: I've been to so many restaurants but I don't always put my review unless the experience of being there is either spectacular or the worst. This by far is the WORST restaurant I've been to! First time last year was a bad experience but I dont really base this on my first time. I gave them a chance this year to see if they improved. The servers are the rudest especially the guy manager who thinks we owe him. There were 16 of us and for $35 a person, we expected to be treated right. He told us they are so busy but at least 6 of teh workers are standing in the hallway just chatting. MEL a lady server just dropped a plate on our table and took off like she wanted to punish us. They told us we only have 90 minutes to eat but they're too damn slow and I only had 4 very small plates 2 pc sushi each for 90 mins! If u want your money worth, skip this place.

hapdyQX_6zvlH1xcPs3O3A.text: One of the best AYCE sushi places I've tried. I make sure to stop here when I'm in town. The fried rolls are my favorite. The teriyaki chicken is great.

YWEjL3mndUuwIa0wBBf65A.text: Their rolls are amazing but the service is pretty bad! It takes almost forever for the food to come out and they often drop off rolls at the wrong tables, we we're there twice on our trip to Las Vegas and neither the service or the time frame change. If they food wasn't good we probably wouldn't have gone back a 2nd time. The price is fairly decent.

EvJHRGaJW34PU0SEHN8Pqg.text: My first time trying this and I always go around looking for yummy sushi places. This is now on my list! The nigiris are pretty big! They were also very fresh, especially the ebi(shrimp) nigiri! I go to many sushi places and they're always mediocre quality but this place serves the shrimp perfectly! I liked how they did half rolls as well so you can have more variety before getting full! The rolls are yummy too!  The service wowed me even more! As soon as I walked in they were all so nice, welcoming, and friendly! I asked for take out at first and the waitress sat me at the bar unlike most places that just let you stand or sit at the benches!   I love this place and will definitely be coming back! I haven't found too many sushi places that get my shrimp fresh and big like they do (besides extremely expensive high end sushi restaurants!) this one is a really good deal for 26.95 :)))) thanks to them!

N8b7eDXstsad_wzgDT6o4A.text: For all you can eat sushi, this place was excellent. It's relatively small but makes up for it in atmosphere.  Our server was rude and acted like he resented the fact we were there, and seemed to be completely lost at times, he came by twice with another tables order. However, what seemed to be a manager was extremely attentive and very friendly.  The salmon sashimi was absolutely delicious and the nigiri and rolls we had were all delicious. Overall it was an awesome experience.

2P0n0g0edo2Fo2lY1HzA-g.text: The ONLY sushi place I like in town ! They play great music have an excellent crew everything's so fresh and comes to my table fast! We eat here a few times a month and bring all of our friends here ! It's very clean

dtDPYFoN-rXmKl_3NqPtSg.text: Really enjoy their Salmon dishes~ It's a nice place to eat sushi.  It can be noisy sometimes depending on how many people are there and the music, so sometimes it's difficult to hear people if they are a bit far away.  They have good quality sushi from what I seen.  I'm not sure if it was just the day I went, but the table I sat was a bit sticky.  I've been there before where the table wasn't sticky, but my recent visit our table was a bit sticky; but, it didn't hinder my friends and I to eat lots of sushi~

Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MioLGJnlsmEXVpoQP_m1Aw.text: After three tries, I'm done.   This place is not awful. However, in a town with so many great sushi places, you've got to be better than "not awful" to get my business.  Many of the rolls are the same (California Roll) with small differences. The Caterpillar Roll that I ordered had almost no eel. The Mango Roll had no mango (just a mango 'sauce') The sushi rice is dull and dry.   Sometimes the place is relatively clean. Sometimes, it's kinda gross. This last time, I was given a menu that was soaking wet (even laminated). Gross.  I tried. Next please.

5_HL2vS3NU3ALAC-DV-nXA.text: Man.... this sushi spot was the place to be for my friends and I! We loved their all you can eat menu. Now that I've recently dined there, I noticed that the quality has gone down. The wait time is still excessive as the restaurant has limited seating.

d4UyOJD7MVIhFCo-wOqHNQ.text: Reasonably priced AYCE Sushi and good prompt service.  One complaints would be too much rice in each sushi.  However, given the overall value, I would nonetheless come back.

qblZlQuQ-u15fahd4yIc7w.text: The food was ok, the service was not bad, but the plates were chipped, and the cushion of the booths were so worn out.

Z2WzCIZpfboBwbEMpqK65A.text: Idk what happened to the quality of sushi here but everything made me sick here yesterday. Sushi roll was dry, sashimi tasted old, the look of the fish was just bad. I have been here a few times before no problems but this time it was just horrible. Sushi came out warm, yuck.

GbNcK_SvOwSHXfUGcUUq9A.text: It's the best sushi in Vegas. Unique delicious rolls, fresh seafood, great selection of appetizers, awesome all you can eat menu. Highly recommend. It will be busy any night at dinner, but worth the wait and there's a karaoke lounge/bar right next door to stop and wait in. All you can eat lunch is cheaper also for the same menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Xxx2 roll. Torched escolar on top.
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Udon noodle, tuna sashimi, kimchi fried rice

1Nl45AcZib1BNV4NTTpfEw.text: I know it's not the best .. and the waiters are not the best or most friendly.. but it is my favorite sushi spot. Best white tuna nigiri in town

RRqV5jtdV8aRUv1AF8e4Eg.text: Their fish is good enough for the price. AYCE is worth it but the rice is way too much. They drown the seafood with huge sushi rice!

jbn3p2yoDqp9wmEauopLuw.text: Best sushi in Las Vegas hands down!  Service is awesome! Restaurant is clean. This pace is so good we went two days in a row.  Another bonus is that they are open late too. Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the cool names of the rolls too!

qbz58RxWXAPn4ChZ8DOlYQ.text: This place is wonderful! I did the all you can eat, and i got down 5 plates (relax, im 6'5 200lbs). I've eaten lots of sishi all over the planet (including Tokyo). This is top notch and I highly recommend the poncho roll! Its ridiculous how delicious it is.

v70f5n6MwQl1UhT3ogiQGw.text: Awesome.  I made a yelp account just to spread the good word about this place.  Brother and I ventured hear off a yelp review calling it "pretty good" and wow, what an understatement.  Even after losing a couple hundred dollars at the casinos, this place made the trip a win in my book.

vLLNtnrhpcCseUJmA8y0Tg.text: Always good the skewers are great especially the bacon&scallops and roasted garlic  kimchi fried fice was great as was the sushi always recommend this restaurant Try the monkey brains yummy

EN24XzlvAE0_wRV1Kuullw.text: Although their prices for the All You Can Eat is a little pricey, their portions here makes it up for it. The food comes out quickly even before the appetizers

gWJCvSOmhTFp2vywYS6VGg.text: This is usually my go-to spot for sushi. Yet today I received the worst service, I question ever going back. Right off the bat, I asked our server if we could order drinks after our 3rd person returned from the restroom. She glared at me so I decided to just order some waters. After taking our order, the table next to us complained about their lasagna roll tasting weird, they are also regulars. The server loudly sighed and said "do you want another one or?" I completely understand how it is working in customer service. I've been doing it for almost 6 years. She checked on us maybe twice. We ordered a few beers which never showed up to our table. She seemed extremely impatient while we asked questions about the menu. The sushi is usually very good but they really need to step up their customer service.

cQj1Xe19MPus0B62R7jEzw.text: To get straight to the point - Sushi Kaya is the choice for you if you prefer a nicer range of good appetizers, especially if you have anti-fish diners in your party. Otherwise, if you're a nigiri kind of person, it really isn't worth the five dollars you'll save by going here instead of some other AYCE sushi joints that are open late.   The fish and seafood is lacking. The textures range from decent to oh-god-gritty-sea-urchin, which can really break an evening and a tooth or two. Some of the fish nigiri were unusually fishy, especially the salmon, which was uncharacteristically lacking sweetness. There's also a clear excess of rice on the nigiri and rolls, and while I understand that the establishment does need to break even, it always seems underhanded to do it with the rice overage method. There's just... nothing the guest can do about it, but to be bitter and be filled prematurely with rice for fear of Leftover Charges.  Fortunately, the appetizers and other dishes are very good, and are actually worth the all-you-can-eat space to try, especially since you won't be missing out on much anyway from the bad seafood. The desserts are good too, but it was a bit strange that they were out of stock of more than half the dessert menu. The service is pretty friendly too, which is nice and well-appreciated especially considering how busy the place was and how late it was at the time. They'll let members of your dining party do a la carte ordering while others do AYCE, too, which really must be inconvenient for them, but is a great service to us, so thank you, Sushi Kaya.  Now, if you'd serve me some better nigiri, and keep the plum wine ice cream in stock, that would be even better.

3Jp3EDOZ6fYG1IQvvWB5Cg.text: I love this place. I've been here multiple times for the last 3-4yrs and is my favorite sushi spot in town. The servers are very nice and I love the sushi and food here.  Must try: Cinderella roll Dynamite White tuna nigiri (I like how theirs taste like it was smoked. Not like that in a lot of places) Bacon and scallop skewer Beef skewer Gingko nuts  And when I asked them if they could recreate a roll I had from a different place, in a different state, they were most happy to do it for me.

FLAHv9capZ2ywI6YW74hXw.text: Nothing really sticks out about this place other than the small environment.  The sushi itself is alright with AYCE sushi being $25 for dinner. The menu, in my opinion, is mediocre. It's all your basic sushi that you can get anywhere. If you're going with a big group, be sure to call and make a reservation. If you have enough people they maybe able to place your party in their private room.  I guess if you're near Chinatown and can't decide on what sushi restaurant to eat at you can give this place a try.

ljz5IBZ0zNv5XhWktIyRUw.text: This place is great! The fish was fresh and nothing was overloaded with rice like a lot of AYCE places. Nothing better than quality fish and the specialty rolls were very unique.  The only two things that keep me from giving this a full 5 stars are  a] the service is a bit slow, I attribute that to how busy they are b] the way the bar is set up you don't get to interact with the sushi chefs, which I wholeheartedly enjoy.  Still a quality joint.

4YYOYYwb2aHrOzXBOrCTPg.text: We ate here Saturday Febuary 13, 2016 for early Valentine's dinner. One of the best sit down all you can eat Sushi in town. Fast service really good quality Sushi. Waited 45 minutes for our table for a party of 4 but it was worth the wait. They do half orders for Sushi orders. It's great because gives you some room to try other stuff on the menu. I would recommend this place for you Sushi lovers. Only negative thing I observed was our waiter and waitress seemed mad and they were not friendly. It also seemed they didn't want to be there working. But the food came fast and drinks too.

1SpFZcLGo6jdaIKoHW6fDg.text: love this place food is amazing and they are very fast and nice!

vne6pljMvC185gcnA-7q8g.text: Been here about 3 times with the boyfriend and I've had good experiences so far. The first time we did AYCE here, the waitress brought us our orders quite quickly which surprised me because we often eat at Sushi Mon and the wait there gets ridiculous as well as getting your orders (sometimes, gotta flag down the waiters). The food here is okay. The ambiance is not so bad either, but this place did not ignite a special bond within me so it's whatever.  The food is great though, so I'm not really complaining!  Food Quality: 3.5 of 5 Ambiance: 3 of 5 Staff Service: 3 of 5 (hit and miss--sometimes cool staff serving, sometimes not) Overall: 3.5 of 5  Will definitely come back again, but not any time soon. Worth trying though!

NsdEusqmj8EbCsNP20EMXw.text: After being here over 10 times in the last year, I feel like it would be appropriate to review my favorite, yes you heard me right, my favorite sushi joint in Las Vegas.  Sushi is this kind of sandstorm that hit, from my observation at least, hard and hasn't left. You can go everywhere and find sushi restaurant on almost every other block these days. I take the undeniable pride in having tried many of the places around the valley and this is my favorite, on a wide spectrum.  Sushi Kaya is "hidden" in the corner of a restaurant complex but you'll always find it packed. The place is a little small, so often on the weekends if you're coming here the wait times can be on the higher end. Another complaint is, sometimes the service is a little on the crappy side. Like people forget to acknowledge you, the good thing about that is that each table has a "call" button that is quite useful.  Other than that, the rolls and nigiri are all very good. I'm not quite sure the days they get their shipments, but I've never had an experience where the fish did not taste fresh. I always order a boatload of salmon nigiri and I have never been disappointed. The unagi is always delicious and fresh on the bright side and homeboys and homegirls... I LOVE MY UNAGI!  My favorite roll is the "Sex Bomb" roll. Very delicious. I might as well be there house specialty, because it is the right amount of everything. I also always order the Brooklyn Bridge roll and the Spider roll. There are very few rolls that aren't good, in fact, I've never been disappointed with any of the rolls I've had. The desert is always good, they give you unlimited ice cream and I always get the mango or strawberry mochi.   All in all, this is my favorite place because the whole experience. There was one instance I left and hated it, but it was because of the service on what seemed like a slow night. As you can probably tell, I forgave but sure as hell will not forget. BUUUUTTTT! I will always to continue coming back, because it's just that good!

OtZYiLSIu87QryKEG1Ybhw.text: Love the sushi here! Only wish they were bigger so the wait wouldn't be so long. Sticky rice is so good!

udotSj3Mh_ejFgLB43oLFw.text: Nice place, cool setting friendly staff and very tasty sushi. I enjoyed the all you can eat menu, they have food items that you don't normally find on all you can eat sushi menus. I would defiantly go back and bring a friend.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Japanese Jalapeño Poppers!!

jzIsg-oHY5zKQQeOHNeU0Q.text: Meh....another mediocre AYCE. I would have liked it better if I was into that kind of thing or into American style 3 sauce heavy sushi. Some things were good, some not so good. The fish slices on the sushi were nice and big. Pretty fresh. Nothing to rave about but it was edible. The booth we had was comfortable.

lec-dz5B6KLM-ocxJHXJjg.text: Excellent service, timely manner, well organized. My experience at Kaya was led by a friendly greeting from the hostess. It was partly crowded and had to wait 5 minutes for a table which is normal. Waiter was friendly and courteous to my dehydration needs. The sushi was good, I highly recommend the "sex bomb" roll if you likes baked sushi. It was delectable. I ordered a seaweed salad and miso soup to start with. I was not a fan of the "one night stand roll" you pretty much pay for the name not the quality of the roll. I next ordered the "tornado roll" which was alright. It was standard which had the cheese, crab, cucumber and avocado.(as did most of the rolls had) it is an AVERAGE sushi spot. Is it the best in Vegas... Probably not. I would come again for a quick sushi place. I would rather go to sushi goyemon or ra sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One night stand roll (do not get it) no tasty at all.
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White tuna and eel roll.
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef skewer &amp; bacon roll

OZ4OQPf5mNqosO7GHRFQZw.text: It was good for the most part. I tend to stay with safer rolls when I haven't been to a place before. They were quick when bringing out the food but when we asked what which roll was for a second time when we couldn't hear them they just ignored us. Also didn't like how they already charged me gratuity and then on the receipt there was an option for a tip. I'm a generous tipper especially when my wait staff is nice and I probably would've tipped more but oh well. But the food was good but I was told by someone in my party that it used to be much better and that scares me a bit.

WLc7TBJFMuAMVOnqJLnhVA.text: I can't believe some of these reviews, talkin bout bad service you'll probly get the chance to order 3 times, I ordered 2 specialty rolls and a 5pice sashimi on my first order and it was bout all I could eat, but I persevered and managed to eat another role. All the roles I had were inventive and prepared excellently, and all the fish was premium quality. Zero complaints, the best sushi for the money hands down.

yWQ0dGdDtb4xm-olZD_32g.text: I love this place ! The wait on a weekend is the thing that I don't like but the food is so worthy!

UN_hZ07YJoxKl8auEyvXqA.text: Had lunch here with some relatives who live in Vegas. We had the AYCE. For the most part the food was ok. I prefer sushi bars that aren't AYCE. It was evident why when I ordered a few pieces of tuna, yellowtail, salmon, squid, and albacore. The pieces of fish were SMALL, like really small, like what the heck is this supposed to be?

QaAb79MggOkAe_9uP5Shng.text: All You Can Eat lunch special for under $20?! Parking was a breeze, we were seated immediately, the staff was excellent, the menu easy to navigate, and the food was delicious. Side note: some of the menu items have hilarious names. I loved everything about this place.

N4PaWRQUX-JczMoLIzF_Wg.text: Customer service definitely needs to improve. I understand when it's busy during dinner rush but when it's lunch hour on a weekday and it's visibly slow. Why does it take so long for a waiter/waitress to see if we need a refill or anything else for that matter.

JwwidKFxl555dqI81f9wTA.text: Rice portions here are HUGE. Im talking about we ordered amaebi and the rice was bigger than the shrimp. Just a huge chunk. The rolls aren't filled with much rice, so Id say if you're more of a roll lover- this may be your spot. I usually go for nigiri, but I only ordered one round because it wasn't enjoyable with that much rice. The service here is very attentive when coming from I think the managers. They were dressed in button up shirts. Our original waiter was a female and she forgot several orders or got them wrong. She never really came back to our table but the managers who helped us were great.

V9QrX0WSGphraY9wwPKpDQ.text: I have an insane weakness for sushi . Especially if it comes from sushi kaya. Best sushi place EVER.   It's the best sushi for your money, and not to mention its alot cheaper than other AYCE sushi places. Try the crispy rice sushi ! It's very innovative for sushi . It's the only place I've seen this kind of sushi. Although I admit their desserts could be better . I love chocolate and they only have fruity desserts. The only chocolate you will find there is in the cheesecake.   If your from out of state , AYCE sushi in Vegas is like a new experience . Every state out of Vegas that offers AYCE sushi does not offer as many appetizers and rolls for the same price . Take advantage of AYCE in Vegas at sushi kaya!

6COcHvKa979t32fXD9q2eA.text: AYCE for around $26 isn't bad. We have been here a handful of times so I guess it's time to write a review.   They have a huge selection of things you can get on the AYCE. The apps are standard fair. The green mussels were just okay. But if you like spicy the jalapeno poppers are pretty good.  2 of my favorite rolls here are the Jose & the Wall Street roll.   We went with 4 adults and ordered a lot. The service was decent this time around. They forgot a roll and we had to remind them twice before getting it.   All in all a standard AYCE sushi place.

HQ-7pMPHQzNdp1ubAz5zhA.text: It was hard to find parking. We went there for my sisters birthday... the waiter was very rude and seemed impatient, he was so short with his answers when we'd asked about the food. When the food finally arrived 25 mins later, we found hair in 2 if the rolls we ordered. We complained and showed them the hair, and when they finally replaced our rolls, all the employees were staring at us eat. Never coming back here. Rude employees

5YkN2GBhTHDhmQ0ZnyZYNw.text: All you can eat sushi for $26, not bad!  There's like over 180 varieties to choose from-not just sushi but you can have noodle dishes & appetizers too.  The wait was long but it was during the peak dinner time; 7pm 30min wait.  Compared to the usual sushi AYCE places, the quality of the sushi wasn't as great. But it was still good! My friends and I shared orders and you could do half orders so that was nice- we were able to try different rolls.  The service was good, the waiters kept coming around to take more orders and the food came out quick!  Parking might be hard to find if you're there during the busy hours since it's in the same complex as other great restaurants.

Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amaebi

J9CZSdjyTvdELy6fHKjhIQ.text: Best casual sushi in Vegas. All you can eat is a great deal - make sure to leave a little room for the green tea mochi, which was the best I've ever had.  Suggestions:  Starters - Dynamite, Jalapeno poppers, bacon scallop skewers  Nigiri - smoked salmon, yellowtail, albacore, snapper, everything else   Rolls - Sex Bomb, Jose, 911

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Go for the Dynamite scallop app and the Sex Bomb roll

s72Z5xnDd70_PgH6xMI92g.text: This place used to be great years ago, I went last night for AYCE worst decision ever, things didn't taste as fresh as they used too. I had to ask for Silverware and plate for a party of six? How can someone forget to set up a table.. I love poke very much and their poke did not taste fresh or good at all. To top it all off I ended up with food poisoning and still recovering.

rHeseCrGZkMLibOoC36kPw.text: Kaya has a massive menu to choose from  but if you are a nigiri lover, this is not the best place.  I ordered yellow tail, salmon, scallop(marinated with yum yum sauce only), and tuna. Salmon was the only one that was not dried. I wish I took some pictures but the yellow tail and tuna both  were like rubber. Not surprisingly, they tasted pretty bad. Go to Sushi Koma or Goyemon, there you will have really fresh nigiri.  There is a huge selection of appetizers which includes skewers. They were not really Japanese style but tasted pretty ok.  I don't usually eat rolls so I can't really comment too much on it, but there is a huge selection of rolls for you to choose from.  The service was pretty good. The gentleman asked us frequently if we needed refills or additional orders. However, it's the only sushi place I've been to that would bring your bills without being requested. Not a big deal to me but some people may care, especially when the place is almost empty.   Overall, an average AYCE sushi place with so-so nigiri but a huge selection of appetizers and rolls. I may give it another try and hopefully there will be fresher fish then.

GPndNRNnUIt1rmR6T3DPAw.text: Giving a 1-Star due to the poor customer service. Ordered udon noodle soup. It was extremely salty and I immediately advised the waiter. He replied "that's the way the soup is!" .... Upon asking if I could possibly swap for another item, he replied "you can pay for another item!" This was very disappointing.

GsRDioUoJVs2TGNS8fwugg.text: Loved it here!! You know it's good when you have Latin cooking the food. Really good and cheap! Good verity of sushi rolls..

n2bX5Mahx0awz_2jEKGHqg.text: 5 star service 5 star sushi! I absolutely love the quality & variety Sushi Kaya has to offer! I appreciate the sushi chefs acknowledging & greeting us when we walked in. I fully appreciated the amount of employees asking if we needed anything, although our server was attentive & helpful enough. Although I'm from LA, I will be back, hopefully sooner than later!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Other side of menu
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Glorious Goodness of Sushi Bliss (zoom in:)
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kaya Roll, Personally requested &amp; generously received: Escolar Nigiri Sushi &amp; the Mango Style Roll

_iB7nn3ZUyA35kUimZtMjg.text: Came here after walking out of Jjanga. Good service, decent food. Won't be a regular here. Even the sushi was mostly good, some of the rice tasted old or not cooked right and didn't stick together properly, also didn't feel right when chewing. A couple of the rolls were funky and the spicy fish had a weird texture that was off putting. So for the rice, the texture and other things that will not be mentioned, I will not be back.

_MecErY8HjNvOwRjIy_BXA.text: If I could give this place a zero star I would. I use to love this place, and I just found a hair in the middle of my Brooklyn bridge roll. And the manager's excuse was, "it's a restaurant, it happens, do you want another?" Like really we would like another sushi roll with potential hair in it, like hell no we just want the check and he really didn't even discount the check. We didn't cause a scene but we should have by the way the manager decided to just offer another roll without even considering there was hair in our food. And the fact that he used the excuse that it happens is pathetic.

NvdyEMCLOCEyRI4NsbkCRw.text: Love AYCE sushi! Didn't like where we sat at the sushi bar cuz I was sitting in the corner stuck in a small place but every other time I go I love it. Food is really good. I usually tap out after 7 different rolls but this time my brother and I ordered more then 20 plus all the desserts on the menu. I would definitely come back and bring new guest with me.

oioSmLQqCOWmoG-EpcBUGw.text: Wonderful service, nice and clean establishment, and great food. I love the variety and quality of their all you can eat menu and such a great price for it too.

tk-i8rJIgg1SGuA1KkHLDg.text: Hands down best Sushi in Vegas!! $20 a person for lunch: All You Can Eat.. 2 pages of food to choose from! Great place for lunch.. Food is always fresh and comes out fast with great customer service as well..

nXGk9ttEjbwetoj1NPnWDg.text: Ok Not excellent, but ok.  Hey have great variety, but many dishes are just "average," nothing spectacular.  Also it is so small that usually we can't get a seat.

WRE92pgldisWsMK1eTdXZw.text: This isn't a bad sushi place but it's not somewhere I go anymore (I have one check in here because I basically stopped coming here before I even signed up for Yelp...but before...I was here at least 10 times....this was my spot).  Overall, this place is a good introduction to sushi because they emphasize rolls and have a huge selection of them. Their AYCE menu is pretty good, competitively priced and not too bad.   Their hours are pretty good too.

4X1DoLETd97uYeS3X0QfEA.text: It's not every sushi restaurant that I'm willing to drive twenty minutes to attend, but Sushi Kaya gets the nod!  They have an outstanding selection of flavored Saki and a very creative selection of sushi rolls.  Service was outstanding, the atmosphere was very pleasant, and most importantly the fish was fresh!  I always say the prime quality indicator of fish freshness will be how busy the place is, in other words, how fast they have to refresh their fish stocks.  Sushi Kaya clearly has a loyal following and they can now add me that list.  It is lively place and would be good to meet up with friends for dinner and drinks to have a great time.

zsoJN-gQVOd3OD_rXO__7w.text: Excellent service and great food!! The owners are very friendly and welcoming. The rolls here are really yummy. The Washington roll changed my life with that kiwi sauce they put on top.   This was not my first visit and it definitely will not be my last!!

rRlshuHNYK3QujgO0k4w_Q.text: Usually this is one of my favorite places to come for Sushi. Today, however, was an off day for Sushi Kaya. There were a couple of flies flying around, and then we found a small bug crawling in our lemons :/ The server offered 20% off our bill for that...  Then, on top of that, the sushi wasn't as good as it usually is, and the fish wasn't that fresh. It was kind of dried out and wilted. Yuck. Hopefully next time Sushi Kaya will be up to be standard that I expect.

ke5x3mxnFaDzGxffRvJQhg.text: Sushi Kaya is one of my favorite sushi places to go to located off the strip. It's really affordable and they have an all you can eat deal that is to die for. The staff is incredibly accommodating and ask you every 10 minutes how everyone is going and if you need anything else. I love the hilarious names they have given their rolls like "one night stand" and "I love my butt" which are both delicious by the way. I also live the bacon wrapped scallops, grilled shrimp, and cucumber salad. I seriously have never left this place unsatisfied or without a full belly lol. I highly recommend that anyone living in Las Vegas or visiting come check out this deliciously affordable place and maybe after you get that full belly you can go next door and jam out to Karaoke at Zizzy's like I always do lol

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bomb.com

xHva_DArvvavakD-wDZEDQ.text: My friends and I come here every Friday! It is our tradition. :) We love Sushi Kaya for many, many reasons. Their sushi is so fresh and cold. We usually do all-you-can-eat, and start off with miso soup and seaweed salad. I love their spicy tuna, sashimi, yellowtail, and albacore. They have a nice fish-to-rice too ratio since some places give way too much rice! I love their mochi as a dessert. The service is usually great every time. It doesn't take long when we order for our AYCE sushi.  This place gets packed on the weekends, and for good reason! I would wait the 20 minutes or make it easier for yourself, and call ahead of time to make reservations.

NJ4uSScyUKd1pyj5yRCxpQ.text: Although this place is in my top 3 doesn't mean I'd choose this place over my top 2.   Nigiri: 3/5 They definitely serve more rice and less fish here. I usually get a huge clump of rice and a small thin thin thin slice of fish. Everyone knows rice fills people up quicker. So its kind of shady how they con people into eating a lot of rice to fill them up.   Rolls: 2/5 I'm not much of a roll person but when I eat AYCE I like to try a little bit of everything and Kaya is the only sushi restaurant that I go to that doesn't allow half rolls until the last roll of your dinner. Which makes it sucky to even try rolls because usually 1 roll can fill me up with all that rice.   Appetizers: 4/5 Only if you get AYCE everyone knows you never really get your moneys worth in sushi unless you go All you can eat. Their baked green mussels are pretty good out of my top 3 its my 2nd favorite, although they take kind of long to come out they're usually never burnt or over cooked and there's a balanced amount of yum yum sauce to mussel. Sea weed salad, if your not doing AYCE  sea weed salads a small portion and not worth it but with AYCE you can order as many as you want. I also like their sweet shrimp skewers Its the only sushi restaurant I know that offers grilled shrimp skewers  AYCE: 5/5 To be honest its the cheapest dinner AYCE I know of in Vegas I think for 22.99? something like that but its the cheapest of my top 3.

0C_d3HklqPp3-ticyXQe5A.text: Love the AYCE!!! Full orders or half orders! The skewers are definitely a must. Towards the evening it gets busy but other than that it's one of my fav sushi spots! Oh yea park in the next plaza cause parking is a hassle

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IRvi7dXTXQlb4gxdz_m-Cw.text: Dishonesty business practice. I will never go back again.  Went there with my friends for dinner around 6:30 (just the beginning of peak dinner time). They already out of Uni. $27 for dinner ($6 more than lunch) they offer 3 more items, Uni been one of them. And that's one of the reason we visit here -- for the Uni.  All right, things happens, we understand. So we asked nicely if they could substitute uni with sweet shrimp (one of other 3 items they offer in dinner). To our surprise, the waitress said "no, the manager doesn't allow".  Then we asked to speak with manager and explained our point: if we pay for the dinner -- extra money for the extra stuffs, we should be served those items. If for any reason restaurant is out of certain items, then we should be offered equal/similar value substitute. The manager then told us that it was the owner's decision: once it's out, that's it. No substitute at all. They can not offer substitute every-time when they are out of uni, otherwise they will be out of sweet shrimp or other wanted items soon. (Really? 6:30 you already out of Uni? And sounds like it happens ALOT.)  Translation:"Bait and switch? Are You Kidding Me?! I won't even bother to offer customers replacement or substitute. Yet I'm still going to charge them FULL PRICE. Because... look, my restaurant is packed at night. Why should I care?"  Well, We do. And we are not going back. Evar!

cM0KqNICw9q9UYAA0qQKQA.text: Love this place! Best sushi in town. The service is great and the sushi is so fresh and delicious! My husband and I eat here all the time!

X9rU35K9vv6O3ra6tQZbdw.text: I was craving sushi but I have always come to kaya and it's packed! But I took a chance and came around 4p.m today and it wasn't too busy there were about two couples and 4 people dining alone. I suggest that if you want quiet come earlier and if you want a little more crowded come later, kaya started picking up around 5:30p.m. And no matter what time you come the service is always excellent!

k5U-mmrGH-5uPgfHKPnUHQ.text: You can't go wrong with Sushi Kaya. Been going here for years now and firstly, their service is always great. Servers are very attentive and hosts are wary of their guests when there's a wait time. The food is great: recommend the Who's Your Daddy which is needed in every table. With their nigiri, the fish to rice ratio is appropriate for their size. With their servings for appetizers, take note of their serving size as they do vary when you're doing AYCE. I see no reason of not going back here repeatedly when you have a sushi craving.

Bzg07V9wFnQZNX7KjeORDA.text: The sushi here is pretty good!.  O don't eat sushi too often, but when I do I like this place. Their baked/friend sushi selection is really good.  I LOVE the Spicy Garlic Edamame

lWX9s5AwjTyjcTcw29Ef1Q.text: First time here, place was okay, clean and servers are friendly. The only thing I didn't like is, I paid for dinner price so I can eat sashimi and their selections that was for dinner time only and guess what? Most of it, they don't have it... so I didn't get what i really paid for, I even asked the server if she can replace it with their one of their "one person limit order only" because its on the same selection anyways but she said the manager said no, oh come on, make sure you have all what you have in your menu that people paid for, or instruct your servers to tell it upfront to customers what you guys don't have or better tell what you really have in your menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AykFCQMUnWFnluLZeHczUQ.text: I've been coming to Sushi Kaya for more than 5 years and every visit has been enjoyable each time. Right when you walk in they have a small waiting area and a headwaiter/waitress to take your count of your party and will call you when notified. There are 3 choices of where you may sit; booth, table, or bar. Usually by sitting at the bar you'll be seated faster compared to the other two.  Appetizers: bacon & scallop skewers, garlic edamame, miso soup, shrimp tempura, pot stickers, and the baked green mussels are my go to orders. I highly suggest that if you're interested in the baked green mussels, order them first!!! It takes time for them to prepare/cook the mussels. Nigiri: salmon, tuna, unagi, and albacore are my favorites. With every visit the slices of fish is always greater than the rice. This is where you get your bang for your buck with AYCE sushi.  Noodles & Rice: the Korean jabchae and the chicken fried rice taste amazing but sometimes it can be a little bit oily.  Special Rolls: the crunch, cinderella, rainbow, and the sex bomb rolls are my favorites. The best part about all the rolls (excluding fried rolls), you may order a full (8 pieces) or half roll (4 pieces).  Baked Rolls: the lasagna roll is my absolute favorite off of this entire menu! When they cook it right, the roll just melts in your mouth and the cream cheese with the eel sauce makes a great savory combination.  Fried Rolls: the California dream roll and the crusty Philly roll taste amazing but the downside is that the rolls are huge. I rarely order these rolls because they really fill me up.  Desserts: all of their desserts taste amazing! But also know you are limited with the mochi and the mini cheese cakes.  I would like to give this place 3.5 out of 5 stars. The main reason for the average rating is for their service. There will be moments when I order a half roll or nigiri and I don't get the order until 15 to 20 minutes later. That wait may not seem so long but when you're limited to 90 minutes it takes up some time. With AYCE sushi places, time is off the essence. If I'm waiting for 20 minutes for a dish, I end up forgetting about what I ordered or I'm constantly asking the waiter/waitress if I may order more.

v6qKTnxfOQ9XCGgwy-AjcA.text: Probably one of my favorite sushi spots, it's super affordable. A lot to choose from, the only thing that could be a little better is the service but been coming here for years. I really love their sushi & appetizers. Definitely, would recommend the caterpillar roll !

VOaEs5F_l6TFwsj_RwuLeg.text: I had just finish watching an amazing concert and I was looking for a place to dine-in on a Saturday night. I came here by accident and it's incredible seeing how this restaurant is very popular and busy. I was told the wait would be around 30 minutes and given that it's almost midnight, I opted for take-out. I ordered the Kimchi Fried Rice ($8.95), Vegetable Yaki Udon ($8.95) and Teriyaki Chicken ($12.95). Thankfully the wait wasn't long. It did take approximately 15 minutes for the food to be ready. Everything was sealed in a foil and the containers were packed well in a big paper bag, which I think is a major plus because nothing toppled over or spilled.  I'm actually quite impress with the distinct flavor of each order. The Kimchi Fried Rice, which is top with fried egg and sesame seeds, has an earthy and subtle spicy taste. I especially like the thick noodles and savory sauce from the Vegetable Yaki Udon. And the Teriyaki Chicken is nicely cooked, the meat is juicy and tender. Now the veggies that came with the Teriyaki Chicken are charred and crispy, and I wish there was more of it because I really like this texture. Also the meal includes a side of white rice and miso soup. Now I'm not able to eat certain seafood so I gave away the shrimp tempura. But I am definitely coming back to try other items on the menu. Hopefully I'll get to dine-in and have my dessert too.

XzCxpVOitx1iWkMUJT4ALQ.text: Came here for lunch on a Sunday and was not amused. My sister and I split an order of the Shrimp Tempura, Crunchy Samson and Kaya's Crunchy Roll. As we were waiting for our order come out, I saw them microwaving the shrimp tempura, which would make sense as to why it tasted as dry as it did when it came out. The rolls didn't taste so fresh and the service was awful. My waitress never came to check on us after bringing us the food, I had to call her to ask for spicy mayo, I was brought a different sauce, had to call her again to correct it and bring the right sauce, and call her when I was ready for the check. You would think the place was swarming with customers for the service to be so poor, but my sister and I were the only ones in the restaurant...  All in all, I wouldn't go back. Much better sushi places to eat at!
