vjRzJJP6bFDBv8qcUkvHhw.text: Ordered a la carte three rolls. Other than the Alaskan roll I don't remember the names but two, including the Alaskan, were "California rolls" topped and the third was spicy tuna roll topped.   The two "Cali rolls" were terrible. For some perspective they're the same size as the $6 Cali roll but with the $12.50 price tag because the one had eel topping and the other a tuna topping - and not hugely topped either. Perhaps my expectations of a $12+ rolls are skawonky but when a saucer is plated with rolls the size of Halloween chocolate-sized slathered in Hershey syrup I'm annoyed. More perspective, the third roll was as big as the two Cali rolls put together. Finally, they use cheap rice. Rice was cooked with too much water (makes it soggier) and was a long grain - probably Jasmine instead of Calrose - so it lakes decent texture and flavor.   Needless to say I'm disappointed that a) we waited 45 minutes for a seat b) I don't feel that I got my money's worth.   I get that this is a AYCE, and my bad for assuming they prepare a la carte rolls differently, but my wife isn't a big eater and normally two regular rolls and an el cheapo Cali roll is more than enough between the two of us.

rPiYuiCftJp1-c6vNb4tuA.text: The food was delicious. The service couldn't have been better!  All you can eat sushi!  The pot stickers were crunchy on the outside and yummy on the inside. My favorite was the Jose roll.

oz-Ej17p81vkBkICtezVLQ.text: This is a good place to go for AYCE sushi. This was actually the first place I ever went for an AYCE sushi.   Despite of my nationality-- I am not big on white rice. I know I know, "but you're Filipino?" Lol I just converted to brown rice about a year and a half ago & I rarely ever touch white rice. With that being said, sushi isn't one of the foods I normally eat.    Most recent visit, I came here on a Sunday for lunch. Wasn't packed like it usually is during dinner time. Lunch is about 20$ where as dinner is about 25$. Service was quick  and up to par. Waitress came back every few minutes to check on us. We ordered half rolls instead of full rolls. I learned my lesson last time I ate AYCE. My taste palette hates eating the same roll over & over so half rolls are the best way to go.   We ordered few different rolls. Ones that stuck out to me & had to order another roll was-- Cinderella roll & lasagna roll! Must try those! I love any rolls that have cream cheese in it & is baked. Melts in your mouth.   After this sushi craving. I'm probably good for about 2 years. Ate way too much sushi lol I could barely breath!

DpAWts0WDmlGV--P307Apg.text: AYCE sushi open pretty late. Came by around midnight and ate. The sushi is ok, had some good rolls and some bad ones. The menu has a lot to offer so definitely a good place to stop by at if you have a late night sushi craving! Skip the miso soup, i don't know why when I ordered it, it came out cold? Pretty sure the soup is suppose to be hot. Anyways the menu is huge, it's open late, the sushi isn't bad.

CqArBDQNJyNGo6iVVbF48Q.text: Very disappoint for today's visit. It was not busy at all but the service is pretty slow. Took the Ayce but none of us enjoyed our food. Everything tasted odd and salmon was not fresh at all. Food quality got a lot lower than last time we visited. Will not recommend to anybody anymore. Umiya may be a much better choice.

Jmmr6ykvYEuu3WyHbhbH3g.text: As I'm reading the past reviews people have left for this restaurant, it leaves me baffled why this place would get a low rating. I loved it here.   The service was amazing. To all those yelpers who complain about getting charged for extra food, most likely there was a lot food left over and I bet the server didn't MAKE you eat the food and she kindly asked you because it sucks when we have to charge you extra. It's not the waitress being mean to you, it's the owners rule. Why don't you try ordering less or just don't come at all. It's ridiculous to see you guys give a one star to this place because you couldn't finish your food or could sit where you want to sit. The only problem with the service was maybe if they could just let me relax and eat that would've been nice, I didn't like being asked repetitively whether I would like to order more as there is food on my table but maybe their really on it for customer service because of dumb reviews like I've read on here.   The sushi was great, I love their salmon belly and their Uni was awesome. The bacon and scallop skewers and the beef skewers were the best I've ever tasted. I've worked/eaten at my fair share of ayce sushi, LITERALLY the best. I feel like this ayce sushi is much more high quality than most I've been too. Even the mussels were larger than most ayce sushi places too. One thing I didn't like was that the rice and sushi ratio was very inconsistent. Sometimes I'd get less rice and sometimes I'd get 90 percent rice, I know that you guys just slinky slice the fish and try to make it look big but it doesn't work on me so if it's okay don't do that because it disappoints happy customers like me. However that would not stop me from coming to an amazing place like this. Will definitely be taking my sister soon.

JY3YPS9rvVGzSsCqMLYtEw.text: Loved the food, it was super delicious we tried a few items on the menu since it was our first time, now I can't wait to go back n do the ALL YOU CAN EAT,  the service & ambience was on point too. Will be back soon.

jHBDmSNL8y405vJIZz46bg.text: I have gone to sushi kaya with my family for the past 4 years and the service is only going down hill. I came with my family of 5 and a baby. My name was was second on the list and they were crazy slow. It took them 15 minutes to seat us. The hostess called our name and and asked if we needed a high chair I said yes and we followed her thinking we were ready for our table. She ignores the fact we are all standing in the middle of the walk way when I stated is this our table and she said no I didn't call you guys but yet she put a high chair at the table. So my family sits back down. The. She sits a lady with a baby at a table that can fit 6 people. From my previous experiences your whole party must be here to be seated. So instead of us getting that table we get put at a table that fits 4 people and they are all out of high chairs. She then asked if we wanted a pillow for the baby to sit on and we say yes. She forgets and 30 minutes go by still no pillow. And for the time I sit at this crowded table I stare at the lady who has a baby sit at the table by themselves for a good 30minutes before her party shows up. That's only the beginning. We order food and have to constantly have to follow up on the food we ordered. This place is literally going down the drain!!! Their restrooms are even horrible!!! How do you even past inspection??? I will not be going here ever! I do not recommend this sushi restaurant it's horrible!!!!

FAPo7uSqlKpt-UbYhxMaBQ.text: Won't come back. Slow service rusde waitress and poor quality fish. Ordered uni and the color was almost brown. I was grossed out. What a shame!!!

2QbDu3Aq8KaBlz1md-Zkeg.text: I love sushi, but my body doesn't really like all of the rice- so I try to find AYCE spots that offer riceless rolls. Unfortunately, Kaya is not one of them. However, they balance this out by offering one (5 piece) order of sashimi per person, and a grill/skewer portion of their menu, in addition to the usual apps, nigiri, and rolls. For those who love carbs, there's also a soup/noodle section available. Pricing is a bit higher, but you have quite a bit to pick from.  APPS: The sashimi plate and sashimi poke were both pretty solid, with generous portions of fish. The "lettuce wraps" app isn't the typical version with ground chicken and vegetables, but features crab, avocado, cucumber, and tempura veggies in lettuce cups, which is at least kind of close to a riceless roll.  GRILL/SKEWERS: We tried all of the items marked as "one per person" (garlic, bacon/scallop, bacon/asparagus, beef tongue, etc). We didn't really care for these items but liked having them available for something different. NIGIRI: Fresh with surprisingly thick cuts. Rice wasn't too heavy but also didn't seem to have much flavor. The salmon, halibut, and uni quality all surpassed my expectations (better than average for AYCE) but the amebi (BF's favorite) was super tiny and bland. ROLLS: We tried the White Vegas and the XXX2 rolls, the former a bit spicier than the latter, neither one especially packed with rice as we've experienced elsewhere. I'd consider coming back to try more.  I was surprised by how nice this spot was on the inside- high ceilings, cute kitschy decor, and a bar area with TV showing an NBA game. Pricing is a little higher than usual: $58 before tax/tip for dinner for two.

8LfQ0tXgtxrQMR14AHqrKQ.text: Unfortunately never got to try this place as they require you to put a credit card down for a group of people if you want to make a reservation. Sorry but I am not giving then my credit card to make reservation. Plenty of other sushi restaurants were happy to take my reservation without a credit card. Too bad for Sushi Kaya as they missed out out on 12 All You Can Eat dinners. That hard earned cash  went to a restaurant that respects us more.

ypL6yK8Cxp78KThmvms7dQ.text: This place is a little gem. Hidden in a busy strip mall right in the heart of Chinatown. It was busy on Friday night when my friend and I arrived. It was only about 20 minutes until we were seated though, and it was well worth the wait.  We both ordered AYCE dinner ($26.99). The service was out of this world amazing and fast. We sat down, and after we browsed the menu for a bit, we ordered like 8 different rolls. I usually order a lot to start, because I know that the kitchen is usually busy and it could be some time in between orders. This was not the case here. I swear within two minutes of ordering, we had food on the table. Less than 5 minutes later, they had brought all 8 rolls. I really couldn't believe it.   The rolls were delicious. Some better than others. My favorites were the Kaya and the Million Dollar Man. The Kaya has spicy tuna, which I DO NOT LIKE, but this roll was sooo good. By the time we were done, we were stuffed and didn't have room for dessert. But they do offer various flavors of ice cream and mochi that I will be sure to get my hands on next time. Oh yeah, there will definitely be a next time. I seriously can't wait to come back here and take my friends. This place has been added to my regular sushi spot rotation!

Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rainbow roll

wXkxOfJZwCIscvZJjcpHug.text: Pretty good, not the best place in town. But decent, especially if you like fusion food!

Bx2Ws0k83BIdAxHxzxaCLQ.text: This was my go to sushi place for years! Food is great and service is usually good,  I like that they're open late. But my last visit we went for my birthday dinner and the hostess sat us at a booth and the whole time I thought I was going crazy because I felt water dripping on me. After we were done with our meal I noticed a little puddle of water next to my drink, we then realized the pipe above us had a leak..  My first thought was to pull the waitress aside and let her know about the problem. When I told her she said oh yea it does that and scooted the table over away from the leak!! At that point I was furious and felt disgusted about not knowing the leak was going into my food and drink.  I then asked for the manager who could've cared less he also said sorry that happens sometimes..  I don't care how good the food is, that's a health hazard and I can't believe they stay open in those conditions and to sit people there knowing about the leak is just mind blowing!  Hopefully by now they fixed it so no one else has to experience that.

JbZt8bmdlauVv8XrTfBdHQ.text: I loved this place but they have lost my business now. Paying $26.95 for a 9 year old is crazy!! She doesn't like to eat much but will pick or at least try what I get and slowly find something she will like. There is absolutely no way I would pay that for a child I have no problem paying the 1/2 price for kids but they changed that to 8 and under.

YdxHn3eLy2J75MBOwsh2Pw.text: Been talking about sushi with the peeps at work for awhile now, and today was the perfect day to get some AYCE. So we all headed down to Sushi Kaya for some of their lunch time love. Having been here a few times previously I was eager for the rolls to start flowing.  As usually we got there right at opening to avoid the rush and crowds that typically occur here once the sushi gets going.  Our party made our way through the entrance and were seated immediately. Luck be told, this is the same table I have sat at every time dining at this location. Maybe  I can get a curtesy name plate hahahahahah. The place was very clean as usual, the staff was friendly as always, and right on top of everything. The food and drinks were out promptly, and are party of nine did not have to wait long for anything.  Nicely done staff.  For the AYCE I went with some edeme, cucumber salad, four rolls, (California, Caterpillar, Lasagna  and a Who's Your Daddy) and finished it off with some Mango Mochi.   All the rolls were tasty, but it did not seem the ingredients were as fresh as normal; which was the only negative for me this time around.   Love the ambiance, staff, and price.  As far as AYCE sushi places this is still the best I have had.  Four out of five stars as I am sure this subtle lack of freshness was just a random thing.  Will definitely be back when the sushi craving comes knocking again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cucumber Salad, Edemame, California Roll, Caterpillar Roll, and a who&#39;s Your Daddy.

-CHSI3nTeKng4zytzwAsVA.text: I was here the other night. Everything was going well until I unknowingly bit down on a piece of shell while eating "dynamite" appetizer. This is the second time it's happened here. I swear I think I cracked my back tooth.

gdguFZcs2RA5WVa9LpA6-A.text: The sushi was not that good. The sushi's are very saucy, and not too reminiscent of Japanese sushi. This tasted more like a fusion style sushi. If that's what they are going for then they succeeded, and the type of sushi is just not for me.

ctED12WOvVV9syExOgcIBg.text: This is my first AYCE sushi experience dating way back to 2011. Since then I've eaten here probably 100 times! It was cutting edge back then and in my opinion still leads the way overall in AYCE sushi. The menu has shrunk over the years but the special rolls have gotten tighter, more interesting and a lot tastier. I prefer this place to places like Yama because the rolls are small and most can be ordered 1/2. What's the point of going to an AYCE spot and getting served a giant roll you HAVE to eat? It's all about variety right? Kaya is the king of variety. The music is annoying. Really really annoying. But it's mostly a matter of my own taste. The serves sometimes ignore me, but it's forgiven as they're almost always very busy. If you want a place to start your AYCE experiences, this is it!

7haL-cT0xDI3gAxSV0Kang.text: I think by now I have visited this restaurant about 60-70 times (no kidding). It is probably not mandatory to read on from here, since nobody would go there that often if it is not a 5 star experience, right?! :)   Wait staff is great, food is very good. Shrimp tempura roll is my personal favorite there. I must say that the only thing that's negative about the place is the size / popularity with no option to make a reservation (makes sense though because no point of holding a table while 20-50 people are waiting outside) but that results in a long wait sometimes for dinner. If you are not willing to wait AND compromise with dining time then this place is not for you. BUT! If you are willing to make some sacrifices (wait or go there when it is not busy) you get an amazing value!

g5qtMfiv5nRNxYAq645lXw.text: There are plenty times where I went to this plaza to eat and noticed that when nighttime came Sushi Kaya would have a line with a lot of people and large groups so I decided why not give it a try seeing as it's so popular for some reason.   Was disappointed when I walked it, the temperature change was immediately noticeable; almost hotter than the outside! (Vegas summer is no joke too)   When seated I was immediately bombarded by the stereotypical smell of the bathroom: the smells of old pee, cleaning chemicals, and toilet water. Almost made me want to throw up whilst eating the food.   My lifesaver would be the menu as I constantly used it as a fan to cool myself down every 10 min when I felt hot again.  Overall the food wasn't the best, the service was meh (too many servers and they got confused sometimes), and the establishment itself wasn't very clean. I would recommend that people who weren't "all-for" this place should go and try Yama Sushi that's down the street.

3PmbmYIi8ghAqKDyb0AmIA.text: does not look like photos , U have 90 min LIMIT to eat , sushi was very bad quality , all came in small dishes, not worth $25 Been in many Sushi places and this is not good place to Spend $25 for 90 min limit and tuna had no taste not recommended!!!

V9MivzEhMZJ10S-FGa2F3w.text: I have been to Kaya three times within the past month.  And I can give them a solid 4.5 stars each and every time.  First visit: * Steamed Pork Belly (Marinated and steamed Pork Belly with condiments) $15.95 - Comes with leaves, thinly sliced radish, sliced jalapenos, sliced garlic, kimchee, etc.  Place it altogether with a slice of pork belly and oh so yum.  Definitely meant for sharing, and more than enough for two people! * Korean Seafood Pancake - Loaded with lots of seafood, and really good. * Spicy Sashimi - Generous portion, but perhaps a bit too much.  * Something Wrong Roll - Whatever was in there, it was really good and we were fighting to get an extra piece. Our waitress was super helpful and we didn't know what else to order beyond the seafood pancake.  She made the other recommendations and were so very pleased with her suggestions.      Second visit:  New addition to the menu is AYCE sushi for $22.95 (until midnight).  Beyond the standard nigiri, rolls, and appetizers, we also had: * Bulgogi (steamed beef) - Generous for one, so go with one order first to see if it's something you like. * Skewers: bacon & shrimp, gingko, garlic, chicken gizzard, shrimp, beef Came for a small party and they were very accommodating for our group.  Even brought out a special dessert for the birthday boy and didn't complain with all the splitting of the checks.  Our waiter, Sunny, took care of us and really made sure we were having a good time.  Third visit:  AYCE sushi again! * Steamed black mussel * Ahi poki * Fried jabchae * Spicy Korean ramen * Skewers: bacon & scallop, mushroom  Service was a bit slower this time, but they apologized and threw in a bottle of free beer.  We didn't mind as much since we got to linger and enjoy our meal more.   Their nigiri is pretty good.  Generous slices of fish and not a whole lot of rice.  That's pretty much what had us coming back the second time for AYCE.  Skewers as part of the AYCE menu is also what we enjoyed - especially the chicken gizzards, the garlic, bacon & scallop, shrimp, beef, etc.  Their steamed black mussels came with a creamy sauce that was good.  Soft shell crab appetizers are also available, including tempura.  Noodle dishes included are udon and ramen.  Rice dishes include fried rice, teriyaki chicken and beef bowls.  Dessert is limited to vanilla, strawberry or green tea ice cream, limit one.  For a relatively new restaurant, they are busy!  We even saw Mr. Lee's son the last two times we went! (From Lee's Liquor)    AYCE sushi with some Korean thrown in there?  Works for us and we have very pleased bellies when we leave.  They also have a frequent visitor card - Buy 10 AYCE, get 1 free!  (Pics posted!)

Jqhf2IGgXpdsjZYUuU1iZw.text: Was craving sushi and went to this place because the rating was decent. Boy was I wrong. The food was ok but the restaurant policy and service is terrible. It's so terrible, I can't give it any stars. The waiter was super rude and argued with me whether I ordered a roll or not. She took my sisters order and walked away and told me she would be back. My sister got her food and the waiter never came back. I had to waive her down. When asked for extra sauce and gave me attitude. The policy here is even worse. It's a buffet!!!!! Why should I be limited to what I want to order?  On top of that, I got charged for ordering too much food. There were certain food on the menu that I can only order once. I don't understand why they have it on the menu in the first place. I don't think I'll ever come back to this place ever again.

tyEDgRkzO9climHpG_m6rw.text: The quality of the seafood is pretty horrible.  I had reviewed the yelp photos before making the decision to dine here.  The food  looked great in the photos but my experience was completely different.  Maybe at one point this place did have better quality food but currently, it's a completely different story.  I wouldn't come back here, there's just way too many other ayce sushi joints here in Vegas that cost the same but of higher quality.  As far as the service rating, it was fast but nothing memorable.

FzQAB_bjUbKyLRxL26NcxA.text: My favorite sushi place in Vegas. The white tuna nigiri, salmon skin salad, and bacon wrapped scallops are amazing. Really the whole menu is great and they serve delicious lemonade! You always get good service. This place is typically busy but I promise it's worth the wait. Always get all you can eat because you're going to want to stuff your face!

3VC57mV5Q-59s3Bh1U2_PA.text: This is by FAR the best Sushi Place in town! A couple of times we have tried to go to other places and we always regret it! The service is awesome! Dinner time keep in mind you always have to wait, its really busy but its well worth the wait! The Nigiri Salmon is so bomb and always soo fresh!! Shrimp tempura and muscles are amazeballs and my favorite rolls are Amigo roll but I usually get it without jalapeno because Im not much of a spicy fan! I also love love love the sexy roll, and the California dream roll.  The green tea ice cream and mochi is also soo soo good!!!

SVFvl31y8HPOsaoI_rDMEQ.text: Was not impressed with this place at all. Cleanliness is not much of their priority which makes me nervous as a client. It could have been that i had a rare bad experience with them but that day I went, the fish was not fresh and i had fowl stomach pains and nausea for the rest of the night. Staff was unfriendly. We had to flag down the waiter for several minutes just to get a refill in our drinks. Wouldn't go here again.

5mWD_CrHXdX8DzH-yyWY9A.text: Went here for lunch the other day. The food and service was great. Not a bad place for AYCE close to downtown where I work. My only issue with the place was that the place is pretty worn down. From the bench seats that are cracked and covered up with masking tape to the chipped table settings. I wouldn't bring anyone here that I was trying to impress. If I am looking for decent sushi close to work this would be my go to place. :-)

3XaWPs8sz95Gvg9Xqt9Y7A.text: HAIR IN MY SUSHI!  So disgusting and my bf and I didn't even finish our AYCE. We still had so much food on the table, but we were so disgusted. In addition to that, I got baked green mussels, and there was shell cracks IN THE MUSSELS! None of the shells were even broken so I don't even know where they came from, but it definitely hurt my teeth when I ate them.  I used to go here all the time, but not any more. Even though the servers recognized me, they still didn't discount my meal. $45 for two lunch AYCE (more like 2.5 rolls that we were able to order) and they couldn't even comp my drink. I paid it though + $0 tip.  DON'T GO HERE! Believe me, I like supporting small restaurants and not corporate chains, but this place does not deserve your patronage!

Z8UFtzVdK5YmaCTL_RSj8w.text: Loved this place! I've been looking for a new sushi place for quite some time and I'm so happy I found this Sushi Kaya! I went here on a date and we both loved it!! The wait to get a table was about 40 mins or so but it was really crowded so waiting that long for a table is totally understandable. We ended up getting seated at the bar and got AYCE for about $26 each. It was phenomenal!! All of the sushi was really fresh, the workers were all nice and attentive, and the atmosphere just had a great vibe to it. I did try this one roll that I didn't particularly like. I forget what it was called but it had a kiwi sauce on it, which is pretty much the only reason why I didn't like it. Other than that, I have nothing bad to say about this place!

zqUfIlUj2hifsKAusxwzRA.text: I really like this place but today was just ridiculous. Normally, the service is fantastic but we got stuck with a server who did not say a lick of nice or encouraging comments to keep us satisfied. We got our order and she forgot the edamame. Once we finished, we waited 22 minutes for her to come back. She decided to take a lunch with no one to cover her tables. So that meant no refills or ordering of more rolls during that time frame. I eventually caught a busser and he sent her over. She comes over, stands in front of us and didn't say a thing. She just waited for is to talk. I usually tip very well but I was so frustrated and disappointed that we decided not to tip. I am really upset about this visit because our normal ones are usually outstanding.

N17Ae8YN8Jh5WxulNn0v5g.text: Server was bad she said she doesnt want to come to our table so we ended up being served by another server. All i  remember telling her was she came to our table and took our first order and drink and she came back with wrong drink and i told her to change the drink she made it sound like i was wrong to ask for the drink i want. I have seen bad service but nothing like this.

LEIyV376mMobUmYJLl0PsA.text: Best sushi ever!!! They have an awesome variety of sushi! The best part was that you could choose all you can eat sushi for $25/person!!!    We had a really good waitress too!  She was very friendly and our drinks never went empty!

WQAKYEAO9h8hkz93NgH5zw.text: Love this place open late, food is always fresh. Customer service is ok but for the most part I'll keep coming back!:)

VnDvnof2dS5s5_TXAbNbrA.text: Disclaimer: Don't come here expecting authentic sushi and yakitori from the motherland...  With that said, we came here to do the AYCE for my friends birthday.   Here is how i broke this place down:  Service 4*: The girls were very good to us. They were on point when we were ordering and remembered who got what when the food came out. The food did come out pretty quick assuming that it was made upon order.  Food 3* Here is the breakdown. The rolls were the best thing on the menu.  The nigiri was decent. The wasabi tako and spicy tuna were decent.  The yakitori items were hit or miss. The bacon scallops and bacon asparagus were the top of this category. I would recommend to stay away from the beef tongue, not good at all (I like gyu tongue BTW!)  The one gripe that I have about this place is that they limit how much AYCE on certain items like the bacon scallops and the fire beef.  The serving sizes are very small so I don't think that they are taking a hit on these items. The only reason why I got more than my single ration is becasue the server thought I was dreamy ;)    One quick tip: Make reservations! We saw the same group of people sitting outside both when we arrived and left. Sucks to be them.. Be smart and call ahead...

miGbWOA4z-35PngAQNESoA.text: We are giving them  a 4 stars because the employees are nice but service is slow.  we been waiting..what seemed like forever for our food.  this place overall is worth the money.  We'll most likely be coming here again. If they can fix the service and serve their food in a timely manner they'll get that 5 stars next time!

3t3F_0y20trrz0Sz-qznYQ.text: I like this place a lot! I just can't seem to figure out which day of the week and what time to go where there isn't a long wait to be seated.  Once you get in the food and service are great, so worth the wait. They have everything from traditional sushi to skewers and chicken dishes.  Also, one of the few AYCE sushi places that I know of where you can order more than one desert included in the AYCE price if you happen to have a sweet tooth.  Pros- great service and great food. Good atmosphere, a lot of people working there and many long tables/booths for large parties.  Cons- possible wait times and parking is limited, so may need to park in the next lot.

yRPmunoYynilph1kxPv15Q.text: I've been coming here for quite a while now, probably like 3 years and I love this place. It's my only go to sushi place, I'm always down to try others but this pne is just my favorite. I'm a huge salmon person so I'm pretty picky on fresh salmon and their salmon is always amazing. The sex bomb roll is definitely the best roll. They have a great variety of rolls, all which are delicious. Nigiri is always awesome, it just slides in your mouth so deliciously. The desserts are great, especially the actual ice cream. The cherry and mocha flavored ice creams are soo good! I think one of my favorite things is that they give you a stamp card for AYCE, not many places do that. You fill up your stamp card and on your 10th order, you get an Ayce lunch or dinner. Here's a tip: if you bring several friends that do AYCE as well but don't have their own stamp card, they'll give you stamps on your card counting them as well. I have filled mine up several times this way ;) service is always good and if a server hasn't came around there's also a button on your table that you can push to get your waiter to come by.  If you're going on a weekend night before 11pm, expect about an hr wait, but pretty much any other time the wait is short. =)

VpCJHlEjbnbAD04xEuTNsw.text: I have been to Sushi Kaya several times before and I thought, well I never wrote a review!  This place is always busy and reason for not giving a 5 star is because of the wait times and lack of lounge area.  The food is great and they have a variety of rolls.  Besides the wait times, the service is fast and efficient.    I highly recommend this restaurant if you want an all you can eat sushi menu.

tC2oVaIAZucSZd7rv5jNFg.text: Sexy Rolls and caterpillar rolls are the best, service is astounding, and the atmosphere is great for family and or a group of friends!

AREmOl09CR5MS2rzF1ItUQ.text: My favorite spot in Vegas for Sushi. Don't sleep on the All You Can Eat!! It's almost the whole menu!! The service is impeccable and the Owner still comes out to check on the tables!! Fresh fish, creative menu and reasonable price.

L9JeELZCExY7Om86VjZD4g.text: Just had dinner at Sushi Kaya for my friend's birthday. At first the staff was extremely friendly but seemed to get frustrated when we wanted to order more. I don't understand since this is their job and it's not like they have the stress of making the food themselves. We were on a time limit that was extremely pressured and reminded upon us. I'm sure we can tell the time. Anyhow, I ordered a lemonade through three different servers and did not receive one. When our cards were brought back, the manager happened to be the lady so I expressed my dilemma towards her. 40 minutes for a lemonade. That was my experience, anyways. Y'all suck. Learn to do your jobs.

xG5WdO_YhqLSBzewBWG0-g.text: The absolute best sushi place in town. Open till 2 am every night, and a wide selection of rolls.  Always fast service.

dCz92qj5_AMvP2jPaXQX8w.text: The food was delicious! the sushi was soo good!! and the all-you-can-eat was also very affordable.   All I did not like was that the service was slow and was not the best I have ever had.. but the sushi was very delicious. =]  No I'm craving AYCE... maybe at Kaya maybe not.. but Sushi for dinner tonight.. yes I think so.

WJOKuPL1m6EEBQZsYqX0cg.text: This review is mostly about the service we received. Went here around 2 pm on a Saturday with three others. We felt like our server, Julie (I believe), just did not care about the job or any of her tables. She didn't check on us once, no water refills and no smiling. We even saw her eating food on the side, and then she proceeded to come and take our order still chewing her food and talking at the same time. She also brought out an order of sushi that we did NOT order. Once we told her that it was not ours, she says "yes it is, you ordered it". We told her no once again, and she protested and asked if we were sure. Finally, she left and took it to the correct table. No apology or anything and completely unprofessional. Food was good as always, hence the one star. We'll be going back, but we won't sit in her section.

C9jUOfAzS2VaXncmcz2Htw.text: One of the best sushi places I've been to in town. The staff is friendly, the sushi is fresh and the atmosphere is all around positive. I am a regular and have never encountered a problem at this location. Also, when you are getting all you can eat and feeling full after a few orders, or never tried a roll, you can order half rolls!

ImYjqPj--svxIyf0NnhrWA.text: Loved this place! They have an all you can eat menu unlike other restaurants that limit you to the sushi, worth the drive and great food! Excellent service as well! My favorite was the Lisa Lisa Roll and Shrimp Tempura!

G0RGSIDeBfQd-fHumscGBw.text: I've been to this place several times with family and friends.  You MUST do the all you can eat for $25.00.  We tried doing the a-la-cart thing but it wouldve been cheaper to go the all you can eat route....

Ax28jcEL86GNG62NWVJd7g.text: This ayce place is the nasty-ess place I have ever ate at in my lifetime. No Joke! BUT the only decent food here to eat are the sushi rolls. Other than that everything else tasted DISGUSTING! There were no seasonings in the dishes I ordered bc there were no flavor but the gross taste of not fresh food. The mussels tasted old and dry. The tempura shrimp and squid was bad. Either the seafood was bad or the tempura batter was old. It just didn't taste right. I was surprised that I didn't get food poisoning from eating here. I ordered mochi ice cream for dessert and even that tasted horrible bc they sprinkled flour all over it but I thought it was sugar powder. So I left this place with $25 less money and loss of appetite. P.S I ate here with a hangover and the food here made me felt even worse. I should of opted for pho.

__Jf-EQ7EVpsB84b3tGAiw.text: AYCE well worth while.  All food was good.  Sashimi Poke was great!   Paid cash, would have preferred to pay  by credit card but there was an issue with their cc payment processor? Will revisit next time I'm in Vegas.

OaHDWKucg_TcpAWJnle9cw.text: The sushi spot since my friend took me here! It is DIFFICULT to find parking, even at 1am. It's dimly lit inside, encouraging a relaxing atmosphere even though It can become chaotic. Once they seat you they will take your drink orders right away. So no waiting on that part. We did the all you can eat and ordered a bunch of appetizers and half a roll or two! Which was more than fair since we ate more than the AYCE price. There is a line so you will have to wait for a table. Or you can always try the bar. However, it is worth the wait!!

S3Z8QSWaC60gkJs3qYImFQ.text: I've been coming to Sushi Kaya for years and have always had a great experience. Friendly service and food that appeals to all the senses put them head and shoulders above every sushi restaurant I've tried. Put them on your 2Do list. You'll be glad you did.

efPjIaqV_Y6l9r1Iy2WkAA.text: All you can eat sushi heaven. Soft shell crab galore! Service was great, food nicely presented. I recommend out of towners stop by here first to get your sushi fix.

PbDMaDdzJJkvE6GvZrq5Ew.text: This was a great place!  I love the fact that they were open late and the All You Can Eat was offered, even that late.  The only thing is the price was different for the late night All You Can Eat ($22.95 from $19.95). The sushi were good and their almond mocha ice cream was yummy!!!  Service wasd good, slow to filling up ice tea, had to ask but the rest was good.  I love the decor!

ryfo5r2eWJqWlVIjaj11Bw.text: Alas, my friends, it is with a heavy heart that I must demote Sushi Kaya from five stars to only two.    Since August, I have visited this establishment over 20 times, and until recently, always found the quality to be consistent.    My last 2 visits (5/1/2010 and 5/12/2010) were extremely disappointing.  As usual, my friends and I purchased the All You Can Eat sushi, and proceeded to order our favorites.  We were all in good spirits, expecting the feast that was to come - until we saw the food.   In the past, I would struggle to eat a piece of Kaya's nigiri sushi in a single bite.  The chefs cut the fish thick and broad, so that it completely covered its bed of rice.  Not anymore.  The mackerel, salmon, and yellowtail nigiri I received had been reduced to half the size, at least.  This, in of itself, is not a problem at an AYCE place.  I could overlook it as a cost-control measure, if the quality of the fish had not declined to the same pittance as the portion.  The fish was decidedly old - even a little dry in spots.  The chefs tried to cover up the worst selections with ponzu sauce.  I love ponzu, but on nigiri?  Sacrilege.     Rolls proved more palatable, if only for the multitude of ingredients drowning out the fish..  The only one that was actually delicious was the Spider Roll.  However, the sushi artistry I observed on my earlier visits was missing.   Each roll appeared sloppy on the plate, and the pieces were difficult to pick up intact.  Was the chef too hasty to give a damn about cohesion?  Was it his first day on the job?   I try not to judge too harshly, but I must also add that the avocados were inexcusable.  My avocado lover (an orb-like sculpture of shrimp tempura, spicy tuna, and avocado slices) was inedible.  The avocado was so hard and under ripe,  I'm surprised it could be sliced at all.  If the avocados are so petrified that I can't poke a chopstick through a thin slice, why would a chef deign to serve it?  I'm baffled..  The worst discovery of all was the tuna.  I'm a big fan of tuna.  I *KNOW* what tuna is supposed to look and taste like.  What Sushi Kaya currently serves as tuna is decidedly ANYTHING BUT.    I don't know what it is, exactly.  My best guess is dyed tilapia.  It has the strangest shade of pink I've ever seen - like a watermelon jolly rancher.  It has almost no flavor at all, and it flakes like a white fish.  Tuna:  you're doing it wrong.  Other small gripes include the watering down of their miso soup, and an unfortunate switch from their previous brand of green tea ice cream (very flavorful and creamy, with bitter tea notes) to a new brand (bland, too sweet, may as well be vanilla).  I don't know if Kaya is cutting corners, having issues with its supplier, or both, but I don't think I'll be back for a while.    The service and ambiance is still pleasant, so it keeps a few points for style.  I knocked them down to two stars, instead of one, in hopes that the restaurant gets its act together.

0PDNYpP2q6MITXmaqlEYeg.text: This place has delicious sushi but the worst service ever!  I've been probably 4 or 5 times and I always told myself that the service would get better but nope!  I dont think I've ever had worse service at a restaurant peirod. It sucks because I enjoy their food and their all you can eat price is awesome but I definitly won't be returning to Kaya sushi anytime soon.  There are far too many sushi joints in Vegas to ever waste another dollar at Kaya

EqJpzUpFfU-mSjhQe_R4xg.text: Really chill place to eat sushi , the rolls are the bomb. The only thing is that on the weekends it gets crazy packed and that's when the service can be slow at times. The Staff here is really friendly and that's why i keep coming back.

C0drKQRJnah4pNwsfIHF1A.text: Best all you can eat sushi place in town!!! I come here all the time!! Amazing!!! The seared tuna is out of this world!!! If your a local they have a stamp card and after 9 purchases you get one free!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love it!!

_Vk7oQkDnxeddIJUaSbe5g.text: I will never, I repeat never eat at Sushi Zmon ever again. This is the best sushi and the best AYCE sushi in Las Cegas. Cajun albacore nigiri.Get some! But, seriously, everything we ordered was impeccably delicious ;) from the mussels to the bacon wrapped scallop skewers to the funky fried mushrooms stuffed with tuna,. Also enjoyed a XXX2 roll, probably XXX3 roll, fire beef, half shell crab, spicy sticky rice cake, and well....everything rocked! You will become a Kaya groupie!

AZUm8mq38MMoQiRca28jnA.text: My favorite AYCE sushi in town.  Salmon skin salad...tuna poke...unagi....ebi...soft shell crab...dynamite...etc...yummy! I just love their food.  We come here almost every week to have dinner.  Wait time is pretty bad though...but it's sure worth the wait..

dowodZ4ITX7zMmB2V8XEAw.text: I was told about Sushi Kaya from a Las Vegas local. This wonderful sushi experience is located near Chinatown. It's a hidden little hole in the wall and I really mean hole in the wall. Not easy to find but once found it won't be forgotten. The food is fresh and the staff is very attentive. Melt in your mouth Albacore, Tuna & some amazing specialty treats, just delicious. I drove from the south end of town and passed many sushi restaurants and I will do it again to enjoy this place. Only one draw back. They need to turn the AC up because ...... Damn it'll get hot in there.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Albacore and Tuna
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasty
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi Bar at Sushi Kaya

neCS_ry1hdFzn8sXWCsSog.text: Went here on a recommendation and haven't stopped going back. The sushi and the service are really good. Multiple waiters and waitresses come by your table to ask for your next order. Never a rush to get out nor a delay on getting your food. I take out of town guests here and never have they been disappointed. For the AYCE the fish is fresh and the service is fast. Eat well!

JHuANm15dhMCOoJ67CTx8Q.text: One of the more popular sushi places in Las Vegas. Do expect to have a long wait. But definitely worth it. They offer a room for groups. They offer AYCE. They've got a variety of sushi and different drinks. Definitely a great place to go.

OuijlesoJjOMZhhDUNYvWg.text: THE MOST DANK sushi in the valley. Service is great and the food is A1. Looks exactly how it does in the pictures. If there is a wait, it is worth the wait. 10/10 eating establishment.

r1pJqu_rp24rhDf_WBFglw.text: Oh Sushi Kaya, I'm not sure why were looking for another place to eat when we can just make the drive to you guys. We've tried other sushi spots and nothing adds up to you guys. The staff is friendly, fast, and are always on top of things. The rolls are so good and we have our favorites and go too's already.  The menu is like in our brain for how often we go. Poke salad is the best here. I will continue to bring and recommend guests to try Kaya. They are always busy and most of the time a little lengthy wait but I'm never disappointed. See you guys soon!

jc5Zk2tuGVE-sZX7jgMVsw.text: One of my favorite all you can eat sushi places in Vegas. The staff is great and constantly checks in on you, the service is very fast, the menu is extensive, and the fish is fresh. They have a stamp card for frequent visitors.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caterpillar Roll

dWJ6YsN_wdvSzly40pjLJw.text: This is my spot for AYCE sushi!  Parking can be hard to find, the wait can be up to 45 minutes when it's busy, mochi ice cream included with lunch or dinner, and service is hit and miss but usually if you get their attention, they are quick to find someone to help you.  All parties must order all you can eat to share rolls together, they give you the option to order a full or half a roll so you have the opportunity to try more, I love their roll names such as "Who's Your Daddy", "Sexy Ass" or "Viagra" roll to name a few, and they give you 90 minutes at the table.  This is all stated on the menu.  Yes they will charge you for leftovers so my advise, order two rolls per person in your party so that everyone can try a little bit of each roll if you don't mind sharing for round 1.  The next round, order two half rolls if you still have the stomach for more.  Anything with cream cheese and drinking water will make you full quicker.  Thankfully I have never experienced any food poisoning.  Maybe my stomach is stronger than others.  The best part about this place, they give you a card to stamp for each visit.  I had three in my party so I received three stamps at the end of our visit.  If you don't have one, simply just ask for one.

NrkJ4T-vvNdP4GjPlb6wTA.text: Convenient location: it's located close to The Strip, right next to the main Chinatown plaza. Although I live on the NW side of town, it's still convenient given that I often drive to the inner city.   Fast & friendly customer service: I went here with my bf around 6:30 & we were seated as soon as we approached the reception desk. Food came out quickly as well since I assumed it wouldn't because the bar looked full at the time. It was our first time & the servers answered all of our questions regarding the specials & appetizers.  Creative names & nice presentation of sushi rolls: I did enjoy reading through the names & most sounded very appetizing. I would've taken pictures but at the time we were starving so it wasn't really on my mind. I would definitely return to try out more though.  Spacious & nicely decorated restaurant: I personally think their menu look should be updated, to suit the restaurant's authentic environment. High ceilings with traditional Japanese decorations were really nice to look at. Compared to other sushi restaurants I've been to, the amount of space between the tables is more than enough to not burst your personal bubble.   So 5 stars for everything except for the parking lot, but that's Chinatown, right?

yfH8_2WemB2W8KDPYzYqxA.text: Amazing sushi!! Every bite was great! Cheesecake dessert was yummy! I like the vibe in there. Waiter was on point. Going back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q--vFnMghD9tGGAW-wsmDA.text: I want to give this place 5 stars but after my 3rd visit, I saw the issue. Food is just amazing, very tasty, and the sushi bar gets the rolls done fast! Now the downfall that I saw today... Never sit at a table if you can sit at the sushi bar. Service is MUCH MUCH slower than at the bar that has buzzers for when you wish to get more food during AYCE. Our server walked by 3 times seeing our empty table during lunch and never once stopped. We had to ask the hostess to get our server so we could order more food. The manager (who I believed is the manager) came by and took our order and told us that any server can take our order. Well.... Lady, You also saw our table empty a bunch of times with dirty plates and not once stopped to bus or ask if we wished for more food. Get your service staff together and fast.

mlYXOOP3H8iA00Bbt2BYDQ.text: This was a great spot for all you can eat Sushi! The staff were very attentive, we never had an empty plate or glass. We ate a *lot*. The only downside I saw was that their sushi menu only has one real vegetarian option, the "Shrek Roll", and that roll contains salsa and cilantro. They could have come up with a few more vegetarian rolls. However, everything else was fantastic and I'm definitely looking forward to coming here again.

-ELthhYUe8OrOTWHjvt_tA.text: Came in for lunch and was seated immediately. The portions of rice to fish are excellent. The fish tastes really quite fresh and there so many choices of what to eat. We visit here every time we come to Las Vegas. The food comes out to you quite quickly and the wait staff is very nice. The atmosphere is very Asian.

q7Q8fpPAxp7i3zZpD1hGpQ.text: The go to place for AYCE sushi in vegas. It's a ways away from the strip, but this place is priced right and the food is great here. Their selection that comes with the AYCE is vast. You'll see what I mean if you ever go. If you're not really in the mood for greasy and heavy Vegas buffets, hit up Kaya, you'll enjoy it.

UKdlDoYslA2JmfAj_vdKlw.text: Today I was told the wait would be 45min to an hour at most, but that they would do whatever they could to get me in around 45 minutes. After almost an hour I went to check up on my time, management at first said another 5 to 10 minutes, to then be told by the host that it would be another half hour at the earliest!!!! Wtf kind of management is going on? Had they told me the wait would be 1 1/2 to 2 hours from the beginning we would have ate elsewhere. Place has great sushi but is not prepared to receive a lot of guest, do not go to this place on a holiday, especially not Valentine's lol as it is a very small restaurant.

IMqKq7Ccvn-3_pajKbHLqQ.text: I have always been obsessed with Sushi Kaya, it has always been my go-to sushi place for quick, good sushi. They have a great all you can eat menu, fresh fish, and the greatest roll... Jackpot roll. Recently I was not too impressed by the slow service, and my rolls were not filled up completely.... still a good place to grab a quick bite.

dm3DJ_V4wjvud9Wqp66FxQ.text: Konichiwa LV yelpers!  Came here for late night AYCE sushi last night with my Vegas yelp friends Nelson S and Will F  I had a few AYCE sushi experiences here in Vegas over the past 2 months and I have to say... I wasn't very amused.  First off... I really wanted seaweed salad and they were out. No mochi ice cream :( and the ahi poke was horrible! The quality of fish was very low.  Sexy roll, tempura crunch roll, seared ahi nigiri and tamago was okay.  They did ask us to clean all of our plates... so be careful when ordering! Service was decent.  I wouldn't go back.  2 stars for good location and late night hours.  Casual dining. Indoor seating only.  NEXT! :((

kib7IcylQZeL-ivdc_-L9g.text: Great place to chow down, unbelievable price to what can you have for quality and varieties. Cool laid back place, simple portion with a cold bottle of Sapporo, perfect. 4 star, love it!

U7i8N3F_gWQLSgz3hgQhQg.text: The food is always great, easily top 3 for Sushi in the Valley but sometimes the wait is a bit much and parking is slim. Selection for an AYCE is actually pretty diverse between appetizers,  rolls and baked rolls and well worth the price. Open late and a short trip from the Strip but good anytime of day. Do yourself a favor and give it a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. An eclectic collection of yummy goodness.

UE1PXrRSc52Rl5cJKyn_OA.text: This place is fun and always pretty busy. We've waited over half an hour to eat here before and be prepared because it's on the small side.   The food is really good and my favorite roll is the sex bomb. The menu is very large with so many choices and they have a lot of fun rolls with unique flavors in them. When we go as a group we order half the menu and it's fun to try a bunch of different items.   I'm new to sushi so I'm still experimenting but I like mostly everything except for some of the raw choices like spicy tuna that is too mushy for me.   Dessert here is also great with my favorite ice cream the almond mocha!!!!!!! Yummy!!!!!!!!

OSH1ET2Dji-sYtkTDgkSxg.text: I used to give this place 5 stars and really wanted to give more! I come her at least 3 times a month and have always recommended he place due to the excellent food and super low prices! Unfortunately I feel the need to take away a star for a few reasons. One the menu change. There are a few items on the menu that have changed that I would have preferred not but I understand switching things up. On the menu of course. What I don't like is the price increase and now I won't be able to go as much or be able to recommend for low prices anymore. And they've also changed their opening time to 11:30 instead of 11:00 which isn't a huge difference but still a difference. Would still recommend though for the amazing sushi! :)

rzoPQ7Os_x604-hIWBNagw.text: The first time I went to Sushi Kaya, was about 3 years ago...and i was less than impressed.  Their rolls were small and it felt like a Korean restaurant vs. a Japanese Sushi House.  My friend was so crazy about this place, and begged me to give it another shot, but I refused.  I hadn't been back until last night.    I was definitely wrong about the place, or they have made some huge changes and improved greatly.  Their AYCE is affordable, and they have a lot of things on the menu that I don't think other AYCE places offer.    We had AYCE and devoured several items:  Brooklyn Bridge (I'm not a fan of eel, but loved this anyway!)  Shrek Roll (my favorite of the rolls that I was able to sample)  Soft Shell Crab roll with Soy Paper (Good, but wasn't blown away)  California Roll (Can't go wrong!)  3 orders of Sake Nigiri + avocado (yum, fresh and delicious)  3 orders of Hamachi Nigiri + avocado (same as above)  Poki (Good, I've had better elsewhere, but it wasn't bad) Ginger Salad (delicious and refreshing)  Mini Cheesecake dessert (I loved it!)   Probably the only thing that I can actually complain about, is that their iced tea wasn't that great.    I will be back, I'm a fan now!

Xdm9eS2JDnArK69riJbe_Q.text: Went for AYCE with my buddy and everything was absolutely incredible. Fresh as can be and we just beat the dinner rush so our food was coming out very quickly and staff was super attentive and kind. This was the best Sea Urchin I ever had and if you know Sea Urchin, it can be completely rotten tasting if it isn't completely fresh. Wonderful meal, will be back soon!

cAmBe3xW-ymcJo-0qdUe0A.text: For me, my quality barometer of a sushi place is its uni (sea urchin). If the uni tastes clean, smooth, and creamy, then this place is worth coming back to. What's your barometer?  The surprising part of this quality place is that they have AYCE. Most AYCE places reserve only the cheaper slices or they load the orders up with rice. SK didn't have a crazy amount of rice with the sushi, so you're ok there. Sure, there are restrictions on the quantity on some of the good stuff, but that's to be understood. Just know that it's tasty and the fish is fresh.  I did have to take a star off because the service wasn't consistent, even in the same visit. Not a deal breaker, but still worth noting.

6_QIJaXBZlnIxkXsa2V8VQ.text: Everything is very good and they are very fast.This is my new favorite place,and they also have A in health now so that's good

LDYPHeb1eUR04h0PBLhJGw.text: I love sushi Kaya the fish is always fresh but they need to work on their customer service sometimes the waiters are slow or have an attitude

OqS5V3Gt8bhtN6aePstNog.text: I absolutely loved this place! My aunt and uncle have great sushi taste buds!   I adored their white tuna (ono) nigiri! We ordered a million of these! Their Jose roll was to die for! It is spicy but its do-able! I believe their fish is fresh! I ordered the red rock roll and it was not anything spectacular! Seems like the chicken gizzard was popular Among my aunt's family. I didn't try it because I was a chicken butt. Oh jalapeno poppers were delicious and they used Japanese jalapenos which are a tad spicy! My aunt and uncle ordered everything so I don't know what I ate exactly. But I do know that their Ono nigiri and the Jose roll left me a good memory of sushi kaya!   Mocha ice cream was yums! What ice cream isn't?  Enjoy! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeño poppers
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi galore

3PuKrW_ec1oD7hfyDi7INw.text: If I ever stopped caring about my health, I'll for sure frequent sushi buffets.  I mean, who doesn't love sushi buffets?  For about $20+, you can eat all the sushi, sashimi, and fried seafood your damaged heart can handle.  Sushi Kaya is one of those buffets that'll do it's best to make sure you leave with your money's worth.  Located in Chinatown, Sushi Kaya is a bit hard to find.  If I remember correctly, it seemed Sushi Kaya and all the buildings around it use the same, if not similar, font.  But once you find it, get ready to eat a plethora of sushi.  We had a group of about 16 people for a bachelor party.  They seated us in this room that was next to the front entrance.  I think they seated us here because they knew we were trouble, so they would want to shuffle us out of the restaurant ASAP.  The room was spacious, had comfortable couches, and was set-up with non-working speakers.  Ah yeah, we were giving them hell about the speakers.  They were playing good music in the restaurant, but our room wasn't playing any of the music.  We decided to improvise by putting an iPhone in a cup and see if the sound would amplify and be loud enough for all of us to hear.  Yeah, we're idiots.  Anyways, the menu had a huge selection of different sushi, sashimi, and other delightful items.  All of us ordered 2-3 dishes because we knew it would take a while for them to make and bring in our order.  By the way, you have about 90 minutes to destroy their supply of seafood.  So, you better make every minute count.  I ordered the Spider roll, Eel roll, Caterpillar roll, and then it became fuzzy after that because I think I ordered more beers than food.  Yeah, they brought the liquor faster than the food.  Can't complain!  Oh yeah, they have a Jose roll.  My Mexican friend thought it was only fitting that he ordered it.  He said it was ,"Muy bien!"  But yeah, my food was pretty good.  The fish tasted fresh, the rice didn't taste bad, the rolls weren't too saucy, and they gave us decent portions for each roll.  The staff-- man.  First, if any of the waiters and waitresses are reading this:  WE ARE SO SORRY FOR MAKING YOUR LIFE A LIVING HELL FOR THE 90 MINUTES WE WERE THERE.  Alcohol + 16 guys + No girlfriends/wives to keep us in check = Rebecca Black's Friday.  Wut?  Seriously, thank you staff for being super friendly, cracking jokes with us, and taking the verbal gibberish the drunk bachelor threw at you guys.  Sushi Kaya. thank you very much for serving us.  I hope the night you spent with us will forever be branded in your brains.  It was one of many fun times we had in Vegas.  Thanks so much!!!!  Until next time...*evil laughter*

M3uu9E8jO3nxsOerXbA1Nw.text: My absolute favorite AYCE sushi spot in Vegas! I've introduced so many people to Sushi Kaya & they love it every single time. I've probably used up 5 stamp cards because I go here so often. LOL   I highly recommend the Cinderella Roll, Brooklyn Bridge & Japanese lasagna roll. I also love their nigiri. Amaebi, yellowtail, & salmon are my faves! Their appetizers are also delicious. Bbq beef skewers, beef tongue, bacon wrapped asparagus, baked green mussels, kimchi fried rice, omg I can go on & on. Oh, don't forget dessert! I like how they don't have a *one order per person* limit on desserts so you can order to your heart's content. I usually order the red bean ice cream & green tea mochi. I'm obsessed with their red bean ice cream!   The only downside is the wait times for this place (usually a 30-45 min wait on the weekends) since it's ALWAYS packed & the parking lot is as well since it's right by other popular restaurants such as Tea Station & Ichiza. Ugh, I wish they would expand their parking lot. However, the quality of the food here outweighs the wait times & parking situation.   Definitely check out this place. :)

OKw6YC7Q7FZe0BHHh_fm5g.text: Place has good food, excellent variety. The price is decent. However each and every time I come here there is always a wait.

u2_w6QviH4Oute8Id9y7wQ.text: The best sushi in vegas . Cinderella roll , sex bomb and crispy rice roll are the best . Always waiting for a table but is definitely worth it . 100% recommended, we're here at least once a month .

oso1lVSismB5hBJJQlsDLw.text: it gets freezing in here!!!! So bring a warm sweater.
