V8Q0b6iA5yF80FQ7W56uLQ.text: This place is the best! I'm a local and I'm come here frequently. Only that sucks is how long the wait is some days but it is totally worth it.

hTguszYqFQ4A-NHHbvVjkw.text: This place is amazing, Jayden always takes good care of me. I love the customer service and the great food. Prices are very fair, i do eat a la carte but you can have AYCE as well.. Definitely a clean place and worth visiting again and again. Ask for the regulars card, they stamp it for you so after 10 times you eat 1 time free

qCveABb2LNYnZLcls_8Wbw.text: This place is AWESOME!  There's never a waiting list, the food comes fast and tasty and the service is always friendly. One of the best AYCE sushi places in Vegas.   The only caveat is when the owner shows up and the employees are forced to threaten you with the "if you don't finish everything, we'll have to charge you more next time around"

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White tuna and unagi goodness

LX3atKrLhDCTCpTiE-0RDg.text: WHITE PEOPLE BEWARE. They brought my white buddy a spoon for his rice because they assumed that he was not able to use chop sticks, which he cant but still. The fact that he didnt have to ask is racist. The service was ok but I haven't gotten a refill in over 35min.

FH8hAK_OwhQNY3lpnnTs3g.text: Don't come here with a big group.  We had a group of 14 people and only ONE person was taking our orders. I knew immediately this was going to be rough.  I didn't receive more than half of what I ordered and the other part of the group didn't get ANY food for 45 minutes and had to watch the other half eat.  Kaya needs to understand how to take orders for a big group.  When I asked for my other half of my order the guy said " oh, it's not coming I don't know what happened to it."  Really?  He comped the people that waited their beers but made no effort to give us our full orders. The sushi wasn't even worth the trouble.  I had Tako Nigiri, seaweed salad, sex bomb roll and a beer. 1/3 of what I normally eat at an AYCE and I paid $40 for a meal that didn't fill me at all.....  I understand that we were a big group so there will be mistakes but when 70% of everyone's orders didn't even come out, that's just not even trying. I'll never come back and neither will the other 13-14 people.  You lost a lot of customers today Kaya.  That's unfortunate.

ZtADydd9MthBOlJy7ccNeA.text: California & Philly Dream Roll are the best!!! Sushi Kaya never disappoints, however my girlfriend and I have noticed the Coke fountain drink they serve is kinda odd taste kinda like if Diet Coke and Shasta cola had a baby. Can't wait for my next visit!

1xN16Ej9aLT8kiy5GoB3Nw.text: I've been here plenty of times. At least 10 that's for sure. The AYCE menu is great & they let you do half others. My complaint comes from the service received here. I've had just about every server and the only one who has proven to be good is Jenice. The service is very  bad. They forget about you and they have no sense in what they do. Manager isn't existent. The only reason we return is because it's open late. Otherwise we would go somewhere else. Management/service needs MAJOR fixing.

CGGIui0DBygN8korbSUvBQ.text: This is my favorite place to go for late night all u can eat sushi.  Friendly staff, call buttons on most of the tables.  Sometimes the service is slow if it's busy but not a big deal if you're with good company.  I have to be honest, I did see a roach crawling around on two separate occasions but out of the 30 to 40 times I've eaten there, one roach on two different visits is not too terribly bad...I guess.  I haven't gotten food poisoning yet and the sushi is really delicious.  I can't speak for any of the raw fish; I stopped eating raw fish after an incident with a tape worm.

kzSusaZocmKEsIuO-PSbkg.text: AYCE sushi for 24.99 (lunch) is a great deal.   Walking in and knowig the price i kind of had the gut feeling that this place was going to be so-so. Wow, was I wrong.   The service was excellent. The waitress was dressed in a cute school girl outfit and stockings. (if your into the asian young girl look here is your girl) She was friendly, fast and al around great. They kept our plates coming and our area clear of empty place. Drinks kept being refilled and they were great at explaining different dishes to my out of town guests.   They kept my little one year old occupied with a little paper menu but no crayons. oh well no biggie. Thye let me share my food with no extra charge which really surprised me. Last but not least tey played with her. Poking her, tickling, talking and lastly waving whenever they went bye. tooooo cute! kid friendly place is the place to be for me ;)  The food was good. Huge sizes so becareful when you order because if you dont finish an item they charge you. I really like tat because then that means they dont waste food and are great with food costs.  Best part about this place was that they have a rewards card system for how often you come. Awesomeness. If i remember correctly the 9th AYCE meal is FREE  Best Dishes IMO;  - who's your daddy. (hilarious name. delicious dish. tastes nothing like sushi. sooo good that i had to order it about 2 or 3 times)  - shrimp tempura & the vege tempura. (lightly fried, the veggies could ahve been a little fresher but maybe it was just me. the shrimp were a lot larger than i expected)  - the teriyaki bowl (its huge so becareful when you order it. It filled me up a lot so I wish that in the end it was smaller. The meat was seasoned well, not too much sweet sauce on it. More rice than i wanted.)  - moochie (very good, ive had better green tea but it would do)  - the cheesecake (the best!! omg every time it was different. they give you a mound of whip cream next to the cheesecake bites, sprinkled with syrup. The first bite was cookie cheesecake. The second was strawberry cheesecake and the third was just plain old cheesecake. All were very  good and i wished i could have ordered more but there was a limit. darn!!)

tUEUH2smlF3rRKiGP4V-dw.text: So far this is the only Japanese restaurant that I've encountered where they cater to my special dietary needs. Everything was so fresh, tasty and plentiful! I never once felt deprived because of my diet. Anyone with a food allergy/intolerance can relate. Our waiter was the best. So, if you have certain dietary restrictions, let them know and they'll work with you.

wRlqcV4gNIaORc4ysAP3qg.text: Love this place; great music good atmosphere and great menu; lots of Items to choose from!!

U3Nian6COKNyfyyxnY4_mQ.text: We went there last night and the 45 minute wait was well worth it! Omgosh the sushi was so amazing I just fell in love. I will def come here anytime I am in Vegas. The sex bomb roll is amazing. I didn't really care for there rainbow roll though. The booths are very big and comfortable if you two sit next to each other if not the table seems to far away.

Rq-IbFA-x6L3dQ5nyWZKDw.text: Great place for ayce sushi! Great price and good service. Kinda small but the food makes up for the space.

QGXlO4cotqx53JjVY6mUiA.text: One of the BEST sushi buffet that I have ever had!  To me it is the variety and the taste/quality of the food that sets it apart from the other buffets.  Back and front of menu with LOTS of options to eat.  The food you get are not "buffet" taste, i.e. bland or stuffed with crap, it was pretty much what you expect to get at a decent sushi restaurant, with the addition of korean dishes.  When you hear of All You Can Eat Sushi, I bet you think of 5 rolls, 5 nigiris, 3 appetizers, green tea ice cream - ALL tasting hella nasty, huh?  Well, you won't find none of that crap here.  True the sign says "All You Can Eat Sushi", but they serve way more than just sushi.  They serve lots of korean dishes also - japchae, bulgogi, "punkin gongee" (think it should be pumpkin congee), etc.  I think the items that you should really try are the skewers (they have bacon wrapped scallop, bacon wrapped shrimp, shrimp, beef, "galic" (garlic), sweet potato, mushroom, and more!!).  All were good, but the best to me has to be the beef and sweet potato.  There must be a reason why they limit this to only one per person right?  The sushi rolls were of decent quality and size, not like the rolls of lots of imitation crap, I mean crab, and rice to stuff you full.  Compared to True sushi restaurants it was be in the middle of the pack, but compared to buffets it is at the top.  Who serves good tasting rolls at a buffet??  No one usally, except for Kaya.  (Hooray!)  The fish used on the nigiri were cut quite thin and not of the best quality, but very edible and tasty.  What do you expect from a buffet?  The rolls are presented well on the plates and are pretty much very tasty.  Menu says each roll costs $12.95 if ordered separate, so eat up boys and girls and make it worth your money!!  They only have strawberry, vanilla, and green tea ice cream for dessert.  You will be stuffed by trying one of each skewer, many nigiris and rolls, bulgogi, japchae, etc. to be thinking of more dessert than a scoop of ice cream.  They only limit it to one scoop of one kind per person.  Mixed review on this.  =/  Went here at midnight and it was pretty full still.  The atmosphere was cool.  Mix of korean/hip hop songs and the customers being loud and having fun.  The people (customers and waiters) were korean, the special menu items on wall were in korean, the music was korean, some menus was in korean.  The food was good, the music was good, the service was good - what more can you ask for?!?  Food was good for an all you can eat buffet. Service was good and attentive - always asking if there is anything else we would like.  Maybe one more star added if they took off the restrictions on the skewers and ice cream.  =P  Will I be back??  HELL YEAH!!  I would take this any day over buffets at any of the hotels on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pumpkin Congee
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp, Garlic, Beef, Sweet Potato Skewers
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi

651PH87fdjN6UL0ZG7mgQQ.text: Although this is an "All YOU CAN EAT" sushi joint, the fish quality is actually pretty good.  The head sushi chef knows what he is doing.  The selection is crazy for AYCE and it is definilty a place to eat some rolls and nigiri for a great price.  I ate a sashimi plate that had some of the highest quality fresh fish I have had in Las Vegas.  A for the quality.   The service was OK- not the nicest people in the world and I'm always put off a bit when not so nice people work at sushi places.  C for the service  The worst part about this place is the music.  Some of the worst I've heard in a while.    Overall, this palce is a nice find in Chinatown.

xOEMrcALTMMVio6Tvog0CQ.text: I went here with my dad because it is one of the more affordable AYCE places in town that does not sacrifice quality to be cheaper. They open at 11:30am and stay open until 3am. Lunch starts right at 11:30am and goes until 4pm for 19.95. Dinner is from 4pm until last call at 2am for 22.95. It is a great deal that includes a few special items and a large selection of rolls.  The best deals when it comes to appetizers were the lightly battered soft shell crab in a ponzu sauce, the ahi poke, the oysters on a half shell, and the baked green mussels. Even if you eat a few orders of these, you would easily cover the price for AYCE.  The nigiri was delicious as well. Yes, the fish slices were slightly smaller but the amount of rice that they use matched well. You do not feel like this place is trying to scam you by filling you up with rice. We ordered halibut, yellowtail, albacore, spicy scallop, unagi, and shrimp. Halibut is my favorite fish, so I could eat that all day. I normally detest yellowtail with a passion, but I enjoyed it here. It was not overly fishy and was pleasant.  The rolls, I find them to be nothing really special. Although they have a whole page dedicated to regular and specialty rolls, I found it hard to find ones that were imaginative or new. We ended up ordering a tiger, caterpillar, and another roll that escapes my mind right now. As you can see the rolls are nothing to write home about. It is better to just order the nigiri. I probably would have loved the roll menu more if I was not trying to avoid the tempura and cream cheese that littered most rolls. Don't get me wrong, their tempura is good, but I cannot justify eating all this rice and fried foods as well. I just wanted slabs of raw fish.  The service is not the best, but after going to a few Japanese places I am used to being ignored (::cough:: Shuseki ::cough::), so this was much better. Even though the server was busy she made it a point to ask if we were doing alright, refilled our drinks, took our additional orders.  This place is a nice fusion of Japanese-Korean food, service, and culture. It felt comfortable sitting at the bar listening to K-Pop that was not blaring in you ear.

UB0r4LqfTJ3PlxV-7UtsMg.text: Came here after reading Chris M's review of the AYCE option. The place seemed somewhat busy, but the sushi bar was wide open.    The AYCE menu is pretty extensive.  The usual nigiri options are available.  In addition, there is a list of a rolls, appetizers (korean and japanese), robata, noodles, soups, and rice dishes. The size of fish on the nigiri is on the smaller side, but the amount of rice is proportionally less too so that's nice. There are limits to certain types of items: uni, amaebi, all robata, oysters, etc. Everything tasted fine, I especially like the kim chi fried rice I am ashamed to say.  A lot fo the rolls have cream cheese, which was a bit of a turn off. Certain rolls can also be ordered in half orders so you can try a little more variety.   The biggest headache eating at this restaurant is the difficulty in placing your orders.  The waitresses were incredibly busy, thank goodness one of them is a friend of mine, or else I might have starved. The sushi chefs are the worst however.  At most sushi restaurants they will ask you if you want anything or if you are ready for more.  Here, when they have no rolls or sushi to make, they just stand around talking to each other. You have to flag them down and place an order. As for value, $20 for lunch and about  $25 for dinner is a pretty good deal.  If the sushi chefs could be a little more proactive, this place would definitely get four stars.

Cx9DrIHFbHIWFNezoNaHVg.text: The AYCE is amazing! I love eating sushi here. Would definitely recommend my friends to come here.

MdPwdcpA55gTtKdFbXmuGQ.text: Ok, whoever told you that this place wasn't worth checking out.....smack them right now! This place is by far the best sushi I've ever encountered in Vegas, and that my friend is no lie. (All right let me not say best, since I'm always on the search for the best. Let's see the best by far) Not only is their sushi amazing, but so is their interior decorating. It's a little crowded at times, and all the songs they play are in a language I don't quite understand, but the food is worth the trip!   The only reason I didn't give this a five is because of their service. But hey, any shop owned by an Asian staff that speaks less than 80% English, hey your bound to run into bad service. Ok, if you can put up with the minor "rudeness" then you'll experience delicious!  Our group of friends came out her on a little experience, after hearing mixed reviews about this place I decided to check this out any way. The price is good for AYCE, compared to sushimon which is almost $30 for dinner.  I gave a quick glance their menu and decided to stick to the appetizers and nigiri for sushi.   Ohhhhh boy, we ordered:  White Tuna Nigiri: OMG! The most tender and fresh piece of fish ever! It was like having a burst of flavors melt in your mouth. It felt like an exotic rush, idk what it is but I feel like raw fish is exotic. Weird right?  Seared Albercore Nigiri: OMFG!!! Another melt in your mouth sushi, idk what it is but it just tantalizes my tongue, always saying give me more!  Yellowtail Nigiri: Also a definite must! It's sooooo fresh, everything just meshes well together.  Bacon and scallop Skewer: I find their rule a little greedy, seeing you only get one skewer per person. And with the smallest strip of bacon on tiny ass scallop, you've got be kidding me that I'm only limited to one? Well, whatever.....the taste of the skewer is amazing. The juices of the scallop burst out if your mouth along with the bacon. It's so sad that's it's tiny as heck.  Shrimp Skewer: again, tiny as heck but deliciously oozing with so muCh flavor. Whoever came up with their skewer rule was cruel. Leaving a person with something amazing, with a limit.  Oysters: I was never a fan of raw oysters, somi was a bit surprised when I got it. I was under the impression that it was baked, but I should've known. You don't come to a sushi place, expecting to get something cooked.  Salmon Skin roll: It was surprisingly good, I usually get a hand roll, but I was surprised with the consistency of the rice. Not too sticky or wet, just right...with the right amount of stuffing.  Calamari: Fried to a crisp served with the special soy sauce, served on a fancy looking bento box. Nothing amazing, but worth the try.  Spicy Rice cake: More like seet and sour rice cake, interesting but nothing special.  Green tea Ice cream: sweet, but not green tea tasting. I'm sad that they didn't have fried tempura ice-cream. Ohh well, there's always room for improvement.  This is good sushi joint and worth the pit-stop. Get there before 7 if you're coming in for dinner. It gets pretty packed.

G2PhI_fw1gZuBu5J5VQtwQ.text: Food is really great, service is mediocre. We came on a Thursday, about 6:30 and it was pretty busy but it was just 3 of us and we were fine to sit at the bar. Seats were open but we were told 20-30 minutes for any seat and the lady just before of us was told 15... We were waiting and saw 3 more seats open at the bar and we were the only party waiting at this point. My friend went and asked if we could again sit at the bar. She seemed annoyed and rudely sat us at the Bar. My one complaint about the bar is you don't get to interact with the Sushi Chef's  and you can't really see what they are doing. We had a great waitress most of the service until towards the end. We then had a very solemn male server who no joke,  aggressively yanked my cup from my hand for a refill. He made all 3 of us feel like were inconveniencing him. Food Spot On but again service is what caused the point deduction.

wTxK5U9GAP_KBgghIP4u8A.text: My friends and I came here to try their ayce sushi, since they told me they liked this place.  They didn't get ayce last time but this time we all did.  They have a lot to offer on the menu from appetizers, rolls, nigiri, and even dessert.    There's just too many to choose from and hard to decide on what we wanted to eat.  We just ordered a whole bunch of rolls and nigiri and started to eat away.  We got through 3 rounds of ordering and that was it.  I had bacon wrapped scallops, gyoza, calamari tempura, baked mussels, baked scallop roll, some kind of dynamite roll, and a tempura roll.  They had a bunch of nigiri and two types of soup.    It was really filling and yes you have to eat everything or else they will charge you extra.  20 dollars for ayce is not bad. I like this ayce sushi because you get to order and they bring it to you vs. other ayce sushi that are buffet style.  This place is definitely a hit or miss for people.  I can see both sides.  However, it's not bad at all for the price.

nq-rpVOs1qzwP1xZpJSlPg.text: If I want to do ALL YOU CAN EAT Sushi, THIS is where I go. Amazing service! Simon is absolutely awesome and very friendly! I LOVE THEIR SEX BOMB ROLL & JOE SPECIAL! I have came into this place a LOT, but my most recent visit was the best time I have had. I came in with some coworkers and our experience was AMAZING! We stayed until 2:30 a.m.

otkRAiYoNFaTgLStXPkFSA.text: Great food. Great service. The owners are very welcoming people. They make you feel like you are at home when you eat there. Sushi is always fresh. Try it! You wont be disappointed.

0fjnLmK2qpEiydKZqYfgVw.text: AVOID GOING!!!  I hate going to places with bad management and even worse food. The hot green tea was lukewarm and tasted like tape water. The house salad was not good at all. We ordered 5 rolls and didn't finish one. All of them has extra gooey rice old fish which tasted bland. It all made my stomach hurt and made me super nauseous.  The worse part of the meal was the rude manager who told me that nothing was wrong and that no one else has compliant. He didn't even get out of his way to me the customer better or anything. Definitely stay away from this place!!!

s1gmV2bkXUJIHXemXok35g.text: all you can eat for 25 dollar plus tax.....its the best sushi deal in town.....  quality is surprising good for ayce...  the nigri is very good quality...so the rolls are good...the plus is very clean and korean run....  service is fast and good....

tIIHWpSmjyEAEV9f0i_LBg.text: I have the nickname of the resident sushi master because everyone I know comes to me for sushi recommendations.  Kaya is always one of the three places I mention each time.  I've frequented over 20 sushi joints in the Vegas valley and this is still one of my all time favorites.  First, they are open late, and by late...3am is awesome for those late night sushi cravings.  Second, 21.95 for dinner just can't be beat!  I actually like that they serve soda in cans and the price includes free refills.  They have a wide selection of flavored saki's and a decent beer selection.   The food is just awesome.  Generous sizes of fish slices for nigiri, the rolls are hands down the best I've had, and they have a huge selection of appetizers including skewers.  The service has always been top notch in the numerous times I've visited.  One of the managers always comes up to me and lets me know that it's nice to see us again and asks how the service was when we are getting ready to leave.    You can't go wrong with this place.  Trust me!

5Zb_laRTortAZ3aitr9Q_A.text: This place is AH-MAY-ZING. Holy mother of pearl. The service is fantastic and the AYCE options are great (more than just sushi and fried rice). The sushi rolls are none like I've seen elsewhere. This place makes me want to move to Vegas...or at least just go for a one day sushi bender. It's that good! Joe's Sushi who?

MoyqCamh9eM2d9Q-21rUhg.text: With a all you can eat sushi menu and low price specials Sushi Kaya is one of my favorite Sushi Restaurants in Las Vegas. They have some of the freshest sushi and every item they sale holds its own. There Meso soup which is very inexpensive (party bonus) is fabulous, they have terrific rolls, and even the appetizers are great.    As far as the all you can eat menu, I have had it once and although it was good I found that I enjoy more off the regular menu than on sushi one. Then again I am not very explorative with raw fish so that could have a lot to do with it. The price per person for the all you can eat sushi is $19.95 for Lunch and $22.95 for dinner. You have an hour to order but when we went we stayed for longer than that and they still let us order as much as we wanted.   I have been back at least a dozen times and have managed to try their different noodle dishes and other menu items and have been impressed thus far. I have yet to get something I did not think was great tasting.  Other than that, always check out the specials! They had california rolls on sale for a dollar for a month. I was sad to see the price raise back up to $4.95 but still love it the same.

dIeJyHwhUcIM9SSbXBA9xA.text: Pros: This restaurant has maybe the best selection on sushi I have ever seen.  Great atmosphere, great service. Tables had a small button on the table to call over the server.  They offer unlimited sushi at a standard price as if in buffet style.  Love it!    Cons: Had to wait almost 45 minutes for a table.  Very frustrating!!!  Overall, despite the wait time, sushi was well worth it!

QeKkOEQvezNY8YwtX2BDRA.text: More like 3 1/2 stars?  And I think this place is owned by Korean instead of Japanese.  Anyway... we were wandering around Chinatown in search of Asian food... We came across the huge sign that said "AYCE" sushi outside of Kaya.  Without hesitation, my family all agreed on this place.  It was nice the day we came... the place was not too busy to serve my large family.  We were seated quickly and we ordered our way with sushi.  Each person could only get one order of uni , soft shell crabs, oysters and the skewer (I wish they would let us order more of the skewer).  The sushi were okay.... not the freshest we had, but it was still good.  But we did notice the sizes were pretty small... that was okay since small sushi = small amount of rice.  We just had to order more... it's ayce...  Besides from the sushi, we ordered cucumber salad (not that good), pumpkin porridge (great), udon (real yummy) and many more....  The only real complaint I had was that some of the items we ordered never came.  We had to keep following up with our orders and re-ordered and re-ordered until we kind of didn't know what came and what didn't.  Besides from that, it was a good experience for us.

SRR6RnJKkgEue8RuFONWhg.text: Decent spot for all you can eat sushi. The service is always pretty good and the sushi is good but not great. Gets fairly crowded on weekends so it's a tough place to go to then. Of all the all you can eat sushi places in town, this is the one my friends and I often end up.

urUTHHXOPAbLy_De8AMQbw.text: 4th time here, everytime has been a pleasure.  Great food and service. The only Con is that its always so cold in there.  One of the best AYCE Sushi in Vegas!

7ELeH0gs0rCEHB5NzN01jA.text: Love this place! My family & I have been coming here for the last 5 years. We've tried other AYCE sushi places in town but none of them even come close. AYCE menu has so much to choose from. Quality of seafood is always fresh. Never had a bad experience.

p9oLS0sSnfGfN-37S9icsQ.text: I took my family here for dinner and my boys loved it. The sushi are fresh and good, especially the beef.  The downside is you certain items you can only order one time.  You have a limit of 90 mins, sound short but actually you have plenty of time to eat and enjoy the food.  The service is fast and the location is near by the strip.

CTVY1zyoAV8b6OYQDjihBQ.text: Love eating here because their menu is huge for AYCE. You can order different appetizers & desserts when you get all you can eat which I haven't been able to do at any other sushi spots. The sushi is good but the service here is not as good as the food. Ate here a couple days ago w/ my family & they were constantly forgetting to bring rolls to our table. We had to ask 3 times for our Ever Green roll which doesn't even have any meat in it just all veggies so I'm confused as to why that took so long. Other times I've had a waiter take 15 mins to take another order. Pretty annoying since I was at a table right in front of the sushi bar. Besides that food is good & I recommend getting a stamp card cause you get a free AYCE after your 10th one.

ZUbbXNpxnizfZVbjP5GS7w.text: great if you love a lot of imitation crab. The only dish I liked was the Who's your dad? roll.  Umiya is wayy better for all you can eat

yHbZi6wsTP0tUiH4Cy0Ezw.text: For those sushi lovers that can't get enough, this is the perfect place to go. Who doesn't love all you can eat sushi. Everything is made as you order. It has Great service & great price.

LDHVbJaX9HWn1IqOKHWSdw.text: I want to start off by saying my boyfriend and I used to come to this place literally every weekend until our visit today.. I'm not too sure about sushi kaya anymore. I understand that it gets extremely busy during the weekends and usually we have to wait over an hour for a table which used to be worth it but this visit ruined everything. First off, we waited over 2 hours but this time I got very frustrated bc they kept passing people that arrived way after us so I went up to speak to the hostess only to find out that she claimed to have called my name a long time ago when clearly my bf and I were standing right next to the hostess podium the entire time and then told us that shed give us the next available table so we waited for about another 20 mins as she kept sitting other people so my boyfriend went up to ask again and they finally sat us, we looked at the menu and a lady came to ask us for our drinks (which she later forgot about them so we had to ask another server again) first round was good, here came second round.. We waited for about 10 mins until someone approached us, same thing happened with 3rd round, even when it's busy they usually attend us quickly but not this time. unfortunately,  we will have to search for another sushi bar.

rzy-mrmuS2WJxrjtAf4TCw.text: This place has good ratings not sure why. The food is bland all there sushi is precut all there ingredients are cheap knock offs the wasabi,ginger and soy were gross. 3 stars at best.

YhXX6kuvDKglR1uUkZut5w.text: Joined my cousin for dinner after she raved about this place. I wasn't impressed. There are way better sushi places in the same vicinity and I wouldn't come back to this place. The service was subpar and the food was mediocre.

IeYMtCnk1C8ZFMMi8-a3nA.text: I wrote a review a while ago with 5 stars because I loved it here but I came here tonight to eat. Absolutely HORRIBLE and the management is ridiculous. We got seated in about 20 mins of waiting at first I thought I was going to have a good time we got the first order in and it came except for two of our noodles we ordered after the first order we never saw our waiter again... Like literally they forgot about our table we had no refills we had to ask someone and he gave us a stink face (waiter with glasses) so he sent he busser of course to do it. The busser I have to say was the best out of everything. We waited and waited and still our noodles never came our waiter never came AGAIN I asked for help and told the girl that if we had a waiter that we wanted to order another while went by. I was just too mad to even order anything else so the manager came and gave us the tab he was so fast at that let me tell you! We told him about the bad experience and all he had to say for it is "We Are Busy" who says that! Everyone else was getting taken care of ! And other then that he got mad because we didn't tip our 'server' what freaking server because as far as I know we didn't have one!!! So I tipped the busser who refilled our drinks! Because I thought that would be the best. We walked out and I found it SOOOO rude that the manager laughed at us. WHO DOES THAT this place is horrible. The management is horrible and if he's the owner then shame on him and if he's not I hope the owner realizes that he has the wrong people for the "management" role he's suppose to be a problem solver not laugh at people's faces totally regret my first review from here lost some very frequent customers and be sure we will let people know about this place ha. Worst place ever

1r2iywqD5APqyv2Y04J0fg.text: For an AYCE sushi joint, this place delivers pretty well. Yes, they do offer Uni, and yes, it's obviously not as good as what you'd get at a traditional joint, but AYCE with an entire menu isn't bad at all.   The service was excellent. We had a big table (actually took up the entire Karaoke room. Yep, they've got one!) and there were two waitresses attentively serving us.   The tuna was fairly dry, but the yellowtail and salmon were both excellent in AYCE quality. It's Korean-owned, so they have some Korean plates to offer as well, on an AYCE basis. The one thing that stood out was the Duk bok gi. It was pretty damned good! I would come back here next time I'm around downtown, as it's the only tasty AYCE sushi place around..at least that I know of.

-2vOlbfWdJ7v8oMvsrvsCA.text: The service here is a bit average, but for the all you can eat sushi, I am willing to accept it.  Their sushi is fantastic, and it is one of the only sushi establishments that consistently gets an A on their health inspections.  I definitely recommend if you want great sushi and you're on a budget.

jKQB0C_jfZme-oL03G83CA.text: TERRIBLE service!!! Since the place changed service has been wonderful. You gotta try the triple x's rolls. Like I said not the best in town but still pretty up there!

kE2q7GfHSBEPJWLjjSSD_w.text: Las Vegas has a lot of sushi restaurants that range from very cheap AYCE to top-end al la carte.  And, it is not always True that you get what you pay for.  Having had the good fortune to travel all over Japan for work for 25 years, I have experienced a lot of authentic Japanese sushi.  Now living in Vegas, I am frequently disappointed in many of our valley sushi restaurants.  Sushi Kaya SURPRISED AND IMPRESSED me.  I went for dinner last night and it was a chilly and rainy night so the restaurant was not as crowded as other Yelp reviewers have reported.  The atmosphere is comfortable and inviting and the two hostesses, wait staff and chefs all made me feel welcomed.  The menu is a mix of traditional and American sushi, all in a good way.  But what I want to report is that the sushi chefs know how to respect the fish.  Its temperature is not refrigerator cold so you can actually taste the flavor of the fish.  The same is True of the rice that you can tell was recently prepared and fluffed.  I don't enjoy old rice that is packed like mortar.   The last thing I want to note is that for many of the rolls you can order a half roll.  This is great if you want to try several rolls and don't want to fill up on a few.  Sushi Kaya offers a loyalty card so after repeat visits you earn a free AYCE.  Nice but not necessary, this is one sushi restaurant I WILL return to and enjoy more great sushi to get my fix.    For a dinner price of $24.95, at Sushi Kaya you get more than you paid for as compared to many other valley sushi restaurants.

Y_H53UdYZdmnaBuBuzymGQ.text: Zero stars. Used to come in here every single week, until they decided that they don't honor their clientele. It's okay that they suck, it happens. I hope they get rid of their staff that sucks, not all of them. But the ones they do, the manager with the new balances, with the attitude, and the waitress that is too slow to be an average human being. I apologize, but this place should realize that people come in here often, and the fact that they don't makes me want to start going to Blue Fin. Thank you so much, but Kaya is trash. Anyone that doesn't agree, has never been here more than once a week. Good bye and good day.

tUIs6-jqf2urtxAg9T7Dtg.text: I think that over the years I tried most AYCE Japanese and this one is now my favorite great food great staff delicious

-VC6CEbe_jMZMtOe7mWTRQ.text: Went here for NYE and was pleasantly surprised by the quality from an AYCE style sushi place. The sushi was very good and so were the mixed drinks. Had to wait about 20 minutes, but that's to be expected at a buffet. Losing one star because we called hours ahead to make a reservation and they said they didn't do reservations before 10 pm. Got there around 930 pm and had to wait...but saw a table marked "Reserved" as soon as we walked in. Aside from that, Service was quick, food started coming out about 5 mins after ordering.  Everything was delicious. Not the absolute best sushi I've ever had, but this place did not disappoint. Lots of variety on the menu. Would definitely recommend it.

FOjd_n0dOVMijgGBg9OgNg.text: I can't give this place a 5 because I'm loyal to my sushi place (I love sushi) in Henderson. It's definitely up there though. I opted for the all you can eat which is about $25. The menu is expensive if you don't do the all you can eat so it's better to just get it. It's a good AYCE menu including appetizers and dessert. The servers were nice and the sushi came out pretty quick. I ambiance is nice too.

NeVKb9I_E6VtqMh-3uVhmA.text: The all you can eat is definitely worth it with just two orders of the special rolls. I really enjoyed their miso soup as well as their mochi ice cream, but I was a bit disappointed with their vegetarian variety. I tried out their Shrek Rolls and ordered a custom Avocado roll, but I decided to just have more miso soup. The place seems very clean and I would probably come here again.

aVHT54BLJvu3m8cx1EmR3g.text: Food quality went down hill very quick in the last 2 years.  Portion is getting smaller. Fish is getting "Fisher".     Now the service is getting worse.  Server has no idea between red wine and Champagne.  She tried 3 times to bring the right drink.  Our party has 5 adults and our drink was about $200+ and still going (our sushi bill was about $150).  We were asked to leave because we were sitting there to long.  Good luck making money.

oA12kklfFh7i0uEqTk6iFg.text: This sucks because they have great sushi and food but have the worst, poorly ran, costumer service here.

M7C_PTtR_gaKVtUpOAxx7Q.text: My family loves sushi and we have tried many many different places around town and besides Oyshi this is the only place that we go to now.   Great section and great price for AYCE

LUFgsCPEGmreNmymNc4e2Q.text: Went to Kaya with my roommate, since she said the food was good the last time she went with her friends.  We arrived about 7:15pm on a Friday night, and the place wasn't too crowded and the service was good.  We ordered some nigri sushi and some of the skewers (bacon wrapped scallops - decent; beef tongue - under-seasoned, disappointed).  Most of the fish are good, but some were not too fresh.    Also tried the Sweety Roll (based on previous Yelp review) and was really disappointed at how this tempura-style roll turned out to be.  The roll is big, but also filled with mostly rice.  The eel sauce it was dressed with tasted burnt=bitter, which is mostly not how eel sauce is supposed to taste like here normally.  Also tried the Rock & Roll (which the waiter said was a cucumber wrapped roll without rice) served with a kiwi sauce.  When the roll arrived, I can clearly see that whoever prepared it was no experienced sushi master or even someone with a decent knife skill (cucumber slice was uneven and on the thick side). The roll is also wrapped in seaweed with lots of rice and the fish described in the menu, which is then wrapped in the thick cucumber sheet. The kiwi sauce was okay, most likely made by blending mayo + some kiwi + sugar, which I thought was interesting to try, but nothing to write home to rave about.  Service from the waitstaff also suffered once we have been there for about 30 minutes, since there were a few groups of 5 or 6 that arrived. It was difficult to place new orders, get refills on our beverages, until additional waitstaff stepped in to help out.  Overall, I would say that it is a decent AYCE sushi experience for the $29 (incl tax and tip, no other beverages).  But if you go, stick to their nigiri and appetizer menu.  The special rolls sounds good on paper, but falls short on taste and execution. Also sit at the sushi bar if you can, so you can at least ask the sushi chefs what fish is fresh and what you should avoid.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rock &amp; Roll - made with thick and uneven cucumber sheet and a bit heavy on the rice.

N7-E740Qzq97UER-5c0mVA.text: OMG and wait here as long we waited over 30 minutes to be seated with the food delicious and the bait remote who were excellent... Service was great and make sure the refill my drink in the sushi came fast ! I really like the stamp card option because I sushi quite often the stem car is like a little bonus..

AfINQ1-RptiHVwOT5VJi5g.text: Came here bc there was an HOUR wait at ichiza.. There was a 30 min wait here. First off, waiting area is SMALL! And also it's right by the entrance so if there is a party waiting you have to slither your way through the crowd to put your name down and then slither your way back out. :/   Me n 4 others were here for the AYCE dinner which is $25/person. Their menu is far different from a lot of Sushi buffets. They have a wide selection of appetizers from beef tongue (yum!) to gizzards (yummm!) to deep fried jalapeno poppers (yummmmmm!). They have a good amount of nigiris including uni & amaebi! Even though I'm not a fan of either, these were some of the perks since I know these items are pricey at regular sushi joints. They have a good selections of rolls (sex bomb is scrumptious) as well as hot food like udon, japchae, kimchi fried rice, etc. Even for dessert they have a couple diff things (cheesecake, mochi, ice cream). I'm used to the reg jap buffet and their infamous ice cream cones.   Customer service was prob one of the best. Waiters/tresses were very attentive and we were able to order from anybody that came to our table, not just our server. Food came out in decent timing.   The only downside is that it's a buffet but it's limited. Your max order for one item is same as the number of heads at your table so... If you have a party of five, you can only order 5 orders of uni. Even though this didn't present a problem for my party, I can see where this could be an issue if everybody loved uni and they were only limited to one order of it.

zxpHyrrxxOzyly1K3yVnzw.text: The food was alright. The worst customer service I have experienced and I have been a server before.  Servers need to explain the menu especially for AYCE. Should always watch the drinks and ask for refills when the cup is half way. Follow up with your tables and be more polite. I was telling a busser if we could order more and listed off some food and she completely cut me off and just said I'll get your server (at least say sorry I can't take your order, but I'll get your server). I asked my server for a refill and he just gave me a finger to wait. At the end of the meal the server did not offer any dessert at all, he was just quick to give the check. My friend found a hair in his ice cream and was disgusted.  We tipped them just to be considerate, but in all honesty they did not deserve a tip at all in my books. I suggest everyone to go to Oyshi or Goyemon for AYCE sushi!   DEFINITELY WILL NOT RETURN!

HmQWveZJNX_VELmZmRnZjg.text: Sex bomb is da bomb  - consistent rolls - average prices - great service - (almost) unlimited appetizers AND desserts  - not the freshest fish but it's an AYCE joint - tons of toppings, pro for some con for others  If you know what you like then try it at least once. In my top 5 sushi joints but not my first. My go-to place when I'm in Chinatown and have a sushi craving

g5g-1gvxpeRMHom8my-jRw.text: Best super white tuna nigiri, lettuce wraps, and kimchi fried rice, although I prefer the fried rice without spam since I don't eat pork. The wait can take a while on weekends but the plaza has some good hangouts to chill at nearby (a boba cafe and a bar) while waiting.   Service is normally quick, but they often forget an order or two since they get really busy. So you might need to remind them every now and then. The desserts that are available to AYCE aren't that great: the mini cheesecakes have too much whipped cream and the mochi ice cream is too hard.

2yMMWTHTCBdah5fmssibsw.text: 19.95 lunch and 22.95 dinner all u can eat  We decided to check this place out because it came to us recommended by a friend. It's not too expensive being 22.95 all you can eat but on the menu it warns you to order little by little (but being super excited we didn't notice that and ordered a bunch all at once). The menu also informs you that if you don't finish your sushi (including the rice), they'll charge you for the whole roll. That kinda annoyed me but we were able to finish it thanks to having guys with us haha.   With that 22.95 rate, you can order anything you want from a lengthy menu that includes skewers, dessert (ice cream), nigiris, and specialty rolls and more. So that gives you a lot of things to choose from but it wasn't the best quality of sushi. It was only so-so.

liLC_rk9KmF3Nx54MNm8mA.text: I love this place. Not very expensive but very tasty. Come here 2-3 times a month. If you want to eat good a tasty come here!!

FE1LEnwRqZ6qwDNdiEzW7w.text: Sushi + AYCE = my favorite equation of all time. I decided to try Sushi Kaya off a couple of recommendations I had received from friends. Upon entering, my boyfriend and I were happily greeted by the employees, and seated at a nice sized table.   Upon first glance, the menu seemed similar to places like Yama, with a lot of roll and nigiri options. In addition to those, they had skewers, appetizers, and desserts as well. After we had received our first order, the service kind of slowed down for us. In their defense they were kind of busy, but after waiting for what felt like 15 minutes to give our next order, it kind of started to annoy me.   As for the sushi.. The nigiri tasted fresh, but was a lot smaller in comparison to what I've received at other restaurants like Goyemon or Yama. This can be a good or bad thing depending on what type of sushi eater you are. I eat mainly nigiri, since rolls aren't really my thing, so I prefer more substantial sized pieces. I do recommend you try the cajun albacore though, you won't regret it!  Sushi Kaya is a good AYCE option here in Vegas.. it's just not the best.

ZDbsphlnAKt3QK37IC7IxQ.text: Perfect place love the food and gilt how help us was so nice and really professional she make us to feel good and enjoy the best plates from the Manu thanks Michael ,, we need you in this restaurant forever ;)

Pu9fnTXJjquVBmOUta1mDw.text: Surprisingly very good quality All You Can Eat sushi in the middle of the desert! I always have skepticism when it comes to eating Seafood, especially raw fish in a city that isn't right next to the ocean. I forget food can get sent anywhere.   Came with a party of 12 during dinner on a Saturday with no reservations. We lucked out because the private room was just leaving and we didn't even have to wait! Ordered a gazillion Nigiris, special rolls, tempura, skewers, soft shell crab, poke, appetizers all on the first run. The waiter was so good, didn't even miss a beat and got us all our food super quick. We could barely keep up as the Nigiris kept coming. The sweet shrimp, uni, yellowtail, ono, scallop, salmon and albacore tuna were not bad! Especially the uni, I usually hate uni because it has this weird lingering taste but this uni was mildly sweet and tasted fresh.   This was like Man vs. Food and I'm embarrassed to admit that we tapped out after the 2nd round. Food always win. I managed to stuff 2 mochis at the end. Yum!!

HQJdn7aAIPB0jsx6THZ_pg.text: Service is horrible.   They just push your stuff out of their way when they bring stuff out and are not personable at all.    They also just throw stuff on the table and don't tell you what is what.    Definitely not leaving any kind of tip

The only feedback that I would give is that when you're ordering something from the kitchen like Edamame for example, it shouldn't take more than 10 minutes.  Also, I love that you have the option to order half orders of sushi! I'll definitely be back and would highly recommend this place!

BCmfjVPddpZY47eekZTPZQ.text: Great music, clean, awesome friendly service, wide selection of sushi. Top 5 in Vegas for sushi! Jan is an outstanding server, she's simply wonderfully attentive.

BYMbBrZGtEb93DhGQSCSiQ.text: Went to Sushi Kaya on Christmas Day with friends...all locals.  Seated at good table after short wait. Prompt and efficient service by helpful and knowledgeable waiter. Excellent food that came out quickly with good presentation. Although they were very busy there was no pressure to finish. Had a great time in a cozy environment. Have tried other all-you-can-eat sushi places but Sushi Kaya is the best.

84IfqyMHU3-CidbHYjvY4Q.text: I really liked this place as I ate $110 worth of sushi for $20 due to the all you can eat sushi lunch. And I thought the sushi was pretty good.

zQrJGDOsm1LjJ_RpNyucVA.text: WOW! This place is yummy! Try the Dynomite and Cinderella roll, so good.   The music isn't too good but not enough where it bugs me. Sevice is alright nothing to great, as long as they get me my food and serve me my drink I am happy. DELICIOUS!

X3QgWKN4Dwx-8hKhpFrA9Q.text: DECENT ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI...can't be that!  I'm a sushi lover myself. I can go for hours eating sushi, so fortunately to save myself from racking up possible $200+ bills worth of sushi, all you can eat sushi places like Kaya is where I would go. Their all you can eat menu has a good variety of sushi and rolls. They even have poke, which is strictly okay (flavoring). I do not like their bulgogi on the all you can eat menu because their meat is too soft and they throw in too much veggies with that little plate of beef.

mnQJWinbecSEH9QOF5Xh4w.text: Awesome deal for all you can eat. I came here for New Years Eve dinner and the staff totally took care of us. The food is fresh and quality is excellent. Don't order too much too fast. You can get the "eyes bigger than stomach" syndrome.

hsDvPul1E9dhQCfFzGsgnw.text: Food isnt that great, all you can eat sushi?? Sound good but the fish/meat was cut so thin that you can see through it.  Servers bad attitude & bad manner if u did not eat the rice (sushi rice)  this is not a all u can eat!!!  its more like all you have to eat!!!

2FjkmHZ6ogHyT1gnEJAkmQ.text: Went for dinner with family and friends.  Had a all you can eat sushi experience.  It was great and all of the sushi appetizers and deserts were fantastic.  The price was really worth it looking at the individual ala carte prices.  Mochi at the end was a real great experience and the ice cream was outstanding.

H6cilxCx622Yr0RwJvOoCw.text: Sushi was descent, nothing special from your ordinary sushi restaurant, but having the all you can  eat ordering is special. But for the price and kind of service you get here, I say it's not worth it. $25 a person isn't too bad but for sushi with dry rice and moderate to low quality fish, not worth coming back a second time around. And the service... Bad, terrible, horrendous, inadequate, lacking can barely describe the service I received. The waiter only came to our table twice to take orders and other waiters/waitresses just walked by and ignored every attempt we made to order more food, honestly you can get better service at a Mc Donald's than this place.

GJbnQMb6OZvwYpBz99N9mg.text: I love this place! Ive been here a few times and have always left happy. The food is great, the nigiris are fresh and delicious. I loved almost everything i tried. The crab is imitation crab, which wasnt specified in the menu. That is the only negative comment i have about this place. Make sure to make reservations as they are always packed and good luck finding parking.

hCqgDdRmcTy5qM38aDKueA.text: Very poor customer service. After we were seated NO ONE came to take my drink order for a good 20 minutes. I had to finally flag down a waitress and she acted like she had no idea what was going on. Hi, I'm a guest at your restaurant and I would like for you to take my order. Still confused? Since I figured I would be forgotten about again after our drinks came, I immediately took this opportunity to put in my order for AYCE.  The first round of sushi came up one item short. When I asked if it was coming I was told that it should be on it's way... After another ten minutes I ask again and this time she says she has to put in the order again for the missing item. Gr8.   After I got the missing item and I finished everything in the first round, I'm ready for round two but unfortunately our waitress didn't feel the need to come back to our table for another 20 minutes after we finished. I tried staring her down to get her attention but she would not even look over to the direction if our table! Ever! Like wtf isn't the waitresses job to make sure her tables are doing okay? She never came over and asked once. Finally when I got her attention I ordered a second round and guess what? This time TWO items were missing. Where is my sushi? I waited and waited and it never came out so I again flagged down the waitress since she was ignoring the table and she said she would check on it. She came back to say the ticket was lost and she would have to put in the order again. GR88888!!!! How hard is it to put in a ticket and pick up the sushi from the bar and bring it to the table in a timely manner? Apparently very hard.   This was my third and final time trying Kaya. Each experience has been worse than the last so I'm going to stop coming here. I tried to give you a second and third chance but you blew it! :(  Only giving two stars because I ate all the sushi and although it wasn't the best, I still enjoyed the food :) NOT the service!

n0ozvtXymi-2tkKRmZ5dIA.text: I am absolutely disgusted. I found a bug in one of my rolls today and all they had to say was sorry. I showed them the roll and they took it back and told me they notified the manager. A manager NEVER came to speak with me at all. I didn't yell at the staff and because I didn't yell they were "courteous" enough to give me a 15% discount on my bill.... I believe finding a bug in your food should automatically be a free meal.. not to mention I have been sick all day. You could not pay me to go back to this place. Absolutely disgusted. Complete waste of money. Thanks Sushi Kaya...

cLlrq2ZzGJ8wi3kZSJsDvw.text: Very good for acye sushi! I believe it's Korean owned, or at least we were greeted in Korean when we walked in.  There are some AYCE sushi places that can make you feel as if you're "overstaying or overeating" your welcome, but this place did not have that vibe.  Great place, will visit again when I return to Vegas!

kd-P7HgknGZTt4fLGUrd9w.text: This is my favorite AYCE Sushi. I've been coming here 3 years, I've been to several spots around town from Henderson, East Side West side. This is the best.

af8-t2aDMpSQdG5P_PKB4w.text: Like Ted Williams, this place ALWAYS hits the spot. Best in town (probably state).

-JBAk418c8dhDhLkKafNEw.text: This place is amazing,  huge selection,  fish is rediciously fresh.  Service was very good as well.  Everyone was so nice.  I was able to make a reservation.  Try the yellowtail nigri! I've eaten at many many Sushi places and this one was one of my favorites.

97x0xRy1w4nTswK2ZIIhQg.text: This place is da bomb and if anyone says otherwise they're taste buds must be fakd. They said my review was too short so its 10/17/15. And I'm waiting on them to have space. And I'm jelly of everyone ahead of me.

kJG9oGSkPeerosiGiO6UEg.text: Hands down my new favorite sushi spot. Our waitress Yuri was fucking awesome! Good food, good vibes, good looking waitress...5 stars all the way. Yuri if you ever see this, me and my boys ate here last week around the time you guys were getting ready to close. We were sitting at the table closest to the cash register, 4 very tatted white guys...you told us how you were originally from San Francisco and the reason why you thought we got along so well was because we're both not from here and that people from Vegas grew up breathing different air lol. Not only was she very attentive, she had an amazing sense of humor and was cracking jokes with us all night. She was a blast, if you guys ever get the chance ask to be seated in Yuri's section. You won't regret it. She's the gorgeous Asian waitress with a septum nose ring, which my homies and I thought she pulled off better than any other chick out there. Awesome girl, super friendly and bubbly.   Sexbomb, cowboy, and jose were my favorite rolls. we asked Yuri what was her favorite and her answer was "anything deep-fried. life is better deep-fried"   Definitely recommend this place!

GaIPGQIxcBsCYawSMTKilg.text: Went to Sushi Kaya yesterday and took a few friends from out of town. I had been here before a while back and don't eat sushi too often. My friends loved it! They are frequent sushi eaters and said it was some of the best they ever had! I couldn't complain I had the sexy roll and I thought it was awesome.. the cilantro sauce was pretty good too. Great service the bussers helped out as much as our own waitress!

YdUDNDazY3pzIo4_QvYbOw.text: In addition to my bad review for Kaya, a shocking discovery was made when I checked out my bank statement. Kaya was not only slow during our lunch hour visit, forgotten an item, served frozen lemons with our waters, they actually managed to charge twice on my credit card and didn't charge my friend's credit card. Seriously!!?? How confusing is a Wells Fargo credit card versus a Bank of America Credit card!! She had 3 tables in the whole restaurant, during our meal (should I even call it a meal?). Apparently to the Kaya server, it is as confusing as black and white.  Willful stupidity absolutely makes me livid!  So, I phoned the manager and asked to be credited ASAP. She talked me into coming down and accepting cash for the duplicate charge.  After patiently waiting for 15 minutes inside the restaurant, I began feeling strangulated because of strong emotion that reminded me of my horrible eating experience!   Additionally, the manager had the nerve to ask for my friend's contact information so she can properly charge him on his credit card! The frozen lemons, welted vegetables and rancid sushi must have gotten to her crazy head!  Gracefully grabbing my cash from her hand, my look of despair and silence concluded her query!!   One great thing out of this is that my out of town friend had a free horrible lunch which I don't mind paying for....

D5joaTdDG_QzWIrSZiAfQg.text: DISRESPECTFUL, HORRIBLE SERVICE. Do not waste your money and time here.  My bf and I went here to have a late night dinner together after a long days work. Ichiza was busy so we decided to come and try this place out. We got seated and our server jayden came by to get our drink order. After he got out drinks, we proceeded to make an order to do the all you can eat. We informed him of both our food allergies which for him is shellfish and mine is capsaicin. When he first heard this he laughed at us. We asked him to make sure that nothing we get has shellfish or peppers. He told us he would make sure but we have to read the description on the menu too. We agreed to that. We got our first order in and our salmon skin salad had chili In it. We sent it back and this server gladly took it back. Note that this dining experience we probably had to talk to 5 different people. When we were ready to put in a second order we had a hard time catching an employee's attention to order. We could not order from our server jayden because he was too busy eating at the bar table in front of us.   Finally we got the attention of the manager (jayden told us his name was Leo) and informed him of our capsaicin and shellfish allergy. He laughed at us also. We asked him if they would be able to make us a special roll with just fish/rice/vegetables due to our allergies and he didn't want to do that and suggested something on the menu. So we took his suggestion and ordered it. It got to our table and it had the immigration crab meat in it. My bf having the shellfish allergy did not feel comfortable eating it so I ate it for him and I removed the crab meat. Leo comes back and says.."why did you not eat it. I told you it was OK to eat. Since you took out the crab meat we normally charge but we will let it slide by". He kept hounding us about why we didn't eat the crab meat to a point where I got frustrated with him and he just said " its OK I won't charge you for it". Honestly, its not about the money and you letting it slide by, it's about our health. After I got frustrated with Leo, jayden comes back again and says "good job". Basically for getting mad at his manager.   Plates were just stacking up on our table and they were not getting cleared. After we got the roll with crab meat in it we asked another server to take it back because of the shellfish allergy and he said " oh I'm not the one who took your order." then we asked him if he knew what shellfish was and he said no. So we just told him never mind.   We finally made our final order of beef skewers. We asked jayden what was in it and he basically looked at us and said duh beef. So we said we know beef obviously but what kind of beef and what kind of seasonings on it. He didn't know and didn't seem like he wanted to ask the kitchen. So we put the order in and the beef skewers were mixed in the same plate as the bacon wrapped scallops when it got to the table. So then my bf couldn't even eat that because it got cross contaminated.   We asked for the check and Leo the manager basically just dropped the check book and didn't say a word. They took it, gave us the check book back without saying anything. As we were about to leave,.. I waved down jayden and asked him what his managers name was. He said Leo? And I said it again.. What is your managers name and he hesitated and said leo and said... "Are you going to yelp us?" I didn't answer and just said thank you. Just him asking us if we were going to yelp them was obvious that he knew we had a very bad dining experience.   Never have I dined in a place where the servers and managers laughed at us. They tried to make us feel bad for not feeling comfortable eating something because of a food allergy. They tried to make us feel worse and say "oh we normally charge but we will let it slide by" when they are the ones that made the mistake. Servers were not knowledgeable about the menu. We had 5 different people take our order. They did not take us seriously. They were so disrespectful and honestly I can say I will never eat at that place again and will never recommend anyone to eat there. They should not be in the restaurant business. The foh shouldn't be at least.   Oh and be careful getting out of the seats on the opposite side of the bar. The lights are so low and in the walkway, I hit my head on it twice. I'm only 5 foot 4 inches too.

v3EP-jJBDEsLv_e65SiKoQ.text: Went here on the recommendation of this lady from a nail salon on the strip who did my manicure. Best sushi ever and the price is unbeatable. All you can eat for $20. Its made fresh and they have a really big menu of specialty rolls that they make. Definitely worth the drive off the strip to go here. Can't wait to go to vegas again so that I can eat here.

DupL_d7r2xcrBNk8OgCGPQ.text: Came with a friend and his girlfriend on their recommendation about 2 weeks ago for AYCE cuz they said it was the best in town.   We all ordered the all you can eat and began indulging in skewers, rolls, nigiri and just about everything. The food was just okay to me and on numerous occasions our server forgot a few of our items. For the same price for AYCE I would rather go to Sumo Sushi 2, and it's much closer to my house. The friends I went with who were raving about this place before we got there had even said the food wasn't as good this time around. Atmosphere is cool, young and trendy with some good music playing. Not cool enough to get me to go back for AYCE though... Would only go back if I was invited by friends again. Nobody in Vegas can dethrone Sumo Sushi 2 for "Best AYCE in Vegas" in my honest opinion!

ER5EzGFdM4Kch10nU2Om9g.text: OMG! always amazing. This is a "local's" spot. we in the industry come here at least once a week!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jose roll. Amazing.

xYeBrX9KUHzW-9rfeZ_M6w.text: Decent AYCE restaurant but always seems to be really busy when I go now which causes the food quality, presentation, and appearance to look sloppy and bad. The restaurant to me feels like it has good downhill compared to other sushi bars/restaureants (i.e hard to get a server, furniture looks beat up, place looks disarranged, bathroom is a mess) Place needs a remodel/makeover.

oqhGQgeowy_b-7AwtBUnvw.text: First off, go with all you can eat!!! Good fresh sushi...everything was good, good menu choices, etc  The thing keeping it from being 5 stars is slow service (I think it was because I was eating too much) plus the lady kept asking me if I was sure, yes now bring the sushi!  The other thing was they don't offer half roles...this is key for all you can eat. I like to sample & not be committed to a whole role (ya so I have committment issues haha) My favorite spot sushi Mon on Maryland/silverado is still the best but about $27 for dinner. For the value this is a close 2nd, Kaya is only $22

IXVp-s_G0jO9pJl-pue4qg.text: Definitely within the top 3 of my personal opinion of the best all you can eat sushi places in Vegas! I absolutely love their fresh sushi!! The only reason I give it 4 stars instead if 5 is because I've been there several times when they are short staffed and so even though there are plenty of open tables they won't seat you for 15-20 min!

cv7WBZna7IjhQF1azBA0SQ.text: I went yesterday with my girl since she has never been there before. We both got the all you can eat deal for $26.00. She started with the teriyaki chicken and I started with the spring mountain roll. She liked her first meal and I liked mine. She had a good time trying different foods and eating off my plate. The bad thing is that if you don't finish your plate they charge you for it. But we both liked our food, all of it tasted good. Had flavor. Our waitress didn't really interact with us at all, so that part sucked. But the service was on time and no complaints from wait time or food.

RaoWuQX9LOtKIk0odKWl-Q.text: The AYCE sushi for $24.95 is such a great deal and you can pretty much order ANYTHING on the menu.  The sushi is good and I gave this place 4 stars because I wouldn't say it's GREAT, but it's definitely good.  There are about 20 special rolls, but they are all very similar with only slight differences.  The nigiri is smaller in both rice and fish than normal, but that's good because you don't want to get full off of just one thing when there is so much to try.  The Spider Roll was the best roll we had here.  It was fresh and warm and so delicious.  I'm not a big fan of their ponzu sauce, which seems to be on everything.  We tried a piece of the cajun albacore. YUCK is all I can say.  The cajun seasoning tastes like something that should be left to grilled pork chops or steak, NOT fish.    The one thing that REALLY blew my mind was the Kimchi Fried Rice.  It's so amazing and delicious.  I know you may think you don't want to eat rice when you go for AYCE sushi, but if there is one thing you need to try, it's that.  It's a small bowl with a fried egg on top and it's EFFING yummy.    The service was fast and super friendly.  Had a great experience and would definitely go back.

lH54scH4oebdI9kB54VYaw.text: Accidentally found Sushi Kaya , turned out to be an amazing gem.   Best sushi buffet ever

DRSPFfbUfydMWVcpbwQ82w.text: Parking sucks but the food is fantastic and quick made to order sushi. Not to mention you can get sushi at 3 in the morning..  life is good..

0chndJlD8QVtZ8XbXFS1PA.text: By far the best all you can eat sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. The menu has so many options of signature rolls you can order. Nowhere else in Vegas can you get unlimited orders of a selection of 20+ signature rolls.  The atmosphere is very relaxed and the service is exceptional. I've taken a lot of friends here for special occasions and we all enjoyed it. Hopefully this place stays in business for many years to come.

FSnyMWwDc-ernEZf-ybzhg.text: I don't have medical proof that I got food poisoning but I'm like dying the day after I had All You Can Eat Sushi that night in Vegas... And after a few days now I can still feel this feeling of poison in my body... Just wanna warn people that are going maybe u can have better choices.. PLUS: I waited a good 40 minutes to be seated and ended up getting so sick... I'm feeling throwing up right now....

j0ArGYQXQNw5VSeo4U6mbA.text: This place is great.  Staff is always nice and helpful.  I just wish they played more Kpop and Jpop.

NF9ZyWDNPQGpYEb5H0KWdg.text: $20 all you can eat special and everything is fantastic. This will be my go to sushi place each time I visit Vegas. Staff is very polite, chefs are excellent. It's a tucked away gem.

YIvb7ePKhKC2GZGPaUnkYA.text: Nice place for a quick sushi fix. Great smiling staff and wait service. All you can eat sushi I believe for $22 def worth it. I ordered tons of nigiri all bite size you can chew without looking like you stuffed your face. The fish was not smelly tasted fresh to me. Uni was too soggy though. I didn't smell like food after I left in case you wanted to know and go out to the strip to party. The green tea and strawberry ice cream is bomb too doesn't taste like it's been left in the freezer for a long time hah

ogGmaiCCeCiUDi3BxNsdWw.text: One of the "alrights." Their nigiri sushi is always fresh. The slices of fish are on the small side but I've never eaten a bad roll here. Once, I ordered a Caterpillar roll and they actually made it look like a caterpillar. :) sweet guys behind the sushi bar!! Kaya has an awesome variety of sushi and appetizers. They have the best baked mussels in town and they even have a number of grilled skewers and Korean foods on their AYCE menu. Bulgogi, kimchi fried rice.  This place is great to come with a friend, by yourself, or with a group. The servers here are very nice as well! My friends and I have had 3 group events here and the girls remember us! Then again, How could they not, we're loud and rowdy when we get together and the group room is outfitted with tambourines and karaoke!!   Splitting checks is NOT a problem here! They'll do it 13 ways if they have to. So for parties, don't stress about splitting the bill!

fap0dlweHaZ-qFnFOfPSJQ.text: Best place to get sushi late!!!  Best Rolls:  Brooklyn* Sex bomb Crazy orgasm (fresh) Cinderella roll* White Vegas Wall Street * (rapongi)  Kaya roll (fresh)

hoCq_UyVvxEP-ao6uJAgEg.text: For a Tuesday night we had to wait for 45 minutes so we didn't get seated until 10:15. They were great about texting us when our table was almost ready and bringing all of our orders out really fast. We were there for all you can eat and had no complaints about anything we ordered. Waitress was good with coming to check on us frequently so we were able to keep ordering through our meal. We never had to sit and wait for the food to be brought out for more than a few minutes. Overall, fantastic sushi and service !!

Dy97jtfHGoPKHNiFqe9V4g.text: This is one of my favorite sushi places for all you can eat. All of their baked rolls are scrumptious and I wish I had a larger stomach capacity just to eat all of their specialty rolls. The buttons on the table help get servers attentions, but sometimes service is a bit slow. For the most part it's a wonderful place whose stamp cards I actually fill up regularly.

1gh61fD1VnZzc3ki89FRJg.text: Being in Colorado, there isnt really any sushi place i like here. Coming from Hawaii, the standards were pretty high. An okd friend told me about this place so we went and i had a blast!!! The food was soooo good. Sexy roll and viagra roll is my fave!! LOL

zKTM-uflPY92FH9tiHbSZA.text: Writing this as I WALK OUT. This place was horrible and the service was even worse. It's approximately 2am, food is bad and servers are rude.

M891Y9P5Qz6wcYGB3UmbGA.text: This was my favorite sushi restaurant for the last 6 or so years. We loved it so much that we would eat here sometimes twice a week. The food was so fresh and the recipes were the best in our eyes. No one prepares the dynamite appetizer the way they did. The service was usually really good. And Leo was the best server we have ever encountered.  With that said if you want some of the tastiest sushi around go here, at your own risk though. The last time we ate here I got food poisoning really bad, for 3 days. Also I was burping fish the whole time. That was the worst food poisoning I ever had.  So if you eat here. Good luck  Get me sick once, shame on you. Get me sick twice, shame on me for being an idiot for giving them another chance. The sushi isn't so fresh and is sometimes room temperature. That's pretty gross and unsanitary. Surprised no one has died from this disgusting place.

LzxLlwWa5ZayBODkdCuTsw.text: FOOD POISONING - FOOD POISONING - FOOD POISONING!!!  If you like food poisoning and want a nice little cleanse for your stomach, then come here. Otherwise, avoid like the Black Death medieval plague.   I'm usually not one for AYCE, but I was meeting up with friends that I had not seen in a very long time, so I thought why not.   There was a group of 6 of us.  The service was good and we were told that any food left over on the table would be an extra charge. This includes eating just the sushi and leaving any excess rice.   We ordered rolls, baked rolls, skewers, nigri, the works.  We all ate until we were all pretty full, got some mochi ice cream, paid, then left.   1 day passes* - I had a really hard time getting to bed and getting a good night's rest and felt really noxious. It felt like it came out of no where.   I had pizza for dinner with a friend that was visiting the states for the first time the evening before and had thought that it was the culprit that caused my non-stop barfing and diarrhea. I cancelled all of my plans for the day and decided to make the drive back to San Diego. The drive was an absolute endearing struggle.   After returning to health two days later, I spoke with my friend and found out that the AYCE sushi was the one to blame afterall since EVERYONE THAT ATE IT GOT SICK.   Stay away from this place. Your stomach will thank you. Consider yourself warned.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skewers
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crunch roll
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked scallop roll. The scallop seemed like it wasn&#39;t completely cooked.

mlenuyOmicCyrIos2VALqA.text: After eating at multiple sushi AYCE across many Vegas neighborhoods, starting to get a feel of each one.  The last visit was at Sushi Kaya in the heart of Chinatown.  On the plus side, lunch is a bargain at $19.99 and average for dinner at $24.99.  Service is very prompt, you will be visited often by the wait staff to take your order and the food comes back in about 5 minutes or less.  The sushi is decent, not exactly fresh, but pretty good for AYCE.  Their poke is a must order it's sashimi with ocean seaweed salad, (limited to one order per person).  Their BBQ skewers are typically not offered in AYCE sushi.  On the minus side, they charge $2.00 for hot green tea, you should order soda instead.  It's crazy busy during prime time, expect a long wait of one hour of more.

rthIencPzAI01WOzb899uQ.text: This place used to be my absolute favorite in town. But after today and getting sick from The Japanese Lasagna Roll. The cream cheese was sour. Made me sick . I've been going to this place for years. Today was my last time setting foot in that place.

g1YGboFUpWZPGhVZF0oMMA.text: Parking is limited so you would have to park next door if you need to (Chinatown mall).  There's a long wait in the evening but this only validates the fact that the foods are fresh (always rotated and replaced) and other people loves this place too.  I have never met anything on their menu that I didn't like. Everything is delicious!  This is the only place that I could proudly say where I can get my money's worth with the AYCE! Hehe  Some of the servers come off sarcastic because they see that I could eat a lot and I order too many foods so there's that face and the question of "anything else?" which I find very amusing.  They bring me my foods and they're perfect and that's all I care about!

nqklfa-MPC5gWEz4SXBpMw.text: My favorite all you can eat in China town LV i love Alaska roll, Jose roll, shrimp lover, skewers, etc.

NALEfvg6kPhYepLtYgSg2Q.text: I was torn between giving this place 3 stars and 4 stars. The reason I chose 3 was because although the food was above par, the service was not. We waited at our table for quite some time before someone came and asked us what we would like to drink. We ordered waters, and then a few minutes ago a different person came by to ask if we wanted something to drink. We ordered beers this time. Our beers came out relatively quickly but the waters never came out, we didn't realize this until our food came out. Again we waited for quite some time before we had to ask someone to come over and take our order. My friend doesn't like sushi and so he got a bunch of little appetizers. The rolls came out lightening fast but they just place them down on the table and mumble the name. Every time we had to stop them and ask them to repeat themselves, and tell us the name of the roll. The appetizers took forever for some reason and I felt bad because we were getting our sushi rolls but he wasn't even getting his miso soup. I don't think that the servers have assigned sections because different people were handling us the entire time. Every time we needed something we had to flag someone down.   Regardless of all this, the food was very tasty and the ambience was nice. Would go back again.

aL3bRuh3SRz84h2FzkfGiQ.text: First time trying this place and I have to say it was great. Taste, service and cost was good. Servers were really attentive. I can't however give them a five star review because the air was not working where we were sitting. Super hot and uncomfortable especially that it was crowded. I left  there needing a shower.

NIWRIUYi_5QtR1sPrYOX1w.text: This place came in 2nd for me otherwise I would have given it 5 stars. They always have pretty good service and food I did try a few things I didn't like but overall was still very good.   It was just a little difficult for me lately because I have to stay away from raw foods but overall.   However, I like that this place does come with one order of sashimi per person which is nice because I haven't seen very many places that do that!

ZhDFIl-Yvi_K6Rl_1lxB8Q.text: If you're a sushi fan like I am I would definitely would recommend this restaurant And I would definitely recommend for you to try the Shrek roll it's the only veggie roll on the menu and it is so delicious everything that we have tried I liked II cannot say there's not one row that I dislike
