_7AOiyyZU8UAkA4OQfGFGg.text: I'm going to suspect the one star reviews is from kaya competitors. I work in Vegas about 4 times a year and I take my staff here for our fanali dinner. Just outstanding. Solid. We've been doing this for years. They have never disappointed us.  Fabulous rolls. My favorite is sex bomb and crunch roll. Starting with oh so fresh himachi and uni. Order half rolls as u have to eat what u order. Seriouly, $25 all u can eat. U can't beat it. Kaya deserve 5 stars hand down and the 1 star reviewers should be ashamed of themselves for playing dirty.

h2OdYxxeXU7YELvv6GWs7g.text: This place has been on a steady decline for a few months now. I went here with my family last weekend and asked for a table for 12. They told me it would be between 35-50 minutes, so I called my family and told them when to arrive. The server gave me a call about ten minutes later and said our table was ready. No big deal, I called my family and told them to head there now. I was seated before my family arrived and when the waiter greeted my girlfriend and I, he was not only super rude, but told me he needed to "make sure that there would actually be 12 people showing up." Really? Starting off my meal accusing me of fabricating my table amount for some asinine reason? As annoying as that was, he at least got us our drinks but every two minutes he kept frantically running back to our table area, look in, aggressively shake his head, and then run out without saying anything. He did this about five times before my family got there. Afterwards, he tried rudely and abruptly taking our order before we had a chance to review the menu and make our choices. After we placed our initial order he mysteriously disappeared altogether and a different set of staff began taking our orders. The food was decent but has absolutely taken a turn for the worse over recent months, and the drink refills were sparse at best. We have been coming here for two years and won't be back again. Management needs to do better and that server should look into a different industry if he's going to provide such atrocious service to guests that are paying large tabs and tips.

1Uyqv4KCF9La6JWCcSOdnQ.text: Sushi kaya is hands down my favorite "All you can eat Sushi" restaurant in Las Vegas. I've been coming here for quite awhile now and refer all my friends and family.   Must order when I'm here: -Alaskan Roll (no eel sauce) -Cajun Albacore extra extra serried  -Cinderella Roll (no eel sauce) -Edamame Steam -Baked Mussel -Beef, Shrimp & Scallop sticks  -Udon Soup -Mango Mochi       OMG make sure you ask for ponzu sauce. Sooooo yummy!

-1akFzSGP011prqn_hRqmg.text: We love this place!  Every time we come even on a busy night the service is on point.  Poke salad, skewers, and a long list of rolls to choose from even desert if you have room.  Great food great price!  We are usually coming in for dinner hours and we have had to wait to be seated for 15-30 min.  The wait is torture lol but it's worth it.

yavt0eZAliA4WpN_9cfHhw.text: This review is long overdue--- This is the best sushi in Vegas. That's it. It's salmon is phenomenal, the Cinderella and volcano roll are unbelievable. Just go.

SeQI6nuAoBuutv5PblPiWA.text: Great sushi, fast and friendly staff, very knowledgeable.   Atmosphere was fast paced and lively.  Everything we ordered was fresh and tasty.  My husband doesn't care for sushi but there was plenty of items on the menu to please his appetite.  Was my 1st time in China town and i'm just sorry I didn't go there before.  100's of restaurants to choose from

i9cvpiFH-b2UyO6R5ONisw.text: Good food , but menus need to be replace, they are old and dirty , gresse also, the manager asian men there seens in a rush always, a smile will be nice before he take my order, i will comeback anyways, i hope he inproves his mood!!

COi-bPrNKFYzvcfDBrWbhQ.text: Super fire. Worth the wait. Fast paced. Cinderella roll and Whos Your Dad roll my top 2's. Get some son.

0ldCZ6O2Kd9hkemukehvSQ.text: I am a die hard sushi fever lover! It's really a shame that sushi fever doesn't have all you can eat so I've heard from multiple friends about sushi kaya and how great there all you can eat is!! The menu has so much to choose from and is not only sushi all you can eat but includes appetizers skewers noodles and rice!! So worth it!!! The desert is delicious and although the waiter takes a little to reorder it was an all around experience

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

I1e8yFlJOyDICRK97ion4A.text: -This place has all you can eat sushi!  -delicious and fast service - price is approximately $22 for lunch and dinner is approximately $27 -all you can eat is for 90 minutes and they will charge you for wasting food  -all you can eat includes appetizers, sushi rolls however they limit you to one mochi or ice cream dessert  -sushi options include both simple and complex rolls.  -open until 3 am so its a great option for that late night sushi fix!!

Tr5hDndoynX_miSU__6Sbw.text: Food was GREATTTT but service is TERRIBLE!!! We had an appointment and still waited for at least 30 min. To be seated! It is all you can eat but for you to order takes another 30min and they are rude! And to top it off they charged my card 3 times!

BH0RSGCz3qy5lfdgyupP4A.text: This is probably the best meal in an "all you can eat". A hidden not so hidden gem. Definitely coming back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp tempura, uni sashimi...

IqBvww9JWS2GXkSBpdYfVw.text: I took my girlfriend out for her first time to eat sushi and she fell in love with the first roll,but later on during our meal we noticed that a piece of mushroom had bugs crawling on all Over it (they appear to be roaches). At least they tried to help us with a 20% discount and didn't charge us for the untouched food since we were disgusted. The staff was nice I just wonder how the food is prepared behind the scenes.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bugs on mushroom

e5poKK9kgHCjQbGUtG5g-Q.text: Sushi Kaya used to be the best spot for AYCE sushi in town but after they started becoming popular the service and food had gone downhill. My boyfriend and I went a week ago on a Sunday and they weren't that busy yet but service was slow. Our order took 30 minutes to get to our table and when it came the fish were dry and the sushi rice on our rolls are so hard. We let it go and did not say anything because it was the first time that happened to us but 3 days later I went back with my little brother and the same thing happened. No one assisted us, no one gave ua condiments and plates. Our server even ended being on the bar because they were short handed and orders are being backed up.   Food and fish were the same. The nigiri are dry and so does the rice. You can tell they have been sitting there. We ordered Alaska roll because that's our favorite. It's normally in a foil because they are baked but this time they were just on the plate which made us think that they didn't bake it.   4 days later, I came back with my boyfriend which makes it today ( March 23, 2019 ) service was so horrible. We had to wait 30 mins for someone to come and get our order. Forgot to give us our plates, had to ask twice. Same thing happened with the Alaska roll, rice is hard asf that you cannot eat. It tasted disgusting! 2 orders of Baked Mussels took 45 minutes because they forgot to put in when that's one of the first food we ordered because we knew it takes awhile. I was so pissed that I went to the manager and explained what was going on. Told her how unhappy I am because of the service they've been giving us when my boyfriend and I are regulars. We come at least once or twice a week but after tonight, I think we are done with Sushi Kaya for awhile.   Fish and service has gone downhill.  Fish are dry. Rolls are bland and presentation are rushed because they are busy. Such a disappointment!   Servers, bussers and chefs does not care about the customers anymore! Only thing that I can say positive is the hostess but other than that everything else is 0.

6onP_ItZJgmvWtQiF0AdTA.text: Great late night sushi spot! Went here with some co-workers after a late night shift one day. I got the Shrek roll, which is the vegan friendly roll. It was delicious.   Pros: vegetarian/vegan option, great late night spot with accommodating hours for people who work in the industry, and hip music that isn't boring!     Cons: long waits, small space   Tips: This place is always busy! I would recommend calling ahead of time to put your name on the waiting list.

moG-3qkhk-kD_ZJ0e-3ydw.text: My favorite sushi place!! You have to be prepared for a long waiting list but other than that I love everything!! Cinderella roll my favorite roll, dynamite, baked mussels,tuna poke, my favorite appetizers

ASdBspCqDEj_V8sKvZCYSw.text: Came here for a birthday meal. The food was so good and the staff were really good at recommending certain items. We ordered few bits at the time and our server always made sure that our empty plates were clear and that we had food on the table or on its way.  The only complaint is that one of our party went to use the bathroom and there was a lady there that kept trying to touch her and hug her, she felt very uncomfortable and another lady who walked in had to intervene. When we reported this to the staff they apologised but didn't seem overly bothered. The lady that intervened however was lovely and cake over to make sure she was okay.  If you want value for money sushi, this is a place to go. Would definitely recommend to others and will be back.

nsJukp-uPeZoNC3YBcNglQ.text: Maybe I'm wrong but shouldn't raw sushi and nigiri be served below room temperature? I used to love Sushi Kaya when i first moved to Vegas but tonight's experience was underwhelming and lackluster. Most of my rolls were served almost warm (and I'm not talking baked or fried rolls). The service from greet to farewell wasn't bad, but it was clear that no one was thrilled to entertain the basics of their jobs-ie.) be warm and inviting to guests. Bathrooms I will say we're clean enough-but the hallway leading to them was not. I used to be shocked when people would tell me not to go here, but I'm so understanding as to why now. There is a surplus of ayce sushi in this town and this one is now near the bottom of my list. They did just open a sister store Sushi Zone that I enjoyed and will use as an option in the future.

rC8Ux5CLEzXMgAeR6HqeBg.text: Amazing place! The food is delicious and the waiters are really nice (and really cute). I recommend a volcano roll with a Sapporo. The atmosphere is very ombre and appealing. This is a place I Definitely recommend for dinner and lunch. It's also kid friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cG8iU2FE3A2Sl2pCLEVAQg.text: If I could give 0 stars, I would.  My family was seated at the bar.  During dinner @ around 9:00 pm on March 15, 2019 (posting time for the owner to look at the security cameras); one of the sushi chef's accidentally hits a large metal box over the bar.  The box came crashing down hitting my father in the face, hand, and landed in his food.  Being that the box was metal, everyone around us looked our way.   The sushi chef proceeded to laugh and said an unapologetic sorry to us with a smile.  We had to ask the hostess to come over to assist us because NONE of the busser's nor service staff came over.  The hostess changed his sauce tray and gave my father a tea.  My dad just decided to finish eating.  We assumed the tea was given as a way to say sorry.  Mind you, the sushi chef did not even speak to us all dinner.  If you ever eat at a sushi bar, it is just super uncomfortable when the chef doesn't even speak to you, since he's right there in front of you.  It wasn't until the bill came and we saw that they charged us for the tea that we finally decided to call a manager over.    After explaining the incident to the manager, he said it was just an accident and that he'll take care of us.  The manager didn't even apologize to us.  After the manager leaves, the sushi chef begins to slam plates down basically throwing a fit.  The bill came back with just the tea removed.  We were done and wanted to just leave at this point.  Absolutely nothing was done for us, we've received horrible service, and was put in an uncomfortable environment all dinner for a mistake the sushi chef caused, which injured my father.

jEcXgqrpah92l6Jbm_eqhQ.text: Open late for that sushi craving that hits in the middle of the night. I'm a bit wary of all-you-can-eat joints, but Kaya is definitely an exception! My party and I had to wait half an hour for a table at nine pm, but the wait was well worth it. They have some phenomenal special rolls...the Sex Bomb was the bombdiggity for sure!! My only criticism was the bathroom needed a sweep (and to be honest, an upgrade!)   We had a super attentive server and the catered to our every request.  The staff in general was friendly and seemed genuinely happy to be there, judging by their smiling faces.  After dinner we headed to the Noraebong across the way. We came out two hours later to see Kaya still packed with a wait...and it was after midnight! That says A LOT to me about the popularity and quality of this restaurant...it obviously goes way beyond our visit!

7afclBzpjT5o3uo-QUiJOQ.text: This place is truly horrible. It's hard to stress the incompetence of the management. Trust me when I say, you will be blamed for any mistakes made with your food and or delivery of the food. I was very upset when I first realized just how rude the expediter were being. Then I had fun with it. I won't go any further but my goal was to irritate them as much as possible.   Just pass on this place. Really not worth your time. The food is good. The price is fair but the service is the absolute worst. The service out weighs the good food and fair price by far.

kNDyu4AH9je-iBPhIzmbUg.text: This is one of my favored sushi spots in Vegas. High quality sushi with an affordable all you can eat option. Leo has taken care of us several times. He is always in a good mood with a smile on his face and makes sure what we order is always just how we like it. Close to the strip and open late.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon wrapped scallops and shrimp
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon fashion, sex bomb, xxx, white tuna, garlic tuna, salmon
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dynamite roll

ehktcov1qQizNQxFHr-4xA.text: This place is one of my to go places for sushi. To be honest they mess up my orders every time I go like getting another table's order. (Three visits) but I like the variety of what they offer.  I LOVE their beef sticks (1 order per person). The sushi is good I'm not an expert. I just wish they were more organized with great bing orders.

N6yxEf8BKXyOEmjLLKwpZw.text: This place gets good reviews and everyone I talk to says the sushi here is amazing. My friend and I decided to try it out last night. It was packed this was probably around 8pm. When we walked inside there was not much room to stand and wait, it was VERY loud in there. I could barely here myself think. When we got sat down at the sushi bar the bar was VERY stinky like a busser couldn't of wiped it down before we were seated. I don't remember our waitress name but she had a tattoo behind her ear I'm pretty sure it was birds. She was rude to us she had a constant attitude about everything and rolled her eyes several times..   My friend order the "Who is your dad" roll and I ordered the " Viagra roll". Her roll was mushy it wasn't what she thought she ordered and she didn't want it no more but the service was shitty and our waitress never came around to check on us for her to be told. The Viagra roll was boring had no flavor to it whatsoever. We were just disappointed...   Apparently we had a new waiter come take care of us and my friend told him about the roll and that she was very disappointed with it and he said that he would take it off the check for us. He never did, so we had about 3 managers come take care of the situation. Nobody ever took it off the check our first waitress thought we were doing All you can eat when we said Al a carte. We paid $30 for 2 ROLLS! I've never paid that much for sushi before. We'll never come back to this place. Shitty service, shitty management, and shitty food. Normally at restaurants when a customer is unhappy they get reimbursed but not at this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UHGAQB_RymU2ez7y3-M_4g.text: Once again, love coming here... The sushi is so good and I just absolutely LOVE the Kaya Roll without avocado.  I came for Dinner and around 430pm and not so many people till hour later more people show up.. between 3-4pm is perfect time to come and eat great Sushi.    I had the Arizona Roll is so delicious and love the Garlic Tuna Nigiri plus the Ono Nigiri Aka White Tuna..

kwQ_fZlKp2RF_5HklSbaAg.text: Not bad place to eat really good and spicy not bad at all first time trying sushi kaya the price was good average it was a bit of things that were kind of a bummer was the selection of stuff was not that great and the portions are suppose to be small but not super small i got 4 pieces of calamari and our waitress needed to be a bit faster she was a bit slow service really enjoyed the food overall the hand job was a really funny and great selection check it out.
