iQ0PuBEPcpiwQHhXOa7hHg.text: Amazing best sushi place in Las Vegas the service the prices and the food absolutely fantastic thank you

49IiIYhHDw0Ewrz2C1424A.text: Have been going here for yeeaars! Have had a problem, the food is delicious and the customer service is amazing. Make sure you ask for a promo card!

6ragVsJM3Sfk6atZriE9YA.text: I've been a fan of sushi kaya for a good few years now, they're one of the three sushi places that I frequent and take friends to especially on late nights. They have quick service and of course great food.   I figured I will write this review a few weeks after my last visit because I hope they will if not have already fixed the issue. After our meal, while finishing up, we noticed a little cockroach crawl on the bar next to my friends hand. Now, we grew up in a third world country so these things are not the type of things that make us go nuts. So, quietly, I grabbed the little bugger with the napkin and told the busser about it. He saw it, apologized and left.  Now at this point I was expecting a manager to come by and apologize. They didn't. Again were used to bugs being around the dining table growing up so my friend and I continued to enjoy the afternoon and not make a big fuss about it. We paid our bill and left.   It wasn't until we were in the car when we realized that we should have done more. Spoken to a manager about it or something like that. So, what we did was call them and told a manager exactly what happened. We even told them that don't worry, we're not making a big deal out of it or want a free meal or anything, we just want you to do something about it.   This happens on August 12 or 11.

ci6mRDe_hLQJpZyuFijZTg.text: Sushi Kaya used to be one of my go to places in China Town. But, since they started pushing the AYCE option, the service and the food quality have gone WAY down. I had noticed that the fish had started tasting not as fresh, and the service had been starting to slip for a while now, but the last visit was so bad that I had to write about it. For starters, the staff was not organized. We kept getting asked, by five different waiters, what we wanted to order. We opted out of the all you can eat, so the we could relax & enjoy our meal, and take home leftovers. But, they didn't communicate with each other, so we kept getting interrupted by new people asking us what we wanted. The spicy tuna roll that we ordered was way too spicy, the ponzu sauce was too sour & not the citrusy tart flavor that it should've been, and the rice didn't stick together at all (Sushi Making 101). The staff were running into each other and the customers. Two employees were talking about going out & getting drunk on one side of me, on the other side, an Eastern European employee was trying, unsuccessfully, to hit on a waitress ("I don't bite...")  At the end of the meal, we were asking one waiter to bring us a box for our leftovers, while another came over and started dumping our food onto a tray to take away. At the end, the spicy tuna roll that I took home gave me an upset stomach. (never trust a fish that's been too overly spiced...) I personally will never go back there again. There are just too many BETTER sushi joints in Vegas to choose from.

RG25dqxncviKJM0mDW-QXw.text: I love this place! I'm pregnant now and can't go eat here but man I enjoy it so much. Their sushi quality is pretty amazing and fresh. I always get the all you can eat special and love their quick service.

L924NIK8vrmgPBVNwhxaQg.text: They got famous this week in dirty dining ch. 13. So sad this place went from the local #1 to -10 dirty dinning.

hRpUUnS09yiT7jGt0g_-JQ.text: I've been here twice and haven't found anything special about it. Servers seemed to be rushing me on both occasions. Except from when I ordered desert (I waited almost 10 minutes, and left without it). Rolls are ok, but not worth the 30 min wait to be seated.

94UZktOBnOGsLJhLdGgYyA.text: Mom nom nom snort snort yum! Came here for an epic off the strip buffet of sushi! Usually sushi buffets add god awful sauces to the rolls to make you lose your appetite quicker but this place makes ever roll small and delicious. I loved the skewers so much I want them over and over. They even have uni on the buffet menu like what?!?! Is this how heaven is? Next time I visit I will be back with an empty stomach ready to eat everything on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapple!

ueA4nZSgYW8-V5JJLYDv3w.text: This place offers a really good amount of tasty, quality sushi and sashimi at a very fair price.  I've eaten at most of the AYCE sushi joints in Las Vegas, this one is in the top 5 for sure.  Servers went above and beyond to make me happy.

YT9pTJGxFkjDZ7nq5xnEdA.text: I haven't been here in about a year or so, but I came here on a Thursday night and it was pretty good. They are ayce so I was ready to fill up my belly and hunger!   I liked their kitchen food better than the popular ones here since they had a variety of yakitori, sashimi (3pcs per person), more noodle dishes than average udon, and more.   For the first time ever, I couldn't try everything I wanted on the menu for ayce because I was too full. Usually I try everything that I want but my belly gave out on me... Will come back!   The service was good too or at least our server was. He was attentive and gave us suggestions. He even let us order more after closing although he could've easily said no.    5 stars for an ayce restaurant.

0MAPw4Hx4NYCg2FjRw6eqw.text: Hands Down my most favorite sushi place in Vegas. I usually go for the All You Can Eat during lunch. It's roughly $21.95.   The only cons I have is that they charged for our drinks ( I feel that drinks should be included), sometimes they take too long to take your next order so you are just waiting (which isn't terribly bad considering that it gives you time to digest a little in between rolls) and some of the items are limited like certain skewers and desserts (limited cheesecake, BOOO).  The pros are that you can order half rolls, which gives you an awesome opportunity to try a bunch of different rolls on the menu, it's very well priced for all of the options that you get, the food is fresh and tastes amazing.  My favorites are the Jackpot Roll, the Shrimp Lovers  and The Tornado (its baked). I love pretty much all of the shrimp tempura rolls though. I've taken a liking to lots of the non cooked rolls as well, but I always order that Jackpot Roll first.  The food is very good. The place is kind of small, but it gets the job done and I've never felt like it was overly crowded. Definitely worth a try if you are a sushi lover.

uHX03KfhW-a1kLsR5H0sSw.text: Ok well look, this is the second place I went to and absolutely loved their sushi rolls! I got AYCE and for the price it's not bad, if you break it down to the amount you're eating as to just getting one plate, well it's well worth it. I never liked sushi before(I know, crazy) until I tried it it was the best thing ever. The pancho roll is my favorite-the best one, but also the 911 roll, nemo roll, sex on the beach, evergreen, crunch roll and jackpot! Just a few named, wish I would've known my first time there. They're all a must try & im not into raw sushi so those wouldn't fall under that. Place is small, pretty packed often, service is okay, I feel like they feel repetitive if not then it seems as if they are. Overall decent, I recommend it. Been here 7 times already and haven't had any bad incidents. Of course some small things here and there, but then again where do you really get A1 service lol

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancho roll with Sapporo beer :) full roll, half also available

gEk72lO8qWbNrQR1g93Vog.text: Every time I am in Vegas I look forward to eating here.   All you can eat for $25 and they have a large extensive menu; appetizers, nigiri, sashimi, rolls, rice, and desserts. Good sushi, good food in general. The staff is friendly and the service is fast.   This is the only place that I drink flavored Sake, it is delicious and they have tons of flavors.

OkSieCH2mwx7wCGe1VJc_A.text: favorite AYCE in Vegas! huge selection, everything tastes fresh and everything is delicious. definitely a hidden jem in Chinatown! almost always packed but I've never had to wait long, there's a party room and you can make reservations. service can be a little spotty but quality and variety are worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Specialty Side&#34;

rxrJLJiBW9ELBqrzAh2ShQ.text: One of Las Vegas's best sushi bar restaurant in mine and many of my peers/families opinion. This place had me at KPOP, their decor and AYCE pricing! Very fun atmosphere, I love their servers (always friendly and funny), waiting time is fair, sushi is bomb.com However, I still prefer Oyshi over Kaya. Cons: -Parking sucks around Kaya area (in advance, I suggest you carpool to save time and gas). -Waiting to get a table or a seat at the bar varies because this spot really is small.

jG6i5iTd6NyRIKGxIWpyyQ.text: I've been here several times and just realized, I never left a review. Well, what can you say? AYCE sushi at a reasonable price; the sushi is fresh and delicious, and since you get two hours of ayce, it's surprising how much sushi you can try. (Keep in mind that you shouldn't order something you will not finish, this is generally frowned upon.)  You can also try non-sushi dishes and dessert is included (definitely a plus) because no matter how full you are, you always have room for mochi ice cream, haha! :D (yes im  a glutton I know, I have a problem).  The bad thing about this place is that its pretty popular; getting seating for a large group will take a while, so be patient, it's all worth the wait.

77AlLiYgu_Qe-RO-K2o-nw.text: Why can't sushi kaya keep there restaurant CLEAN!!!!???  I love the sushi but the restaurant is just so filthy now that I don't really want to come back. I would be embarrassed to recommend it to my friends. The last time I went there was a hair on one of the rolls, dust and spider webs on all the tapestries hanging from the ceiling, the tablesame were sticky with a layer of filth accumulated on it thick enough to be scraped off with the back of my chop stick. If the dinning room is that nasty it makes me seriously concerned about what is happening in the back with the food. Sushi restaurants are supposed to be extremely clean because they are dealing with raw fish, i guess sushi kaya did not get the memo. Very disappointing.

dGcquzKTZlN67DLNx9oiKQ.text: There were six of us on a Saturday during Thanksgiving weekend. I tried my favorite spot on Decatur but it was an hour and a half wait. Decided to give Sushi Kaya a try after a friends recommendation. The hostess said it would be 45 mins to be seated and we said that was fine. We went a few businesses down to have some drinks. I got a call in 35 mins saying our table was ready. -soon as we were seated we were served water and asked if we were ready to order. We ordered drinks and some rolls and and it wasn't long before our food arrived. You can order anything from skewers, nigiri and an assortment of other food when you get the AYCE. I tried the bacon/scallop skewers which were ok. The rolls were all delicious and I over did it as usual. Aside from the server forgetting a few of our drinks this was a great experience and I would return again.  They added %18 gratuity automatically to the bill which was fine since the service was not so bad.

fhCXIF15yXlMMAPLOJP1rA.text: Love the sushi, hate the service. 8 times out of 10 I'll be stuck with a terrible waiter or waitress. I haven't gotten sick from the sushi here yet so I guess I'll keep coming.

YBGoy6Gmugy_o1xN2KSBmQ.text: food: the variety was great. from sashimi to rolls to hot dishes to skewers. there were some items where you can only have one order, but one is enough. i cant remember which roll is which since we ordered so many. the baked rolls were good. ***4/5  service: it was easy to get somebodys attention. critical at a all you can eat place where you have to order it from the server. they will give you weird look when you ask to order everything on a small list. i dont think my request was that bad. it was the skewers and you know those things are small. ***4/5  value: worth the money on the variety alone. there are so many options to choose from. it helps when the food is decent too. they have some creative rolls in there. ***4/5

QmV1h-YJcEI0j7CHb9voBQ.text: Excellent quality and portions the fish was clean.  I went against my normal beliefs and did the all you can eat, and was completely reword it! Can only recommend this place nothing to say against it

jqo-XpdgF9JZV9vyELWSwQ.text: I had the Dynamite Roll and the Seafood Udon.  Both were fantastic and the presentation was great.  Finding the door to the restaurant was weird but as long as you follow the signs you will find the entrance :)

lf0ZDZuB7BL4zSsAJlWbNg.text: We tried the Sweety Roll (excellent!), Big Mac Roll (the fish tasted very good), Shrimp Tempura (very good), Zizzy Roll (has spicy tuna, but was really good), Crunch Roll (not fond of the asparagus, but otherwise a decent roll). We also had the Bacon and Scallop Skewers (they were small, but delicious!). The place was cheaper than other all-you-can-eat sushi joints at $22.95 per person (pp), other places are $25 pp or more for dinner. My girlfriend tried the Green Tea Ice Cream and it tastes just like green tea (I knew not to get it because it didn't sound right, and apparently didn't taste right either because she didn't finish it). Beer was $2 a bottle. In review, it was a great place to eat at a very competitive price for all-you-can-eat. They also offer a stamp card for future visits. After 9 visits, the 10th is on them. Overall the service was great and the food was enjoyable, definitely recommended for anyone who likes all you can eat.

cT72LYhdsGNCk6etcbGwcA.text: Kaya is a hair above average.  It's saving grace in its AYCE concept is with the Korean dishes and Skewers.  Otherwise, I would rate it a 2.  If this was your first AYCE Sushi/Korean, you would definitely rank it higher but there are far better options in this fattening buffet town.  The japchae, seafood udon, and skewers are excellent, but most people are coming here for the AYCE sushi and the sushi/seafood is lacking. The proportion of fish to rice is small and not as fresh as its competitors.    I've been 3 times and on one visit everyone in my group had the mad case of battleshit shits from eating their "fresh" oysters.  (Shout out to Harold/Kumar and the 2 girls in the college dorm bathroom)  I also have a philisophical issue with going to a Korean owned restaurant for sushi.  Don't get me wrong.  I HEART korean food and love koreans.  I am not being a a racist.  But would you really go to a Chinese owned place to get some chitlens and collards.

oY9sa1UWQnwEKPQPPPoYbA.text: Hands down the best all you can eat sushi place in vegas. The most extensive specialty roll selection and only about 26$ for dinner. Don't get fooled by anywhere else in Chinatown !

Jffz7GBnKifFUeLKSaWNwA.text: Quality of service only reason it's not 5 stars.  Was really busy and hard to flag down our waitress.  In her defense, she was being run ragged on an "all you can eat" special and each table was "sampling", but the sushi chefs were outstanding, and the sushi very fresh and good.  I lived in San Francisco for ten years, and worked for a Japanese company, so I would want people to know I was pleasantly surprised, no, I was shocked at how good the sushi was at Sushi Kaya.  Just put in your order and don't expect a lot of service

DnGRTo3cUk-Rm0DP5ckwGg.text: Service here is quiet friendly, food quality wasn't bad, just like most AYCE places here in town, I do like their skewer and noodle selections on the menu, good for no raw fish eaters. :-)

VRReUOucIA1ozqBHMefaqA.text: I'm not going to beat around the bush: this place isn't the best. Their sushi was ok, but not nearly as good as Ichiza's (upstairs in this same place). And the service seemed rather poor, too, which made the situation even worse.   I came here for a friend's birthday, and it was a letdown. I know other people have had better experiences that I did, so I'm going to have to give it a try later on just to see if it's gotten better. I hope so.

wsLyTzlSMTBsOdpA8f8o_g.text: ***Something wrong #69, Brooklyn bridge, white vegas, wall street, crazy orgasm, xxx2, Japanese pizza, kaya roll, mango style roll, sashmi poki, sweet shhrimp, squid  yum yum yum. two uni max per person =[ The service was very good and matches the ambiance. I also love they get your phone number a call when your table is ready. We ordered our rolls in half portion so we can try the different rolls. And for dessert you can have ice cream and mochi (now that is amore)!

B81nvQgkIYdHVqQxs4sbdA.text: I have been here many times and I always leave a happy camper. When you do the all you can eat option there's something for everyone on there. Everything is cooked to order and its nice so you don't over eat and take your time. Nice interior and friendly service. If your visiting Vegas you must try it. Its a good deal compared to how much buffets charge there.

p8EOGe4sjY6zHt7GfNTdEw.text: Sushi Kaya is quite a popular place to get some all-you-can-eat sushi.  As far as quality goes, the rolls and nigiri are usually pretty good.  On my first few visits, the service was friendly and fast.  On my most recent visit, the service remained friendly but evidently became slower (perhaps they were short on chefs or something).   My biggest gripe with this restaurant is its parking.  The parking lot is really bad!  What makes it worse is that even though there is a huge parking lot next to this complex, there is a guy who usually stands guard and tells you that he'll tow your car if you park in his lot.  Ugh.  Anyway, Sushi Kaya is one of the higher quality AYCE restaurants in Las Vegas!  Come here if you want some delicious Japanese food.  Just beware of the horrible parking...

H3IuUpoJmHiJbeXTU-Bl9Q.text: I've eaten here quite a few times but haven't checked in. I do love the 19.95 AYCE for KAYA, but yesterday my lunch was kinda boring. But I will go back.

Gj-W7vX9Ine6evxcRcAN1Q.text: I should have listened to my cousins review before going here..  A good friend of mine recommend this place and she raved about how good it was, so naturally I was excited. There was six of us so we had to wait for a table to be set up which was no problem. Once we got our table our server quickly asked us what we would like to drink and if we were doing AYCE. Things were going pretty well and we were enjoying the food and the service till we hit the 30 dollar mark. Once we hit that mark it was as if we were invisible! We waited ten 10 to 15 minutes to make another order and from there we had to wait 30 minutes for our rolls! The most annoying part was that our waiter often looked at our empty table and never said a thing! Not to mention their hostess kept looking at our table as if we should be leaving! Hello we were waiting for our rolls! I told my friend about it and she was shocked, she mentioned that next time I go I should go with them. If things do change during a second visit I will update my review.

qauVrKASso_YzqzzefB6MA.text: Excellent food, excellent service, our waiter was Leo, he was very attentive, definitely we going to back to eat to this place.

2u1Vo3epLi4BhwCdWHg2jQ.text: I thoroughly enjoy the AYCE menu at Sushi Kaya! My favorite roll is the Sex Bomb Roll as it contains every flavor and texture element that I personally enjoy in a sushi roll. Tempura shrimp, salmon, spicy crab, eel, eel sauce, spicy mayo, avocado and cream cheese all make up this fantastic little morsel that we ordered 3 times! You can't go wrong.

5QqwAX3iN-tOz7-7VaLdmg.text: This place is wonderful ! My daughter Sammie brought me here to eat .......... It's a piece of heaven ! My most favorite place to eat !

EuyND37843nCkUwZsF5EkA.text: We often enjoy great sushi at kaya but today their lady manager is as cold as their raw fish.

r7hg7gYbqONazLm00Swd5g.text: Went for lunch during Chinese New Year Festival.   Service was terrible and the server over booked our order 3 times.  We had a party of 5 and they charged for gratuity and they would not take it down.   Food portion was horrible.  $15 for small bowl of unagi don.  Food taste was decent but not big enough portion to really enjoy it. I been here many times and I have to say the experience is just getting worst.

9wsGPv4k5HfZDVPDnBimzw.text: Roach problem??? I've been coming here for 4 years and loved it until I noticed the fish was lacking freshness the last few tines. Never noticed the german roach stalking me before either. The appetizer selection is nice but not worth getting sick or driving for. Hoping this place can get back on track to make me a regular Kaya fan again. My boyfriend still insists we eat here. That's how good they used to be.

jHH7JoQMNLj9isRMUh5ubQ.text: Fish on top of nigiris are sliced so thin I can't taste the fish.  What they excel at are the endless selection of specialty rolls and you can order them in half size.  The appetizers and desserts are good. My search for the best AYCE sushi in Vegas continues.

_H9ABxF-GaVuH0jYmf4ynw.text: I can say that this sushi place is one of the best place i've been to here in vegas! Great service , Great food! Def coming back.

i9OQGzQtW8Zlg0i9sLxZ9A.text: I went during lunch time on Christmas Day so I knew it was going to be busy.  We were told it would be a 30 minute wait but it ended up being an hour or so. The service was horribly slow. I had to keep asking for a refill. The sushi itself is okay but not worth all the trouble. Nothing stood out in particular to me. I thought dessert would make everything better but it took around 15-20 minutes for our order to come out. We had to ask another waiter to check up on it. I've been to Kaya once before and I didn't remember it being that bad. It's funny because they claim that you have 90 minutes to eat but a family, who had been there since we first arrived, was still there when we left.  Very disappointing service, sad to say.

pFIO1-B5TRtTRRMxdcjVSg.text: This used to be my go to AYCE but it's been about 3 months since coming here and I now find myself highly disappointed and dissatisfied. As always the service is good. They are punctual and gear to take orders, refill drinks, and clear plates. But it's not the service that I'm disappointed with, it's the quality of the food. Much of the fish served here is precut and unfortunately I was getting slices that ranged from fresh looking and tasting, to old and tasteless. The amount of rice they give with the nigiri is crazy. The rice had a slight mush to it with little flavor. The worst had to be the masago (smelt roe) and the scallop. The Masago was mushy and didn't have any texture you would expect from fresh fish roe. The scallop was clearly premade hours before and left to sit. It's up in the air whether I am returning or not.

MJZjcn3mvxndoL1rgjscpg.text: First timer, very impressed.  Quality and variety of rolls is excellent, and service was exceptional.  I've given up on sushi places in the past because I felt like the staff ignored me.  These guys are ON IT.

o_qK6O87Y-5yQL8IwTgWhA.text: Always wondered why people were waiting outside this place... so finally decided to try it on our last day in Vegas. Went right when they opened, so we were seated fairly quickly. Quite good! Fish is fresh and the cuts are good. All you can eat sushi lunch for $20 is great. Loved that you can order half rolls too so you can try more variety. I am always leary of buffets since you wonder how long the food was sitting there.. but that is not an issue here as they make the items after you order! Winner in my book. Plus, they have dessert. I was stuffed, but managed to eat a mochi ice cream for dessert. You have to! :)  Some (like my family) will complain that a sushi buffet with rice - you can't just get the sashimi fish - is a rip off, but i thought it was great. Would go back in a heartbeat whenever I'm in Vegas next.

IPqCRdnZ25vRU4paTBDiXg.text: Absolutely delicious! Great selection of sushi rolls. We had about a 30 minute wait, but it was worth it. Once seated the sushi was made promptly. Our waitress also had good recommendations.

3P6Mx9T1SuxI-lo7hWEZBw.text: We should've walked out the second we walked in. The hostesses were nice but there was just this nasty stench... like when you leave a wet towel bunched up on the floor for a couple days. The menus were really dirty I didn't even want to touch them. We got seated right away so that's a good thing.  We had a party of 5 and got seated at a booth. The tables have a little call button that you press if you need something. We all decided to do the AYCE sushi. We ordered green mussels, a couple of hand rolls, couple of sushi rolls, and tons of nigiri. Most of the food came out right away. The green mussels took a while which was expected. What was weird was that the mussels came out before the hand rolls. Makes no sense at all. After we were all done with the sushi out waiter asked if we wanted dessert. We ordered mochi all around and also asked for the checks as well. The mochi took about 10 mins to get, the check took another 10 after that, then it took another 5 mins for them to pick up the checks. We all got so frustrated that we were pressing the call button and no one paid attention. Multiple employees walked by not even glancing our tables direction. After he finally picked up the checks it took another good couple of mins to bring them back. By the time we left we were all hungry again from waiting so long to leave.  The food wasn't even worth it. The salmon had a fishy taste to it. The tuna was good. The Ono, albacore, yellowtail were all weird tasting. The mussels were prepared differently than I'm used to but overall were good. The tako slices were really thin. Overall experience was bad. Most likely never coming back here.

I2IPIIkV0xlG22tR84pSaQ.text: Love this sushi joint.  Their specialty rolls are delisious specially the "sex bomb" and "sex on the beach".  Their choice of nigiris are also delicious.  Find myself coming here from time to time, sometimes it's a long wait but always worth it.

dxgCqTy3nIH3gzsQ8lsMMQ.text: First strike, waiting 1.5 hours for what was supposed to be a 40 minute wait. Strike two, drink orders were incorrect but I was willing to overlook such a minor mixup considering how "busy" they seemed until.... Strike three. My original review from 2010 can be completely disregarded considering the lack of customer service provided by Nate, who did not seem to understand what was communicated to me during my last visit less than two weeks ago, which was that my stamp card could be redeemed for a free meal during my next visit. This is what they have always honored for as long as I've been coming here. I had one stamp left to go until my free space; the server from the previous visit guaranteed that one of the meals would be comped if I came to visit for two. And no, this was not honored to me by one specific server; it is the tradition followed by every server I've ever had in the dozens of visits I've paid to this establishment. But this is the final time I will be dining here. The staff is poorly trained and, instead of apologizing for the misunderstanding and offering to have a manager resolve the issue on his behalf, Nate chose to argue with me for five minutes, which was even more frustrating than his piss poor job at executing my bill. It's a $40 bill, which isn't detrimental to my wallet whatsoever but the audacity of my server talking down to me when he is at fault was appalling. There are plenty of places I can go to in this city for better sushi and this Yelp review will not be the last place I express my disgust for Sushi Kaya. Pass along the message that Kaya does not play fair and that Nate the server is clearly too good to put the customer's needs above his own opinion.

EIClv0e1DZf3ZnsGvSi0IA.text: Love the Sushi always fresh!! When our clie ts are asking for a good place to eat sushi, I always recomend this place!

RjKhiH7lqtiw958ZvIHwAA.text: excellent service!! food was great!!! This is my second time here and came with a big group the first time. Kaya accommodated our group in their back room.

hLBxnrd7yDTcDbfJvEYnYA.text: Most disgusting place I've ever been too EVER! Me and my gf were having dinner there and there comes a roach crawling on her seat coming from there wooden booths ! So unsanitary I even took a picture of the roach and showed the manager , they need to be closed down! I'm scared for life from that place and there customer service is horrid !

heu-ve-ZAE0XD_WE1LSeqA.text: Last night my friend and I waited 20 minutes to be seated at a semi- sticky table. As soon as they set our waters down, we were greeted by a cockroach crawling across our table.  We immediately left. I'm  glad our guest showed up when he did. Based off of Google and Yelp, they are a pretty popular spot.  I suggest completely avoiding  them or extreme caution.

AJRCATGCFTqaneTlGeSiMA.text: This place is horrible. Fish quality is bad, service is even worse. My wife and I went o eat, the servers kept on bringing pre made Sushi and they rushed us out and last orders were not even fulfilled. I had to give 1 star because 0 star is not a choice here. In Las Vegas there are many good Sushi place so avoid this restaurant.

wm5O_sJ2HY347782yRL3Fw.text: Was craving sushi on Saturday night , It was my first time and it was very good . Our waiter was very helpful and nice and attentive . It was a busy night so we waited about 15min before being seated but it was completely ok. The sushi was great , and the kimchi fried rice with a fried egg on top was amazing! !! I had strawberry soju, it was too sweet for my liking but it was still really good I think next time I'll stick to the yogurt soju . The prices are really good ,  we had 3 rolls , the rice , the bacon wrapped asparagus the vegetable tempura I had that huge soju, 60 dllrs so prices are good (; enjoyable will be back again'

4TqQZxSbMP-YimA1g9MZSQ.text: We love Sushi Kaya! The sushi never disappoints. We have been here countless times and every waiter we have had has been awesome. They are prompt, super friendly, and the AYCE is such a great deal!! They have a stamp card for the AYCE which is great!! Love this place!

3acnTMoTmK1l_eq8-QKwLA.text: I'm not much of a sushi lover, but this place was really good.  Reasonable pricing. If you LOVE sushi this is the place to go for All You Can Eat!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aET-vsw_dTCGrfkAqk_gzw.text: As an AYCE sushi enthusiast, I would give this place a C-. The location and the decor are pretty good, but everything else is very mediocre. The fish is not very fresh and the tuna has a grey-ish color when is should be a deep red. The specialty rolls are pretty small and are usually doused with overly sweet sauces. The nigiri has a thin, (almost transparent) piece of fish and a big serving of rice to fill you up. The service is very inconsistent as well. I would have someone check on me right after I got my food, but nobody was to be found when my water and plates were empty. I ended up taking a pitcher of water from the servers' station and bringing to my table. When it came time for the check, I had to locate a manger just to close out.

-trKqGsbtozWJ3-8Yl8StQ.text: It's taken us a long while to stray from our usual AYCE sushi joints... Aka Yama and Sushi Mon. I cannot give Kaya 5 stars because I don't believe their fish is as fresh as those spots previously stated. There's something to be said about fresh nigiri whose texture is as pleasant as it's mild, non-fishy flavor. Kaya's isn't bad, but there are definitely places serving fresher sushi. The rolls are tasty, but you can only take so much garlic ponzu and eel sauce before it's just too much. Much like the rules of eating quality barbecue, sauce should be an extra to the taste of meat, not covering anything up.  However, their service is unrivaled. There are call buttons utilized at each table for your convenience of ordering, but you won't need them. The servers are attentive and will be at your table no longer than every five to ten minutes or so. Everyone is mild mannered, a rare occurrence in an AYCE environment.  Another plus...they're open until 3am. Perfect for your late night sushi craving.

WJRPkx4g5FTAhYA_VYMXUA.text: This place is delicious!! I love the salmon and yellowtail nigiri, the bonzai roll, the house salad, the handrolls, and the skewers. My boyfriend loves their uni and tako wasabi. The only con is that they drench their rolls in too much sauce (eel sauce and orange mayo), so I always make sure to ask for my rolls without the sauce or very light sauce. I am part Japanese, and I have been to Japan, and trust me, real sushi chefs do not use any sauce! But hey I get it, this is America and they have to cater to their audience lol.  Overall, great service. Will come back.

piRXT4aXfojtplGxsSSxCg.text: Went here the other day to add it too my list and had an epiphany.  I had been here before.During my meal I remembered that this place was not memorable at all.   Of course I went for the AYCE, thats my M.O.  I ordered almost all of the raw Nigiri sushi items and a few things from the kitchen, no rolls.  The Nigiri was nothing to brag about, the servings were ok, but I found myself needing to add condiments for flavor.  The shrimp on the regular menu was dry and flavorless.  I also ordered the sweet shrimp, you can only do this once and with the dinner meal, they did not taste that fresh and were a bit sticky.  That's my other pet peeve about this place, there are only two dinner only items, sweet shrimp and sea urchin, and you can only order one.  If you don't like these two items and order them, then the dinner menu price  is not worth it,  There is one saving item on this menu, and this is the spicy seafood udon.  That was the most delicious item that I have had at this place and may come back again for it, but not for the AYCE.

rcGhCyz_TDNHPRFEmmRPFA.text: this is not something you want or need in your life. for example, this is what a NOT tight butthole looks like.. this is a place that will mess you up.. (my sister literally said she's about to throw up and we are not even home.. ) you just can't trust it.. and it'll just have you shaking your head with anger.. the decor is great but what ruins it is the service.. seriously f*** that place

dq9adtz3LM2V-MI-1RDM2g.text: Worst sushi joint in Vegas. The people that work there are rude and the barely attend to you. I had to stand up and personally get my server to get some service. They didn't even refill my drinks until I asked. I was hoping the sushi would at least be good but it was ok at most. Oh and they also charge a 18% gratuity if you have more than 6 people, which would be fine if the service was even halfway decent. I had to fight with the supervisor to take that off my check because wasn't going to pay for people who got mad at me Everytime I asked for something. Don't waste your time or money here!

9A4U2OUvxvGFRwUAQkhG_Q.text: Great all you can eat sushi. Arrived to the table so quickly and very reasonably priced.  Nice casual atmosphere.

A3-OiRdXl48LeFIWxJtM3g.text: Absolutely disgusting. Have come to this place multiple times and something is always wrong but never took it too seriously. Sometimes the rolls would have an old, bitter taste. I found a hair in my mochi previously and the server had the nerve to say it was plastic from the stick put inside. Came here again to give it another shot to find a bug in our food. Was not even completely compensated for the food, as the manager claimed it was "impossible" & it is "out of their control" to keep the bugs out since the door opens when clients come in/they are "too busy" to inspect food before serving it. Was a table of 4 & all they did was give ONE AYCE and a pina colada for free. The MANAGER tried adding the pina colada to the tab and when we checked it, all he had to say was "oh I'll fix it". Tab still came out to $85 after finding a bug in our roll. You would think after being loyal customers to this place, they would have the respect and decency to compensate such a terrible and disgusting experience. Would not recommend. Management is terrible and did not help with the situation at all. Service is terrible as well, wait forever for your drink order and never received our miso soup order. If I could rate this place 0 stars, I would. DO NOT COME HERE.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Absolutely disgusting. Found a bug in our roll and nothing was done about it after taking it to management.
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Absolutely disgusting. Found a bug in our roll and nothing was done about it after taking it to management.

y_J2-Vf7R6VU3mV4EelGaA.text: Do not come here! They will make you sick! I have come here many times and I have bugs in their miso soup, in their wasabi, and in their sushi rice.  I used to love coming here until I started to find bugs in the food multiple times and I tried to brush it the first two times because they apologized. However, the third time they still charged me for the dish (miso soup) and after I explained that there was a bug and showed them they apologized and took the dish off.  Whatever right? Well I just had lunch there today and there was a bug in the rice in the nigiri so I put it aside frustrated and when someone picked it up I let them know about the bug. The manager came over and yelled at me for, "not finishing all of the rice." He told me he was going to charge me for that one piece of rice. I tried to talk to him but he was incredibly rude and would not listen so I told him that I would never come back.  I am currently looking for a new favorite sushi restaurant if anyone has any recommendations. It was good at first until it got me sick from the dirty conditions and the rude management.

sRTDH6skn0nN3uv73I4Erg.text: When we got there the wait time was 20 to 30 minutes, so after almost 40 minutes we noticed people that came after us were seated, so we asked and they said oh sorry another 35 minutes... After an hour wait they sat us in a private room, it was 5 adults 3 babies under 3 Again... another long wait, I had to walk out there looking for a server.  After all of this, they included an 18% tip on the check. I don't think I'll be coming here again, 10$ tip was not deserved.

1Y4moQYpBtsWpc1OjEyMlw.text: The service here is always so bad when I come. I don't recommend this place to anyone unless you like waiting and having to wait forever for your server to come back. Plus, this place was on DIRTY DINING.

oJdA4vwSzP7i8IL8g-H_fQ.text: I don't think you can go wrong with Kaya even for Korean sushi. I've been going here for a while now and it still stays busy. They are an all you can eat joint with a huge menu to select from. The price is pretty fair considering that it is an all you can eat (AYCE) sushi restaurant. After you are finish, they provide you with a stamp card that you can save for the next visits to eventually obtain a free lunch or dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi buddy
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni (sea urchin) and amaebi (sweet shrimp)
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4izEgAizm8lyUgJ1qjmczg.text: I have eaten at about 20 AYCE sushi locations I will say that on their good days, this is my favorite AYCE sushi place in Vegas. Their Cinderella roll is to die for and they have great appetizers. The quality of their rolls are great and there is very little I wouldn't eat on the menu. The reason they get 4 stars is only because on their bad days their rolls can taste a bit stale and I would say a 3 out of 5. So since its hard to say when they are great and when their not, I'm just going to rate in the middle.

YGabrsALadFVeIy2k-1GFg.text: The first time it was awesome, no complaints.  The second time, it was so-so service.  This last time, we did not even eat!  If you go after the busy lunch crowd during the week, its amazing.  If you go for dinner, a late dinner, then its ridiculous.  Hostess and servers are rude, some of the chefs are chewing gum while preparing food, which is a BIG no no while preparing sashimi/sushi.  When I saw the gum chewing I googled this place.  They were a part of dirty dining and just conveniently switched their name around.  I checked their board for the health inspection grade, and they were at a C after being shutdown.  You have to monitor the hostess to make sure she does her job.  I noticed that she let people jump the line because they were buddies/friends.  If you eat here, make sure you pray before you ingest anything.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

txxu5FVrWen1Mu6juZ8m-w.text: Love this Sushi Place! I go here every time I get paid and i always receive the utmost care and service! This is the only Sushi place I will go to... as long as i'm living in Vegas... The manager is so kind and as well as his employees!! They go above and beyond our expectations with their service!!! Thank you for having amazing food and for being the BEST!!

_4y8OSBXhkTw5LS5-UCUqw.text: This is my fave sushi place. Do not come here for great service or drinks. Come here for great food at a great price.

YehJxJMCy7fsrYNRHnpdMQ.text: For the past years, I've been coming to Sushi Kaya at least once a week, and refused to go elsewhere. Sushi Kaya may have once been the best AYCE sushi place, but has been going downhill for the past year or so in terms of food quality. And after this recent experience, I am assured that I will NEVER visit this place ever again.  Recently, I took my visiting friend to Sushi Kaya, ensuring her that this is my favorite sushi place in Vegas. I ordered the usual and was excitedly talking with my friend, until the food came out. We were shortly in shock. The rice must have come straight from the freezer; it was hard and cold. The sashimi pieces were disappointing -- not fresh at all. Long story short, everything was unsatisfactory and below average standards. My friend and I REFUSED to eat the rice, and tried to finish most of the sashimi, and did. However, the waiter came over to us TWICE, rudely demanding that we finish the rice.  If we had finished all of the rice, I know we would have gotten sick. The rice was not edible.  The food and the service were both disappointing, and while signing the check, I swore that I would never return to this place ever again. And I never have. There are plenty of other AYCE sushi places in Vegas, with equivalent or lesser prices and even better menus. I have no reason to return here ever again.  *In summary: Good interior and location but rude and unfriendly service + low food quality. Your choice, but no thanks for me. I'm surprised that this place is still in business.  *Update: For a better AYCE sushi experience in Vegas, I recommend going to Kaizen, my new favorite for some time now. I'm sure there are plenty others that are infinitely better than what you will get at Kaya.

tM0pLBtaftWKnVrXBrFVgA.text: I dined here tonight for the first time for my friend's birthday. There was a group of 13 of us or so and they accommodated us in a nice isolated room by pushing long tables into a U shape.   The majority of us ordered AYCE and a few ordered a la carte. The service was slow but it didn't bother me as I understood we were with a large group and ordering various items off the AYCE menu.   I started off ordering miso soup, tuna poke, seaweed salad, shrimp skewer, and a few pieces of salmon and tuna nigiri.   I got the seaweed salad and tuna poke first, then the nigiri. Seaweed salad tasted the norm and the tuna poke was so-so. Tuna nigiri didn't seem fresh, but the Salmon nigiri was the complete opposite! Big portion of soft salmon on top of a small bed of rice, just the way I like it!!  After a while, the server asked if anyone wanted to order more. I let her know I was still waiting for my miso soup and shrimp skewer, which she said she would go check on. I went ahead and ordered udon, baked mussels, and garlic edamame.   Disappointing to say, the miso soup never came out (shrimp skewer did) and neither did the garlic edamame. I heard some of the girls across from me getting upset about not receiving their orders too. I was getting full so I gave up trying to remind our server...  - 5 stars for the salmon nigiri - 3 stars for the rest of the menu items - 3 stars for the service

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Tempura Udon
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon and Tuna Nigiri, Tuna Poke, and Seaweed Salad
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Mussels

ZYxOz0hOaZr6U4Q_hwZaCw.text: Favorite sushi spot in Vegas, great s staff a bit tough to find parking but overall good food and drinks.

IOgC___dnMkw1B2CIAkiQg.text: All you can eat sushi, awesome food choices fish always fresh and yummy! And they are open till 3am so it's nice when I'm working swing to swing by after :)

lepUDQmgKqvYRnWgJb_xSA.text: It doesn't smell good, the entrance smells like a dirty mop. They're messy. The furniture is runned-down. The wait staff doesn't have uniforms so you can't tell who is who, menus are falling apart. They don't have the soft drink and ice dispenser machine thing, weird right? they serve right out of the 2 litter bottles. Sushi was ok, but not 5 start quality.

V6B1HDPWWl2CJhw8SlL3bg.text: I did not have a good experience at all... the waiters were kinda rude and if they could've thrown the food on the table the would've. Don't really recommend considering they weren't busy AT ALL. They were just moody because they had to work the night shift. Not coming back.

8m53BSsVAuFih5OJYyoMDA.text: I GOT FOOD POISONING.  I don't enjoy slamming a business but seriously guys. Unacceptable!!  Multiple reports of food poison here on Yelp in the last month is disturbing

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of many people in the last month getting sick here. Unacceptable!!

OEkiiL9ijd1dT1XXAHvIsw.text: By far my favorite place to eat when it comes to eating sushi! It's AYCE! Appetizers and rolls. The customer service is great!

v7Q3cdN4LE_yx_H76GiLlQ.text: The quality of food is great , food flight out of the kitchen  Beacon scallops were a bit too chewy for my liking.  Never let them sit you on the bar by where they pick up the order as you feel like they are going to drop food all over you and servers take a long time to come back and put in any other food you want.  Love their hot green tea ... and the dessert deal of getting 2 can't be better .

0dYQ6iYGZ_ZMfxo7Ex-wFw.text: Pros:  Excellent food! All you can eat for 90 minutes*  AYCE includes multiples of single items elsewhere  Great staff  Con:  closes at 2, not 3 as listed At 2am they do last call. Even if you just sat down for AYCE  We arrived Saturday night at 12:45-50, got sat at 1:25. That's a fine they where packed ( see the pro's) We ordered a couple apps and drinks. When the apps came out we where informed they where closing and doing last call.   We still ordered 11 rolls, but it felt like they where hovering to empty the room. Plates where snatched as soon as the last piece was picked up.

JElTUk-IBD2uUHi-9yz8Sg.text: Really wide selection, very fresh dish. Service was impeccable.   We arrived on Friday after 2 pm for lunch, and the place had quite a few people already seated. The waitstaff was very friendly (waiters, runners, and a man that I believe was the manager).   White Vegas roll and Brooklyn  roll were two of my favorites.

Ktxukejr6Hk02_cGNy2-bQ.text: Definitely one of the best all-you-can eat sushi deals I've ever encountered. Seriously...$20 for unlimited decent sushi? Best deal I've seen in a long, long time.  They have some fantastically named rolls ("I love my ass" and "one night stand" rolls cracked me up!). They also have what I think is their secret house sauce called "yum" sauce, that they put in almost everything  we ordered. For better or worse, you simply can't keep your mind out of the gutter with a creamy, off-white sauce named "yum sauce" that is drizzled *cough* all over 6-inch long rolls.....  While I love he value, and very friendly service, I have to admit that if the 6 different rolls we ordered, they all tasted pretty much the same. Maybe one had a slight spicy bite, while another had more crunch, they all could have been the exact same roll, all smothered in 'yum'.  Can't say any of the sushi tasted authentic or out of this world. But if you're hungover, starving, have a budget, and simply want sweet, creamy yum in your mouth, then this is the place to be!

Kh2H61qk9FCVEenEsC0hHQ.text: Baby COCKROACH ran from my crunch roll!!  Once I saw my girlfriend and I were official done, our appetite was gone. We just sat down to eat our dinner too. Worst place in Vegas. Who knows what the back kitchen where the fish is stored looks like. Must be disgusting.   I'm officially done with Sushi Kaya, the last time I was here I left with a stomach ache and my friend. Their fish must not be fresh. Don't eat here. Take it from my honest review; I usually don't take the time to write a review but this was just so bad to keep to myself.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi Bar

6CxTCmdCaCJ_oRKXeeKiDw.text: Service here sucks, the manager is quite rude and made a huge deal out of the fact that we weren't sure if our party was 7 or 8. We also asked for drinks and had to ask for our Sapporo 3 times.   Sushi selection is limited compared to many other places within a few blocks of here. Seafood quality was very average. Way better options out there. Also the inside was dirty and the bathrooms were gross and needed updating.   Solid 1 star

GEzElDmt7BgmsPQPGxR8iA.text: Kaya used to be my favorite AYCE place about a year or two ago, but recently it hasn't been living up to the love and hype I used to have for it. The menu hasn't changed much in a long time, but what's really been an issue has felt like the quality of the fish and seafood.   The rolls and nigiri used to taste fresh and flavorful, to the point that I would order my favorites multiple times in one sitting, but on my last two visits, the fish has tasted kind of bland and dry and my squid nigiri tasted...weird? Off? Any rolls with spicy mayo also tasted way too strong, like they would overwhelm the roll. The last time I came here, I invited a friend from out of town and he seemed disappointed. I felt so embarrassed because the sushi here just didn't taste fresh anymore.   The service has always been pretty good here, though they work on orders slowly like most AYCE places so you wind up waiting awkwardly in between periods until your food comes out. It's why I do recommend ordering in bulk; if you're afraid you won't eat everything, I would usually order maybe 4-5 rolls when I'd go out with a friend, and that's always been a safe amount.  Fried and baked rolls will fill you up faster though!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Waom2vD7vp2fWnjyjm_7KQ.text: It's a hit a or miss with service ! Luckily when a friend and I came here on a Friday night and they were busy we were taken care of with amazing customer service ! Our waters always filled and the food came out in a very timely manner! Thank you a bunch to the staff of sushi Kaya for making our dinner exceptional

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miso soup

G85GnMa7D8IiLwwh17rIIQ.text: Sushi Kaya used to be one of my favorite AYCE sushi bars. The fish tastes fresh, unique sushi roll combinations (my favorite: Cinderella Roll), & the price is right. Service can be spotty. I notice that I had amazing service in the beginning, but it would go downhill from there -- which is why I usually make a list of a handful of things in the beginning and order it right off the bat. Yes, your girl can EAAATTT!!   I highly recommend ordering the Cinderella Roll, Sex on the Beach, French Kiss Roll, & Baked Green Mussels. There's something about their mussels that I absolutely love! My husband and I usually order a lot of it. However... To my surprise, I was looking over their menu during my last visit & found that they limited the amount of times that you are able to order it :( I was super disappointed which is why I had to dock another star. Limiting oysters and uni is understandable, but green mussels? I can definitely find another AYCE sushi place here in Vegas with AYCE baked green mussels. If you're not much into green mussels like my family & I are, then this probably isn't much of a "loss" to you.   Overall, this place is a 3 out of 5 stars at its absolute best.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Left - Cinderella roll; Right - Tuna &amp; salmon nigiri

CpMhH3eWwnN5Pt_S_CKjSw.text: My friends rave about this place ALL THE TIME. I finally know why. Food is delicious and service is on point. It's everything I've ever wanted in a sushi place!! The staff is attentive and friendly. The food comes out fast, I never had to wait too long for my roll. And the best part is that the price is really great for AYCE. Cannot rave enough!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KpTPCxj59yxdqBiFAikm5w.text: Good new place, so it's clean and looking good. Not many restaurants where you can order sashimi for all you can eat, but this place offer few kind of sashimi like salmon, tuna etc. Food was good, but I giving only 4 stars because I tried better. For Ikura lovers will say that the taste of it very weird.. They probably use not real one (simulation) or something like this.. I didn't enjoy Ikura sushi like I usually do at other sushi places. Also I got full too fast and didn't eat much, so I can't say anything but I'm wondering maybe they add some protein to the food, that people can get full fast and don't eat lots of fish when order all you can eat...

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food

4urN_jXkW1PWcg8DaqVERg.text: Going to Sushi Kaya is like coming home for dinner. The place is familiar to us after years of dining here, it has a laid back coziness and delightful consistency in food that taking first time guests here is a no brainer since you know Sushi Kaya will always make it right. The menus have changed over the years but a few staples have gladly remained such as their sushi nigiris and skewered offerings like grilled shrimp, garlic and mushrooms. They now also serve sashimi (yellow tail, salmon and tuna), albeit limited to one order per meal/person, it's still good to have. Their sushi roll menu is quite extensive and we found a few gems, but we predominately stick to ordering sushi being that we do come here for a good ALYCE sushi fix after all.  Oh BTW, a dessert tip: skip the cheesecake, as tempting as it sounds, it seems this thing has been sitting in the freezer for a while and suffers from freezer burns and a dry-as-chalk texture. Mochi ice cream is your friend (say it with me)!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi Nigiri
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamachi aka yellow tail sushi!

oDG6BAd0TQc_UOb2-WW6TA.text: We've come here many times and this is my first review. Was there on Labor Day weekend 2019. Servers are fast and friendly. It's AYCE for very reasonable price. Sushi rolls have hilarious names, suited for Las Vegas. Food quality is very good but not great. Quality matches the price, hence we keep returning. Fish portion and quality could be better and I wouldn't mind paying more. Nonetheless, fun times and very filling. Mochi ice cream is included, very good quality but limited to one per customer.

1potRVvctVIBUYhUUOoazg.text: I try not to expect much from AYCE sushi restaurants, but Kaya far surpasses my expectations. I come here every time I visit Vegas.   The food is made to order rather than sitting out on a buffet line, and you actually get a lot of options to order as well. You can order appetizers, tempura, skewers, rice & noodle dishes, nigiri, sashimi, and even dessert! I feel like its pretty rare that AYCE sushi places allow you to order sashimi or nigiri. There's also a large variety of sushi rolls you can choose from, and they let you make half orders so that you don't get too full and can order multiple rolls. Despite being AYCE, the fish quality and sushi rolls are still good, and all the appetizers are great! I love the mussels and poke.   In addition, service is generally really quick considering this place is always packed when I come The manager usually walks around checking on tables as well. I've hardly had to wait for a table, and the food generally comes out fairly quickly. They don't wait to bring out everything at once so you can start eating as dishes come out. They come back frequently so you can order more as well. Also, there's a fee if you don't finish all your food, but I have never been charged extra for not finishing. On my last visit, I had a fair amount of food leftover, and the manager even told me not to worry about finishing it so that I could order dessert (for free too)!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DmktosUQnGtBQ6gmoADOlQ.text: Very good service. Sushi was alright over all. Yellowtail wasn't my cup of tea and lemonade was like powdered hot drink don't think I'll be visiting this place again. But I do want to emphasize the service was Fast and curtious!

CL5JsJ1Av8enlHE7CQpJSw.text: Amazing AYCE sushi place! I absolutely enjoyed and loved all of their dishes! We went during their anniversary celebration so it was a little cheaper than regular days, although their regular price is pretty good still considering how good it is.  Their entrance is kind of hidden, so you have to look for the poster that says "to Sushi Kaya". There's a bunch of other Asian restaurants in the same strip as well. This place times you though so be sure you order well the 1st round so you don't have to keep waiting around to order more.  Their servers are pretty nice and efficient, just that one of the guys (the tall skinny one) didn't seem to care enough to keep going and help around- like he can't even be bothered to pour water for you and asks the others to do it for him- like c'mon dude, it takes less than a minute with the water pitcher right beside you, you know. *rolling eyes* Anyway...  They have a variety of entrees to choose from, and everything that we ordered was devine! Their tofu was crispy outside and soft on the inside, dipped in really good sauce. The baked mussels was flavored with some kind of syrup and cheese- and it was so fantastic that you HAVE to scrape off the cheese from the foil cause it was just that good! Their sexbomb sushi's sauce was very flavorful and made each bite a taste of heaven. Like I said, just everything here was amazing! What made it even better was each person gets one mochi (a kind of japanese ice cream) once you are all done eating- talk about a sweet deal! Definitely a must try for all sushi lovers.  I will definitely be coming back here when I'm in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef skewers and shrimp tempura
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sexbomb sushi

9Qx8l-p2YCeVH2qz-S-8SA.text: There are way too many good AYCE sushi options in Vegas and you are definitely better off heading down the street to Sushi Neko.   I really can't say anything positive about the selection on the AYCE menu or quality of food. If you find yourself trapped there, just order the yakatori skewers. The beef skewers were my favorite and they use marinated Kalbi beef. Unfortunately some of the skewers were really fatty, but it was the best thing out of everything we tried.  The nigiri rice to fish ratio is not proportioned and the rice was hard. The miso soup was watered down and placed on the do not order list.   This place just feels dirty and dusty when you walk in. The restaurant has been around for 10+ years, but I think it needs a complete renovation and a deep cleaning.  Thank you, next.

fvjOkeHbxCp3cJX4pnpM0w.text: This is my go to place for AYCE sushi. The service is exceptional friendly staff and all of your orders come out on time. The best part about this place is you can order both half and full size rolls and there are no rolls added to the menu almost every month. Plenty of room to sit at the bar / the dining area and there's even a private room too which is nice. The price is well worth the quality of sushi and the menu is great!

8WrAIuJ6Kxjnb431ZckdIw.text: Another AYCE sushi buffet in Las Vegas.  Once you try a handful of them, you start seeing the qualities that are different from the rest.    First of all, the location of the restaurant is very convenient and it's in a good area, near the Strip. However, parking is extremely hard.   Secondly, the service is very fast and efficient.  The manager is constantly walking around to make sure that all of your orders are completed.  He even followed up on a few orders that was missed and heard him tell his staff to hurry up the order.  Third of all, the restaurant is spacious and has feels even bigger with very high ceilings.  The tables are quite large, enough to hold all of the food you will soon order.   The sushi is not bad, nothing really stands out from other AYCE sushi places and are pretty much on par in terms of quality and selection.  Definitely one of the AYCE sushi places to try.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4J-rH7-IX6a868X6lDNuZw.text: Absolutely amazing! My go to sushi spot. The prices are very reasonable and the sushi is phenomenal. I loooooove and highly recommend the "Cinderella roll" and the "sex bomb" roll. They are my absolute favorites!! If you're looking for a great sushi spot, look no further!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pxNuRFRwlaiNH2b5yRGh1g.text: The deep fried sushi (any of them) are the best. Don't forget to ask for extra octopus sauce 'cause it will make your meal heavenly! And, it's always better to get the eat all you can.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TcHhqmtkOaRx7QRtsOKlvw.text: First off- the parking can be a pain since the entire complex stays busy before 12 midnight.  Beware.   My first time I was lucky enough to go with a group of friends and they already had a table.  No wait but I've seen people wait over 30 mins on avg.    The food- is good.  The service?  Needs work.  Few times servers and runners walked by me on the end of our big table and my water cup was empty.  I finally had to call someone over to fill it up.  My friends first were told that they were out of mango only to have another order come to our table 20 mins later...yep you guessed it- with mango!    The place has a nice atmosphere to it.  So 3 stars for now.   :)

YlN8tcwg7YAu0K4e5azI3Q.text: So good!! Im so happy i found an AYCE  place that has half orders! The Tiger and Sexy roll were so yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crunch Roll! ( half order)

BLkL2dsiq6TbEG00AzUHSA.text: Decent fish and great service from the servers. There was an incident where the power was out yesterday, the manager was forcing us to either pay with cash we didn't have or leave our cards' information we weren't comfortable leaving, or we could leave our phones and IDs there.  Understanding that their credit card machine was down, we asked the manager if he could look into us doing a bank transfer or Chase quikpay to himself, the owner or any employee who would be comfortable doing this, he refused to look into this option or discover any other options that both parties would be comfortable with, this I don't blame him but we weren't able to pay with cash and we were strongly uncomfortable leaving our cards' information with a stranger, plus we were not obligated to accommodate to this inconvenience caused by the sudden power outage.  If only the manager was respectful and understanding about it and not walk away from it, I am sure we would have come to a solution both of us would be happy with. That was the story but the point is, the manager was rude and told us they have already given us options and we had to work with it, I would have offered to leave my card's info if he had taken the effort to ensure us we would only be charged the amount on the bill, but his rude attitude was making it a night ruining experience during my stay in Vegas.  Nonetheless, this would be a 4-5 star restaurant minus the manager who doesn't fulfill his responsibility to solve problems and work with customers.  P. S. We would like to thank Chance, one of the employees at Kaya, who was willing to help and get this resolved.

v7GXIyEIQT5GQ9XPnQmZpA.text: Only give one star bc I have to. Worst service of my life. Waited for an hour to watch another group who came after us get seated before us. Such a horrible experience.

_YOxk0nqvmIcB1Ehi2mxlg.text: First time here the other day and I probably will return. Service was pretty good and the food was good. My only complaint is that if you are NOT eating all you can eat, their prices for rolls/sushi separately is really high compared to other spots. Overall not bad.

bpkN-Xb3VYWA3XfRbxgSJA.text: We have been sitting here at Kaya and the staff are very inattentive.  We could never find out waiter/server and the restaurant is gross with dirty dishes and the workers have a "get your food and get the fuck out" type of attitude.  VERY DISAPPOINTED!!  They totally need to up their attitudes and they need to stop being buddy-buddy because they should act like they're at work not at a social club.

Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No dispensery so once they run out, another is taken out and sits for a while.  Also, food just sits a while before serving.

QjFvfxlsWky2Ot9-LeCwLA.text: I can't explain how much I love the place , such delicious food that will not compare to any other sushi restaurant. P.s if it will be your first time going , order the sex bomb roll , you won't regret it and will thank me later

If I see her again, I will not come back...thank u for pushing us for dinner prices before we could sit for lunch... Thank you also for sitting us next an annoying loud young couple... Also I had to remind the waitress of our orders... Will most definitely not be back... You're better off at sushimon...

9x9mrEe8DPrQpQP7fHo5RQ.text: I used to eat here all the time with my husband and 2kids but I stop coming because same of the staff are very rude and this place has been on dirty dining so many times I don't even want to eat here anymore. Management needs to step up and take control of this place again! Make it to the place it once greatly was

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi kaya always make the best and freshest sushi :)

_5KtomoyHlTH_fqEIXLphA.text: All you can eat is a good deal with lots to choose from on the menu. Kids 10 and under are half off the regular price for all you can eat.   We waited about an hour on a Sunday night before we were seated. We had a variety of items from the menu. The tuna is okay, but I'm biased cause I like the way fresh fish is prepared in Hawaii, and we are a long ways from the ocean.  We all enjoyed the Kim chee fried rice, unagi, tamago, and salmon skin salad. The restaurant is small, so expect a wait.

TNGgvrm9w9ts12klT2jfcA.text: I love doing AYCE sushi here! They have a great selection of appetizers and plenty of fish! Their quality of fish is surprisingly GOOD for such cheap prices! MUST TRY!

qJlLy3BZA2nFDoHTrW58LQ.text: I would like to start off with saying: BEST SUSHI I'VE HAD IN A WHILE. After living in Japan for a few years, I have high expectations when it comes to sushi. This place surprised me. Though it's still not exactly the same (nothing is, unless you get the real thing in the actual country), the different kinds of sushi options that they had just blew my mind.   Everytime I come here, I always get the all-you-can-eat sushi, which is reasonably priced at $19.95 for lunch and $24.95 for dinner. They charge for leftovers, so be careful in how much sushi you order at one time! The ambiance of the place is cozy and the staff is really friendly. They're really fast in bringing your food out, even when it's busy, so that's a definite plus. The food is amazing and I would definitely recommend this place for a nice date!

tASPjELat9AV1on0WxEl8w.text: Very impressed with the place. Very fast service - from being seated to have the table fully served for all you can eat - just 10 minutes!!! Plus, they do reservations for 10 of more people in VIP room. Will bring friends next time.

AqzzrHFiN6cf5oYqtJ2PlQ.text: This is the most horrible experience I've ever had From bad service to Shiity food I didn't even taste the Sushi that I ordered as the fish didn't look fresh or smell fresh it was de colored and slimy  the most disgusting sushi bar in China town....

BROQO8wUOILAkqEdhNiGgg.text: Update, we came here for a party for my friends birthday and Leo (apparently he's a supervisor of some sort) was our server. So rude. So unprofessional. I understand if you hate your job but at least don't act like it, and don't bring your problems to work. He's got an attitude problem. However, the busser/runner with the red hair named chance is amazing. He's got a great smile and gives awesome service. Very friendly. Sushi was okay. If you're reading this review and want to try some other sushi places I recommend either Umiya Sushi (which is right up the street from kaya) or Jjanga sushi on Russell and ft Apache. Thank me later.

KxTX_FvHHYn2_3A1vhLNbA.text: Stopped in for a light bite last night and had a great time! Sat at the sushi bar had a few spicy rolls EXCELLENT, shrimp skewers OFF THE CHAIN, saki was tasty too! They are a keeper!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Crab and Shrimp Skewers!

fcCqpTnaH3yrJ0lfxLYi5g.text: Don't ever pay with cash here. I've done it twice and each time waiter brings back wrong change then plays stupid when you bring it up and prove what they did. This has happened two times in a row to me two different waiters.

Z1qsl__HNAb9h9WF8tLK4A.text: Our first time here was  just okay. Smaller place than it looks from the outside. Wait was over 30-mins at 5pm on a Monday. Food was okay, sushi amt per roll was small. Bar was good. Now that we are finished, and after being in here for just under one hour and $160 later, they are forcing us out. Service was okay, but we kept getting different waiters, waitresses, and I call the finish guy, who is asking us if there is anything else that we need. If not, here is the bill.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Notice that the rules only are partially covered with sushi.

DuCZDGBvBmKScD0YirmjKw.text: My girlfriends and I came here last night and it was amazing. Everything I tried was great!  Drank soju (watermelon and strawberry). We did the all you can eat and we left buzzed and full!  I can't wait to return!  My favorites were the French kiss and baked mussels...although it's hard to choose bc everything was really good. We ate Mochi and cheesecake for dessert. Strawberry Mochi, mango, and red bean!  Soooo good. Service was great. We had to wait 30 minutes, but I went by fast bc we had a drink at a bar close by. They called us to let us know when our table was ready. I really enjoyed myself and will def be back.
