Wp6345XqIWC0iH8waqj_uA.text: Great sushi and great service. Portions could be a little bigger but still fresh and yummy.

bB_4KkDispmgLi6b0sanHQ.text: This place is now officially mine and my friends new traditional sushi eatery in vegas.  Let me run down the process of ordering for you. You're given 90 minutes after you declare your table is all you can eat. You literally can order all you want with no restrictions. All you're restricted by is commonsense, always exercise it no matter what. We kept ordering the salmon nigiri which was amazing in all regards! We then started following up our meals with the house rolls and their various selection of tuna.  The biggest surprise to us was their willingness to let us consume so much halibut nigiri. The experience in a nutshell was outright positive. You're greeted by the entire staff with a loud HEYO!!!!! Seating took roughly 30 minutes and the staff were more then compassionate to help us with our friend. He has sight issues and the staff were kind enough to describe dishes to him and help him make selections.   Very professional and caring towards their customers. I highly recommend this place to anyone going to Las Vegas!

Dslvl-4VV2B8_q58DZqSPA.text: The food was pretty good here and it's open late. We came here for a birthday party one night, our bill came out to $100 for two adults and my two boys (8 & 4) had to pay too with gratuity. It was our first time here and they were quick with some of our orders considering we did AYCE.  I recently saw them on the local news for being a "dirty dining" spot after we ate there and it happened a week before we had went. I know True fans will go regardless though.  We got the bacon wrapped scallop skewers were good. I ordered the ahi poke, shrimp tempura and a few other things for appetizers. The spider roll, shrimp tempura rolls were good too. I just wish most of the rolls didn't have ponzu sauce. But we tried only a few rolls because we were in a rush to go somewhere afterwards. I'd probably come back because my husband likes the fried shrimp heads there.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Tuna hand roll

_MqFv72421Jmy2XZY94cUA.text: Too long of a wait, food is super good but it's pricey for their service and wait time (45 minutes plus for dinner! And you CANT make reservations!) There are too many food poisoning reviews for me to ever go here again.  They aren't too strict with making you finish everything tho, I just rip the food up and stash it in napkins or under the bowls they don't mind.

P4g590fhT6wb3w-1xAUveg.text: I've been to a majority of the "Best Sushi" places in town.. This by far, hands down, without an argument, beats all competition. They provide you with a stamp card of which I have filled up three of them and working towards by fourth. Their AYCE menu is huge combined with nigiri, half rolls, full rolls, hand rolls (you have to ask for them), specialty rolls. Every time somebody tells me they want sushi, this is the place I highly recommend.  Some of my favorites are the sashimi poke, who's your dad roll, brooklyn bridge roll, black dragon roll, shrimp tempura roll, ebi, and unagi.  My only complaint, is the parking lot is extremely small (not their fault, their is a few restaurants in the same lot) and sometimes I have to park next to the mall in the other parking lot and walk.  *** TIP *** If you are going CALL AND MAKE A RESERVATION beforehand. Sometimes the wait can be 45 minutes (which I have done plenty of times because the food is that amazing, plus the shopping mall is literally in the next parking lot.  Food - 10/10 Service - 8/10 (sometimes they forget to bring rolls and I have to repeat myself) Atmosphere - 9/10 (I just would prefer the music choices to be different. They play a lot of the "hip" songs.)

IeMNh8iHOjFegLwFpGAThQ.text: The quality of the sushi here isn't that great. The fish isn't cold! The beef tongue skewer appetizer was delicious though~  The lunch price for AYCE is only $19.95, which is pretty reasonable. We had a great server too.  For the price, the experience wasn't bad.

RnpTdUtI4AORVx4j8SEhrg.text: Pardon me, but I did come and eat here twice in a week :P Yes I enjoyed it that much to have an AYCE again and eat like a queen, king, the whole kingdom of Suki Land. I have to say this is my favorite AYCE restaurant from all the others in Las Vegas. It's simple, fresh quality nigiri, rice perfectly formed ( not overly packed ), and everything I ate was GOOD, not mediocre... Tasty and satisfying good!!!   Parking could be a hassle on weekends and holidays. Be forewarned.. parking was full in this complex, so I parked in the Chinatown complex nearby Seafood Palace restaurant and minding my own business.. then slap right on my driver side window.. a warning note that my car will be towed next time I park in this area. Damn serious?! This lot is empty late at night, I'm doing this lonely lot a favor by parking here kiddin' me?!!??!! I guess the security guard saw me skipping happily away to Sushi Kaya and he got jelly.. I don't blame him.. I would be so jelly too, knowing I'll be chowing down some real good eats in a few minutes.   Sushi Kaya is tucked in the corner right next to Cafe Noodle & Chinese Barbecue restaurant. If you're not the type that reads signs and banners.. you might as well missed this place and gone to Anime Ramen. I lived here all my life and never even knew about this place until a few of my lovely coworkers decided to eat here after a crazy night at work. Fell in love that night with Kaya.. Sushi Kaya that is. Then came here again a few days after with my Family for my Brother's going away get together.   The owner is extremely kind and welcoming. Took our names and in matter of minutes, we were seated and our server, Juno, that's another story was attentive, patient, and sound in service. Almost like he had sixth sense of when we wanted to order more, to taking finished plates, drinks refilled, to just anything we needed he came around every time to see how we were doing and if we would like to order more. Couldn't have asked for a better server, yet alone a very handsome one :D   We didn't order any rolls, but only nigiri... Salmon, Tuna, Yellowtail, Scallop, Uni, and Sweet Shrimp. All were fresh and delicious. My favorite was the Salmon... never had it like this before.. melts just melts so smoothly in my mouth. We ordered ten orders of Salmon and Tuna. The cuts from the Salmon was the best quality I ever tasted.. Both my parents mentioned about it too. Unfortunately, it was so good that I forgot to take pic of it. Once I saw the dish, I devoured it.. I mean my Family and I killed the nigiri. We were like synchronized machines.. one by one.. nonstop. Finishing everything... Clean.   Raw oysters were fresh & ended with a reviving bite. I insisted that my brother's gf and my mother to eat it all, since I'm single.. know what I mean :P Eh anyways so much more food to enjoy, I just wanted everybody to eat a lot & be happy.   Bacon/asparagus and bacon/scallop... do I need to say more.. flavor madness.. must try!!  Shrimp and calamari tempura had such a light, crisp crunch. Not too oily or salty. The batter they make this in had to be fresh every time. I seriously enjoyed every bite!   Cucumber, Seaweed, and Salmon Skin salad.. sum it up with one word.. Refreshing!!!  My two favorites... Ginkgo nuts and sweet potato diced skewers. I'm not shy to order 20 each and cheerfully finished every single piece. I'm the killa of these two and don't tempt me to strike again, because I will! *chomp chomp chomp  We ordered desserts consisting of: five orders of mini cheesecakes, mocha almond/green tea/red bean ice cream, and green tea/red bean mochi.   In waiting.. I completely forgot I ordered  three orders of baked green mussels and the food runner goes.. ooooh are you done with dinner?!!? We all said Yeeeees. Then she goes oooh, but I have your last order of these mussels? Then my whole family looked at me haha I go... it's okay... no problem.. I'll still take it :P Done. It had a caramel finish in taste and cheese topping. Very yummy for my tummy. No problem...  Desserts all came and I ended up finishing all the mini cheesecakes, since my family warned me they couldn't hang anymore.. what I say... No problem.. I'll eat them for you. My Brother keeps saying out loud.. Damn my sister can eat!! Damn right. Weak sauces... nah just kidding. We all did a great job in finishing all our dishes.   From start to finish.. it was a great experience in dining here. Food and service were on point and never at any given moment was it a disappointment. Food came out promptly and never once were we just sitting there without anything to munch on. Always busy eating away!!! Ha! :P   The price is so reasonable and exceptionally affordable compared to other AYCE places. Don't forget to ask for a punch card to redeem after 10 visits :) And best of all.. it's open late hours.. last call I believe is 2:30 in the mooorning, seven days a week. Even the interior design of this place is cozy, love the bird cage looking lamp!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini Cheesecakes!!! So soft and light.. yummy!!!
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Round 2
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The goods ;)

ud9CfQblqjNXz0osYGVjxA.text: Went there yesterday for the first time, and was amazed!  In the beginning, after we ordered appetizers, they were slow coming back, but after that, it was great! Service was great. Staff was friendly and attentive, the sushi was excellent, and the AYCE price was Great!!

LPUaSJSuH1iRS2xiq0GISg.text: Really fast service and good rolls, but they didn't have that much nigiri sushi..

TOv75WjAHoyyCG_sska6Wg.text: It's yummy sushi for Vegas, The best way to go is all you can eat for 26$ because 1 specialty roll alone is 12$. I don't know why but the floor is always slippery walk to the restroom with caution the music is super loud here so loud it will have you shouting across the table to your date the only plus side to the music being so loud is you can fart all you want and nobody will hear it and they have the same 15 annoying songs on repeat that get stuck in your head and haunt you all night while you are trying to sleep get a new playlist Kaya. Other then That the food is good and they will have you waddling out the door satisfied.

tY33KbWS_fKEg0fBXhk6mw.text: I don't eat fish, but as you probably know everyone else you know does and when you're in Vegas it's pretty good odds you're going to end up at a sushi place. So while everyone else will concentrate on the seafood related menu options this review is for those of us that don't eat seafood. For many years my group of friends would go to another place in a strip mall that seats about 3  1/2 people which naturally makes large groups hard to seat, and in case you have a short attention span I don't eat fish so the choices were limited to appetizers so I had about twenty plates varying between teriyaki chicken and beef, Miso, and cucumber salad.    This year however we went to Sushi Kaya and they had a ton of choices and they were all great I especially liked the beef bowl. I especially liked that the service was fast, we ordered our first round and the waiter looked at us and said "the food comes fast you really need to order more." And he wasn't kidding. For desert I really liked the mini cheese cake, which of course you're saying who doesn't like cheese cake, right? Well I loathe cheese cake so consider it high praise from me.  Now if you eat fish from what everyone said that was all good too, but really just read another review if you want more detail.

9Beu3xrnrfym4zoWBtmPZA.text: it used to  e my go to spot for sushi .. but the service is getting worst and worse.. the food is good but the fact that you have like 5 servers and none of them smile or look happy ruins anyone's meal.. i've brought a few different friends and each one agrees with me . great food but horrible service.. they need to go to customer service classes

2f5HKvSGXfLTW_fx9Vs1rg.text: Came here after spending a couple of hours at Valley of Fire and we thought we were too late to catch the lunch AYCE but when we got our bill, we were charged for the lunch time price. SCORE! Anywho, we were seated right away and someone came to give us menus and get our drink orders. We did the AYCE and we calculated how much my husband and I ate and it was well worth the price. We managed to get three rounds done and everything was pretty tasty. The quality of the food we got was good and the longest we had to wait was no more than five minutes after ordering. Even if someone wasn't our waiter, we were asked if we wanted to order more which was nice and they weren't overbearing.

f82VcnGOr8bioMVZy6GsyQ.text: Zero star., if I can. Too much monosodium glutamate on the food to make it flavorful but still flavorless.   Vineger on seafood sushi..Seriously? Is this actually  japanese restaurant??  Had lunch @noon, now it's 8pm, been thirsty since we left the restaurant. No matter how much water I drink afterwards can not stop the thirsty feeling.   Will not be back nor recommend to anyone.

s4tB9XojmlhbMaiO-l3WBA.text: But the all u can eat comeon now~?.  It is the best deal by far and the sushi is so very fresh and tasty.    In the heart of china town, and in a strip mall at Spring Mountain and Arville.  The sushi is fresh, well prepared, spiced enough , but not too much and the drinks are cold.  Solid stuff here, with value.  Get some!

Ex9hJ6w9ShjLmEsj7-ZpDQ.text: I won't lie, I love coming here for late night sushi. Unfortunately the service doesn't match the love I have for the sushi. I told my server and everyone bringing plates to my table that there was a serious allergy. Not once, not twice, but three times did we send back food because there were said allergy within the dish. When the server was called he did not show emotion and didn't apologize. He didn't even know what was in the dish. Even when asked to speak to the manager of the shift, not even he could bring me to forgive this place. All he did was say he'll speak to the server and walked away. I hope they do read my post and realize the food industry isn't a joke.

GkFH4I97MwYmsn5rDgBxow.text: Been coming here for YEARS!   AYCE SUSHI AND SOJU!!                                           These things are a MUST TRY if you don't have ayce sushi at home. I love being served by a variety of servers! I have yet to beat their timing with figuring out what to do next when having ayce sushi. But make sure you call ahead- sometimes there is a wait when a bunch of people wanna get their sushi on AT THE SAME TIME! oh man.....I am having sushi cravings....I am being overwhelmed with the desire to experience a wasabi-wow! Next time I go I am sure I will leave more than satisfied.... Be prepared for a sushi coma.

tueZi8XuWPzqkQjjUUTpmQ.text: This place has been my go-to for two years so far. I'm originally from San Diego and every time I would visit. This is the spot. All you can eat DELICIOUS FLAVORFUL sushi & end it with my favorite-mochi ice cream. I now live here in Vegas and still recommend this restaurant to family and friends who come by to visit from San Diego.

UUkhnBjGYS-Ua93BEDrBwQ.text: Expensive for what you get. I work at Kumi so maybe im just used to the best quality. My girlfriend got a basic spicy tuna roll and it sucked. The miniscule beef skewer was mostly fat. The only decent item was "who your daddy roll"  Wont go back.

8fJYZd-PC0filG2oWo2x5Q.text: We waited for 20-30 mins while people who arrived later where seated. Also instead of seating 8 people on to a table, we where squeezed to a 6 person booth. The hostess had a slight attitude with us. Food was decent but our poke looked a little old.  We ate here before and it was decent, now in our opinion this place has dropped to a one star.

hqy9KG1UbVEOMhbn_ERXRQ.text: This place is my new favorite little sushi spot in town. I went there a couple weeks ago for the first time and as soon as you walk through the door all eyes are on you. Everyone is extremely friendly. I have never had a waiter so happy to hear my order! I was so impressed with their customer service that I wasn't surprised that their food was just as impressive. All the sushi rolls on the menu were half off making this place the cheapest sushi place I have eaten at. I had 3 rolls and an appetizer for 15 dollars! The sushi was very fresh and they put very little rice on their rolls and sushimi.   Their combo specials are:  1.) classic roll + miso soup + mini salad for $6.00 2.) chef special roll+ classic roll+miso soup+mini salad for $8.00 3.)2 chef special rolls+miso soup+mini salad for $10.00 *The small salad that they serve comes with ginger dressing.  Overall I would highly recommend this place to everyone! The food, atmosphere and service is great!

PIs8JFjQf0JZigdtBVnMPg.text: Sushi Kaya is usually my go to place for all you can eat sushi in Las Vegas. Located in Chinatown, parking can be a bit difficult if it's busy. Me and my siblings usually come here for dinner time or late night eating session after walking the strip or watching a Vegas show. Price is fairly reasonable at $25 per person if you do the AYCE. If you don't have an appetite you can order individually but cannot share food from those who did choose the AYCE choice.   There is so many sushi rolls to choose from and I would recommend to try them all if you could. Don't over order because you can get full very fast. The skewers are delicious and I enjoy the beef tongue skewer and the bacon with scallops. Both are tasty ad juicy ,not overcooked. I like the gyoza and the calamari but then again you can never go wrong with appetizers. My friend tried the Uni Nigiri which she thought was delicious (it's not my thing so I did not think it was as yummy). Anything with spicy ahi or shrimp tempura in the rolls were delicious. Fish does taste fresh and just enough spicy.  The setting is almost like a mix of korean and japanese. They have some korean art work up as well as play korean music if you can hear it in the distance. Wait time can vary if they are busy, I think they longest we have waited was 45 minutes for a table.

Jf9do10m4eLlS8RS4x_RGQ.text: Amazing!!!! We have been there Twice Now, and I've been craving Sushi since then (just not in our budget) - They had an Awesome Wait Staff and Food came out Perfect and Fast- We had 7 different roll's + Edamame (appetizer)+ 4 Garlic Tuna Nigiri (of course) + the Quail eggs (trust Me) + the green tea ice cream for dessert (refreshing) - All You Can Eat, isn't that expensive - We paid $50 for 2 people plus $18 tip, We will be back next Month for Our Date Night

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fVsn9gHZEPfQSZ7PmEQk9Q.text: So, I lucked out and this place wasn't super slammed last night (Monday of Chinese New Year) when I took a couple clients here. The 3 of us were sat immediately upon walking in at 7:20pm.  We lucked out.  It's pretty close to The Mirage (where they were staying) and it's pretty easy to find provided you know that it's tucked into a strip mall in China Town / Little Asia.  Parking was a bit tough since there are a couple other eating establishments in the same strip mall so .... that might be problem.  We had to circle the lot and on the second pass a car left so I could snap the spot.  The Good: - Dinner AYCE is $25 - Good variety on their menu - All the rolls we ordered (can't remember them all) were tasty ... some were better than others - Our favorites: Jose Roll; Rainbow Roll; Kaya Roll - They don't drown their rolls in sauce ... the sauce is an accent... not overpowering - The ginger was fresh and crisp - The Green Tea ice cream was smooth and creamy - And most importantly... my clients liked everything and were stuffed  The Not so Good: - It's pretty loud in there when it's busy - Had to flag down servers to order and get refills - The servers didn't explain how the AYCE works (luckily I'm well versed and explained it to my guests) - While the rolls were good, the sashimi wasn't the best (I use Naked Fish as my standard on sashimi)  The I don't know where to rank this: - We also ordered the Baked Mussels which were served HOT (that's good) but it was in a creamy, cheesy sauce.... it was good but couldn't really taste the mussel... maybe that was the point - The Red Bean ice cream was good but the consistency was grainy

2QlNxPfHbYFYcm0s4RoByg.text: Susho Kaya is tucked into a corner of the infamous China Town.  One of the things I love, love, love about Vegas is the abundance of AYCE sushi. Sushi Kaya offered fresh rolls. There was no half roll option (which really bums me out when you are dining with only two people or by yourself). There were no rolls that really stood out to me.  One cool they do offer is a punch card. Yes, ladies and gents, a punch card for AYCE sushi. 10 punches and you have a free AYCE sushi dinner. This almost makes up for the half roll option.  Then when the bill came, they don't take card for orders under $10. This again put a sour damper on my night.   Good sushi, weird policies, and a punch card. Solid 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kaya punch card!!!

XCHZQpCJqq2zJISW_LyFEA.text: Wide choices of menu .good food . Clean and nice place . We will recommend it to our friends. I really love sushi all you can eat if I'm here in the states. The service is fast . Usd 25 adults and usd 13 for kids for dinner .

v9S4dzEytBOchrrvJz6sgw.text: Best sushi in town. Great all-you-can eat menu selection that does not cover their rolls with massive amounts of rice to fill you up faster.  They have super fast service and a great staff!

mjHc5ORyCtx42bYXwwUEoA.text: Quality was terrible tonight. The amount of rice served with the sushi tonight was stifling. The quality of the sushi was completely down tonight.

lWD7JSuog0Hb3q2dv9J6fA.text: Been here a couple of times and sushi is always delish!  On weekends there's always atleast 45 min wait,  which is a pain,  but it's worth it!  They have so many options I've tried different things and have yet to find something I don't like!   Hostess are great, very friendly and helpful,  servers are more on the serious side,  wish they would smile more but they're  not rude, plus food and drinks come out fast so I can deal with that!

6HMM6q0hHRJ_RawMZ_zweA.text: I feel awful that I am writing a one star review. When we arrived off the beaten path, I thought, great, I place few visit. I read the reviews and visited YAMA SUSHI, but wanted to try more than one ayce places in Vegas, so off we went to KAYA Sushi.  We seat down and were warmly treated, they have an extensive menu, and we ordered. A couple minutes into being seated at the bar a caca rocuhe ran up from under the bar. My wife noticed it, I tried to play it off and said I didn't see anything, wanting to give them a chance, but momentarily later it resurfaced, and that was the end of our visit. We very quietly got up and let the manager know, who was very apologetic. When we exited the restaurant a family was looking under an suv, I thought they had hit the curb, nope it was a dead rat.

GQHZnw_OCEM661klmT5fcA.text: Me and 3 of my friends are at Kaya on 2/25/16 and became very ill afterwards from food poisoning. 3 of us had to be seen by a doctor. As of this review the restaurant has a rating of "B" by the health department.

jfvQEiiSPbzH2VF5rbW0cQ.text: The food is amazing, the deep fried philadephia is sooo good!!! The service is pretty bad, everyone is usually rude and stressed out, and there is usually a waiting line, but the sushi is so worth it...

RC0B9CukdZkWmoQwyMvodg.text: First time coming to this place was a great experience.  Customer service was topnotch and quick. I usually don't't eat sushi but the server made it easy for me to order by making recommendations that were to my liking. The only con i have is the lasagna sushi was not my favorite I expected something different from other experiences I had. But overall  I will definitely come back here with my girlfriends again.

6KGfnjI2Fm2ZfmWv6hVKbA.text: Friendly service and awesome food. We tried new things and loved everything we tried. I like that the menu shows if the rolls have raw items on them!!! They were also accommodating bc I requested soy paper and it was no problem.

TVcFQwUWTvkPQ_-7i9-gVA.text: Very delicious and worth the price ayce sushi the only problem almost all the time the waiting time more the 45 min and always hard to find a parking

Mt4V1zp-7R6IEA0j6_WZCw.text: I have been going to Kaya for about 5 years now (wow didn't think it was that long). I fell inlove with it the first time I went!  $20-$25 for all you can eat sushi, and wonderful service! They always have at least 6 people running around helping customers even if it is not the table or section they are assigned.   Only down side I would say is the place is kind of small for how busy it is, I definitely think they should expand!   Other than that the tables are spacious and comfy, again amazing service and the food is TO DIE FOR!! Even my toddler loves coming here with me and eating off my plate.   Always recommend the Sweety Roll, Dynamite, and Baked Muscles!!

kiy1JQg2UB4wEE1uIjX4Og.text: Sooooo disappointed that we came to this place to eat!!..Totally will not recommend this place to my family & friends at all. Not only we waited to be seated for about 30-45 mins but the service is bad too!. The food is nothing extra ordinary either. Whew! Bad dining experienced for us. We just wasted our money and time coming to this place. Totally two thumbs down my yelpers!  We would rather go next time @ Oishi sushi on  W. 215 - rainbow/warmspring, or Yama sushi on flamingo/maryland, or go to a buffet @ Makino on Flamingo/Decatur,  or @ Kabuki resto (best in town!) in town square... but never again to this place!

p5Jl1y8mz5xuNKMe-sfG5g.text: I've come here a few times, usually for lunch, and it's always been a great time. Today, however, left something to be desired - namely, sushi.   The place had a foul, sewer smell. I'm going to assume this isn't their fault, but regardless it's unappealing for a restaurant.   Several of the serving dishes were noticeably chipped. I'm no expert, but that seems like a food safety hazard to me; Let alone how it impacts the presentation.   The food was phenomenal as always, especially the house made pot stickers. Light, flaky and full of flavor. A must order.   Our server was decent, I guess. We said we wanted to wait for our Japanese Lasagna roll to come before we ordered more...and didn't see her again for 25 minutes. Just because I want to pace myself doesn't mean I want to be ignored or I'm done eating.   I'm sure I'll be back, but my expectations have definitely been lowered.  Finally got to order another round and dessert...the mini cheesecake came out frozen. Literally rock hard. What the hell?

vAxpWtgLOJ3Ss70pKBakxQ.text: Food poisoning!! I ate at Sushi Kaya on Thursday 2/25/16 with 3 friends. My partner and I met up there with 2 other friends we hadn't seen in awhile. Read up on why the restaurant currently has a B rating. Two days later everyone but me went to the emergency room. I didn't go because I couldn't be away from the toilet for the car ride. Never going there again. Be warned.

Kr3Mb5GSjV188VnPjtNZSQ.text: Still an empty space sits but no where to sit to eat. Not a personal computer is here because this is obviously not about the needs of the customer. Bad management decisions are perpetuating long wait times and more negative reviews.  Lastly, my husband and I could hear the waiters and food peepers making gay jokes from our table near the restrooms. Very unprofessional.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bAgJY5uwzCD5d0BztctUUQ.text: This place is not the greatest. Music is so loud that the people in your own table can't hear you. The selection of sushi is not the greatest. 80% of it have tempura shrimp. The minimal raw fish was not fresh and it was extremely fishy. The cheesecake they have for dessert is frozen. Not a good experience. Choose a different place to eat!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This cheesecake...not edible it&#39;s so hard. My spoon has been there at least 10 minutes!

sn0gFaBlr8404CH7U1xWeg.text: LOVE this place! Reasonable priced All-You-Can-Eat with a large selection of items! Fun music! Can often get pretty busy around dinnertime, but it's worth the wait! They also have a stamp card. I love filling up my card and getting a free AYCE meal!

pxnZt91Gua_QgbY2HAKdJg.text: And the winner to my very first review goes to... THIS PLACE.   Why? It's the very first AYCE sushi joint I have consistently gone to over the past two years or so after discovering it (despite my lack of check-ins), and of course, because I have really come to love the specialty rolls, appetizers and nigiri here.  Like any sushi place I've tried, I end up loving the most awkwardly named rolls to say out loud on the menu- the Sex Bomb is my fave here. My other usuals are Brooklyn Bridge, Wall Street and Mango Style. Salmon nigiri is always refreshing, as well as the white tuna. I have fallen into the habit of getting a side of garlic ponzu sauce to dip them in. Spicy garlic ponzu sometimes too! They have THE BEST beef skewers, so tender and flavorful, but it's on that infamous *one order per person* list :(  I LOVE THE PLUM WINE ICE CREAM. End of story.  In general, the actual restaurant is nice and decently spaced. At the tables that you would think receive a lot of neglect because of its placement don't! They all have call buttons to press to prevent that from happening. It's decorated nicely, with pretty Christmas lights that are up year-round and funny Japanese masks that make me laugh if I stare too long.  Service is pretty speedy, except when busy but that's expected. Good price for AYCE and they have stamp cards! All in all, one of the better end sushi places in the Chinatown area of Vegas. Recommended for sure!

o4LwV_eb5ye430BORMWXhA.text: Let me start by saying that I love AYCE places, however I have never had a good AYCE sushi until Sushi Kaya. While we are on the positives let me begin with the fact that most of the rolls are REALLY GOOD, my best advice would be to get half rolls that way you get to try different rolls.Also the little ice cream at the end is pretty good.  Now let's talk about the reasons why I might not be returning to this place. First of all service is somewhat slow and not so friendly (It may just be a language barrier), if my water is empty for more than 5 minutes then we have an issue. Second, when the rolls started coming in we had play a guessing game trying to figure out which one was which one since the server just dropped them off without saying a word (this gets frustrating after a while since several of the rolls look really similar). And finally this is probably the biggest negative of this place, the cracked/chipped plates. As other reviewers already mentioned the majority of the plates are cracked/chipped and I was scared from a food safety perspective, especially when we are talking about uncooked meats (sushi).  Overall a good place to try out once, but probably won't be back.

gLd6SF9iq6ZDjYbZVPypZg.text: Went for the first time about a week or two ago,and I don't know why I waited so long to try it! The food here is amazing! The place is very nicely kept! The hostess are we're very friendly. Our waiter was wonderful and very attentive. I will definitely be going back a lot!!!!! I most definitely recommend this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the California dream roll, it&#39;s to die for. There&#39;s is also a piece of the Washington roll which is delicious as well!

v3B8GtLN2Phu5MTRy5qovg.text: Sushi Kaya - All you can eat sushi - Average bill ~$25. After eating at so many sushi buffet restaurants I don't know how to taste the difference anymore. Compare to sushi yama, this place have less rice on their sushi yet also less food items on the menu. Overall experience, it would be ~3.5 stars because service is pretty much the same everywhere, nothing special about them

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RA9Dq-yjt_6iapKJTOvaBw.text: My favorite sushi place in Las Vegas!! All you can eat sushi! I love this place although it does take about an hour to sit us every time we go, but it is worth the wait. If you decide to get all you can eat, I think it is best when you go with a group of friends because you can share with everyone and there is no limit in to how many plates you order. We tend to get the private room all the time because we tend to go in group of 10 people.  the sushi here is amazing! I do have some favorites. the triple xxx roll is to die for! appetizers are great! and the best part is dessert! I love me some moshi ice cream! I recommend sushi kaya.

M6KWS0qAE5nB3bcVBliH_w.text: Food was good I was very surprised by how good the maguro (tuna) and hamachi (yellowtail) nigiri was! And service was fantastic, efficient and friendly. I'll definitely be back!

SGW0CExQh-9CRHKdI4yaWw.text: This is my go-to sushi place!! I come a few times a month. I love their loyalty program and their selection of starters, sides and rolls. Everyone is always really sweet, the service is great and the hostesses always sit us as quickly as possible.  I bring all my friends here and they love it! Open super late which is a major plus. Fish is ALWAYS fresh and yummy! (:

hXpszWCqCEsLrnopfYSWGA.text: I've been coming here for years now, Sushi Kaya has always been my go-to AYCE sushi bar, and the service and sushi itself has always been great. Lately the past few visits their service is just not so great. It seems like a whole new crew, because Im not seeing any familiar workers. The servers always have a resting bitch face which comes out intimidating, and always to have some sort of attitude taking and giving our orders. They never seem to smile or like to talk, we tried greeting one our servers and thanking her, but she just slid the sushi place on our table, rolled her eyes, and walked away. It was an upsetting and awkward dinner.

dbq4gsdB62Bfewcsk7inrw.text: Extremely disappointed. I'm totally letting the quality of the service I received outweigh the food. If you're in the mood for good food and you don't mind crappy customer service, then this place will suit you just right.   I've been to sushi kaya many times in the past and wasn't always impressed with their customer service. The main reason I come back is for the decent pricing and good food. I even had my birthday dinner here last year. Their sushi selection is good and the AYCE menu has a variety of appetizers and tapas. I can't remember how much the lunch AYCE price is but dinner is ~$25 which is pretty competitive compared to other sushi joints around town. Aside from the food, their service totally got in the way and ruined my likes for this place. They're open until 3am but last call is at 2:15am. I opted not to get AYCE because we got there at 2am and 15 minutes was definitely not enough time for me to order a crap ton of food. I ended up getting stuff from their regular menu (kimchi fried rice $8.95 and four pieces of agedashi tofu $5.95) while a couple of my friends did AYCE. While my friends were ordering, the waiter kept interrupting them saying they were not allowed to share their food with myself and another friend since we were ordering stuff from the regular menu. We could tell he was not happy that they were doing AYCE right before closing time. It was just a huge disappointment. If you're gonna offer hours of service until a specific time, have the decency to honor and uphold it! They were pretty quick with bringing our food out but that's probably because we were the only guests there, aside from a couple that were seated a little before us. Near the end of our meal, they came by to ask how we were doing. My friends were missing a couple of their orders so they went to check. The waiter argued that we had received the orders already and defaulted the blame on the server, excusing her because she's still training. Regardless of the fact that she is new, he should not have argued with us. It was not professional by any means. We finished eating and continued to sit there to chit chat but noticed that it got extremely cold around 2:40ish. I'm not sure if they cranked up the a/c to get us out or if they just had a door open. We paid our bill and there was still 20 minutes left before closing time. We probably should have left right away since we knew they were closing but we were in the middle of a great conversation which was interrupted by the waiter. He came over to tell us that we had to leave because they were closing. I totally understand but it was very awkward. He didn't walk away from our table until we got up to leave. It's not like we were gonna camp out there all night.  I wasn't happy walking out of there. I'll probably come back again but it will definitely not be my first choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kimchi fried rice

H2a_2N80cj9Kvnn-j53RmA.text: Seriously the worst service I have ever had! Honestly I've been coming here for a while now never had this kind of experience. We came here at 3pm it's not even busy, maybe 6 tables no huge parties. We order food and they didn't bring some of the dishes we ordered. I ordered bacon scallops and I literally had to ask the server 4 times where they were. He never came to check on us, no one did they just looked at us and walked away. Finally we got upset and asked them where our food was and he said I told you the first time we ran out of bacon and scallops by that time I was so upset and told them it has been 15 min and no one had asked if we wanted anything else. The server argued with us that he did come and check on us which was not professional at all. Then he switched table with a different server, and the table next to us were upset too for the same thing. Never recommending this place or coming back. Horrible service

30QO0HkQm60ehMPVYmRyyQ.text: I've eaten at a lot of Sushi place and this one by far has the best service and selection. They still have all you can eat for a good price. I have also taken many friends here and no one had ever gotten sick. The reason a mention this because of what others have wrote in their reviews.

wBoHadyu_aker9ms6SpVpw.text: The best sushi in town. Smoked salmon nigri is my favorite. Don't forget to ask for a "punch card". I'm glad it's not closer to home or id be there every night. Service is great and they have late night hours

gAyoSCS9iWH6KSHq8YewIQ.text: This is my favorite sushi place in Vegas hands down. The waiters and managers are always really nice and have a positive attitude and the sushi is really great and always really fresh. My favorite roll is the sex bomb and many others from their diverse menu. When friends and family from out of town visit, this is the first place I bring them to and they love it just as much.

obINmTAO95wH4JqsroujCg.text: When my daughters have a craving for sushi....we mostly end up here. Good place and just down the street.feome home. Never a dissapointment while dining here. Happy eats!

7LwVxnX2wCDAiXMuJSLWKw.text: Yummy AYCE sushi. Well worth the lunch and dinner prices. I am only rating this establishment 4 stars because they took out the oysters from the dinner menu.  :). Please bring them back!

TZofvpELkgdFT8YpD6gr8g.text: Worse place EVER! Tables are dirty & sticky! Some of the staff members need to be retrained on customer service. FOH

mAC_rdyAgYcEjr9fzGY4ag.text: I went for lunch and had my big meal for the day, the all-you-can-eat for $20.  I had shrimp tempura for an appetizer and they were very nicely done.  The miso soup was nice.  I had a spider roll, a Lisa Lisa roll-shrimp tempura with cream cheese and avocado, a Kaya roll-spicy tuna, smelt roe and asparagus.  All of those rolls were good.  The tuna (maguro) sashimi looked pale and washed out, like it had been thawed out recently and it lacked flavor.  The masago (smelt roe) looked strangely like that, too, but was OK.  The service was excellent.  Overall, I enjoyed it and would return.

KVqn_p0iKeI9-fmRqCiLeQ.text: This place is the best for AYCE sushi. They have the best rolls, especially for people who don't eat raw fish. Whenever my boyfriend and I go, all the employees are so friendly and inviting. The pricing ($27) is great for their quality and their service. I would highly suggest getting the "Jackpot" roll and the "Who's Your Dad?" roll. This is my go to place for sushi!!!

QGO8ZyCQxQ1p5_tgDYiEAQ.text: This ayce sushi place is actually pretty good. The ayce includes from appetizers to desserts. It's $27 and I think it's worth it.   The good thing about this place is that they don't fill their rolls or nigiri with lots of rice like other ayce sushi places. They have a great selection of rolls but in the end they all start to taste the same. They use the same ingredients for most of them if you read through their descriptions.   They come around often to see if you want anymore or anything you need. The service is good and quick.   I would recommend this place.

R2Ih1PzLGxl8XNW7Q9FSoA.text: Kaya has been on my bookmarked list for some time now. There is a large selection of rolls here, but a majority of them are listed as spicy and contain mostly the same ingredients. The nigiri selection is decent and the fish pieces are huge.   AYCE dinner is $27 and I think I would have enjoyed myself a bit more if I had sat at a table rather than the sushi bar. Servers grab their orders off the top of the bar, and there is a lot of hustle and bustle and shouting that interrupts the dining experience. Not a big deal since sitting at the bar meant not having to wait long, but something to consider.   Sushi was pretty fresh, but I didn't have anything that really stood out. I'm actually leaning toward 3.5 stars because Kaya is a solid sushi spot...just nothing special in my opinion.

Xq09asZl9I7eg5LZTGCjiw.text: Service is quick and attentive. Lots of staff around. We had three different people ask us if everything was good and if we needed refills on any of our drinks. We both ordered the All You Can Eat. Most restaurants intentionally slow down their cooking/preparation for all you can eat. This was NOT the case here. They are very generous and quickly prepare your order. They aren't shy about asking if there is anything you'd like to order. Staff is very friendly and very attentive.   DEFINITELY recommend.

RMpSZcWN1bkSJ7lP3LAuoA.text: The best sushi ever. It's not important if you have to wait a little bit. Will be the your best decision ever

bE7kQ5ioveiu4Lu8R_PBtQ.text: I loved this place until today. I work in customer service and get yelled and screamed at on a daily, so I don't understand why as a one time gesture they couldn't accommodate us. I get that it seems a little shady that towards the end of our meal once we got the check we noticed the bill was wrong.      First off, I asked for separate checks. They didn't do it. Second of all the manager came right next to our table and asked the girls next to us if they were okay and said nothing to us. Which I thought was poor customer service, but what really urks me is that I made an innocent mistake and stated that both myself and my friend were doing all you can eat when really it was just me doing all you can eat.         I thought I heard my friend say "yes". I get it MY FAULT! That's what I told the waiter and the manager! I said, "it's my fault, not yours but can you help us it was an innocent misunderstanding, my friends first time, WE MESSED UP". They gave us their policy and procedure story, which is fair, but I didn't yell, I didn't disrespect them, I was just assertive. I asked if the manager could help as a one time gesture. He said NO. I ADMITTED to messing UP! I didn't lie and cause a scene, but he refused to help!   When you work in customer service I understand you can't always compensate for the client's error, but they didn't trust us even after I recited everything I ordered. They didn't listen and care to help.      The atmosphere and music were fine, the waitress she's fine. Overall, great food. Service was slacking a little more than normal. Usually, they are much more on point and they check on us more. The hostess, the guy James was great, but the Male MANAGER did NOT have good customer service. BAD experience. I hope it was his off day. ... Unfortunately, I guess I never posted this, but this occurred in  2016.

NC1h2wV3s5tV9JLxDINbWg.text: Sushi was decent, service was iffy, and the table was dirty and had a suspicious sticky residue all over it. Also, we received sushi that was served on a cracked plate... That can't be sanitary!!  The sushi also didn't taste very fresh; in fact it was almost too warm and was pretty unpleasant to eat. In addition, it was served with so much sauce that it was soupy, and it certainly didn't help that the sauce was so watery. For the price you pay, you'd expect top notch quality, but this place didn't deliver. All in all, do yourself a favor and try any other sushi place in Vegas, it'll probably be better.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A CRACKED PLATE. We were served warm sushi on a cracked plate!

F50Y2Ulw3Jm9befB3rF8uA.text: The service here was amazing and the all you can eat sushi came out superquick.  I would definitely go back for the all you can eat sushi I love that you can do half orders of the specialty rolls.  But I think I'm spoiled by a different sushi place in Vegas even though you can't do all you can eat at that particular sushi restaurant.  But for all you can eat sushi this place was amazing.

Your lunch all you can eat deal is the (sex) BOMB DOT COM!   $21.95 per person, you can order half rolls (shout out to all the other girls who want to try everything but can't eat 8 rolls of everything), and literally everything but 3 items on the menu are fair game. ztUOXV8I8j4OUUH8lLHRcw.text: I loved this place and have been going here since 2014... until recently. The last few times I've gone, me and my partner have been met with rudeness. However, we decided to give the place another try. Tonight was the first time i have ever had someone take my plate and tell me I'm going to get charged for "extra rice" IN THE MIDST OF ME EATING! I wasn't even asked if i was done. Not only that, the last time me and my partner went, he was accused of trying to take the ice cream out of the shop. Incredible. Needless to say, we will not be returning.   *the waitresses are sweet but the manager is rude

2zWqEp2IfvFsclRaEOTpGg.text: Wow, just had lots of dust fall in my food twice over there. Please keep an eye out on dust falling into your food. They will most likely start wiping down the wood near the front after what happened. Just look up and see heavy amounts of dust. I should have taken a picture but I let it go because sometimes bad things happen.  Anyway they relocate us to another table and the busser brought the same drinks over from the dusty table.  When I asked him nicely to change it because of the dust issue he rolled his eyes at me making the whole experience terrible. I did not ask to change it to make his life harder, but because dust was flying everywhere when they wiped it down.   I previously wrote great things about this place but will have to change that with this terrible interaction.  When I spoke to the manager he tried to lie and say he did not roll his eyes and they asked me to leave. He was trying to argue with me when I called his attitude out.

ZeBvvrTpoHQSvcqGTIRRuA.text: Shrinking menu?  Been a regular at this spot for about 4 years now, and we fell in love with it instantly. Buuuuut, in the past 6 months, there have been some changes.  Let's start off with the overall dressup. Parking is very, VERY limited. Kaya shares a lot that houses multiple restaurants and shops, so on a busy day like today, expect to park and walk from the neighboring China Town Mall. When you walk in, the interior decor is simple and inviting. Mixture of Hannya masks, and story art. Sushi bar is big enough to seat about 15 people, and a private party room that seats Mayne 20. They can combine tables for larger parties. They are very clean here, mopping, and keeping tables clean and ready for the next paying customer.  Ambience is mellow, with mixed genre music playing in the background. What we come for: AYCE, usually dinner because that's when soft shell crab, uni, and sweet shrimp are available.  Special rolls: Mango style roll - inside mango, crab, cucomber. Outside: salmon, tuna, yellowtail, and avocado with aspicy garlic ponzu sauce  Spider roll - inside: crab, avocado. Outside: cucomber, gobo, and kaiwari with eel sauce   Ok so here it is. We've never had bad service here ever, but like I've mentiond, changes. Let's start off with the menu. No more softshell  crab app.. (nooooooo!), and no or limited Uni. Hmmm.. sweet shrimp doesn't include the fried head anymore. OH! And not to mention my Sake (salmon) kama. Yup, deleted off the menu like a smelly fart. There are more deletions, but these were my top ordered items.   small FLAVOR! Ever since Kaya has been getting more business,  flavor has been ghosting. (There but pretty faint), almost bad enough where the "Ghost Hunters" may have a hard time locating their taste pallets.. The baked green muscles definitely changed. Too much cheese, making it dry. They used to have larger muscles, but now use a huge shell, and put 2 small muscle like "thingys" in its place. It says spicy sashimi poki, but missing that kick. We do not usually order "special" rolls, but tried the spider and mango roll due to them being new arrivals. All I can say is, I'm sticking to Nigiri.   Anyways, Sorry Kaya, you have dropped from being our first choice as our go to AYCE. The customer service is good. Having separated the duties to server and waitress only, helps them concentrate on their jobs.   NOTE: tried ordering redbean mochi or icecream. Nothing, star drop.  Ok so to end it, we still like it here. Not the best hype like back in the days, but enough to fight those raw fish urges. I have a stamp card that needs one more signature,  then we get a free meal, so I'll save it for the update. Not the best, not bad. Looks like we'll have to find another sushi diamond.

pkCOSw1j6F6TJbctzkAbBg.text: Service and food get WORSE each time I get here! I've been here about 4 different occasions at different hours/day's and bringing fewer and fewer people along. I brought my cousin here today for lunch and while we were seated immediately it took a FULL 20 MINUTES for the wait staff to ask us what we wanted to eat. Not to mention the ladies sitting next to our table were seated and asked what they'd like to order within the first FIVE MINUTES Of being seated? Is it because they're white? Because we're Filipino? Because my cousin wore hoops? Tell me why that's acceptable? And when I complained to the waiter he spent the next ten minutes eye-ing me down until near the end of our meal. Prejudice and racist service, they gave us old brown tuna-which fresh tuna btw is a nice red or pink color. It isn't smushed up, it isn't freezing cold to the touch, and fresh is certainly NOT what they served myself and my cousin. Please explain why you would serve old fish in the middle of the day? Our meal was at LUNCH time. That's disgusting and I feel so bad for anyone who would be eating later in the day if this is their way of serving meals or preparing food. I had to demand and repeatedly ask for missing portions of our meal and it wasn't until I put my Louis bag on the table and literally took my phone out to time the poor service / wait, did they actually start to be remotely attentive. A waiter actually asked me if we had even ordered 30 MINUTES into us being seated at our table. Why are you waiting so long to realize there are people I served at your restaurant ?! Bottom line is if you're expecting to eat fresh sushi and be treated respectfully then I GUESS you should bring your money to the table and not show up there as a medium/darker skinned person. I'm never eating here again and I'll certainly not bring my cousin here again-she's 15 and should not be exposed to this prejudice.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. OLD FISH BURIED UNDER THEIR SAUCES

YjnR7EDICigBK0sJOsg1RQ.text: I have been coming here for years. I took a break from coming here due to the many times of bad service. I thought I would give them a try again and probably not going to be coming back.  They are just not friendly here. We have dined here so much that we have a numerous stamp cards to use for free AYCE meals. Once we use these, we won't be coming back.

7HuEwqmBfTZnTG6HH3HRRQ.text: Went here with a group of 4 at 9pm. Was immediately warmly greeted and sat down. The waitress also immediately brought us water, asked us if we wanted anything else to drink and suggested a few starters. We ordered around 20 different half orders of rolls and appetizers with Moshi to finish the night. Everything was delicious, uniquely prepared and fresh. Hands down one of my favorite sushi experiences and for the $30pp unlimited tasting price, can't beat it!  They do charge for pieces you don't eat but that's normal at any all you can eat establishments. It clearly says it on the menu anyways. This is a great place for first time sushi eaters and those who like cooked rolls. They also have the healthier raw ones here too

9AVy1RZmZ2BkU2Fdp_E62w.text: I'd say 3.5 stars for the sushi, 5 stars for service. Ate here as a spur of the moment decision while friends were in town. It was pretty busy on a Friday night. We were greeted by friendly, smiling faces who were noticeably pleasant. Did the ayce which was about $26. They had a great assortment of rolls, appetizers, nigiri, etc. The food was decent, but not my first choice for sushi in the area. They do charge for leftovers so don't over do it. The food came very fast even though it was busy, and the service was very good. Overall okay sushi spot.

h1av2ocSoK1C1uzopCi4tQ.text: Sushi Kaya is how I imagined Heaven, if it was a Sushi restaurant, as a young boy.  Perfection in AYCE food and service.

qPU7P6ydk2bo8Y05r8ajag.text: Awesome place glad I found a spot out in vegas! just like the one in my hometown. hungover sushi fix! lol

Ik3gNIoPC2aY8wteGhdhRw.text: My boyfriend and I are huge all you can eat sushi fans. We have tried quite a few AYCE places in town. We have been here twice now and I have to admit it is becoming our new favorite. The 5 stars are for the food and selection on AYCE menu. The staff are nice but kind of slow...which I've come to expect at sushi restaurants so I don't even care any more as long as the sushi is good. Like I said the AYCE menu has so much selection, and you can order half rolls which is very important to us because we like so many different rolls and most places don't offer half rolls. The sushi is just delicious. I also love the udon and mushroom skewers. The price is very good too and even a few dollars cheaper than most other places. We will definitely be visiting this place often...only down side is that it's small and usually busy, and waiting area is super tiny. But the food is worth it!

BMeKvOMnrWI-4N02vM11lQ.text: This is my go to AYCE sushi spot, never had a bad experience. The ambience is great and the staff is usually on point. Sometimes a bit of a wait, but you can walk over to ziggys and grab a beer, and don't feel rushed to kill it! they don't have a issue with you bringing your beer in to finish.

4sp92wqjR6SSFwX19pAM4A.text: This place may have "the best AYCE" in town, but they no doubt have the WORST service in town. Sure we were seated immediately, but we had to wait 15 minutes to even be served drinks. What ticked me off the most was that 2-3 servers have walked past our table several times, glanced at our bare table. Not even a "someone will be serving you shortly" or any form of acknowledgement, just table glancing. Despite the servers passing our table plenty, we were never approached. We heard from reviews that this place would be hot and busy, but the sushi bar was not full and there were some empty tables, so it wasnt busy yet we still got ignored! Ignoring this place FOREVER like how they have ignored our presence.

czRpw-udQlw9HGc4057ljg.text: Yelp 365 Challenge - Review 014/365 (8/14/2011)  We ate at SK by accident on our last day in LV.  We actually intended to go to Sushi House Goyemon but, after being denied a table and only offered seats at the bar, my friend decided to storm out ... and we ended up here.  The restaurant was easy to find.  Parking was a joke, however, even on a weekday (apparently).  Since Sushi Kaya is part of a strip mall, it wasn't easy to find a space.  Oh, and don't even think that you can stand outside your car for even a minute just to relax for a bit. We tried to do that after we ate and there was already someone waiting to park.   I thought the food was OK.  The AYCE menu confused me at first, what with the spatter of asterisks all over the front and back.  If I recall correctly, "**" denotes items that are max one order per person, while "*" denotes items that are raw fish or seafood.  Sadly, I looked over all the options and realized that most of what I wanted included the "**" stipulation.  All-You-Can-Eat was beginning to look more like All-We-Say-You-Can-Eat, which in turn made me (slowly but surely) lose my appetite.  I chuckled to myself when most of the food arrived at the table because the portions are suuuuuper tiny!  The only exceptions (that I saw first-hand) were the specialty rolls.  On closer examination, however, I discovered each of these rolls to be heavily packed with or drenched in sauce.  I suspect they do this in the hopes that some people get fuller faster, for less ... because that's what happened to me.  On the positive side: 1.  The restaurant was clean and well-maintained. 2.  There was no delay for a table. 3.  The waitresses were attentive and friendly. 4.  Our orders were quickly fulfilled. 5.  The atmosphere was quiet and unclaustrophobic. 6.  Price is relatively cheaper compared to other AYCE sushi places.  Three stars for Sushi Kaya.

5zbMVX3hhH2zaX4QMaNIVA.text: Definitely my favorite sushi spot. Great price and delicious sushi. Service can be better though.

hrtF7gtoOJD4RPTF1a-TUA.text: They do their Dynamite Roll a lot differently than many places. Phenomenal. Try it.

RGjLUk5d_4Xg6gvYppyvNw.text: This AYCE Sushi restaurant is one of my my favorites. My sister and brother's go to spot if we are hungry and want to meet up since it is very central for all 3 of us. The service is quick and attentive. SOME of my favorites are white tuna, yellowtail,tuna nigiri, Jose roll, Shrek roll, and baked mussels. It's a great place to chill and talk especially if we need to catch up. I recommend this place to everyone because the service and food is always consistent.

eMjtp6D1KMsCXq87PeA0RA.text: Did not get all you eat sushi, just got 2 other menu items (chicken teriyaki and chicken fried rice). Items say 15 minutes to cook which was fine but we got one 10 minutes after ordering and the next 10 minutes after finish eating the first order. Thankfully we were sharing anyway. Waitress says teriyaki comes with soup or salad and a choice of tempura (shrimp or veg). Order the shrimp and soup. Get shrimp tempura first then fried rice. Fried rice was alright but it tasted like the pan it was cooked in also cooked something that burnt. Husband liked it so whatever. I ask a water refilling waitress about our soup and she said she would ask about it. 5 min later, same waitress is  passing our table but no answer. Teriyaki comes (very disappointing, non-sticky rice but good sauce, chicken and veggies) and we ask that waiter delivering about the soup and he said he would ask. 1/2 into eating teriyaki, waiter is walking around us but no answer. I go to front and ask a different waitress and she said it doesn't come with soup or tempura (!??!). Go back to table and ask our original waitress and they bring us 2 instead of 1, after everything was eaten. For all you can eat, multiple wait staff might work but not so good when you just want to eat other food.

feDgaHZdd24nUEGiuAUIuw.text: This place was amazing, best AYCE in town! The customer service was very good and they had the cutest lil Asian waitress working haha. The Sex Bomb roll was delicious and so were every other roll we ordered!  Definitely coming back soon!

-hbgA-R-g8QZUnb_6eAsvg.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! all you can eat sushi plus everything else on the menu??! Only $20 for lunch and $25 for dinner?! This is a 1 a week if not 2x a month type of place for me!! Not only is the staff amazing and greets you as you're walking in and leaving but you have a button on your table to notify server if you need assistance! Plus they all seem GENUINE when serving you which is VERY RARE in this town! I almost never rate anything 5stars if you check my reviews and this place gets my vote for Best Sushi in Las Vegas!!!

foRV2ndCtBuWjTbUqFd6-g.text: This absolutely one of my FAVORITE all you can eat Sushi places in town.  The appetizers are all amazing.  The dumplings are my personal favorite, but I also love the seaweed salad too.  For rolls I like to keep it simple with the Philly & Veggie, but you can't absolutely go wrong with anything on the menu.

_M69298toKvvx867YXaBJA.text: Less than $25 for all-you-can eat sushi - and it's incredible!  Fresh fish, excellent preparation and perfect flavors.

A3YU4Ne7BiJVec5PRBUmpg.text: Great place to come to get the most sushi for your buck,  if you're a small eater them I'm not really sure if it's for you.  Service fir me is good and the selection is perfect,  anyways go home full and satisfied.

t5z5Pbfr72Loao3aVYbUeA.text: This place is awesome, great appetizers, and a nice selection of sushi and nigri. Their baked green mussel is amazing. Their sweet shrimp is the greatest man made thing ever.  I'm allergic to seafood but who cares, Ill spend a day on the shitter for a meal here.

cR9ZpMv8gSahQubrPBvAuw.text: Been coming here for about 3 years now and the service recently (just this past year) has been terrible. We went today and put our names down for a party of six and the hostess (more on her later) took down our number incorrectly. After waiting outside to be called for about 30 minutes, since the waiting area is so unbelievably small, we decided to check on the wait time and she said that she called the number that we gave her five times not knowing she took it down wrong. After waiting inside for about another 20 minutes she decided to give us a table. I say "decided" because I over heard her tell a server that she only gave us a table that soon because we kept bothering her. First of all that is rude and unprofessional to say to anyone let alone a customer. Second of all it's literally her only job to seat people and she couldn't even do that right. We will not be returning here because of the hostess. We have a big family so they will lose out on some good business. For anyone reading this I recommend umiya sushi, prices are lower, it is less crowded and the service there is great! Doesn't hurt that their sushi is also really good :)

KW8A8GmcHbrNRqKHq-cCYA.text: Came back to this place again. The Jose rolls are one of my faves. Udon noodle soup was more sweet than salty. Miso soup was salty and delicious. The cucumber salad didn't taste good this time. Green tea ice cream didn't taste good either. Mango mochi balls were good but too hard. Wait staff not as attentive, like I refills on the tea (had to ask for it). Some dishes did not get served. But overall, the rolls here are fresh and tasty.

2C-iPpT326A9NnnYM1OcVQ.text: I will never come here again. The first time I came here and the service was horrible so I decided to try it again....everyone has their bad days. I am here for lunch currently. I ordered 2 orders of hamachi 30 min ago and I still haven't received it. When we talked to the waiter 15 min ago he was checking on it....still no sushi. It is good food but not worth the terribly long waits between your orders. There are sushi places just as good in Las Vegas that have better service.

x-iwFrzzhq07kCu2yyOr_g.text: Finish your food. We left two pieces of rice on our plate and the manager saw it. When the waiter came back, he said that the manager said if we don't finish our food, they will charge us extra. What if we had dropped that rice on the floor and didn't want it anymore? Jerks!

JHfOETbyGNBqhkJOOWggmA.text: All you can eat for $19.99! So many good things about this place.  Nice and roomy, open 'til 3am and a big karaoke room for a big party. I'll probably need to take a several shots of soju before you can get my ass to sing anything haha. Parking is hard to find though since this is a pretty busy popular small plaza.  Nigiri sushi here is better than most places I'e tried. I get them all seared, but that's just my personal preference of how I like my nigiri served. So many good things on the all you can eat menu that it's so hard to recommend just a few. But here are my favorites: Soft Shelled Crabs, Sexy Roll, Baked Mussels, Scallop Roll, and Bacon/Scallop Skewer.  For desserts, Almond Mocha Ice Cream is very good but kinda of a bummer that they don't have Tempura Ice Cream.

1ft41DmBGKtzvEDvvCvXug.text: My family has this thing where we drive from SoCal to Vegas ... to eat off the strip. Don't ask why, because I honestly don't know.  Anyways, this is a nice sushi spot with an all-you-can-eat option. Which is of course what we went with. For $25 a person, you get all the rolls, nigiri, whatever you want you can eat. Now, I'm not a big fan of all-you-can-eat, but if you are, then please stop by! The quality isn't bad, but it isn't anything to write home about either. Being in the middle of the desert, it's hard to get fresh fish for that price.

VD5qi9i-tdPyLxMvz9zruw.text: Food was really good. Service was below average it didn't appear that they have enough staff. They offered me a stamp which was really cool. Ten stamp and the 11 one is free. The food was so good.  I will be back.

-UC-7AW07AnK2B8Ag0v_Fw.text: Great place,  excellent service and a pretty dang good selection of all you can eat sushi and appetizers. There was a little bit of a wait for a party of 6 but it was Friday night close to 5 so not to bad considering. Definitely on my short list of great all you can eat vegas sushi joints.

iglJT5Lcf72VkpYn2J3UfA.text: The only nice thing I can say about this place is that the decor is cute. Most of the rolls that I ordered were pretty much California rolls mixed with a little bit of something else, which I did not like.  I would have not ordered those rolls if I had known they contained the CA roll. The amount of fish they give is very very little.  Do not order the Big Mac. It's a huge roll mainly of rice mixed in with CA roll and TINY slice of either salmon or tuna.  Do not get anything with spicy tuna here! It is disgusting. This includes the Kaya roll.  Maybe that day it was not fresh, but it was truly nasty. It had a very weird taste that probably should not even be served.  I would probably just stick to their cooked foods such as the skewers and the bbq.  Really, this place is for novices who can only handle CA rolls.    If you want service, this place is not it.  It took a long time to get everything. Actually, I believe we didn't even get all the food that we ordered.  I believe they do this on purpose to prevent from over-ordering or something.  I think they purposely brought out the food slowly so we would get full soon.  The servers were not attentive at all. We asked the servers several times to get a setup.  There weren't that many people there when we were being served.  It took a good 15 minutes for our bill to come out when we asked for it.    Oh yeah and you can only get a half roll it it's your last order.  Like what kind of rule is that!?!?   Overall, I've had much better AYCE elsewhere.  At 22 bucks a pop, this place is not worth it.

QVsRMg6GH3z3V_g8PhXXJg.text: As I was singing along to Shy Boy by Secret, I kind of found myself in a bit of a surprised state, am I eating at a Korean Restaurant or a Sushi joint? There really isn't much to say about this place, but I'll state the Pros and Cons of my first experience here at Sushi Kaya.   Pros: -AYCE for $19.99. So decently priced -We were seated immediately upon entering and our orders were taken. -The place is clean, roomy and open late. I believe till 3a.  -Karaoke available here! -The rice used on the sushi is really A+, not too sticky or vinegary.  -Minimal use of yum yum/teriyaki sauces (a con if you like the sauces)  -A lot of avocado used in the rolls (Loooove Avocado)  -Soju is served here!!!! -Appetizers here are Japanese and Korean combination. Few of my favorites being the Kim Chi fried rice, Dukkbokki (good flavor, but the rice cakes seems quickly pan fried so it had sort of a crunch on the outside) and the no rice roll, which was a ball of spicy tuna with shrimp tempura in the middle and topped with avocado.  -the only ROLL that was Great is the Kaya Roll.   Cons: -Nigiri sushi selections were pretty good. It's hit or miss with the quality of the fish. Some orders were really good, and some other (same) orders later seemed kinda off.  -They were taking your orders frequently, but it seemed more often than the food ever came out. We would wait for our food, but instead of steady plates coming out, they'd bring it out all at once.  -for the Rolls, there was a lot of cream cheese and avocado selections. it seemed like almost all the rolls had either cream cheese or avocado or both. there wasn't much variety for the rolls.  -for the skewers, you were only allowed one each person or something like that, so we were only allowed to have one type of skewer each. :(( The beef tongue skewer was sort of flavorless anyways.  -Parking is really hard to find. A small parking area.  All in all, it wasn't totally bad, but it wasn't impressive either. I'd come back here again, but it wouldn't be my first, second or third choice. I'm still on a sushi hunt!!!   Sayonara or Annyeong Haseyo!

ihwdDKRQPKRrjw3zz3sFwg.text: My family and I always come here.  I guess you could say that the waiter and waitress know us here...esp. there's always 4 or 8 of us.  We truly love the food.  Sushi galore!! The price is very reasonable $19.95 for lunch and it's all you can eat!!!! Dinner is $25 Let me say that the kids can totally eat so much here.  We even make a list of what we order.  They also have a stamp card...so pretty much we always fill it up and we use it for another time.  This is our favorite place to go for Sushi!!!!   Go try it...I'm sure you'll love it like we do!!!

9xIn05Va6bP2Rvz0ESrj4w.text: I dont know why people are not satisfied with KAYA when Its the best sushi place in town! I've seriously been to alot of sushi place for AYCE and KAYA beats sushi twister, xtreme sushi, kobe sushi, yama sushi or sushi on tropicana. I mean first of all they do half orders on sushi so you dont have to eat the whole roll!! It gives you a chance try different rolls. Also they have a good selection of specialty rolls. Plus,  they give you stamp cards which is awesome for sushi lovers!!!:)

haAvydYmWvUdH2IWinnytg.text: This place is awful. I felt sick after eating there. You're better off by sticking to the cooked dishes but even those were sub par. I'm guessing this is more of a quantity play for a lot of the people eating here.

rGSuN5vMU0ck-vi401alQw.text: I like this place a lot. The best all you can eat sushi place which doesn't suck :3 everything was tasty. I would come back when I'm in town.

3nd7nY5NW0AR6Azpa9jmOQ.text: The service here was atrocious, and it should be renamed limited all you can eat. A lot of the good items on the menu can only be ordered once, but the children cannot even order these items. The menu stated to order a little at a time which we are perfectly fine with; however since the portions were so small we had to reorder consistently. Apparently the servers only wanted us to order once at an this all you can eat because they kept giving us attitude and saying "anything else" while rolling their eyes, which insinuated they didn't want us to order anymore. In the middle of the dinner (30 whole minutes!) they then dropped off the check. By no means are my family and I hefty eaters, but we do eat a little more at a supposed all you can eat, so I don't want to feel like a pig for ordering more food! I am astounded by how I was treated and I would go as far as to say my experience here is the worst experience I have ever had at a restaurant.

Dc4B-YnNZcOhgSuo-wVcBg.text: I enjoyed my visit to Sushi Kaya, food was excellent, but not as good as the stellar service

wlfx3pf8lPDr91SOW7Sy1Q.text: Best sushi I have ever had in the three years I've lived in Las Vegas!! This place is amazing!! An awesome selection of both rolls and nigiri, good price for all you can eat, and good ambiance!

8Qa5vTTa0blYRzs2Ii7mkw.text: This place is on my must-go list for every one of my Vegas trips. They've got some of the best AYCE bbq/sushi you can find in Vegas ...and for only $19-23? WOW.  Come here hungry so you can try everything. Usually my girlfriend and I set aside one day to be the kaya-only day. We would skip breakfast, gorge on kaya for lunch, and be too full for dinner. Totally worth it.  I always recommend this place to anyone that is visiting vegas.

7z-66Sptn7RDIrbvKMHQIg.text: I went here last night for the first time with my brother and some friends. I liked how the hostess gave us another seating option since we were already waiting half an hour, and the only way we could all sit together would be another 30 min wait. At least we were seated across from each other. So me and all the girls we at the bar and the guys were at the table across from us. My brother didn't really like how even tho we got split up and were clearly 2 separate groups they still charged us gratuity because there was 6 of us all together. I understand where he's coming from cause where he works they don't charge it when the group gets split and what not, but their policies are different. Anyways I really enjoyed it there and they have a lot of things I liked since I'm pretty picky about sushi. And I do like how they have stamp cards so after so many times eating there I'll get a free meal. I'll most definitely be back again :)
