WTCTAcrasZzywlKDXFuVkg.text: Oh my god what happened here? I used to come here often when I want sushi. It's been months since last time and everything turned to a disaster. Nigiri smells too fishy and no flavor at all, Miso soup tastes hot water, calamari fries too sweet and blend, no skewers available for all you can eat customers, wrong order taking servers(they can't count!) and the restaurant is too cold. I'm so shocked that they still have customers. I don't understand why they charge so much money for these shits. I will NEVER come back. I should have gone to the one on Tropicana and Decatur...

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I didn&#39;t order dried tuna nigiri... this is the conditiom of tuna they have. No flavor at all but the texture of rubber.

IAuIc_h_lE__FiMxShjaDA.text: There are lots of options. Food is good. Loved the cherry amaretto ice cream. Wait time for a table can be long but food comes fast after you order.

vXIMwI0TQQRCj-hrdFaKhQ.text: Sushi Kaya is one of my favorite all you can eat sushi places in town.  Everything is made to order.  The sushi is fresh and taste great.  The place is very clean un like some other sushi places I've been to.  The only thing I dislike is parking is a bit hard to find on a busy night.

Z4kTunkLNH-z_9QV1bJT3g.text: The food at Sushi Kaya is very good. The Nigiri tastes very fresh and there is a large selection of specialty rolls to choose from. However, the service could be better at this establishment. We received most of our food, but trying to order a few more items was challenging. We could not get the attention of our server. The sprite was a little flat, as well. Overall, a mediocre experience.

LwOqm9gn-4VzPIJjLgnpZg.text: So I went to Sushi Kaya to meet my cousin for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. I was impressed with the fast and friendly service. We decided on the all-you-can-eat menu. The sushi rolls were good, but portions and the rolls were small.   After having a wonderful time and great conversation, my cousin pointed to "something" crawling behind my bench. Needless to say, a friendly ROACH paid us a visit. I stopped eating as I felt sick to my stomach. We asked for the check as quickly as possible. I WILL NOT BE BACK. They need to spray that entire restaurant!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I was so disappointed. 1 star for the cockroach! :(

kaokWK6KaSCJJkYWHI_ikg.text: Delicious meal and great atmosphere. Kaya roll Spider roll Crazy orgasm Jackpot Roll One Night Stand - Best Roll White vegas roll Spicy crab hand roll Spicy tuna hand roll

qsRZGllnFDVPGgZf00DRUA.text: Yum yum yum! Tuna crispy rice to die for. The tofu in the broth also excellent. My girlfriend and I always come here and are seated immediately , unlike Goyemon which takes forever. But the pork belly there is sometimes worth it. I love the scallop bacon skewer, but its too bad we only get one serving on the package. We loved the white Vegas roll . Service is fast and dishes are delivered promptly. The hostess was very sweet and accommodated a more comfortable table and moved us over to a larger table. I just don't like the lighting it needs to be a little more dim. I just got out of work and honey it was a hard night. There are still many other dishes I would like to try. I liked the cherry amaretto ic much better than the mochis. Although it being super busy, we were seated in a minute and I love that. Check it out

i2ursJWfilHuQI_Thf5GRg.text: I called to ask whether it was crowded. The person I spoke with said no and that it would not get crowded, because it was a Wednesday night. We drove all the way over there, and there was a 30 minute wait. I would've preferred they had given me accurate information over the phone. My daughter was tired, and then we had to drive all the way over to Sushi Way. At the end of the day, Sushi Way was fantastic. Good food and fast service.

KBM408ZTlVWY_gfIitPVVg.text: Great all you can eat sushi with included appetizers, skewers, mochi, and ice cream. Chicken teriyaki came with miso soup, 3 shrimp tempura, white rice, and a small salad. Overall great atmosphere, great food, and fantastic value! Stays open til 3 am for the night owls. Definitely plan to return again!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White Vegas roll - one of the MANY specialty rolls in the all u can eat

_eEhtBGvPCx7CycmEQwzLQ.text: i love the "all you can eat" option and that it applies to practically everything on the menu.

nwfoOG5iQvZkXAgCcjKeFw.text: Favorite sushi spot in town. Definitely get the sex bomb roll. It's so delicious! Service can be a bit of a hit or miss though if your seated at the bar so beware of that.

T8PxVi4bBEkY7PE2Peh_XA.text: 30 mins waiting for my food. This is all I got so far. Not impressed with the service, so the food better make up for it. I hate eating angry

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 30 mins in....

PkMUuhbl-r0v497vTRjJ8g.text: Sushi Kaya is the best place in Vegas to go for AYCE. With a good price, great rolls and a good open choice for people who have friends who love Sushi but aren't fond of the raw side of the food choices.   Curry rice is delectable and a safe choice for those avoiding raw fish!

6iVYvmcCZQuYuk9XtMmqYQ.text: Love this sushi! I am an ocean baby and coming to the desert this food is so bomb. Gotta try it. Great service, great food. Yum!

6oxaW2hAyFbmPU5esQ1U1w.text: I've been here quite a few times since my first visit, mainly because I have a stamp card that keeps getting filled up with the groups I go with.  The price is a pretty good deal. $19.95 for lunch and $22.95 for dinner and that includes a list of special rolls, appetizers, nigiri, and even dessert.   The service has actually gotten very polite, friendly, and fast since my first visit which is why I'm giving them another star.   The sushi may not be the BEST in town, but it's definitely good and the appetizers are even better.   I really like that this place gives out a stamp card; it's a big incentive to keep coming back. The restaurant is also very nice and clean, which is always a plus. Whenever I bring visitors from out of town here, they're really impressed because it's hard to find places that do ayce sushi along with appetizers in SoCal.   I'm glad this place has improved since my first visit. I'll be sure to keep coming back.

hdNfSyuaZlBJE9P_QpNiug.text: I ve passed this spot plenty of times but never stopped by .always read the reviews but decided to skip it until last week where I ventured inside.  Service was great. We got sat right away and decided to sit down at the sushi bar, where we thought we will be ordering directly from our chefs . To our surprise we were not allowed to? What the deuce !!? This was very weird. Are they protecting the chefs and their magnificent sushi ninja secrets? Do I look like a sushi chef killer Come on..I appreciate them serving me fast and refilling my drinks right away but if I sit at the sushi bar and the chef is right next to me, I should be allowed to order from him.  Place is big and clean. Seems to be a good spot for groups too. Nice comfy looking booth and a nice waiting area as well. Lighting is good as well .In general the ambiance is pretty nice. Now..what Im gonna say some of you may not like. But there were no Japanese employees.I understand that most places are Korean owned/managed, but at least lie to me and hire one Japanese person. Its like going to a Peruvian restaurant that is run and managed by Colombians..yes we look alike but we are not the same.  Food is good. The appetizer menu is extensive and their poke salad has big chunks of tuna which is a win in my book.The soft shell crab was delicious. Very well cooked ! Rolls don't fall into the "damn that's a roll or rice ball" category so that's another good sign for me as well. I lie the fact that the nigiri doesn't pack that much rice either. Lots of sushi places make this mistake, however Kay packs the nigiri with a good amount of fish.  Will this be my next favorite spot? No, would I come back? yep..if im in the area. There is nothing spectacular in the menu that would make me want to return despite the distance, however it is very good..hard to explain but that is just a personal opinion. The food is good, the price is average and the service Is great. Only thing missing is that IT factor, which makes me decide if I should drive far for a restaurant or not.  Fear not readers..my chase for the holy grail of sushi will not be done anytime soon

mqNjZlF3Jenz4vKVbi5bAg.text: Our friend wanted sushi and this was the close that was open at the time we went with the highest stars on Yelp.  We decided to come here.  We all were really excited to try this spot out.  Parking is a little out of control here, lots of businesses and very small lot.  We got lucky and found one spot completely opposite of where the restaurant was.  We walked around the building and saw they offer AYCE here.  My friends were super excited since they were starving.  We walked in, I thought it was weird no one greeted us coming in.  We were standing there a few minutes before the hostess sat us down at the sushi bar since there was no more tables.  Well there were tables, I guess those section weren't open or something.  We tried to sit down and there was rice on one of our seat.  I had to grab the hostess to clean it up since there was no napkin around.  We were ready to order and no server has even came by to us yet.  Every time we needed something, we have to hunt down a server.  Basically the service is non existence here.    The food was ok, They didn't have a lot of fresh sashimi dished that comes with AYCE menu like how other places do.  A lot of their rolls are really similar to other rolls, just one of two things different or how they prepared it.  It wasn't all that bad.  I did remember there was one dish that was really, really good, I think it was called the Sex Bomb Roll and everything else is whatever.  We were done within an hour for our late lunch.  We got the check, the server came and told us that since it's our first time.  She's not going to charge us for the leftover.  The leftover was what I ordered.  I'm allergic to soy, which means I can't have any soy product in my food.  I have to order all of my food with ponzu, ell, and soy sauce on the side just in case someone else wanted to try the dish.  The chef forgot and added ponzu sauce on a couple of dishes I ordered for myself and my friends didn't want to eat it.  I didn't order anymore because I felt bad throwing food away, but I definitely would have eat it, if I wasn't allergic to it.  I definitely would fight this if she was going to charge me for something that was made incorrectly.    They do charge here if you don't finish your food.  Service sucks.  Food ended up not so great, two of us got really sick after eating here.  We were the two eating almost all the same things.  Our other friend ate 3-4 dish different than we did.  After that experience....NO THANK YOU!

Zd5vV2QVzXT0UdHrMhg4CA.text: Pathetic customer service, no air conditioning whatsoever, mediocre sushi, ridiculous prices. It was like eating inside a chicken coop on a hot summer's day. Yeah, no thanks.

qxVOFqhibh-xJM5OMDWUew.text: I love Sushi! I went here yesterday with my GF since we haven't been to Kaya before. It was sort of busy, not so surprised about that. our wait wasn't long at all and the customer service was extremely friendly when we arrived.  We sat down and had our go with the sushi. Great quality, Made fast, the Portions are perfect, what more can you ask for? My favorite is always Shrimp Tempura rolls, i can't get enough of it, i know. Simple. lol But i also found a liking to the Lasagna Roll. very tastyy!!  Short but sweet review, loved my experience here, great service and i appreciate every bit of it. Definitely will be back again.

0KWDEhHIc35bJPcvt2SIDA.text: I really like the place, sometimes is a long wait specially during dinner hours, but thats every sushi place I know. Its really good specially when you and all your friends want to grub and feel like you're gonna have a baby after. Im only giving it 4 stars because I have a different sushi place that has become my favorite but this spot is great regardless.

JsFPvrmyVeotmieZp5ILmA.text: Yeah. Don't come here, especially not for the all you can eat.  The service is godawful.  First round, the waitress simply ignored me.  Subsequent rounds were a crap shoot as to whether or not we got our food.  I ordered a grand total of seven items and got two of them before talking to the manager and bugging out.

GEiQMavuW6amEkMCOzVVJQ.text: Love their Shrimp Tempura. Word of advice: don't sit at a table where there's no call button. Service is slow. You need the button to call your waiter/waitress.

3or1M7nfl0zLABuD5m-mIQ.text: Good place to eat sushi, the food was great had no problem with in the other hand the waiter was in a very very bad mood bad attended bad mannered seemed like she hated working there

3JKzNmNLNLbnSAqjq0HuRA.text: I love it here, but it is getting too popular! Long wait for dinner, and the service is good...but it is a very rushed atmosphere.  Great spot if you are in a hurry! I will keep going back! Just not for every sushi occasion :) Really good rolls though!

2wIqxC3cMi1L1nbxoAJFcg.text: If I were to suggest a sushi place this would be first to pop in my head! Their lunch special is pretty much the cheapest I've ever seen. From 11-4 it's $19.99. Dinner is normal for a sushi place $24.95. Children are half priced! I recommend going for lunch. They even have a punch card system which shows how much I go there because I've already used 3 free AYCE!!! The customer service is good. They're always nice and talkative, even cracking jokes here and there. They also refill the water quite frequently, you don't have to ask! The quality of the food is really good. My favorite roll is the crunch roll. Their baked and deep fried rolls are really good too. They do half and full size servings. Their bacon wrapped asparagus is sooooo delicious. I suggest going for lunch and just trying everything!!! It's yummmmmmmmy. Oh and their vanilla ice cream is soooooooo good.

-LI_XCDkfd59KaS66laBZw.text: KIM-CHEE FRIED RICE!   Only ayce sushi spot I know that has it on there menu, which keeps me coming back all the effin time! Its rice fried with Kim-chee, cut pieces of spam, and an over easy egg on top! So delish! Theres a lot of good selection of specialty rolls with funny ass names ie. "who is my dad."  Skewered bacon wrapped scallops is yum! However, there are certain items that limit one order per person just like the skewers.  My all time top orders are: Kim Chee fried rice, Pot stickers (fyi it's not called Gyoza. I keep saying "Gyoza" and they look at me like ?!), and last "Spicy Tuna Handroll" shit is bomb. com!  What's cool about Sushi Kaya is they do half rolls which comes in 4pcs vs a full roll  that is 8 pcs, so that way you can try the rolls without having the feeling of "fcuk why did I order so much!" haha. And the prices is cheap! Compared to most sushi spots that charges $25+tax. Sushi Kaya lunch cost is $19.99 (until 4pm) and then $22.95 (4pm till late). Plus, they do stamp cards (think the 10th one is free).   I don't care what anyone else thinks about sushi kaya. I'm a huge fan! Quality of food is great, fish is fresh!, and customer service is fine. Love coming here and telling all my friends about it.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My top faves: Kim chee fried rice, spicy tuna hand roll, and pot stickers!

t7FRuCV0zuWtX6dbffX9VQ.text: The sign says they close at 3 so I arrive 10 after 2. The sushi chef sees me and calls out for the host who's sitting at a table. The host promptly gets up and aggressively makes the throat cutting gesture to say "we're done". I arrive an hour before closing and you stop serving??

nARrb_CLLlxG-fThwMM-Lg.text: Quality selection for an AYCE sushi restaurant. They offer a lot of options as well as quality. It's probably one of my favorite AYCE sushi restaurants in Vegas. Their skewers are a must but you can only order 1 round of certain ones. The baked mussels are also a must. We always order way too much and they are pretty lenient with not charging us extra for the leftovers. The parking lot is small so you might have to park in the shopping center over. The wait can also be long.

lTgUeLKaExleAhwZl4qnGw.text: Pros: AYCE Sushi, great selection, fresh fish and shrimp, close to strip.  Cons: No Reservations, long wait time, slow servers, confused and forgetful servers.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QiIdME7Pt7M-LgWVwJjO0g.text: The lady who helped me had an attitude (and not a good one), which seemed to be because of my questions I was asking. Then at the end of the transaction they took like an automatic 5 or 10% out for gratuity! I wanted to choose if I wanted to tip or not and they kind of forced me to pay that extra little bit of money. Then they charged another dollar or so to use your card! It says that on the receipt (at the bottom) but not big enough in my opinion. They need a sign or something saying they charge to use your card. My meal just seemed to keep racking up a more and more of a bill which seemed odd to me. Also they had like a 90 min table limit!! Which is crazy! I understand maybe an eating limit so ppl don't stay there forever for the all you can eat sushi but jeez we had to vacate the table, and we had more people joining later that couldn't even eat because we had to leave. The food was pretty good but I don't think I'll be back. If you want a good place for sushi and don't care about budget, this is the place to go.

0SszTnI5l9mlF1qQ-JQmoA.text: They deserve 0 star. They do watch how much you leave on your plate. They try to put a big rice on your sushi and try to make you full. If you can't eat them all, they tell you to leave and not to come back. I've heard some people saying, "Those Japanese workers are rude." No No No ! They are all Koreans !!! If you like a nosy restaurant where they watch how much you eat or can not eat and do not mind to be treated with attitude, go to this place. I will NEVER go back !!!

mziF72tGibjTBGska75QtA.text: Me and a few friends decided to go to a this place based on the reviews it seemed pretty decent. I don't eat sushi too much but everyone I was with loves it, they assured me there would be other options besides seafood, which there was.   I ended up opting out of the all you can eat as it was $27 and I wasn't too hungry. So I got some chicken fried rice and two skewers, the food was okay at best, definitely not the best I have ever had. The beef was pretty fatty.   My biggest complaint has to be the portions of food, I ended up paying $15 roughly for less food than I would have received somewhere else much, much cheaper.   To top all of this off the customer service was absolutely appalling, the lady who was taking my order laughed at me for a question I asked about the food. I apologize that I'm not a sushi aficionado and had a question. We needed refills on our drinks and no one had come by to ask us, they were nowhere to be found after we placed the first round order of food in an attempt to clearly kill the time limit they place on the all you can eaters. Disgusting business practices.  I can safely assume that I will never be coming to this restaurant again. As well as never recommending this place to a single person I meet unless I don't like the person. There are many other sushi joints in Vegas that are far superior to this one. If it was possible I would have given them 0/5 stars.

yANgnFOuQwy7KaereEMsMQ.text: What's Vegas without a buffet! I love buffets, especially the SUSHI kind! Located just around 10 minutes from the strip, you can find Sushi Kaya. The first time I came here was by accident when my friends and I were super hungry and just pointed to the place. Random.   Anyways, lunch is around $20 a person. They apparently have a 90 min limit to eat according to the menu, but I'm not sure if they enforce it. You have to eat everything so if you don't think you can, order half portions!   I tried several of their rolls and most of their nigiri. The fish is reasonably fresh and I always want to come back for more! 10 orders of salmon? Sure! 5 orders of eel! That totally hits the spot. You can also get your order of skewers, noodles, etc.   I always end the meal with a mochi ice cream as well as regular ice cream! Green tea is the way to go! Yum!   Sushi Kaya, I'll be back when I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Vegas tradition!
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eel!
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black dragon roll

RfKxlWYrDNPZWaq783Xwzg.text: Went in early march had the ALL YOU CAN EAT LUNCH every thing was great tasting and fresh will come back here always

w00qTAgtpAn87r6x4AdZhg.text: I went here with my brother since he was craving sushi. The ambiance is great for any occasion and the establishment can service large groups just as well as the smaller groups. The food was so-so, but not terrible. There are definitely better sushi places, but they have good deals for all you can eat sushi. I had the spicy ramen, and while it was flavorful it was far from spicy. The service was great, everyone checked on each other's tables, as well as the manager. It's not a bad place, the price is reasonable and it'll satisfy your hunger.

sjZlAiE0M0Pxbaf-tIjyaQ.text: The All you can eat sushi is $24.99 for dinner and has so much to offer. I highly recommend this place if you're looking for a good sushi spot in Chinatown.   The service is OUTSTANDING here! The waiter and sushi chef were extremely fast and polite. Wonderful menu with lots of yummy choices even one or two items for those of you who are vegetarian. The food comes fast and tastes great! The restaurant is hidden in a strip mall off of Spring Mountain so keep you're eyes open. 5 stars for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y_29aAaNlCrYNZNJDg59SA.text: AYCE everything was  great here.  Food is alway perfect.  Ordered the salmon, yellowtail,  and spider roll.  Delicious!  Kids had the fried rice,  garlic, and meat skewers.   Wife ordered the Ebi sweet potato skewer spicy tuna etc...  All the food are great here.   Love the ice cream at the end as well.

3tIYiaH0uFbLVk43FVD5Uw.text: Even though I have waited 45 minutes some times to get my food here it actually was worth it. The food comes out super quick and the service is great. I always get this sweet asian guy who is so nice. It's a busy place so I guess you can't complain about the wait. ;)

b0cuxKW02u-LP_6D_DEtxw.text: Great late night eat, great service! amazing food and the staff was super helpful! Definitely my new go to sushi spot. Kinda lacking on vegetarian / vegan options, but the Shrek Roll was delicious. I will coming back often to this place.

pR5dJ_5zX-9FyhRvR0BbhA.text: I read through the reviews with intentions of being treated terribly by the employees, having to wait for a table, plus it was my first time trying sushi, so I was expecting it to smell like ocean fish. Therefore, I went in with extremely low expectations and was proven WRONG!  We got our name on the list and after 40 minutes I was given a call. The wait was as expected but there is a tea shop right next to the sushi place and had a boba while we waited. Our waiter was helpful and suggested a few things. We ended up not going with the all you can eat, which is what she suggested. We had a party of 6. Our bill only came up to 55 and that was with the 15% tip included. We order 6 different types of roll and shared between everyone. We enjoyed a lot of the rolls, yet we choose them with a preference of familiarity with the ingredients. We stayed away from the foreign (to us) described items.   It was enjoyable. The atmosphere was very intimate with dimmed lights, of Asia decent paintings and decorations, and spacious. We all fit comfortably in a booth. There was also a sushi bar for faster service.

7P4AEWjpDWcnjMFFeJZsIw.text: The best all u can eat sushi in town!!! The downside though was the table is always sticky to touch and found a 2 cockroach crawling on my side a year ago and the server just grab a napkin and got the cockroach on my side...

6kmJYDc-T6jVBrafQk9Qtg.text: I was pretty disappointed in my experience. Service was terrible, food was not great and I'm confused as to whether this place is supposed to be Korean or Japanese. Not as good as Goyemon.  First off, me and my friend sit down and instantly a waitress comes over and asks what we are drinking. We had not had a chance to look at the drink menu, so we reply "water." She whisks the drink menu away, so even if I had wanted to order a different drink later we wouldn't have been able to.  I didn't order AYCE because I am trying to not be a fatass. I ordered miso soup, three types of nigiri (tamago, salmon and ikura.) I also ordered a spicy tuna roll. I gotta give it to them, they give you A LOT of sushi for the price. Usually, you'll get two pieces of nigiri per order. Here, I got three (except for the ikura.) They are cheaply priced (don't know anywhere else that you can get ikura for $3.50 per order.) I was glad I did not order AYCE because of the amount I received--I would not have been able to eat more than that. There was a lot of rice, and the spicy tuna roll came with like 9 pieces. Quality of the fish was meh. My bill came out to around $20. AYCE is $25--but I would have regretted eating so much. Check took FOREVER to come and we weren't able to flag down our original waitress.  When you come in, they greet you in Korean. However, I thought this place was supposed to be Japanese based on the name. Sushi Kaya: Identity Crisis?  This place was PACKED on a random Thursday evening (many people waiting outside) so plan accordingly!

2th5Kah81XGI70jr0k5wsQ.text: Amazing sushi and all you can eat is a great deal!!! They have a punch card and their Yuzu sorbet is really good~

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spider
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tornado
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaska

6ueZkAeq95lqBtQ6ZynVTQ.text: AYCE!!! Try their salmon fashion probably one of the best rolls there. Also try their mango smoothie it's pretty good.

o-Fiz5LeMN-vjGmNzPkLJQ.text: I came here to celebrate my friend's birthday, it's all u can eat sushi, the price is 22$ per person, I think the sushi is decent,  I heart the beef skewer, and the tuna salad, the soft shell crab was so so, ( we asked two orders for the soft shell crab, the first time, the shell crab was really tasty, but then the second order came out, it was too salty, may be because they were too busy,  the scallop was also very good too, my friend ordered the spicy udon noodles, the texture of the noodle reminded of the Korean rice cake dish,sweet and spicy I do not like the service here, they were too slow, they did not refill our tea  until we asked them twice,  and they charged us 18% for the tip, wth,  and one more thing, after stuffing all the meat and fish, we wanted to have some salad, but the salad was not fresh, and the salad dressing was mediocre,

KQ3-igYhyIcHcvkHF6EMzQ.text: All the sushi had pretty much the same ingredient...tempura shrimp. All of it seemed to have the same bland flavor. Will not visit this place again.

cCxHIyym2cJ_mIk0fXE-MQ.text: A hidden gem! How did we find this awesome sushi place? By accident. Because the Japanese restaurant upstairs was packed and we didn't want to wait because we were hungry. Although I still wonder how come this place is never packed when we go. But I ain't gonna complain because then that means we don't have to wait.  I wish we had something like this in LA. We do, but this one is better. You get an ice cream dessert for in all you can eat sushi!  Ever since we found this place, it's becoming a tradition (for me at least) to hit up this spot whenever we're in Vegas. This ain't no Todai... where they leave the sushi sitting for hours. It's made to order. And, this owns all buffets on the strip. I love me some sushi! They also have skewers on the list.  The sushi is fresh. The mackerel and ono just melts in your mouth. And just the variety of rolls you can choose from... it's insane. Even better around lunch time when it's only $19.95. You really get a stretch for dollah dolla bills, and some more. Oh and they let you eat for 2 hours whereas in some places they only give you an  hour limit. Even if you've been there for two hours... they weren't really anal about it that they'll kick you out.  And did you know they have a punch card? Free AYCE after (I believe) 10 visits (something like that). If I lived closer... I'll probably get my freebie at the end of the month.

NQnlz-Ac-fRYSl99ihr86A.text: this place is a little far for me, BUT it is DELICIOUS!! its kind of hidden so you need to know how to get to it. the atmosphere is great, very intimate, and a lot of beautiful art everywhere. They also have some great lunch specials as well! Tip: green tea iced tea, looks like algae but tastes sooooooo good!

meU5RAG7eLMPRncotJWgSA.text: friendly staff! good sushi! my personal favorite roll is the Pancho Roll (if you like spicy)  down fall the wait time!

pR6iGShW9k8w5RJlF6YRZw.text: For what it is, it is perfect.  For around $23 you get all you can eat appetizers, sushi, small entrees & ice cream.  It's not a buffet so everything is made fresh to order.  There is a rule preventing you from ordering certain items more than once, however, if you are in a group of a few people, someone else can order it again for you!  Sushi quality is not the finest, but for mass produced sushi, it is good enough.  Will definitely be back.  Go hungry.

0zGRONMwGm9st7U_7iORPg.text: I go to Kaya often. I went in there this evening a Monday night they weren't that busy all. I was alone just wanted to grab sushi real quick. Didn't really feel like sitting at the bar this is when the host informed me since I was eating some I had to either sit at the bar or a two ton table she said it was there new policy. I was like well the only two top table available is right next to couple I didn't see the need to have to sit right next to them and make it crowded when there were a handful of other tables open and there was no wait to be seated and it was 10 o'clock on a Monday night I asked to speak with the manager he informed me sorry there was nothing he could do about it it was a policy. I can't believe a restaurant would rather turn someone away then to sit at a table that they would enjoy sitting at when there are other table options open it bigger tables came in I used to go to Kaya all the time now after this incident I don't know when I will be back.

B2uFSb0PJmf6UNIGgYiCuQ.text: This sushi place is amazing . They have a variety of rolls and appetizers and sashimi , big choice . Everything is always super delicious. It's the best sushi .

CwFM23nXseXHowS-Sntwqg.text: Last night my boyfriend, my roommate, and I were trying to figure out where to go to get some good sushi since our sushi joint down the street closes at 11pm and it was already 10:30 (no where near enough time for all you can eat sushi!).    I got on Yelp and looked up some all you can eat sushi restaurants and we finally decided on  Sushi Kaya for it's price of only $25 a person for AYCE sushi, and it doesn't close till 3am! Perfect for our late nights :)    Located right next to Anime Ramen, once you walk in to the restaurant you see the splendid Japanese/Korean decor, and the atmosphere of the place is just great!  Next to come was the hostess who took us to our seats without us having to wait a few minutes or more, which was awesome because I just got off of work and I was starving. The servers were so sweet and attentive, didn't have any problem getting their attention or asking for their advice. They did a really good job at keeping our drinks filled and checking up on us to see if we needed anything else.    Now we get to the sushi- DELICIOUS! They offer full rolls, and half rolls, and have soooo many selections to choose from. My favorites were the Lasagna Roll, the Salmon Fashion, and the Sex Bomb. I'm a petite person and can't fit too much into my stomach- but I most definitely plan on going back soon to try more!    I, along with the bf and the roommate, would recommend this place time and time again. Can't wait for the next visit!

tHzIeuuQlQyaHq6G-VugWA.text: Good sushi, kushiyaka, n soft shell crab.  Service was prompt.  Ice cream was yummy... Love the red bean flavor... Brings back memories.  But please fix the a c... It s a little warm in there. :-/

bREAghaX9o41rja65zy7DA.text: Best Kimchi Fried Rice in town!! But I'm not a huge sushi fan so I can't comment on the AYCE, b/c all I eat is kimchi fried rice, california roll and jabchae .. totally not worth getting AYCE, but if you eat sushi, it's not a bad deal.

QXb3zhTdGWwt7YQVxtCjQQ.text: Cinderella roll and crazy orgasm roll are the best hands down....the cinderella roll is actually the owners favorite, whom is also a personal friend of mine!

d0Px-1ZP7PV8-YigPtyGtg.text: Haven't been to a lot of different sushi places in Vegas; however I think it's hard to top this place as far as all you can eat sushi! Their food is just so good and pretty inexpensive (like $22 for lunch and $25 for dinner...) I love their shrimp/garlic skewer, baked green mussels, the mochi ice-cream! Sushi rolls are I think got a bit too much rice and fillers but overall it's still decent.

iI0pfbATqCdf3T3U3GBOKQ.text: My husband and I stopped by to eat there ( AYCE) about 3 weeks ago. From the moment we walked in the staff was very friendly and helpful! The sushi and rolls came out so quickly!( and they were pretty busy) We were so impressed! We've been back several times since then , and brought friends each time! It's our new sushi place on this side of town!

RYYaj69y9viFTb5JN185jw.text: Came here for lunch while the woman had pho down the street.  Ends up the pho at Pho Kim Long was not to her liking.  Anyways, ordered the AYCE deal at the lunch price (cheaper than dinner).  Sushi and rolls were pretty good considering AYCE and less than $20 and it includes ice cream.  Place was busy so I felt like the wait to get my orders was a bit long. Overall, I was very pleased.  I was so hungry and craved sushi.  Why do I oftentimes eat only one meal a day when I'm in Vegas?  If I had gone to a regular sushi joint and ordered the same amount of food, my bill would be about a $100 (5 times what I paid here).  Would I come back?  Most likely but I definitely want to try the other AYCE joints here in Vegas first.

ZJU5PEfZycE50b_nfG7zuw.text: i am always wanting to come back here.. my friends and i always come once a week to have there all you can eat sushi.. there specialty rolls are awsome.. i love spicy so any thing with spicy ahi is good.. they bring your food fast to.. must had reservatons when you come here.

qyfRFwOzIsMuKHO1X74itA.text: I'm so glad we found this place. It's way better than Yama. The hours are better too they close at 3 am which is perfect for us. Fish is fresh and their garlic tuna is delicious! I highly recommend this place. STAY AWAY FROM NASTY ASS YAMA AND THEIR HORRIBLE SERVICE.

kipheDPOd-r5L_mVUVpLbA.text: I give props to the atmosphere, and friendly staff(Although when its busy they may take awhile to check up on you). Parking is a terror, as Kaya is in one of the most popular plaza's of Chinatown, but yet very small. I suggest parking over at the main Chinatown plaza and just don't get caught walking over lol. But definitely do not expect high quality and authentic sushi at this place. instead, expect highly bastardized sushi. But if you don't mind that, then Sushi Kaya is an alright place for AYCE. The quality of the sushi rolls were terrible, when I picked up my sushi, they were doused in sauce and came falling apart. It was as if they flimsily put together an abundance of rice, small portions of fish and fillings, and disproportional sizes of rolls. The nigiri were alright though. I don't have much to say, as it wasn't that fabulous, but it also wasn't terrible.  Now onto the the good of this place! If you do some here, I suggest trying their skewers and appetizers! As well as trying some of the Korean dishes they offer. Although I did not enjoy how crappy my rolls were made, the spicy rolls were pretty flavorful and tasty. If you like spicy, its worth it to at least try. One thing I like about this AYCE place is that dessert is all you can eat as well! Which some other AYCE places don't offer at all. Sushi Kaya is not my first choice for AYCE, but its good as a last resort as its open pretty late. Definitely take time to try other AYCE options in town.

prThqe5okNgFc1F8Kb-SXA.text: Service sucks! They're usually understaffed and we were told to wait an hour for a table to be cleaned. There was only 1 chef and after we sat we waited for our food for 20 minutes!!!! Even the appetizers took 20 minutes. Will never recommend this place to anyone again. Big big mistake

bqp01Xng23ABTxQMxRn0JA.text: My Fav Sushi so far in Las Vegas, It's open until 3am, It's all you can eat for 21$ the Sushi Chefs are very nice and I usually sit at the bar and chat with them. The Food is great, nice flavors and very fresh and its not all sushi, they have a nice menu of other Japanese items to eat as well. I like the tempura and the seaweed salads.

Dd9IRd6TjgIcYuSnwagCTA.text: Great sushi buffet for the price with a wide selection. Expect for a 20 min wait as there will be a line.

iuW5WYpCxp6MAAlhOshvIQ.text: Worst service and I have been coming here for years now. We were told to leave because another party wanted to combine the tables and it just so happens my friend and I were seated in one of the tables. We weren't done eating at all. I wanted to speak to a manager but after one of the waiter threw the check at our table I didn't want to come back again. This isn't the first I was given bad service and I was always polite to all the severs but there's always one. I loved coming here but I don't think I'll be coming back.

ntKUI3v-Y7Ru2cdfNLEM8g.text: Great sushi great price I just wish that the sushi chefs would have some sort interaction with the customers. But if they keep making sushi taste this way they can ignore me all they want

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gooooood! Eat until u get one
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Japanese pizza

4An_L5OTzeYBpnpYZsoacQ.text: After unprofessional service and the worst green tea ever, we left and never tried the fiod. If they can screw uo the tea, how can we expect good food.

wp0PpINVGjLaYAkHCkB1iQ.text: My favorite place in town for all you can eat sushi! Alaska roll, Caterpillar, and Washington rolls are the best! The only bad thing they don't allow reservations between 6pm and 10pm, so waiting time can sometimes be up to an hour and a half. Not worth it on Friday nights. But for the middle of the week there is no better place.

3bfu60rtRTrQYS5YmfKNnA.text: First time here and I must say...I'm mad I didn't know about this place sooner. I've spent the last 5 years going to the same sushi spot off Rainbow and Robindale . Glad we found this gem. Amigo and Mango-style rolls are the bomb. Save room for the cherry amaretto ice cream!!

qtSukJFZmK6hio0pkEP1PQ.text: Best sushi ever! long wait to get in but so worth it everything on their menu is really good appetizers, soups, salads, sides, their sushi of course and all of their dessert. You get a punch card too so that you earn a free "all you can eat". By far my favorite sushi place

rr2I9rrxA2lGRAVFaRWeIg.text: Had the AYCE sushi lunch for $19.95. Choose from appetizers, noodles, rice like kimichi, chicken fried rice, teriyaki chicken, nigiri, tempura rolls, specialty rolls, and vanilla/strawberry/green tea ice cream for dessert.  Miso was very bland, had zero flavor. Ordered the shrimp tempura and black dragon roll and Lisa Lisa roll (avocado, cream cheese and shrimp tempura) yummy.  Overall, this place was decent.  Great service and affordable prices.

XZJM4b8QD5pWXpl3pjlWJw.text: I am a sushi fan, this place has the gourmet sushi ever... Weve been in many sushi bar and nothing beats this one. Highly recommended.. A little bit expensive but it's worth it. :)

2D1fJLSfCJtp4VzUqUoMKg.text: This place takes my breath away! Hands down the best ayce sushi. Theta always a wait so you know it's bomb and worth the wait. Not too many places here have quality and quantity, this one offers both. You can't go wrong any day of the week with this place

aXSRTUOql0OlvRgqMFFSGg.text: This has been my go to for sushi for a couple years now until recently. The only reason I have to give this place a low rating is because of their customer service skills. Horrible! We were ignored on various attempts to order and the staff seemed annoyed with us over all. They were not prompt either in removing our dirty plates and it was not even that busy. I have to say that I am very disappointed and will probably not return.

2zOue5mTTSz7j7OuFw2pwQ.text: I love this place. I've been to ayce sushi joints all around town. This one is by far the best. It's worth the wait & horrible parking.

qcqgyfJSbF-MnO4PiQXcwQ.text: Best service. Great sushi. Quick and friendly. Punch card is a plus. AYCE for 26$ during dinner rush. Open late 3 am sometimes.

lW9D6I1hDkudWNOdrpJFNg.text: I love this place. Always leave stuffed. Made to order. Good price of ayce. Good quality. Only problem is, for dinner you usually have to wait about an hour b4 ur turn.:( but other than that great service great food:)

OWfWiOtlWFvjbkqTYELpsA.text: This place is definitely worth the hype. Only reasone we're lacking a star is because of the wait. The food was out of this world, a bit of a drive but all worth it. They have a large AYCE menu with nice variety beyond your standard rolls.

KVpjwKiweBrn-b3KWsFJTw.text: I live in Austin and we don't have a place like this but every time we come to Vegas this is our first stop. Service was exceptional the last time we went. One of our favorite sushi spots in the USA.

T8mu77uI5Pf8ztzd30qKxw.text: I've been testing different AYCE sushi bars for the last couple months and I think it's safe to say Kaya is the winner in all categories. The price is lower (by a few dollars) than many other places, the food quality and selection of rolls is far superior, and AYCE includes so many different appetizers (edamame, potstickers) and mochi (!!).  The servers are always so attentive and kind. I rarely have to ask for a water refill because they do it so frequently and placing the sushi order is quick and easy. Wait time can be slightly long but if you go during off times (early afternoon during lunch, late afternoon before dinner starts) it's not so bad. My recommendations for rolls: sexy, nemo, bonzai, royal California.

F-523xLAieV4CrsaP6G9DA.text: The food it is very good ! But I do not like the way the do Business. I was there at 3:45 PM and I see they have a lot of table open they tell me to wait for 15 Minute before I can have a table . Because there price will changed to $21.99 to $28.99 after 4:00 PM. So I just want to let the boss know they have to Change the that he does business.

1a8kOjFuD39bTbYcfnv_fA.text: My favorite go to AYCE sushi joint! I've been going here for years and never really have a problem, the wait is sometimes long but that's expected so I don't mind. Service is always fine and the sushi is always delicious. My favorites are the sex bomb roll, salmon nigiri, seaweed salad, beef skewers, Philadelphia hand roll, Cinderella roll, Washington roll, mango style roll. Everything is delicious honestly. =)

-ctpeM8NUMxDw2RjFw4jAw.text: FUC-yeah to their AYCE sushi! Man-o-man! They offer a WIDE selection of food, even more than Goyemon and Sushi Mon. They have a skewer selection, and more delish dessert selection too. Their sushi offerings are more with fun and exotic selections. Their sushi is fresh as well. I ordered the Viagra Roll for the deep fried selection which was delish; the Ultimate Albacore roll which was also recommended; and the Rainbow roll. Their hand roll was also amazing which i think you should order also at least once. Then we ordered the usual yellowtail, albacore, white tuna, etc...  Great tip is to eat the sushi upside down so taste the fish first, which I never knew you should do. Awesome AYCE sushi deal for $26.

xEJNQwif-h3LgM0wgdiDlg.text: I've been here only twice and appreciate the consistency of how delicious their sushi is. The first time I ate here our service was excellent. However the second time was horrible. Several of my family's orders were missing and some never made it to the table. Our server disappeared and never came back to check on us. We had to ask the chefs by the bar for dessert because no other servers would come to our table. The manager (tall, French ?) was rude as well when we told him how upset we were.  Overall although the sushi was delicious,consistent service is what I'm looking for in a restaurant. It'll probably be awhile till I come back to this place.

HOzjPTB1wkyOFkVWhGeCmQ.text: AYCE selection was okay, special rolls & deep fried rolls were not included like other AYCE sushi places I've been to, but I was happy to see dessert was included. Rolls were average, nothing special. Kimchi fried rice was bomb! We came in around 1am and service was fast and attentive. The AYCE last call is @ 2:15am.  There's a one per person limit on the mochi ice cream. The green tea cheesecake is absolutely to die for so make sure you order one!! :)

G1JWeBcVrBl98bu23bqr5g.text: As a major fan of sushi I am always trying to find new spots. Came here with 5 friends on a Thursday night around 6:30. We had to wait to be seated but not too long.   The service was prompt and we were taken care of very well by various members of the wait staff.   The sushi selection was quite large and for all you can eat I was pleased with the menu.   Our sushi came out just about as fast as we could order it and I was very happy with the quality of the sushi.   If you come I highly recommend the smoke salmon nigiri.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PmeZ4XwHx5rGO6RHOR-xJg.text: I've pulled up to Sushi Kaya several times, only to be turned away by the hour + wait. People flock here for their AYCE menu, and convenient location (although the parking lot can be a bit of a nightmare). I was FINALLY able to walk in on a Thursday night around 7pm last week, which might be the trick, because when we left around 9 there were people waiting around the corner.   We opted for the AYCE menu which I believe was about 26.95 a pop, and is definitely the way to go since rolls start at like 11.95 and nigiri can range from 6.95-9.95. There are limitations of course, only 1 order of sweet shrimp and uni per person, no sashimi, and you must eat all the rice or you'll get charged for leftovers. I wasn't blown away by the flavor or quality, but it wasn't horrible either. The halibut and salmon belly were the best, but the tuna and yellowtail etc. all have a way of blending in together sometimes. I tried mackerel for the first time....pass. Way too fishy. Uni was subpar, I've had better at Spicy Tuna. If there isn't a wait I'd head in at 2am, but don't line up expecting the best sushi meal of your life unless you're the kind to order cream cheese rolls and lemon drops.

GwIAb8EAgU7RxxXCacp92w.text: The guy, because I SURE hope he isn't the manager, with the New Balances his name is Leo horrible attitude horrible service horrible view of the industry. I hate going out and having a horrible experience but today was just one of those days. DISAPPOINTED taking into consideration I come here at least twice a week.

VdSsgdxuQgAL1iIfV3bVSw.text: All you can eat sushi...lower price for lunch, a bit higher for dinner ($24.95).  The menu is pretty extensive, many types of salads, tempura, skewers, nigiri special rolls, etc.    The food was good and fresh.    The size of the orders are small, but again, if you leave stuff behind, you have to pay for the excess.  Overall a good option, located in Las Vegas Chinatown.

5-c-QNPNBakF1Jd9bb5oNw.text: This place will get my first review ever based on the fact that their service and food blew me away! Google says they aren't usually busy but this is a lie.  Honestly I was ready to head to the next place after being told it would be a 20 minute wait.  But within five minutes we had our spot. This place was SLAMMED.  We received our first order of rolls and drinks almost immediately and never once had to hunt someone down to order more.  You can tell this place is run really really well. Not to mention an extensively delicious all you can eat menu! Trust me...this place is worth it!

qkSvuWVFEPpQ_ZwFdYSnOw.text: Why does this place have bad reviews? I freaking love this spot!! I live on the other side of town, but I still try to come here at least once a week.  My idea of a good sushi place is somewhere with FRESH raw fish, as in sashimi and nigiri.  I always do AYCE, and the nigiri is a perfect ratio of fish to rice.  They don't overdo it on the rice, so you don't get full that fast.  I always order salmon, halibut, yellowtail, and red snapper.  I am never disappointed. The fish melts in your mouth.  Not fishy tasting.  Try their garlic ponzu, it's a very nice addition.  I'm not sure if other restaurants offer this special type of ponzu.  Don't listen to the other reviewers who obviously prefer a deep fried California roll over real fish.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. salmon nigiri! Sooo good!

-CTmur6tsMjcjBxDmoPQlw.text: Service is good  Food takes awhile to come out but  Atmosphere  is nuce and relaxing  Fish is GREAT!  But it kinda seems like all their rolls have close to the same ingridents.. defiently woul recommend tho!   Con  No fresh oysters

Pf-Fk2u7fgBg7RFJVuaNGg.text: FXXX THIS PLACE!!! Just went there last night, had a heavy rain last night, and the whole building's power out. We were in there without light and AC and try to wait for the power back, the we can pay [paying by card]. We waited there at least 45mins, then we tried to talk to the manager and see what can we do to solve that, but the Asian manager's attitude is rude. Since we don't have cash, and we are not from local, so we try ask them is anyone have chase bank there then we can transfer money to them.  And the manager just keep saying i am giving you option have to choose either one to do, you guys either leave ur actual cell phone and ID here or wait here until the power is back!!!!!  AT THE END one of the staff helped us to solve that, used his personal bank to take our money! I think the guy called CHANCE! Really nice!  Food is okay not bad Price is okay Service is good beside that Asian manager

VTjv8StGWeMrgbgWk4d-Vg.text: Sushi is good but the raw fish is okay. Didn't taste extremely fresh and they put a lot of rice. If I didn't eat so much of the regular raw fish sushi I would come back by since I do I still have yet to find a good ayce sushi in Vegas.

KsI0fgWt1F1_6sZ9EgdnVw.text: I always hit this place up when I'm in Vegas.  My family of 10+ always does the AYCE.  Even my brother in law that doesn't eat raw fish.   There's tons of options and their sushi quality ain't bad.  I do wish their scallops sushi wasn't cooked!! Argh! Last time we went, we got a sweet private room by making a reservation for 10!! Service was awesome and their concern that we ordered too much was sweet (they charge you for leftovers).  They haven't meet my family.. hee hee...  Love this place and can't wait to go back!   Note: always make a reservation! !!! This place is packed! !

Also had the garlic edamame which was kind of spicy but really good. Next time I'll do all you can eat because it seems worth it since each specialty roll is over $12 so 2 rolls is the same as all you can eat  The service was really good too I felt well taken care of and they were all very sweet and accommodating. Definitely will return!  Update: had all you can eat and it's a little overwhelming since there are so many specialty rolls to choose from but everything I tried was so delicious this is definitely my new all you can eat sushi

jp-ODzl4tO7QjIY9ZvUVCw.text: Great food, but the owner forced me to pay for my food even after i showed him that freon was leaking from the ceiling onto my food! Owner only cares about money! NOT the customers or service! ONE STAR!

zLazvZLgeLxAbb6mhW8iIg.text: Always a great place to come. They have different varieties of AYCE for all types of sushi lovers. The have lunch and dinner prices with AYCE appetizers and dessert.

Fqb_mtgZfK7g4Mj2f5yHkA.text: The best All-U-Can-Eat Sushi. The waiter took our sushi order and it came out within 2 minutes and 43 seconds.  I know because I timed it...hahaha. Great atmosphere. Worth the wait...

ioKlFP-Zx55GUL8FF4VEBQ.text: Sad to say they have roaches Used to be my favorite place until the roaches. Hope they take care of that issue. Spoke with manager and she said that she notified the owner & are working on fixing this issue immediately .

e-eotCjrmqszlnpIbSjb4w.text: While their food was good their staff is not.  My friends and I reserved a room for a birthday dinner. We had paid for the room but the staff was being extremely rude about the fact that a few of the people were running late. They wouldn't serve us and threatened to kick us out before our prepaid hour was even up (or barely started for that matter). Now, I am not going to say we didn't get a little loud (there was 12 of us) BUT that's why we had gotten our own room! The servers coming in and out would rarely shut the door.  We would order food with one person and sometimes it would never come and when we would ask why, we were told we were wrong.   Now time to pay the bill for the food (room was already paid for the time beforehand). They SHORT my boyfriend $20 by saying he did not put the money in when I watched him do it! It was $40 for us both (tip included). They come back and make him pay another $20.   We say screw it whatever because we are still celebrating a birthday in the group. Mind you, none of the staff says anything else to us, not even when we were outside for about 20 minutes afterwards taking a few photos and setting up a meeting spot.   After we leave the parking lot, the friend who paid for the room gets a call from there. They tell him we are nkt allowed back! That we were roudy, rude, and racist! In no way were we any of that! When my friend protests he also demands they check the video of the room to see what happened with my boyfriend's money. Of course they say nothing looks wrong. Funny how they didn't want to tell us that while we were there.  I will never trust this place or ever suggest this place to anyone sheerly on the poor customer service and the blatant lying to make a quick buck.  But hey, eat here if someone else is taking you because the food ain't terrible. Just don't waste your own money.

uZjWH5YOI5SceMZEdI4PyQ.text: If I could leave no stars I totally would. This place is so frekin bad I honestly just feel bad for all the servers and hosts everyone looks miserable I blame management. My server was this skinny tatted Hispanic guy he was probably the worst server ever. I feel bad I mean maybe he was having a bad day it was obvious he didn't wanna be there but at least try to give good customer service. It makes me upset because I work too, I get it work is frustrating but I ALWAYS give good customer service and don't let the worst of me get to me. I will never comeback here, and on top of that my bill was priced wrong. Worst sushi restaurant ever with such a great location. On to the next one.

weIlR0zERJeTcROTHdnJSA.text: I came here in December 2015 and I really enjoyed it.  I enjoyed it A LOT.  I was really excited to come back here, so I brought my friends and I who are all in Vegas for a convention.  I have to write this sad review because we went there for lunch on 3/6/16 with a group of 6 of us.  We ordered quite a variety - the rolls, skewers, nigiri of all sorts, seaweed salad, etc.    HERE'S MY FOOD POISONING STORY:  Unfortunately the next day at midnight I started throwing up, and I had a very high fever.  I didn't know it, (I thought I had a really bad hangover) but I had food poisoning.  I was throwing up water until 5am and had the hot sweats from having a fever.  I could barely stay asleep and I was out the entire day on Tuesday, missing my convention.    After I was finally better, I found out the rest of my group had food poisoning too - SIX OF US. one of my friends decided to drive home earlier because he couldn't hold it down from both ends.  A few others were nauseous, and the others were taking Pepto Bismol.    One of my friends said they noticed the sushi wasn't as cold when they ate it, and that could be the reason.  I don't know, but it's really unfortunate as this was my favorite AYCE sushi place to go to.

ZmoxWY0cCosSgoUEmgkGCw.text: Been enjoying some sushi that my son got me yesterday.  It was an early BIRTHDAY,  which today is Jan.  19th my B-Day.   He got me 3 rolls and I'm still working on my last one which honestly I don't want it to over yet... Lolol... So goooood!!   U r also both of sons favorite sushi place!!!

2YnQ2_ZP3QhLhluiaDRT8Q.text: The food was ok, not that great. Items are very limited, tons of Rolls if that's what you prefer. However, the reason why I gave it 2 stars is because of the lousy service(which by the way was 18%, already included in the bill ) we waited for more than 10 minutes after our water was empty and no one came in to refill it, later on, the beers we ordered they completely forgot about it and we waited for another 15 minutes or so. I don't normally leaves reviews, but this store not worth my time.

1v7uEPdeur3MTUj9evMqJw.text: They charge me 12.95 for my 4 yrs old daughter and she didn't even ate anything!! Rip off!!

AxaCr7gwcwF-VkNF-esn-A.text: Extremely slow service .They forgot  few of our orders. Food okay service bad . I will not recommend to any of my family and friends !

ybtI4DU_nnl9j3wmcBM7fg.text: Cool casual ambiance with tons of options!   I really liked this off-Strip suggestion from Thrillist, which boasts an all you can eat sushi menu that's very extensive.   The rolls utilize a lot of tempura shrimp, dressed up California rolls, and cream cheese, but the good picks are very decent. I also liked that you can order half rolls so you can cover more of the menu.   If you have a car or are willing to uber ($10ish each way from the south end of the Strip) then this is a good swap for one of the big hotels' sushi restaurants.

U8hnvuKPij0nfHu-iez4Bw.text: My son and I had a 3-day vacation in Vegas. After having a lot of buffet lunches and dinners, we decided to eat something lighter and less fattening on the last night in Vegas.  Hence, we decided to go to Sushi Kaya for sushi rolls. They have an all-you-can-eat dinner for $24 per person.  This was a lot cheaper than the buffet lunches and dinners we had before.  As we had eaten a lot of food in the previous two days and nights, even the $24 all-you-can-eat dinner was too much for our appetites.  That's why we ordered sushi rolls a la carte.  Each sushi roll costs around $12.    The Latino lady who served us turned her face contemptuous when we went for a la carte "against" her wish for all-you-can-eat.  As soon as we finished the last count of sushi rolls, she came forward to ask us "are you still waiting for something".  We still had our full glasses of beverages not yet consumed!!!  She even brought us the check although we are not ready to check out.  We were still drinking the beverages, reading the dessert menu and would like to place an order for ice cream.  She reluctantly took the check back.  We had never met any servers so rude in any restaurants.  Even fast food restaurants such as McDonald's and In-N-Out Burgers don't push their customers to leave after they finish their meals,  let alone the fact that we still had our beverages on the table!  When she first took her liberty to bring the check to us, we had been there in Kaya for only 20 to 25 minutes!  It was 10 pm on a week night when they still had a few unoccupied tables.  We're not taking up their valuable space or having an extended stay there.  Why this Latino lady was so keen on getting rid of us decent customers?  On the other hand, the other waiters and waitresses who are Japanese or Chinese were very nice to us.  They asked us to refill our drinks.  What was wrong with the Latino lady?   I think she thought we could not afford the $24 dinner there, and therefore she behaved so rude.  In fact, with the sushi rolls, miso soup, beverages and ice cream we ordered, the total bill was close to 2 all-you-can-eat dinners the Latino lady cherished.  So, what is wrong with her mentally?   Well, she did not notice that my watch alone is worth more than her annual salary. The money I donated to charities can buy her a new car to replace her piece of junk in parking lot.   Frankly speaking, the quality of this lady is worse than the Latino cleaning ladies in my company.  The Latino cleaning ladies in my company are very hard working, polite and nice.  I don't see these qualities in this Latino waitress lady.  I don't know why Sushi Kaya hire such uncaring rude person as their employee to serve their valued customers.  I believe she could be a spy from Kaya's competitor to hurt Kaya's business and bottomline.

WqWmXNzX9_NmCEJP_pbm5w.text: AYCE sushi. Best value in Vegas. Be prepared to wait to be seated.  This is the best AYCe in Vegas.  Beer is always cold and they give all the food you can eat.

lLwW78fDXcIIbPAvQ0K6cg.text: I like this place since it is quick and reasonably price. I like the skewered shrimp and beef, even it is not japanese dish.  You cannot go wrong with the salmon skin salad, ultimate albacore roll and salmon skin roll. If you opt for dinner, you could have added 5pcs of sashimi (very thin, I warn you), sweet shrimp and sea urchin. They also have good fried rice, surprisingly. And mochi ice cream is included. Many all you can eat does not include Michigan ice cream.  Over all, decent bang for the buck.

DyEek_thMnZyz8nMACwdEA.text: The sushi is good but the way that it's ran is dumb, we came for my birthday with a group of 12 and they wouldn't take a reservation but said in order to hold the room we have to ensure that 10 people are doing all you can eat bc of a "new policy" which I knew we were but it's kind of weird texting everyone else last minute to confirm if they were doing all you can eat as well (especially with there being vegetarians in the group and them having a very limited veggie menu) but we showed up to the restaurant at 7 which is when we tried to make the reservation and we all had to wait outside in the freezing  cold for 25 minutes before they would seat us in the room that was empty when we got there not to mention that the host was being very rude. It sucks bc I've been coming here for my birthday for the last 4 years and never had a problem. Not sure if it's under new management, but I definitely would not recommend coming here for big parties or special occasions. They're horrible at accommodating.

KZAZJ6E9KEGytpaf9lRHGw.text: My teenage granddaughter suggested that we try this ayce..all you can eat..sushi restaurant. At 1 pm they were very busy but we obtained a table within 5 minutes. The service was excellent as they have a very large staff of waitresses. The menus is impressive with a wide varity of sushi rolls. Everything was delivered to our table very rapidly. Now the problems. Every sushi roll tasted the same. Great presentation. Different name but blind folded they are all the same. The price was definitely far too high..$66.00 for 2 people. Btw there is a time limit of 45 minutes. I would not recommend this establishment.l

5FBit5FXGkH0urJcKcvjZA.text: Once you walk in, you're immediately greeted by the sushi chef staff and their chanting of some sort of Japanese dialogue. Came during lunch and got the AYCE sushi ($21.95/pp)   Great tapas portions = allowing you to try more on the menu. All speciality sushi can be ordered in 4's vs. 8's. My favorite specialty sushi roll was the "Sex bomb" great complex flavors; especially with the eel and salmon. I loved the beef, shrimp and beef tongue skewers. The other top contenders: Seaweed salad, fried tempura mixed was fried to perfect, can't go wrong with the salmon nigiri- taste fresh and not frozen. I had a few rolls which I didn't like and unfortunately I can't recall what they were. When I told one of the staff I didn't like these rolls, I had the most nastiest glance. I was like ugh..OKAAYY.. Just went from a 4 star down to a 3. SMH.   Parking here was pretty easy when we came.

Y7BxO2MLTYjbhG96wmWhGw.text: Fast service, foods great and clean, top 3 AYCE!  Desserts on point, all around win for ayce craving

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi is so good, even with a fork and orange soda its bomb!

They seem to be known for their all you can eat menu which typically I am not a fan of.  Here you can order half portions which is genius cause you can try many of their items without feeling gluttinous.  I enjoyed many things and would recommend if you need a Japanese fix.

za_DUGJ-O6VkGFHPkLpXUg.text: The rolls were "the bomb" my first time here and I am in love  great food, awesome service!!! I'll be back soon for sure!!!

sIv-brhtgLoZQ0j3fkjxfw.text: I'm going to preface this with the fact I've been to this restaurant before and had pretty much an average experience nothing extraordinary. However last night me and some friends decided to eat some late night sushi. There aren't many in town so our choice was pretty clearly going to be Sushi Kaya. Upon being seated we were quickly asked what we'd like to drink, most servers would typically ask each individual what they'd like. This server heard one person say water and ran off saying "Waters all around then!" Most of our table was confused but brushed it off as just a miscommunication. Next we began to order, nothing too out of the ordinary there, until we had ordered our second round of Salmon Nigiri. Our order was delivered to us and as they set it down they said "Salmon Nigiri and Smoked Salmon Nigiri". I'm not a fan of smoked salmon nor were any of my friends. So we asked why we got smoked salmon to the same server that told us it was smoked salmon. So she took the plate, we assume to ask a chef, and returns with the same plate saying it's just salmon nigiri. We try it and it's definitely smoked salmon. We then ask the same server that "took care" of our drinks about the smoked salmon and in a unhappy way took the plate and didn't really apologize or say anything regarding the mistake. Finally we finish our meal and ask for the check. Upon receiving the check my girlfriend notices that we were being charged the 18% gratuity for a group of 5 when their policy is 6 or more have added gratuity. We ask one of the servers if this is a mistake and they proceed to ask several other people who say that the gratuity is "supposed to be there". The server then approaches our "amazing" drink server about the added gratuity and she confidently states that it is supposed to be there. We of course dispute this that they aren't honoring their policy and should remove this discrepancy. She then folds and takes the checks and removes the gratuity. Upon arriving with our correct checks she throws them down aggressively and disingenuously says have a good night and leaves. Of course after an experience like that where she forces things upon us such as drink orders and added gratuity, my friends and I are never planning to come back and left her a nice healthy $0.10 tip for her "amazing" service.

Mx8aZwwvu_YUVDbU_7aA9A.text: Sometimes I don't like to review places I ate at while significantly intoxicated because let's face it, anything tastes good.. but I distinctly remember this place being more than just amazing post-alcohol sushi. This spot was definitely on point. The miso cucumber salad was refreshingly simple. The chili garlic edamame to die for. The pancho roll and crispy rice roll were absolutely PERFECT. Since my old favorite AYCE spot closed down, I've been on the hunt for a replacement. Sushi Kaya to the rescue.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

j_Tr-bQFJ5exy1fvZw6P3g.text: I wasn't impressed with their calamari and service was just ok. Nex time i would go to the bar instead of table. Over all it was pritty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Njt0pow_TaWmzPHMiOO6cA.text: Just like the first time I went there all over again.  I went here was like 5 years ago, and I'm glad it hasn't changed, because it was eye-opening and wonderful!   There's plenty of parking, maybe like 60-80 spots, but they are still not enough when the restaurant is at peak business, so you might have to driving in circles a few times. Unfortunately most of the time it's first come first serve without reservation unless you have like a lot of people on your party, then they might accommodate.   When you finally get inside, they have what seems like a million servers always running around checking on everyone. They called our name, and seated us after about a 30 minute wait during peak Friday at night. Immediately someone asked us what we wanted to drink and if we were ready to order. Drinks yes, food not yet.   When they came back in a few minutes we started ordering half rolls and nigiri. Half roll portions are the way we do because if it doesn't taste like you thought, it's only 4 pieces, as opposed to 8. Kaya has a rule if you waste too much they'll charge ya extra for it.   Anyway all the rolls were delicious and the wait after ordering a roll is like 5-10 minutes, extremely fast & fresh. Now one thing to note is, most rolls have a lot of seasoning on them yum yum sauce, ponzu, spicy etc. so if you're a purest and just want nigiri, it might not be what you're looking for. For me I love the spicy yum yum sauce and colorful display :).   Overall excellent service, speedy food preparation and really tasty sushi options. Not cheap on the weekends, but when the stomachs happy, the wallet doesn't care!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegas Roll half portion, so tasty!
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Where the magic is prepared!

QhK6GHg9wsRH7deFQHqyyg.text: Very rude lady on the night shift spilled water on the table and walked away and didn't say sorry or nothing she just left her mess and left the table all wet from the water she spilled

Tqi2IAd3f0ntUtt5yvT7IA.text: Not only does Sushi Kaya offer incredibly fresh all you can eat sushi, but they also have an extensive menu that includes anything from ginger salad and spicy edamame to curry rice and mochi ice cream. Basically you are getting all you can eat appetizers, entrees, and desserts for one low price.   There are two vegetarian sushi rolls on the menu and they are both very tasty. But again, given the depth of the menu, you will find plenty of vegetarian options in addition to the sushi to make a visit to Sushi Kaya worth it.  This might not be the best place to get sushi if you are gluten free. They do not have a gluten free menu, and you'll really have to sift through the speciality rolls to find any that don't contain gluten in some form or another (sauces, imitation crab, tempura batter, etc). They do not have gluten free soy sauce. If you are really careful about ordering, you might be able to make Sushi Kaya work. At least the mochi ice cream should be gluten free.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best all you can eat sushi in Las Vegas.

5etHK4TLIpPzwRRf_1sP6Q.text: Decent AYCE sushi! (AYCE = All You Can Eat) I have come here multiple times for lunch and once for dinner. The lunch hour definitely fills up so beware of a possible 20 minute wait time.   Food: For the most part tasty and fresh. The nigiri is probably the best bang for your buck! The sushi rolls are good as well though and i recommend the skewers!   Rolls: Cinderella, Amigo, Sexy, Monkey Brains, Crispy Rice, Jupiter, Sex Bomb, Dancing Eel, White Vegas, Evergreen, Wall Street, and Brooklyn are my go-to rolls.  Nigiri: yellowtail, yellowtail, yellowtail it is sooo good and fresh!   Check out the bowls too when you first get there, they take 15  minutes so you'll want to order them first. They're not a full size just a nice mini personal or two personal sampler size.   Service: The staff changes very often, it's rare we get the same server for long but they're all very nice and we've always received fast service.

Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AYCE for Lunch
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Rice

f7T0wq4WL3iTyTTOs3gqmA.text: Loved it I recommend this place !! I got who's your daddy , pancho , jack pot.  Definitely going back food was fast drinks had a great night with my friend . The server was really sweet and kind always there for us. Thank you Milani

nkfW0ma7Xz-DzaNCKCQL7A.text: Love this place!!  Service can be iffy sometimes when you go during rush hour but they have great fish!

pc0NhsMEBFWVTk0PGW6Uwg.text: Went in last night. Service was horrible!  1. They took a while to order a our drinks.  2. Missed a few drinks once dropped off. 3. No one attended our table even though we had a few empty cups! 4. Gave us attitude every time I waived someone down for service.  Overall horrible service!! I remembered last night why I only go there once or twice a year, it's the service that's just so horrible, food is decent but the staff is not!

FeBHVZjiNsqW78DKGGuz6g.text: I love this spot! I've been coming here for years, and sure, every place is going to have an off-night (news flash- that's the reality of the world anywhere you go), but I've never had a bad experience. The sushi, the service, and the vibe all collectively make it my favorite sushi joint. On a busy night, I just head next door to the karaoke bar (Zizzy?) to have a drink while I wait for my table, since they'll call when it's time to be seated. Perfect routine!

SkRmUFQ7ng5taSfr4cksww.text: I have gone to sushi Kaya 3 times n being a local I like to go try new or local restaurants...tho the food is good,the service n the staff are not friendly to most...I will never go back n just pointing out two of the servers should not even have a job there!!!

AOaoU1uwHvGF66jAPghirg.text: Awesome service. The staff is constantly circulating the dining room. Don't like certain ment items though, simplicity is best. Sashimi is a nice slice of fish, not a slice of fish drowned in sauce and covered with siracha and s hall jalapeno.

43iqm52j1NsToDMRqKfaXw.text: Sadly, this use to be the sushi restaurant to go, we would not chose another one but the last time there was disappointing. My mom was visiting and she is a sushi lover, took her there and we had the worst experience. Literally the only thing offered to us was the table. After waiting 20 minutes or longer we saw a server and requested menus, he left and forgot about us, next server around asked if we had decided, only then we had a chance to request menus. The second server took our order and was not able to bring the correct drinks, she brought me ice tea after I had requested green hot tea and of course the wrong soda for my mom. When the food came we had to ask for condiments and chopsticks because those never came before the food. The sushi looked dry, had little flavor and the presentation was falling in-front of our eyes, truly embarrassing for a place of high reputation. It was noticeable how a restaurant gains reputation and the quality falls. It was not even busy to justify the slow and low quality service, we did not even had all you can eat, we ordered specific dishes and left a tip out of curtesy. The hostess had a smile and was friendly.

us5RQz1ZcntYCPtkblzKAA.text: This is currently my favorite all you can eat sushi spot but then I haven't tried enough of them to truly know the major diff at this point.  They have a nice variety of things on their all you can eat menu including baked green mussels (take about 30 minutes to cook so ask for them when you're seated and ask for a bunch of orders of em); included in the all you can gorge menu is miso soup, several skewers (shrimp, scallop, even tongue); there are a ton of choices and everything is delicious. It isn't top top notch but only because we are nowhere near an ocean. There is an item on the menu named WHO IS YOUR DADDY? and if you know the answer to that, I say you're doing better than most. Cap off your blossoming stomach ache with a mango or strawberry mochi ball (they're mind benders) and some green tea ice cream.

BcdUo3sDmZq5GyA3VfkmJQ.text: Meh. We used to come here all the time over the last few years and loved it every time.... However, after going back a few times after not coming here for a while. I can honestly say service has gone downhill. I don't know if it's the new management or ?? But both times we went recently, I was surprised they lowered the price but then I realized why. One of the times we kept getting another tables rolls and we had to flag our waiter that we didn't order that. Another time they took so long to bring the check back when it wasn't so busy. And the food isn't what it used to be, the poke isn't the same. I can't quite put my finger on it but it just wasn't it. Both times I've gone they've been "out of bacon & scallop". The first time I was like "ok we are here late maybe they ran out." But this time it was around early dinner time, same thing. If you're not going to have something anymore why not update the menu? Menus could sure use an update. They looked like they hadn't been cleaned in a while too. Idk this spot lost its touch, kinda disappointed.

17vE7rYY-UAgbHi50KlL_Q.text: Great service, good food, and positive vibes. I would definitely recommend. I've been coming here for years and they never disappoint.

id7IJMIAR4htIxYUV71rjw.text: I really like this place. I usually go here. The smoked salmon is really good and I recommend the pancho roll if you like semi spicy rolls.

ETghb9z_haHC6Ju5cCD58w.text: I will come back and do a proper review but never have I not only been denied booth just to see someone else get it to being threatened to be charged for left overs and I totally got so sick from Eating this food , ally *sp was our server and this was just a freaking nightmare
