fSjcKoo_eBpfXdOZQx8mXA.text: The price for all you can eat is amazing, $24 at dinner. The ambiance is pretty cool, very cozy and intimate. The menu includes a wide assortment of salad, soup, appetizers, sashimi, nigiri, and a TON of specialty rolls. Everything is prepared pretty quickly and the quality is good especially for the price you pay. The server we had was a bit standoffish and didn't really check back often to see if we wanted to order more, but we definitely didn't leave hungry! The grilled skewers and dynamite appetizer are a must, but skip the calamari and pot stickers. Thenrolls were really creative and tasty as well. We favored the Washington roll and the One Night Stand roll. The octopus nigiri was a little off tasting, but not bad enough to not eat. Overall, a good experience and worth trying. We wished there was more of a sashimi selection and brown rice as a sushi option. Again, no huge deal as there is lots to choose from!

uWYB7gPPSbeHfCN2AnovgQ.text: Made reservations for 7 on a Tuesday morning and the sweet hostess still seated us with no wait even when we were 15 minutes late (Thank You!) Always try to make reservations, because their waiting area is very tiny! Which is understandable, I rather have a small waiting area and more tables than vice versa.    Service is a hit or miss! Usually when it's lunch time and not busy, the service is right on. I wish I could have put in a good word for our server, but I don't believe that they have name tags (darn). Anyways, our waitress with the short hair was so attentive! She always asked us if we wanted to order more and always checked up on us, which is odd because that never happened the last 5 times I was here.   For an AYCE restaurant, the quality of the fish was okay, it wasn't excellent though. Our yellowtail nigiri was kinda on the warm side and gross, but they are very generous with the size of the fish and amount of rice. Big piece of fish on top of a little stack of rice (perfect!) I would recommend everything on the menu, especially all the baked rolls like the Tornado and Sweety roll. The only thing I would not recommend are their baked mussels. They put way too much cheese and cook it for too long, so the cheese is all burnt and tuff (ew).

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Other side of AYCE menu
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AYCE menu

fUK--bp0zeKIho8hE_Omew.text: We still think it's one of the best AYCE sushi in Vegas although the menu got changed. Besides sushi, the skewer items were also good especially the bacon asparagus and mushroom. Used to have the yummy chicken gizzard but it's now off the menu... Don't forget to try the Spider roll which was one of our must have items. Also love their ice cream,  plum wine and mocha almond are the best!!  $25 for dinner and $20 for lunch but you can't order sweet shrimp and sea urchin during lunch. Ask for the stamp card. They will give you a stamp for one meal. You get one free if you got 10 stamp within a year.  We go there usually before 6 pm to avoid the wait, or you may have to wait at least 30 minutes during weekends.   Just fyi - there are lots of parking spaces behind the restaurant :)  3 starts because we sat on the bar table last night and saw too much dust on the decor that was hanging on the sushi bar. You can tell the dirt were built up for years...

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free meal when you get 10 stamps
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sushi and the seeweed salad

Bv189hY4WGCn8ESI_P8F8A.text: We ate here Sunday morning at 2am. We were a group of 8, my brothers, their friends who drove from CA a few hours before, my mother and of course me, I had a flight to CO in a few hours, we spent all day at my Father's funeral service so we were all exhausted, we wanted to spend time together before everyone parted ways. I get it, it was near closing time, my brothers and his friends were loud, but the host/server had a lot of attitude. At one point, I could have sworn he said "ok, I'll just take your fucking order" and I darted a look at him. He was a foot away so there couldn't have been a mistake with what I heard. I did my best to say my please and thank yous to this punk. In my line of work, I have to watch people, so that's what I did. My mom got up to go somewhere, when she was walking to our table, 2 guys behind the bar, the cooks, one was a short Hispanic male &  the other was a taller, heavy set, pale, Caucasian male, hats flipped backwards, they watched her and proceeded to make comments, the heavy one shook his head in disgust and said something to the tiny one, and I stared and watched this entire conversation. The woman they made comments of spent 44 years with my now deceased father, she spent 10 years taking care of him, she spent these last couple of months feeding him and cleaning his hospital bed everytime he defecated, she did everything, we have to make her take sleeping pills so she can actually sleep. She's beautiful inside and out to me. So to these 2 young, odd looking individuals, when your loved ones pass, I hope you are as protective with them as I am with mine.   The food was okay, the chicken curry didn't have chicken in it. It wasn't impressive, the fried sushi was on the stale side. The corn tortilla for the Japanese Pizza didn't go well with the ensemble, but the rest of the "pizza" was tasty. Calamari was the best on the table.  It was a quick serve, fast food style. Food would have tasted better if the service and people weren't so terrible. Server didn't deserve the tip we gave him, but I'm generous.

mvKSYzw_T6PJMV85NpH1YQ.text: Since I had Sushi Kaya 2 years ago... I haven't been anywhere else. I love this place. They have the best sushi and great appetizers!  The staff is amazing every time I go... Very friendly. Cinderella roll and lasagna roll are one of my favorites. Who's your daddy is a must try! Also the lettuce wraps. So yummy!

bI8TzSANbzogJbp2bfMfTg.text: This place is awesome for AYCE!!!!! The wait staff is friendly and super helpful if this is your first time. The menu is huge so many choices, other than sushi they have many side orders. The only problem is that some of them are limited to one order per person. Try the beef skewer, tongue and the mushroom just to name a few. These are limited but so good so be sure to order your limit.   The nigiri is always on point, hamachi, garlic tuna and super white are a must. If you like rolls try the baked Alaska its A-MAY-ZING!!!!!! They don't disappoint. When ever I come here the sushi comes out really fast and they always check back to see if we need anything.   Now depending when you come here there is a wait sometimes, just because the place is not that big and the food is awesome. So they must be doing something right. It crazy that people complain about the wait but would you rather go some where the food is bad and no one is there? All good things come to those who wait! Trust me it's worth the wait. Just eat here and make your own decision.....    Dessert is the usual Mochi ice cream, vanilla ice cream, red bean, green tea and strawberry ice cream. If you want something different try the Yuzu sorbet  it's refreshing! The mini cheesecake bites are cool, it comes with whip cream and some chocolate syrup. Enjoy!!!!!!!!!

jZKEFg2mPAy0fMrrSedcBg.text: garlic edamame is amazing. Food taste fresh and right size portions. Price is great for lunch. Upset my favorite sushi spot was sold so this might be my new go to.   Service a little slow but attentive when you did have their attention.   Green tea cheesecake. Delicious

KC-P2tOfvrst9CitZesiDg.text: Creative and varied menu. Poor service. Amazing food. Poor service.  The all you can eat is a great value, but I'm not fond of it switching to a la carte for anything unfinished.  Staff is courteous, but unbearably slow even with the place half empty.

yHBQdRltRWX4q_jUaVIBgg.text: Service was so shitty today. This place use to be fast,courtesy and a place I would recommend....just like yama sushi something must have went to their  heads,cause service here sucks now.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Disgusting. What happened to this place? Was out of jalapeño poppers..miso soup ice cold ,waited ..cold ass spicy rice cake

G7-3KCRgqVH3EAe23t_qtg.text: Hands down one of the best sushi let alone all you can eat I have very been to. Kudos to this place.  Great service as well. We will definitely be back!

WzleDR3NrwNywe5oS-S3nw.text: If you're looking for a good AYCE sushi place in China town, this is the place. If you have a party 10-20 (16-18 comfortably) you can reserve the front private room. They do ask for a credit card to reserve it though. The AYCE includes appetizers, sushi, and dessert (everything on the laminated menu). Be careful to not waste our they could charge you. They didn't seem very strict but I wouldn't test them. Good quality and portions of fish. Sometimes places try to fill you up with rice, not this place. You can also start a rewards card with a stamp for each AYCE paid for. Once you get it filled (10 stamps) you get a free AYCE. Worth the $26 for sure!

r2Hf383mCrNjRDa4nxSXcg.text: This is my all time favorite sushi place!! We always get the all you can eat. Totally worth the price for all the great food!! We have received free all you can eat meals several times since we use our stamp card

3lvw0D4HTN7uTn8n6F2IgQ.text: Absolutely rude and unprofessional staff. Manager doesnt know what he is doing and chasing people away. Fish not fresh. This restaurant was on a "dirty dining las vegas " show. When i left this place i felt a little sick and threw up...

Nothing was good. Nothing.  All the fish was really weird looking. They gave us super weird cuts every time. And it all tasted terrible. Consistently. We arrive to be told that we arrived 3 minutes too late to eat there and have to leave with them closing an hour later. So do not arrive an hour prior to eating or they will tell you to leave.

cV9pwfpG_sLWgU2c6pb2fg.text: Good service, decent food. Selection is wide and great. The one thing that was not that great here is that they limit the sashimi orders to one per person, but you can get around that by ordering the nigiri. They gave us a stamp card which would have been great if we were staying in Las Vegas longer.

1BCAFASLLTXjySZD93xJrA.text: Wanted to try their all-you-can-eat sushi because we always see a lot of customers in there but was disappointed. Service was slow. We ordered nigiri only so can't say for other items.   Salmon/yellow tail and pretty much everything else we ordered was not fresh tasting and rice didn't taste good. All the fish on the nigiri we ordered looked dry and tasted like sushi from supermarket.  We've tried ayce in Sushi Mon and service there was much better/faster and sushi was 100% better.   Won't be back!

VGKmX1xes2IJFNblEkCieQ.text: Low quality sushi at an average price. Our rolls came out warm and I had to unwillingly force most of them down since they charge for leftovers. Baked rolls were better.   Service was mediocre with the servers not being assigned to specific tables and the employees scattered amongst all tables. Made it very difficult and irritating to order our food, we had to place orders multiple times with 2-3 different servers throughout our meal. Mind you it was only about 3pm. They were polite but definitely not oriented on good waiting service.   That being said, the warm sushi -yuck- along with the terrible waiting service was not worth coming back to this place. Also left there with a bit of a stomachache that lasted a couple of hours, but nothing too serious.

7E6zwdPytO_CuIP-eoh90w.text: Came here on a recommendation since our favorite sushi place is currently closed for remodeling.  Nothing tasted fresh except for the Cajun Albacore. Our food was served in chipped dishes, the staff was just ok, and the food was disappointing. Too bad because we were really looking forward to trying another place.

C1o-s0XCO0T6zxcoJPXqqA.text: I went here two times now.  The first time I ever went here I didn't like it but I listened to people and decided to give it another chance, my mistake.  I went here for my birthday and got food poisoning that night.    Don't come here.  Both times I saw bugs flying around and servers took forever to refill water.

l3F838E42tzTloi5Cpjg2A.text: I love this place. Service is always good. Price is great. Cajun Albacore is my fave.  Worth going. Try the monkey brains.

TRDQIXgIWBkpZucvLFd3Xg.text: Sushi is always great.  Service is good.  Very popular place do go early if you don't want to wait.

Y1RI_Zvy21-Tbxfc_LH-OA.text: Used to come here couple of times a month back when they used to have softshell crab and oysters.  Both are not offered anymore...  Either way the food here has always been great!  It's not the cheapest AYCE sushi joint but definitely one of the best.  And yes it's another Japanese sushi restaurant with a Korean owner.  They also own Zizzy like 2 doors down.  So you can order most of the Kaya's sushi at Zizzy's too.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qVpFQ5uVHP72Hw6NqK0CXg.text: HERS: The most delicious AYCE sushi in Vegas! This place is a hole in the wall and from the outside may not look appealing. Once you walk in the aesthetics of this place is very nice. They have spacious booths with nice lighting and great decor. It's definitely a comfy intimate atmosphere. The wait to eat here is usually pretty long, but it's worth it!! Offer to give them your cell number and if they are really busy, they will text or call to notify you that your table is ready. They usually have great music playing and the staff is usually friendly. Now, on to the rolls. My goodness!! The rolls here are amazing!!! The rolls are well made and don't fall apart. They are also generously filled with fish or whatever kind of roll you order(some vegetarian options) and aren't made with an excessive amount of rice like most AYCE sushi places. They also have an array of appetizers, soups, etc. $26 for all you can eat dinner and a couple dollars shorter for lunch. I'm very picky about sushi since it's one of my favorite foods and this place never disappoints. The sushi comes out very quickly unlike most sushi spots and it's always delicious. They also have a stamp card when you visit a certain number of times you get a free visit, which is amazing!! I go to this place at least once a month. And have never left disappointed.   HIS: Like she said it has a whole in the wall look but don't shy away! The wait is no joke and can be up to two hours on a busy day. Go when you have the time because it seems no matter what time we go it's packed. The service is ok and you usually have a variety of different waiters helping you throughout your time. Some nights it's great and they waste no time getting your food and others not so much. AYCE is where it's at and definitely worth every penny. Almost the entire menu is included (Uni too!) and you can get whole or half rolls of almost everything too which allows you to really try lots. As far as suggestions I'd say try the Shrek, Mistake roll, Who's Your Dad, and Something Wrong. Those are some of our favorites. Don't forget to get a stamp card and enjoy!

SzUxJtI-uMDqJGHkoyhBfA.text: All you can eat sushi for $24.95. It includes pretty much everything on the menu. My husband and I loved this place. The Sex Bomb Roll and the Mussels was fantastic. They were fast and very friendly. They're also open until 3:00 am!

2w2_7sXo8bE-_A3WtrhtCA.text: They are lucky they have good sushi customer service is TERRIBLE ! I called to check in and they were so rude and hung up. Didn't even ask for a name for a reso.

hzIvLKuz-oks2s2mPFBeYA.text: Awesome sushi place! They have all you can eat for $27 but you can choose from their whole menu which is a lot of different yummy foods to choose from. Absolutely the best service i have gotten anywhere, she made half orders for us and did easy rice. Absolutely loved the food and service. Highly recommended!

ZvOtGwjFrfGqi6j-FGOBLQ.text: Been here couple of times and we never got disappointed. Love there dynamite and sex bomb roll. And don't forget to order there skewers

1mQEl_wzLr1NEUzc_fnUng.text: I went to this restaraunt on a sunday night. I j as d multiple servers approach me after my drink order had been been taken initially making me confused as to who my server was. During my meal plates built up on my table as i ordered more and more making things cluttered. I sat with empty glass of wine for about 10 min multiple times before i had to flag someone down to get me another. When i asked for a taste of a wine i was unfamiliar with i was told that they dont do that in their restaraunt and was unable to even get a good description of the flavor. At the end of the meal i was charged for 2 all you can eat dinners when my girlfriend only had a bowl of soup and an order of edamame. The server told she had an all you can eat and i had to argue to get my bill fixed. My bill was returned anf i payed the bill leaving a 10% tip to reflect the poor service. Unfortunately that is not the end. As i am getting up to leave the server runs over to my table to infor me she forgot to add a drink on and i needed to give her more money. At this point i just want to leave and pay the additional amount leaving no tip. The food was average. Exactly what you would expect from an all you can eat sushi place and i will not be returning due to the extremely poor service.

6x957KvCb9Wk8Kyc4zkpLg.text: Great price for a large AYCE Sushi menu!  My girlfriend and I knocked out a ton of stuff in our time there and although we had to wait for a while to be seated (even though we had a reservation), it was well worth it.. The service was friendly but a little on the slow side, though it was understandable considering the volume of customers they had that evening..  There's an imposed time limit for eating but we didn't get any rude warnings that interrupted our dining experience..

svL96pQrnIeZTzaCNUTw5g.text: Love the place. Been my favorite sushi place for years, always happy to see the staff, and service has been good every time. No complaints~

d1yHg9lK8WCyWbn7VjxDuA.text: Unlike other sushi places, they have skewers , udons and other stuff for ayce. All that just cost 23 dollars. That's a stealing... I love their skewers ex bacon and shrimp. Sweet potato is my favorite!! I have been there twice and definitely will go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet Shrimp
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nigiri
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet Potato

WNvU-zgWk7dy_ruuq9fLkQ.text: I have been very impressed with Sushi Kaya on multiple occasions. Their fish is always very fresh and the rolls are absolutely amazing. Many have embarrassing names like Sex bomb but the food is still great. I also like that you can get half roll orders on many rolls. The only drawback is the place is tiny and there is usually a wait, but it is always worth the wait. Highly reccomend.

A2qT0mrEuukjbvQZWTjTVg.text: AYCE is the best deal, for the appetizers  alone like gyoza and skewers are extremely small and not worth the price. Don't get me wrong , it was super delicious sushi  and appetizers with great presentation! It's my second time here and it was packed , so expect a little wait. Worth the wait though!!

3orRrcGoik-hkBaJxCyvgw.text: Hands down by far the best sushi restaurant I've ever been to and I've been all over the world and had sushi in every neck of the globe. Awesome awesome and super fast service. There was never a wait and all of the food was fresh and made to order. I will make a trip back to Vegas soon and plan on eating here at least once a day.

xKAHrhoJw4Q5_s7A7UIdeg.text: First off I want to say, service was friendly, professional, and fairly prompt. I have no regrets spending about $25 on this AYCE sushi place.  However, based on other Yelp reviews and the words in bold print on the menu,  I heeded the warning and finished ever single bit of food put in front of me.  In Sushi Kaya's defense, I did not test the rules about not wasting food.    I just felt uncomfortable and nervous the entire time I was there. There are too many rules and restriction---must finish food, two hour limit, items you can only order once per person.   Since I don't eat rice or much starch I was limited to skewers and appetizers, no sashimi on the menu.  Most of the skewers were meager, especially since I was only allowed to order each one, one time.  Three bucks for a dinky skewer of meat? $12.95 for rolls with catchy names. Common on! They overprice the ala carte and only "force" a customer to choose the AYCE.  Luckily, I deceive people because at 100 lbs,  I can eat enough to match a 200 lb, 6'2 man.   Certainly I had enough food, but if it is AYCE, I just want to walk out happy, full and feeling like I got my monies' worth at a AYCE,  instead I felt relieved I finished all the food on my plate, and feared testing my limits by trying that last skewer.  Sheesh, I feel like a child eating at my mother's house!  I've had AYCE that is more suited to my sashimi eating lifestyle. I am not going back, but I will say the menu is vast and includes dessert (which I don't eat).   You should try it, you will enjoy it...as long as you follow the rules.

sfXO60w0JxVRoMCoYtEBoQ.text: SUSHI KAYA!!! My favorite sushi bar in Vegas, hands down. Everything I've came here their's most likely a wait BUT I'd rather wait 30 mins for a seat then go to any other tacky place! The Sushi here is amazing! They have All you can eat, so it's ideal for someone with a empty stomach. I recommend The rolls: Sex Bomb, California Dream Roll, Who's Your Daddy, & Jackpot! Service is good also!

DELHhQQ3X1dkdf4FVCI5Uw.text: I am going to say that this place is a must try if you haven't been here. This is AYCE the right way. You don't have to eat yourself to feeling absolutely horrible. We order most things half size. Just enough food and varieties. I recommend all the skewers and red bean mochi at the end.

-ywGd_GEQ8-VQ155uCgFNA.text: My boyfriend took me here to sushi kaya because we wanted to try a different sushi restaurant. I love it here. My favorite new sushi place!! Very yummy and so many different rolls!

S2OLgw9BMXgDUt3IG0-RsA.text: Great place to dine in for all you can eat sushi. Not an overwhelming price at all. All the rolls are great, but I got to say the customer service is quite slow. It is probably difficult to make tons of rolls which kind of explains a longer delay in receiving food. Overall a great place to go if your not on a time delay or impatient.

WA2gWuVchIYdyJ-JCJ05IA.text: Well this was my favorite ayce spot until the service became worse, the quality went down, and the price went up. Service is sometimes nonexistent here. The salmon sashimi was off last time I went. It was a struggle to eat. They were recently on dirty dining, so that was the nail in the coffin for me. There are better options in Vegas, so I would recommend to explore them.

k1YXihVC169opUV2Zr7cNA.text: I don't know where you guys ate when you say "great service." Service here is always slow. I come here because the food is great but I've never felt really attended to. I took my friends here last night and I was embarrassed! We waited a little over 1 hour for a set of orders and guess what? They never prepared any of it. We cancelled that and ordered 6 pieces of oysters instead. After waiting 40 min. we cancelled that too and just got ice cream. Even that took half an hour. How hard is it to put a scoop of ice cream into a small cup? Ridiculous! We felt so neglected. We were here 3 hours and only got to successfully order twice (both in the first hour only). There were 5 servers last night and no one offered to refill our water. Are you kidding me?

D-2q3qWGiI3lX82EIt3ozA.text: Very good all you can eat, not the average joint to get filled up on rice, tried some very good rolls, the one with mango was the best. It's not my first time but so far will keep coming here

5-S2-eoqX5wlRDYPFlo8YQ.text: Finally got to try their All You Can Eat, and I have to say its pretty delicious!  The dinner price is $22.95/person (lunch is $19.95/person), and you have 1 hour to order off the AYCE menu.  I went with my parents, and we sat at the bar so we can put the order straight to the sushi chefs.    The AYCE selection is quite nice.  It's got all the basic appetizers, nigiri, and rolls (lots and lots to choose from).  It also has a rice/noodle section where you can find varieties (fried, cold, soup) rice and noodles.  Plus a section for skewers, which you don't find at most AYCE sushi joints.  There are also a few more things on the menu the usual AYCE sushi places don't have with this restaurant being a japanese/korean fushion style i.e. korean cooked beef.  The service was fast, the food was delicious, since we sat at the sushi bar, we actually got to meet the owner, and he comped us a few items that was not on the menu (scores!), for example the hamachi kama (grilled yellowtail)  Here's the list of things we devoured (from what i can still remember): Edomame - served warmed and salted, very good! Seaweed Salad - delish strings of seaweed seasoned just right Lettus Wrap - pieces of tuna sashimi, seasoned imitaton crab, avocado slices, cucmber and carrot strips all wrapped up in a lettus cup, so refreshing, kinda like a california roll minus the rice! Tuna Poke - good size chunks of tuna sashimi dressed in sauce and served on a bed of seaweed salad, very fresh and refreshing Mixed Tempura - hot off the frier mix of tempura with 3 or 4 shrimps, squid rings and legs, and a good mix of tempura vegitables Grilled Hamachi Kama - large piece of bone-in yellow tail chin grilled to perfect yumminess, mmm mmm Hamachi Nigiri - pretty standard, nothing worth mentioning OMG Roll - your basic california roll topped with chunks of salmon and tuna sashimi dressed in creamy saunce mixed with fish roe, thumbs up! Beef Skewer - juicy tender beef Bacon wrapped shrimp skewer - charred shrimps and bacon, great flavor Spicy Rice cake skewer - sweet, spicy, crispy, chewy, YUM Mushroom skewer - mushroom cooked to juicy perfection Oyster on half shell - i didn't have any but my friend said its fresh  they have so much more on the menu, i encourage everyone to check it out!

rBaqfIiC2rqKsGXy2MfQeQ.text: This place is a must go when I come to Vegas. The all you can eat is the best! It is not a buffet style all you can eat. You order as though you'd be ordering from a regular menu and is made to order, so the food is fresh and I love this place because the rolls very rarely rely on soy sauce and wasabi for flavoring. A lot of their custom rolls come with their own sauce catering to those rolls. I def. recommend this place. I have family that own sushi restaurants so I really do know when a sushi place is immaculate.

R1wwWGfSApKYvNU6CfDVGA.text: The food is still great. The service is going to pot. Orders never happen or you get the wrong item. Once I complete my stamp card, Kaya is coming off my list.

l_-ZbZS3bqy_m9bLaeBOzA.text: Nice interior, friendly service and cheap. Unfortunately, the fish quality is less than desirable. I actually enjoyed the korean noodles and the beef skewer but you can only order one beef skewer for AYCE. Stingy.

CRmjd1pt8QP_Nl-QhTFfvw.text: Awesome sushi place. Very busy most the time but worth the wait. Can't go wrong with unlimited sushi.

8aSqs7Vz8G7hP3FZAF1slA.text: Every time I visit Las Vegas, the first place that I head to is Sushi Kaya in Chinatown about 1/2 mile from my hotel The Palazzo.  And there is always a long line no matter the night or time.  It's the best place in town for fresh all-you-can-eat sushi.  We arrived around 9:40pm and waited 20 minutes for the sushi bar.  The sushi is the perfect portion with right amount of rice and fish, temperature hot miso soup (like all Asians I hate lukewarm soup), tasty seaweed salad, and good tempura including sweet potato.  And my favorite Japanese beer - Asahi which is the measuring stick on whether it's a genuine sushi joint.  Something I learned while traveling in Japan.  Every sushi place carries Sapporo or Kirin, but a real sushi house also carries Asahi.  Call me a beer snob.  Service is always friendly and superb.  And your sushi arrives within 10 minutes after the order is placed.  Don't forget to try the "I Love My Ass" roll and thank me later.

fZAqqyyG_9YGX8jWrNYCiw.text: I like this place. I had to take a few extended trips to Vegas and this was my choice of dinner most often. For a buffet price you get fresh items to choose from the menu. Seafood quality was very good, presentation ok, overall quality excellent. You cannot beat this place for the price. This place is not for those of you that do not like to sample variety, and raw items.

Corc7tbdSj9ZVQonnZWQ1g.text: Food is excellent! & so many selections for appetizers & grilled skewers. Sushi quality is great.. Perfect rice & fresh fish!

AIx-H_Ynz-oXQPfET23SGg.text: Thing is, I'm not a "Sushi" person. So I won't pretend that I'm an expert on what sushi should taste like. But for the price and for the amount of food I ate; to me, this place is the BOMB! "Sex On The Beach" roll and the soft shell crab was DELICIOUS. The service isn't all that. One of the girls seemed to only want to deal with one corner of the restaurant... almost as if she couldn't handle waiting on more than two tables? It was lame that we kept having to ask the waitress serving the table right next to us for help, only to have her tell us "I'll go tell your waitress." So the key was to order in bulk, for our party of four. If you have enough patience to withstand the lousy service here, you'll enjoy the food. On a side note, they always keep the TV on ESPN. Watching sports while I eat good food is AWESOME.

aOGdhPm2tVPqGoe41C20gg.text: Overall the my experience was all right.  But I've certainly experienced better.  Plenty of items on the menu.  The only thing that I was not satisfied was freshness.  I just had feeling that the food wasn't FRESH as I was eating.  Couple hours later I had bad tummy ache and you know the rest...

jDFK2PpuZHUIgLHZMZ1CxQ.text: tried out the ayce $22.95 for dinner. This place is owned by a Korean as all the writings on the walls were in Korean and not in Japanese. This review is about their service. First round of orders were quick, then as soon as we kept ordering more, the service got slow, as in SLOW, the waitresses started to ignore out table. it was only when they took away some of our plates that I was able to order. Once we ordered ice cream they gave us our bill.

KI6KXT2jedAETanuUy_ZzA.text: First off, don't let the 3 Stars fool you. This place has good food. The service here is by far the best I've had in any sushi house here in Vegas. The prices are the lowest also. Good poke. My favorite roll is the amigo and the spider. The grill items are great, and the fried rice reminds me of being back in Okinawa. My only issue is most of the rolls include shrimp tempura which for me is a cop out when it comes to sushi. I like the raw stuff. I wish they would be more creative on the menu. Sushi Kaya is worth checking out. Its tasty, and you will always get great service.

eUFUkg8YrjuKfhiEbbk9sw.text: Open late, great service, yummy sushi (AYCE)

t902B-zRd1W-zZfAsT1a3g.text: I thought the food tasted great! We got the all you can eat. It was a really good price, and I thought it was better than the sushi place we usually go. Having said that, the waitress was outrageous! She kept trying to get us to order the nigiri. She wouldnt stop asking us if we wanted that, which we clearly did not. I thought the point of AYCE was you could order whatever you wanted. It started to get uncomfortable. It was like she wanted us to order the cheapest things or things with a lot of rice. For this reason, we have not been back, even thought we loved the food.

o3vWon6qh5dQC57iI7abaQ.text: For AYCE sushi, this place is definitely one of my favorites.  Whenever I visit my friends in Vegas, this place is a must go for dinner one night.    The AYCE sushi menu has tons of options, some of which, you can only choose 1 of the same item per hour, but you can have multiple different items, IE the skewers.   If you aren't into raw fish, there's many other options as well, such as jalapeno poppers, skewers, noodles and tempura.   I had a couple of rolls with cilantro sauce on this most recent visit.  It was a nice twist from the usual spin on sushi.   For those of you having ordering issues, I'd highly recommend sitting at the bar where the cooks can take your order directly.

unV7r-Vvo-4z6pK8icYgnw.text: This is a great all you can eat sushi place for only $23/ person for dinner.  The quality you get for this price is well worth coming back again again.  Once you get your stamp card filled up, you get a free all you can eat sushi dinner!!  Let's keep them in business; don't be wasteful.  Just eat what you want; don't over-endulge! :)  If I wasn't trying to have a baby, I'd be eating at Kaya right NOW!! :oP

NeW_WAzKkMgiDO9Hm-EioQ.text: Too bad I can't critique on their food since my friend and I couldn't get over their horrible service. So, if you're looking for an opinion on their eats...I wouldn't know, we never got to that part.  A friend of mine and I were driving around Chinatown on a last minute whim to find a sushi bar to grab a quick bite before meeting up with more friends later in the evening. We walked in and were greeted and seated and asked for our drink order, we only opted for some water to start since we had been driving all around town for a good hour and a half or so. Two tables were at play and we were the third, in the middle. Our waters came to us promptly but after that the wait staff that seemed to have consisted of three females and one male (maybe he was the manager that night) pulled an epic fail move. We had decided what we wanted to order and filed our menus at the edge of the table (this is an indication that you're ready to order, no?). We sat and watched us be completely ignored. After much frustration I saw one of the waitresses walk over our way, made eye to eye contact with her...she stopped between our table and the table on the other side of us, the minute she saw money sitting on the table on the next side of us she decided it was more important to pick up her $3 tip and walk over to the other waitresses and have a gigglefest over who-knows-what. It was then that my friend and I decided to leave.  Clearly this place does not get yelped about their awesome customer service to begin with, so if it ain't broke why fix it, right?  This is probably the same reason as to why they charge you for cucumber salad...so you have to wait to order, wait to receive it and PAY for it. Personally not worth giving them a second chance, in this tight economy, people like this do not deserve my hard earned dollars.  We ended up somewhere on Twain and Decateur at SHOBU and they were amazing!!!

1k0-a-9g6i0PWLE_E6_D9w.text: Ive been to many all you can eat sushi places, but this has to be the best one. All the food was great quality and really delicious. I loved the soft shelled crab and the oysters. $22 is not bad for the quality and quantity you get. Great place overall!

ItCUcdPLH_OI73oSk65KAA.text: Good sushi place to go to especially for the price. 21.95 for lunch and 26.95 for dinner all you can eat. They have a variety of dishes to choose from rice dishes to noodles to sashimi to specialty sushi rolls. My favorite rolls would have to be sexy, sex on the beach, and sex bomb. Also, he good thing is you can try the many varieties of sushi rolls because you have the option of getting half the amount of rolls. The service is great. You don't have just one server so you get attended to quickly. The atmosphere is great too. Music isn't too loud and if you love watching sports, they always have a game on the tv. This sushi restaurant is a go-to spot for me!

w-XGoNF_Rxj23gNLUUSagA.text: $25 for AYCE, I'll take it.  It most certainly gets busy for AYCE during lunch time. I came in with my family after a night of blurry fun. There was a total of 7 of us, but no tables were availble for another 20 mins. We asked if we could sit at the room that looked like a waiting area. It was their private dining room. To accommodate us, they agreed and sat us right away. They did inform us that the raw items may be a bit slow to get to our table due to the high volume of orders. We were okay with that.  They were great in accomodating our group. Service was pretty standard. But great that they were attentive towards use since we were in the private room. I appreciate that. The food actually came out quicker than we thought. Food was delicious and I was stuffed. I'd definitely come back for more in the future. It'll bit me my go to sushi joint in the future if I move there.  I love Sushi!

p6OeVTPbpzCU5rjAUcBkEw.text: My big qualm with this place isn't necessarily the food, which is alright, but because of the deceiving pricing. If you go to this restaurant, make sure that you understand that the price listed is for each sushi and not for "two pieces" as described by the header. Two pieces of sushi ran me $8, plus an extra dollar for the apparent crime of using a card. That on top of the forty-minute wait time on Saturday was extremely bothersome. I think I could get better sushi quicker elsewhere, and unless you're looking to provide some mouth-driven sushi devastation via the All-You-Can-Eat price, I would stay away.  Honestly, if it weren't for the price confusion I would have given this place a 3.

uuFul75WNkwxtv04LN1I0Q.text: Food is great, staffs are very welcoming except for the manager. The manager is very rude, never greets you and never checks on how youre doing. Instead he sees you as just a dollar sign and another money in his register machine. I dont see why he is still the manager at that place. Hes very rude.

swbzDIA-VF9Tb66afpDQ_g.text: Went with a large group and the service was good. Great sushi and decor. It was easy to split the billup too, which is normally a hassle at other places. I would highly recommend for large groups

LwHSWsTR-uyN6xXWKWzgng.text: i really like this sushi, the fish is really fresh, the appetizer is awesome! they have different sushi rolls to choose, and so many alcohol drinks too, absolutely my favorite place

F03dLA8-aafdwHc-7Uaong.text: With there being plenty and I do mean PLENTY of sushi places to choose from here in Las Vegas, sushi Kaya happens to be one my favorite spots!! For those of you who've never experienced an all you can eat FRESH to order sushi then you have not lived!! They provide some of the best tasting options on an extensive menu that provides you a HUGE selection of dishes to choose from! In fact if you plan on coming on a regular they have a cool punch card they can provide you with so that everytime you eat, you are working toward a free meal the next time you dine with them! They are located on a pretty busy intersection of Spring Mountain and Arville and the parking can sometimes be a pain but other than that they have to make it on you sushi places to eat list for sure!!

RlnbHLhkXr_n-c2WECv7GA.text: I really enjoyed the all you can eat lunch.  I like to order the half rolls so that I can taste more of everything.  Cinderella roll was my favorite with a side of spicy mayo.  The items I did not like were the Japanese pizza (too soft and soggy in texture) and the scallop (I was expecting a raw scallop and instead it was small cooked pieces on top of the rice). The service was great, always keeping my green tea filled and hot.  The green tea ice cream tastes more authentic and less sweet.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini Cheesecake
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels

PGdkBdu6yi6tJp5cAYSV9A.text: This is my to go to spot for sushi in Las Vegas. I've been going here since New Years of 2011. The price hasn't changed Mich for their AYCE and they're open late, which is nice. I also like how they have a time limit, considering how they can get busy fast and some people like to gorge themselves on food.  I always get their seaweed salad here and their salmon skin hand roll. Even if I order a la carte, these will be my prime items. They DO offer half rolls, which is amazing since some rolls are like 8-10 pieces long! Food comes out promptly and they do mention that some items will take longer on the menu. I usually get nigiri here and I have been always satisfied. They also have a large variety of rolls to choose from if you're into all that.   Their service is borderline okay to good. They're prompt and they bus plates fairly quickly if you make them available, but they don't really have much personality or a smiling factor. But, considering the type of people who go into these type of restauarants, I shouldn't be surprised they end up not putting too much emphasis on that. So, be sure to tip!  Anyway, point being, I come back for the food and prompt service. Thanks guys!

U-P8luF9xg-UGH60Lht08w.text: This place is really good and crowded all the time I get there I think is because is really good and the all you can eat is like 27 dls per person and it's pretty close to the house of my friend and when I discover this awesome spot I just got in love with it . I truly recommend it

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail sashimi yummmyyyyy

3kUvsWfBcVm0uozKnpQ2tQ.text: Went here for my birthday dinner night I will never forget amazing rolls and dessert!

iiWXXiQ7Sf4yL_frgCUS4g.text: My eyes definitely get me into trouble a lot of times!  And they certainly did here at Sushi Kaya.  On my Halloween weekend trip my best friend took us out to Chinatown to get a little away from the strip.  She has raved about Sushi Kaya for a long time now & finally convinced me to check it out.    We just missed the lunch price cut off, arriving at 4:04.  I like how you can order how ever much you want up front and even if you're not finished yet with your order you can still order more later.  The $25 all you can eat menu covers a lot of sushi, special rolls, izakayas, some teriyakis, noodle & rice dishes & well as dessert.  We all ordered what we wanted but shared especially if there was something that more than one of us wanted.  Good strategy right?    I know that this place is Korean ran and it's supposed to be a Japanese restaurant, but damnnn, the kimchi fried rice was so good and pretty spicy!  Finally a kimchi fried rice that deliverers on the heat for me!  I also enjoyed the beef tongue skewer which was grilled perfectly.  The sushi was pretty good too!  I think my favorite roll was the 911 roll which had spicy crab, crunch & cucumber.  My bestie also enjoyed my seafood yaki-udon, just wished they had a non-seafood option for the noodles!    Not a bad place and for all you can eat with such an extensive menu for $25, it's not a bad option that's not very far from the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic skewer &amp; bacon wrapped scallop skewer
Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California Dream Roll

CzOrQ4o0P8XkCJlkQtGs1w.text: Excellent staff and costumer service 5 stars. Convenient for Las Vegas business hours. Will recommend to all sushi lovers.

1-85ISHYsu3GFrc6S5ntBg.text: Very good sushi. The one that I liked best was the Cinderella roll. Best green tea ice cream I've had. The tempura was decent. Not really sold on the all you can eat for $26.95. My appetite is not that huge, so not worth it for me. The music is a little loud.   They have cameras everywhere so that they can watch you eat and make sure you don't share with someone who went for the all you can eat. And they threaten to charge for any leftovers. Kinda lame that they have to do that and takes away from any class the restaurant may have had, thus they only get 3 stars from me.  Excellent service. Very attentive.

6Qq8MPVQyP7KcXJVrGfGQA.text: We always came to try the Sushi at Kaya but it was busy and we left...We thought it's really good food and a comfortable atmosphere however I strongly recommend not to even waste your time or money!! at this place. The unfriendly staff that didn't even have a simple smile on their face and horrible service with a very rude/unprofessional manager that just keep shaking his head to me and the other guess! We tried the all you can eat!... Whenever we were trying to order the same thing over , The server will say, It's an extra Charge!$$ Then what's the point of all you! We were not happy and we felt that they were trying to rip us off with their all you can eat in their own way !!  I guess it's another way to rip off people. The Quality of the food was very horrible and we were all sick after we left the restaurant. There is more to say! I recommend you would never try this place!!! It's not because we didn't like it or we were not happy. If you don't believe it then try it for yourself! We will never go back to this place. I guess the owner of the restaurant really doesn't care!

eCLhs1oKb53Bmlm-fPzBbg.text: Fantastic Sushi! I'm so used to all you can eat sushi being where I had to pay extra for specialty rolls, but this one is literally ALL you can eat including specialty rolls! Thank you Sushi Kaya for your great service and amazing sushi!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Kaya - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just a little bit of this amazing sushi!

8XOSG0_ny-cfUHmpDkCi5g.text: An average looking place but good sushi rolls. It was better than i expected it. I went there at 1am and enjoyed most of the rolls. Would go again if wanted late night sushi

C2E0cBYVuTNrbaOd6u19mA.text: I really was looking forward to trying this place and although the food was decent the experience made me never want to come back.  A group of us from work have a soccer league that we play in every Sunday night and after our game this Sunday we decided we wanted to grab some food and like I  said before I was really wanting to try this place so we went.  Now I understand that some of the guys I was with were in shorts and t-shirts because we had just come from a game but I have never felt more judged in my 23 years of life. I feel like they took one look at the guys because of the way they looked and didn't want to help them.  We probably went through five different servers, and I understand that these guys can be jokers but you should never judge a group of people by the way they're dressed. They wear suits and ties everyday make 6 figure salaries and because of they way were dressed we had some of the worst customer service. I'm still in shock.  The manager came around to every table while we were there, except ours. Our servers were very rude, our food took forever to get to us and the manager completely snubbed our group. We didn't even get a chance to let him know what was going on.  The food may have been decent but we would much rather go somewhere who treated us with respect no matter what were wearing then bring our business back here.

Cr4tWOMNSWusnJPMI7LTmQ.text: This place looked really cool, that's about the only good thing. Our server (well the person I think our server was) only showed up once to take our drink order, and twice to drop off the check. 4 other people helped us in between, and all but one of them acted so very strange. The rice was too hard, and the salmon was too fishy. The bathrooms were among the worst smelling I've ever encountered. Disappointed, this place looked very cool.

0wqQAmrE4JCfMLFb26aDiw.text: My favorite place to have all you can eat sushi in Las Vegas! There's usually a wait, but there's a cute little bar next door that has good prices. I love going here!!

cPxyc6gQT7b-VlZCai7YwA.text: I have been coming here for years. My single most very favorite roll in the world is exclusively Maya's "Crusty Philly Roll" take a Philadelphia roll, dipped in tempura batter and deep-fried. Yum flipping yum!! The spider roll in hand roll form is a first round mandatory order.  Great prices, exceptional customer service,  and terrific food. Give it a try. I did like 5 years ago and I'm STILL going.

5stAiWfTamf-Rlfdb8fOkg.text: The only plus side was my smoked salmon. It was peeeeerfect. But anyways let me start from the beginning, as soon as we entered the restaurant it smelled like piss. Idk if this is normal or what? I thought I was the only one so I asked my bf if he could smell it and he said yeah. But anyways the smell lasted until we had some food to smell. To be honest I'm surprised we didn't end up leaving after that smell because I'm super picky. Anyways all the sushi was average the quality of the fish didn't seem that fresh. (P.s. I found my love for sushi in Reno (sushi Minato and ijji, for all my northern Nevada yelpers) therefore my expectations are set  high. I just haven't found a sushi place in Vegas that does it like Reno. :(  the only good thing about this place was the smoked salmon and the fast service. I didn't enjoy any of the rolls and my bf didn't enjoy the nigiri it was a waste of money, not too mention my stomach felt sick after :(

TsIVVPrDAL040X-Glnldyg.text: Sushi is good, nothing special. Don't like the fact that they automatically charge gratituity because most of the time I wanted to order I had to call them to get their attention. I like to tip what they deserve because today I was really disappointed and I paid $10 in "tips".

4mnCLD_mXqvvQUcw_d6KGw.text: This place is a good spot to go to if u wanna do AYCE. Their prices are pretty worth it and the menu is big and have a lot of yummy sushi rolls which i loveeee! The nigiri's are pretty small which i dont mind at all cause im really tiny and i get full really fast lol and i dont like to eat too much white rice anyway.  The service is pretty fast and u can order half a roll if u cant finish a full one which is a plus for me! The only down side is they get quite busy around dinner time and there's usually a wait but once they sit you they get your order right away. Will definitely come back here again for some AYCE!!!

hy9nOtqEh0jcKGxM7Wr7uw.text: One of my worst experiences. I have been coming to the establishment for years. The food is always good and the service is always awesome. During this particular occurrence it was less than par. I understand having a bigger party makes it harder to seat. so i understood when they said it was going to be a 20 mins wait. but when 20 mins goes by and then another 20 mins goes by and they say nothing it gets a little frustrating. especially when they start seating other parties that came after you. I get when a group of 2 or 3 are seated before my party because they have smaller seating available but when there are groups of 5 and 6 sat before me and when we asked the hostess about why they were being seated before you I get they have a smaller party. when looking at the seats that the groups received my family could have more than fit comfortably. and for a restaurant that doesn't take reservations and being told that there are two tables being reserved for a party of 2? I don't understand. when I was passed on to the manager all they could say was sorry. The didn't help make it any better of a visit. not asking for all our meals to be compt or anything but maybe hey lets us take care of your drinks or something. got nothing showing that they wanted to take care of our service or anything. what is going on wih this place.

l-lDtdFCTNie0xhhSdDo3w.text: 12/28  Okay, I went for the AYCE during dinner and it was under $25.  I ordered ice water so I'm not sure if the price includes your beverage.  Good selection of Sushi / Appetizers.  PROS: * cheaper than most AYCE sushi dinner * lots of unique appetizers on the menu that I have never seen at any other AYCE sushi joints (Spicy Udon, specialty skewers, Bulgogi, & more) * clean w/ awesome decor * Nigiri was fresh * comfortable seating (sushi bar available too) * open late * Low Sodium Soy Sauce  CONS: * slow service & forgot to input some of our orders * Limited to only 1 of each type of skewer available * parking sucks !!  * drink refills are non-existent.  I waited like 15 minutes to get more H20!  TIPS: * If they don't tell you, make sure to ask for a Stamp Card... So worth it! * you can host a mini-party-  Karaoke Room available to rent out that can host up to 20 people.  Sushi and karaoke ...awesome !!  Not overpriced either ! * Ask for two drinks, that way you do not have to wait for a refill. * This place gets pretty crowded so make sure to order enough sushi (assuming you are doing the AYCE) to keep you busy. * if you buy 2 rolls of sushi, you may as well take advantage of the AYCE deal... I'm just saying.  -=)  Highly Recommended  Start serving Sashimi on your AYCE and you'll get a 5 star hah.

fKF9uT_-a4G50zHeLbhO3g.text: I love this place. Kaya is my go-to sushi place. Only thing keeping me from giving it 5 stars is the fact that service can get really slow from ordering to delivery simply because there are so many people serving each table that things get lost in translation.  other than that I really do love it. Great food, great price for AYCE sushi.

7LTYBlJcPA3JKSMIIncwLA.text: Me and my wife love this place i like almost everythinh they serve specially the "Amigo Roll" I recommend this place 100%

UhZNiTB17djNg7J9U4EJQw.text: So I'm walking past sushi kaya right now and I had to review it since I just started yelping and  since it's basically the best fucking sushi place in town. Fuck the rest. Go here and love it

fwuPwMc2ioA3-63XHyEVSA.text: This place sucks.  Sushi is crap.  Management is ignorant.  DO NOT COME HERE.  The other reviews are fake and from restaurant family and owners friends.  The sushi here is dirty and rotten!!

OWtAVOIML8bQYEw3dxvNWQ.text: Great selection of rolls, but after you have tried all the rolls, they are basically all the same. Couple of unique ones. Kitchen food takes forever, but guess that's better than it being cooked in bulk and then left out.  Shrimp tempura was undercooked, batter was half done. Sushi chefs were rude!! You know when they are cracking up then staring at the tables as the sushi is being served. The good stuff has a 1 per person limit. That sucks ! The steak skewers ( well, 1 skewer max) are GREAT!! Cheesecake is usually frozen when it arrives to your table. Mochi is great, Overall in vegas sushi kaya is pretty good. Occasional negative thing here and there. But it came down to only 4 rolls that I would go back for. Maybe if I was a sashimi fan, it'd be different. Just my opinion

uusEjOf7LiVl4NnkvWOVBA.text: AYCE menu is awesome. You can order anything you want from the menu. Pretty much everything tastes good there. The freshness is debatable but I like to go there when you get that sushi craving.   I would recommend the baked and deep fried rolls there! They are a must!!!   All in all its a very good place, atmosphere is small and nice.

ihccG7cG3R0tErLU0_ukgw.text: This place is nice. It's roomy, great for big groups. The service was A-OK. The rolls were good, although, when my daughter's california roll was served, i couldn't believe how much rice they used on her roll , she had  a hard time eating it.   This place also makes it clear that you do not waste food, even rice on your roll, so make sure that you eat what you order! (not that they said anything to me since i ate everything).  Everything was good except for one roll I ate that tasted kinda fishy. and Fish shouldn't taste fishy, so the quality of fish is questionable.   I was there for 2 hours with my daughter and so I don't think they have a time limit?  I would go back because I love their mussels and their Jose roll. =)

cvcNuNmtIbWLhcXJeDtEYQ.text: What brings happiness into my life? Sushi. There's nothing like an amazing roll that just makes your taste buds go crazy! All you can eat for $25?!?! Ummm HELLO! CAN I GET AN AMEN??!! Great Japanese beers. Phenomenal rolls. And oh em gee their bacon wrapped scallops and bacon wrapped asparagus...anything wrapped in bacon is absolutely the greatest thing in life. And to finish it off with mango mochi ice cream?!!! I can eat here every day if I could! Only negative is their parking. Absolutely terrible parking. Not everyone drives small cars you know?!  Still give it a 5 star tho because it's THAT AWESOME!

qX_2m4Ef1zCtOEAWTjtIiw.text: This sushi place is great they have great sushi great drinks sakis delicious the cooks are great food gets out pretty fast

53SrcHTo4LhTiNZYuTslqQ.text: All you can eat for $24.95 for dinner is very good deal.  :)  Servers are nice and sweet.    Agedashi-dofu was little sweeter than I expected, but  Nigiri and Rolls are good as AYCE.

oSES9Ry1SAQzD72t9_Qqag.text: I wasn't impressed on my first visit and I think it was mainly because I came with a big party (orders weren't met and given to the wrong people, etc). But the second and third time I've been here was pretty good. The second time I was here with two of my girlfriends celebrating Christmas a couple days earlier and the recent one was with my bff during lunch. Dinner seems to always have a wait, especially during peak hours (starting at 7pm til around 10pm). Even during lunch there's still some wait time (damn this place is popular). For $19.95 lunch and $24.95 dinner AYCE, their prices are on the lower side which might be the reason why they're always packed. I really liked their baked green mussels, nigiri, and dessert. Their rolls are a hit or miss for me, so are their other appetizers and skewers. I try at least three different rolls every visit, then maybe one day I'll figure out which ones are my favorite. EDIT: so far I've liked their "viagra" roll haha! I love getting their almond mocha ice cream and green tea mochi ice cream for dessert. I finally warmed up to Kaya, so I'll add this place to my "Sushi List."   Btw, I noticed some of their hosts graduated from my high school. I found this amusing haha

q44Uxn--7MoCAbG6DbPyBw.text: Good sushi at a very good price. Eat all you can! However, there are a few items in the menu that you can only order for a limited amount (e.g. Uni, salmon roe). Aside from sushi, they have a variety of other choices on their menu. This is unlike other all you can eat sushi joints who gives you only 10-15 sushi options.  I have no complaints with their food and their price but I do have a problem with their service, hence, the 4 stars. Every time we go there, we never know who our server is. It seems to me the servers are very inexperienced. They get your first order and you never see them again. You're constantly trying to look for someone to get your order. It's kinda like whoever passes by gets your order. Sometimes I feel like they're doing this on purpose so that you can't order as much as you want too since there's a 90 minute limit.  Overall, I would definitely recommend this place. They just need a lot of improvement on the customer service part.

OxxYQb37m0MHU-m4ZKciZA.text: Very poor grade sushi. Very small portions. Looks like this place is living off and OLD reputation. Dirty bathrooms too. I was hopeful because of the Yelp and Trip Advisor ratings but that did not hold up. Try somewhere else for quality sushi IMO.

uElQMWSn4j-xyua3xUvOIg.text: This place had gone down hill.  I walked in at 2am happy that the placed wasn't packed. They close at 3am but their last call is at 2:15am.  So the waiter stands there and expects you to order everything up front before the kitchen closes.   The rice that came with each order was hard.  The waiter never came by to see if I need anything, he just drop off the orders and left.  He never refilled my drink or asked me how was everything.  The only time I saw him again was when I had to flag him down for the check.   This used to be a great place.   I was surprised how slow it was for a Saturday night, even at that hour they used to be packed.  Now I can understand perfectly why.
